Reviews.Title: “Vieques + W= Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: PRinBR
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to relax. The W retreat has thought about every single detail to make a vacation experience delightful and unforgettable. From the moment you arrive to the island, the service is outstanding. The facilities at the hotel are impecable. The price- especially if you book an offer- is a good value compared to the other high-end hotels on the island. I am definitely staying at the W Vieques again. Suggestion: Take a tour to the bioluminescent bay and visit some of the island's secluded beaches.

Reviews.Title: “simple-natural-repeatable”
Reviews.Author: TreeHuggerTravels
Reviews.Content: Thank you for a great vacation. Quick three nights-bio tour amazing-dress to get wet and be prepared for very bumpy ride to the tour spot. Don't skip out on sitting by the fireplace to watch sunset and enjoy a elegant risotto and the candy bar dessert is a must. Bellman team was wonderful-thank you to Pablo for the sea glass beach advice and locations to photograph the horses on property. Also that you to Rahoul for telling the boss about our challenge with the early power washers-he recovered with a drink in the lobby and smooth trip to airport. Pamela in Spa saved the day with a quick nail polish recovery and Mr. Joelle in dining always brought me earl gray tea bags when they ran low in the lobby. Edward in the landscaping team actually offered to take me on the golfcart to go find the horses-what customer service! Bohemian look to the property which is charming and well done to a t! If you prefer a traditional table and bedroom decor, may not be for you. If you love colorful, unique and just something a little different, but still high end-this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Len H
Reviews.Content: While staying in Puerto Rico, a couple of people had mentioned to my wife and I that if we had the time we should go to Vieques and stay at the W Retreat and take the evening Bioluminescent (Mosquito) Bay tour. So, we did! short flight, incredible W service on arrival, and the tour is something eveyone should do!! Our only downfall was that we were only there one night as we did this on the spur of the moment. We would go back!

Reviews.Title: “His name is Jimmy S.”
Reviews.Author: bill v
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review of any hotel. Simply put I was inspired to write about this resort. The level of customer service here is second to none in the world. Specifically the talent and expertise that is employed here is a gift for any person staying at this resort. In particular the head of beverage and food, Jimmy S. is a prodigy. After watching this staff and specifically Jimmy S. the head of beverage and food, I realized what passion, effort, and a laser focus on the customer service at its zenith looks like. I was humbled by the level of attention and gracious service this man and his staff achieve as a routine standard. Absolutely intoxicating setting, and service. You will not find a better place, and you will absolutely never find staff like Jimmy S., who's devotion to his craft is only comparable to a monk. I know this sounds a bit dramatic, however this is my best attempt to portray the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: SG192Newjersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night and 2 days. It was an awesome experience. Great rooms and excellent beaches. Very good lounge and pick up service from and to airport. We came from San juan to Vieques by Flaminco airline, awesome view from the flight too.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but nice”
Reviews.Author: EJG4
Reviews.Content: The W is a very nice property but very overpriced (i.e. $5 for a coke, $6.50 for a tea, $30 buffet breakfast, etc).. Here is some random feedback: Yoga class in the mornings was great, lasted almost 2 hours Nice gym Two little beaches. Don't look like typical white sand, Caribbean beaches but nice. Very nice pool. Restaurant is good, but expensive. It was good to get into town for dinner and mix it up. Room was very quiet and great for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “great everything.”
Reviews.Author: skyflierpr
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend, thurs-sunday and had an awesome time, we were a couple (30 +- years old + our 18 month old daughter) the service was Excellent, especially the pool and breakfast staff. the food at the restaurant was great, breakfast awesome. The facilities are all well kept. My couple of issues were the ridiculous prices, including a pint of velvedere vodka in our room for $55.00 and johny walker black $50.00 I really found it abusive and atrocious, also the $60 a day resort fee is unnecessary. The 1 free cocktail per person per day they say from 6-6:30 but one day didnt start serving them untill closer to 6:15 and will not serve any more at 6:31.... but in reality those are small issues In general I will look back on the weekend as being spectacular. I would recommend if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at W Retreat & Spa Vieques”
Reviews.Author: Dawn F
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weeks stay at the W in Vieques with our 4 children. It was a great experience for all of us! We felt instantly relaxed from the first day. We were upgraded the first 2 nights to a villa suite as our ocean view rooms were not available. Our friend, Wade, at the front desk was very helpful in making sure we were comfortable and eventually getting us to our connecting ocean view rooms...which were lovely!! We very much enjoyed our time by the pool and swimming in the ocean. Our kids (12-20) enjoyed the comfortable spaces to lounge, the fire at night and playing some pool in the living room. We all enjoyed the food at the hotel, especially the breakfasts. What an awesome setting to dine while looking out at the ocean! The staff were very friendly to us and we really enjoyed getting to know Greg Kolakoski. He greated us every morning and asked us how our stay was going. He was helpful with giving us suggestions of where to go and what to do. He truly made us feel welcomed and as though we were special guests..

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful setting for our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: 1060WestAddison
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at the W Retreat & Spa on Vieques for our April 2012 honeymoon. The hotel gave us an upgrade to an ocean-view room, which was lovely. The room, while not a suite, was very spacious. The huge metal tub was a treat, the bed was very comfortable, and the rain-style shower head was nice. The rooms are situated in villas, with about eight rooms to a villa, so we never had a lot of people coming and going near our room. It gave more privacy, which was nice. The resort has one main restaurant, a small cafe, and a poolside menu. We ate several items from the poolside menu, all of which were good. As with any high-end resort, there is a bit of sticker shock at first ($12 for mojitos and other "fancy" drinks). We fell in love with the passionfruit mojitos! We ate breakfast every day at the main restaurant, Mix on the Beach. The breakfast food was excellent, as was the fresh French press coffee. We also enjoyed several services at the Away Spa, which is small but very nicely done. The "cafe con coco" body scrub and massage in the beach-view room was the highlight of our stay. A few other positives: the W lounge at the local airport was a nice respite after several hours of travel; the onsite Avis car rental and Blackbeard's Sport shop were a huge convenience; the "iguana tanning deck" gave a fascinating view of some local wildlife; the concierge was a huge help in setting up tours and making reservations. Only a couple of "cons": the late night room service choices are disappointing - you're better off getting snacks somewhere else; also housekeeping didn't pick up our room service trays until we asked. The "sunset sip" isn't really worth doing unless you happen to be near the lobby anyway. Keep in mind, too, that everything here runs on "island time" and is more laid back than many urban W hotels. Staff were very friendly, and the resort is situated in one of the most beautiful places I've ever seen. Highly recommended!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Best escape from home and work life EVER! Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: I alway stay at top resorts when on vacation and this amazing retreat just landed in the #1 spot after 20+ years of traveling. Sorry Hotel Park City but you have been bumped to #2. I am a man who has high expectations when on holiday because rest & relaxation is my primary goal. This W and the staff but most impressively THE MANAGEMENT created an atmosphere so special and service oriented that I didn't even want to leave the grounds even for an hour. Truth be told, I left twice to eat with the Bride & Groom and could not wait to return to simply enjoy the stunning oasis. The Staff- From the moment we entered the lobby, we were greeted with friendly smiles and a very attractive staff that clearly had marching orders to make sure we have a wonderful stay from beginning to end. The front desk staff, the embassadors, the restaurant staff and the poolside and bar cocktail staff made us feel like VIP from morning to midnight. I admit that I am high-maintance and a bit of a diva (so I'm told by friends) so to have a staff that knows the true value of customer service is paramount for me to rate a vacation spot as AWESOME. The Management- Above all, I was most impressed by the attitude and hands-on approach of the management team of The W at Vieques. I travel enough to know the limitations that high-end resort must experience with such a vast operation in this remote spot but I saw no signs of such handi-cap. I attribute that to the management team and their pride in their position. I'm horrible with names but Greg?? (manager of dinning room) greeted us every morning and evening with a smile and repeatedly ask if we were enjoying our stay or if we needed anything he made many suggestion of things to do on and off site. This guy was delightful to chat with every day and truly impacted the enjoyment of our stay. As much as I would like to think that we were a special guest, I witness Greg doing this to each and every table in the dinning hall and on the patios. He led by example as did the manager of the Bar (silver hair guy) and most notable, Alexandro who gave new meaning to leadership. I had know idea that he was an owner or the owner and yet he was one of the highlights of my stay. He came across as just another guest who had stayed at the resort many times and wanted to make sure the wedding party and I enjoyed every aspect of our stay. It was not until Alexandro had left four days later that I was told what his role was at the W. I wished I could have thanked him in person for creating such an awesome retreat where the service matches the beautiful landscaping and stunning interior decor. The Resort- Wow, the decor is absolutely fabulous and striking from the front gate to the ocean view. I own a real estate firm and I do design and renovations in DC so I love seeing unique and modern use of old or vintage materials. This location gets an A+++ on interior design. You just have to come see the lobby, the dinning area and the rooms with your own eyes because pictures will not do justice. The use of ropes, old wood boards, new wood beams, painted metal evented walls, unique lighting, layered see-through curtains and funky accent furniture and colors all worked well together to create the ultimate pleasure place and retreat. The design of the endless pools and the fire pit created the perfect excuse to just lay back and drink and drink and drink some more in between meals and sun-bathing. Oh yeah..you will not want to leave this resort for most any reason. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff - Not worthy of W flag”
Reviews.Author: Thor H
Reviews.Content: We just spent four nights at the W. I am a frequent traveler and have a good point of reference for what to expect in travel. This hotel is not up to the standards of a W. Hotel is tired in some areas. Tennis courts are quite run down. Trash removal from grounds is an issue. Rooms were nice but there were issues. The sun shade on our porch had a massive hole in it (looked like a bowling ball may have come down from the upper unit.) Food was excellent. Staff at Mix is strong. Pool is okay. Remember, this is a W so bringing the kids is at your own risk. We left ours at home and were glad we did. Unless you are a strong swimmer, best to respect the Atlantic and not swim at either hotel beach. Spa was fine. Attention to detail around trash pickup an issue. Our jacuzzi area was littered with votive candles (used) from what appeared to be previous uses. As I stood at the edge of the manicured lawn, I happened to look down onto the sloped grounds and could clearly see what looked like the contents of a trash can. Ashtrays on the property were not cleaned out. The big issue that we ran into was hotel service. We called ahead and reserved dinner, spa, a certain room location, pillow type and Jeep rental. We double-checked all of it and then showed up. Room was wrong but we chalked that up to a busy hotel, no big deal. We could make-do. The pillows were not swapped out and then we started wondering. We learned mid-way into our stay that they changed our Jeep rental (without telling us) and because we did not take the Jeep on the day they changed it to, lost our rental altogether. Seemed odd but when we tried to work with the hotel they treated us pretty poorly. It was comically-sad how poorly. I even made at least three calls to the Luxury Collection reservations and they contacted the hotel on my part...all to no avail. We are talking horrible gaps in communication and severe lack of ownership at local level. I wanted to chalk it up to local-attitude but the people were transplants from other Ws or Starwood properties. I took our issue(s) to management just to offer them a chance to take some ownership but their response was not what you might expect. Before we went to the hotel, I checked this site for feedback and took the initiative to email the hotel and ask specifically about some of the issues. The reply was well-written and explained that they had worked out all the bugs. When I sent them our feedback, as a courtesy, they went in to "deflection" mode. Didn't even address some of the issues. For what it is worth, I asked to speak to the General Manager twice and each representative I asked took the info and then effectively blew my request off. My sense is that you have a nice property, clearly best on the island as far as major flags go. But, the operation is poorly executed. In case you are wondering if I am just a crank, truth be told, I wondered as well but as I reflected on this here is what I concluded. I shared my feedback with the hotel as a courtesy and was rebuffed. I let a week go by (as in to sleep on it) and decided it was still bothering me. You come to your own conclusion. I was happy to pay the Ritz-Carlton prices, but expected value for the premium. What I received was an Hampton Inn experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: andreia6
Reviews.Content: First I must say we travel quite a bit and therefore have stayed at countless resorts and hotels all over the world so we have a good point of reference. The resort itself is absolutely beautiful, the grounds and views are gorgeous, the rooms are nicely decorated and clean. The beaches at the hotel are ok not the best but still very nice. the pools are also amazing and I dont consider myself a pool person. Great atmosphere too! I cannot say enough about the staff at the resort!!! They were professional, friendly and catered to our every request (we had quite a few) even when we requested a room change after the first night due to the frogs (coqui) outside the room only to realize a few days later that the entire island is filled with these frogs and there is no escaping their "nightly song". So we were extremely impressed with their customer service. Way to go W!!!!! The food at the resort was a bit overpriced but this was expected so it wasnt a big deal for us, the cafe had pretty good breakfasts but somewhat expensive $6 for a yogurt and $4 for a small plain coffee. The poolside lunch was probably the best food I had at the resort & the most reasonably priced for the quality and quantity. Dinner at the Alan Ducasse inspired restaurant was disappointing...the food wasnt bad...it just wasnt good, it was mediocre...sorry. I really wanted to like it! we were a party of 4 so we got to taste many of the main dishes and appetizers & nothing stood out. To be honest we tried quite a few restaurants all over the island and they were all kinda of the same we were not impressed at all with the food in Vieques. The ONLY exception was Next Course which I can whole heartely recommend, the food was AMAZING!!! The island itself is very nice & unspoiled, wild horses everywhere, beautiful remote beaches the black sand beach and blue beach are a must, we spend an entire afternoon at the black sand beach & we were literally the only people there. We also did the bio bay kayak tour which was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: MChaudhary
Reviews.Content: This you are in Vieques, you must stay here. Oceanfront rooms have amazing view, pool areas and beaches are great, and W's service is impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Subpar -”
Reviews.Author: rjrodriguezds
Reviews.Content: Is this really a W? Decor is OK, Lackluster design, unlit sidewalks, racist bartenders, unhelpful concierge. You can tell this is an old hotel with some make-up, definately not even near any of the other W's I have stayed at. I get that their sales are not doing so great, but all the more reason to step up your customer service. Being a worldwide business traveler might make me picky... but when you go to a hotel and their lobby bathroom is as dirty as any local bar's bathroom, STAY AWAY. I was with about 6 other people. We waited for a 30 mins for a drink at the bar, only to leave without being served. It seemed that everyone that looked like a tourist were able to get their drinks just fine. I asked the concierge if they had any bars at the hotel that actually served puertorricans, he looked at me like I had spoken in another language. No apologies were offered or anything. Puerto Rico does it better! (/sarcasm)

Reviews.Title: “Should be so much more...”
Reviews.Author: tleecouch
Reviews.Content: We just arrived back from an eight-day stay at the W Retreat and Spa. It's a beautiful property and they did a lovely job with the landscaping and the pool area. I like the decor of the rooms, the soaking tubs, and I thought the beds were incredible comfortable. There were some wonderful people at the front desk, and we loved Angel behind the bar but this property should be ranked the number one hotel on the island. These are the two areas that I feel are truly hurting this resort. I will start with the food. Our first meal was by the pool; we had just gotten off the plane and were starving. After looking over the menu, we were shocked not to see ANY local flair on the menu at all. I don't travel to unique and interesting cultures so that I can order a burger and fries. While I understand that you have to have those types of food on the menu, the fact that that's all there is to order was quite disappointing. We then gave MIX a try, and were equally disappointed. Over cooked meats, disappointing wine list, and servers that don't seem to know the preparation or the ingredients in the food they are serving. It was our last meal we had at the resort, as it certainly did not live up to the standards of an â€œAlain Ducasseâ€� restaurant. Fortunately, we rented a car, which you MUST do to explore this beautiful island, and met some local people who finally steered us in the right direction for food. I wouldn't waste your time eating at the resort, besides the absurdly priced food, it's just plain bad. Check out La Vieuense for breakfast or lunch, Bev's lunch menu at Coconuts, and for some delicious authentic local food, check out Bili's, Conuco, and El Patio Restaurant & Bieke's Bistro. Next Course was a lovely spot and we had a decent meal there and the ambiance was pleasant. Duffy's has a great beer selection but to be honest, I would avoid eating anything that's not fried. Ok so back to the W. I found the service overall was just not up to par especially for their motto. You would ask for something and the server would not return or return much later completely forgetting what you had asked for. The resort fee is absolutely absurd. JUST RAISE your room rates. This place just nickel and dimes you for everything. One of the worst offenses of this I saw was during their Sunset SIP. Where they give you a "free" half glass cocktail. This lasts from 6-630. I saw guests wander up to the bar and request their free drink at 632 and they were refused. Pissed, they canceled their reservations at MIX and didn't eat or drink at the resort the rest of their stay. After witnessing that, we didnâ€™t return for Sunset Sip either, because we were pretty appalled. That was a prefect example of a situation where the refusal of a free punch cocktail lost them hundreds of dollars worth of business, and sadly, they weren't the only people we met at the resort who felt this way. As I read the trip advisor reviews, over and over, complaints about service and food keep surfacing and it astounds me they do nothing to change this. I have seen the W retreat drop from number 2 on Trip Advisor to number 4 since we decided to book our trip there. They really need to take a step back and reevaluate their business model and practices. To me, they could learn a lot from Francis Ford Coppola resorts, he has nailed down the service and the food part to a T. I would like to say I would come back and stay here again, but the nickel and diming and confused unprofessional service would push me to check out renting a house or another resort, especially since we didn't spend any time at the resort except for our first and last day, when we didn't have choice because we didn't have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Went here for a drink... wish I stayed here.”
Reviews.Author: sailaway22
Reviews.Content: Was residing at a friends house while on the island. Dropped in for some drinks when they first made this hotel (2010). Prices were high but atmosphere was so beautiful, romantic, and unique. Drinks and service were perfection. Will come back here for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “My family and I really enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: skyplane
Reviews.Content: My family recently returned from a 5-day stay at the W. We had two rooms - a suite (including a sitting room, bedroom and two baths), that attached to another bedroom. The rooms were huge, by any standard, nicely furnished and immaculate. The hotel is set up as a series of two and three story buildings, some overlooking the pool with the ocean in the background and others located further away from the pool and overlooking just the ocean. While it would have been convenient to have been located right on the pool, we were happy to be located in ocean-view rooms, which were significantly quieter than those located near the pool. while there, we had breakfast each morning at the hotel's restaurant. As others have commented, it's relatively pricey but no more so than what you would expect to pay at any hotel for similar food. During the course of our stay, we also had snacks and drinks by the pool, dinner at the hotel's restaurant and dinner at room service. Our only complaint about any of these meals was the time it took to actually get the food from when we ordered. The W is located on the north coast of the island, so it's exposed to the colder (and wavier) Atlantic Ocean rather than the Carribean. To access those beaches, you will need a jeep to make the 10 mile drive. If you go, be sure to bring lunches -- while it's a short distance in miles, the trip into town from the beach can easily be a 90 minute round trip given the state of the roads.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection: Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: DrRichardR
Reviews.Content: On a scale of 0 to 10, the Vieques W Retreat and Spa is a 15! This was one of the best trips that we have taken (and we travel frequently), and we will definitely return. The W Retreat was recommended by a friend of ours, Jim Parker, of Caribbean Flying Adventures. Jim has a consulting company for owner/operators of private aircraft, and suggested the W as the top choice in the Caribbean. I wanted this to be a perfect long weekend getaway to celebrate my wife's birthday, and it was that and much more. The W has a reception area at the Vieques airport, which is a really nice touch, and a very comfortable setting while waiting for the hotel shuttle. When we arrived, we were greeted with big smiles, a warm welcome and two glasses of champagne. The bell staff did a great job, and within minutes, we were in our ocean front suite. 1400+ SF gave us room to stretch out. With the sliding glass doors open, we could relax and listen to the sound of the ocean. We really like the chic style of W Hotels, and the resort was a great example of this. We ate dinner at the hotel and really liked the menu. The maitre 'd Cindy and Tim were on top of the wine list, and pulled a few special reserve bottles from the back (we are very much into European wines.) Our waiter, Nenad, was spot on. When we returned to our room, the staff had delivered a birthday cake for my wife. Great touch! The next morning, the manager of the hotel, Greg White, touched based with us, to make sure that my wife enjoyed her birthday. He also arranged for a courtesy amenity at the spa for her. We took in some of the local food and culture in Esperanza, and went horseback riding one morning, and also did the bioluminescent bay. I would highly recommend both. The rest of the time we spent at the hotel and enjoyed every minute. This was one of the few vacations where I really wasn't ready to go home. We have traveled extensively in North America, Central America, South America, Europe and the Caribbean, and I have to say, the W Retreat in Vieques is right at the top of our list. We are planning our next trip back, and will definitely bring our kids (adults) and friends. Rick Rasmussen Tampa, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: rickandleigh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay and I will agree that service was inconsistent. At times they were "Johnny on the Spot" and other times you felt as if you were annoying them. It was a luxurious resort, nonetheless. The bed was very comfortable and the gym was large. I recommend eating off the resort. Our first morning there we made the mistake of eating the buffet breakfast. $70 later (including tip) we wished we would have spent that money elsewhere. The next morning we went to the W Cafe and grabbed 2 coffees, fruit and a breakfast sandwich for MUCH less. I would return if ever we visit Vieques again.

Reviews.Title: “Away Spa”
Reviews.Author: Teri1260
Reviews.Content: Amy was an awesome representative of the friendly, warm atmosphere the spa has to offer. I was there to check out the spa and its services. I was greeted immediately and given a tour of the area, products, and massage area. Very nice and inviting experience. I will definitely be back to try out the services. Thanks for the warm hospitality Amy....

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Trip - W Vieques”
Reviews.Author: mademane99
Reviews.Content: We were married on Paradise Edge at the W Vieques a year ago and came back for our 1st anniversary for 6 days. Being the 3rd time at the hotel, we were able to make comparisons. If we had not been to the resort before, I do not think there would be many negatives about the hotel. I very much recommend this resort to a couple looking for some relaxation in a destination that is still not commercialized what so ever like other carribean islands. The island is pretty incredible itself, with its natural beauty. The private beautiful beaches are reason enough to get to Vieques and we recommend renting a car for at least 1 day to experience them. Secret beach is one of our favorites. Overall, the treatment by the W was really wonderful as we have made relationships there with the staff and were treated very well. We were upgraded to the restreat side of the island which we prefer. You can hear the ocean from the room which makes it so serene. Management is very attentive- Christian, Jimmy are both very welcoming, personable and helpful and we were able to spend some time with them getting to know them. We did have a bad experience with a woman behind the front desk. Not sure of her name but she has very curly short hair, possibly Rosalita? She basically made us go into a publico(taxi) when the W car was taking a couple to the same restaurant as we were going to. At first she said we would be able to get the ride and then she denied us. It was very very poor customer service! I really wish I got her name as I think it was an extremely terrible way to treat guests in a business completely based on customer service and think that she should be noted for this! We had a private 5 course dinner on Paradise Edge which we HIGHLY recommend. Part of the reason we enjoyed our dinner so much was our waiter, Joel who was so knowledgeable and servicing. He taught us a whole bunch about the island and culture which is always something important for us when traveling.He also was very knowledgeable in the food and wine. Request Joel if you can! Also was so excited to see Eugenik as she was one of the few employees we recognized from when we were at the resort for our wedding. It was so nice to see her as always. She is a great bartender and we enjoyed spending time with her every night at the living room bar. Amaryllis was a great waitress as well, very hard working and provided great service, always a smile on her face. There were several cons but not enough to not visit this incredible hotel-- The service at the pool could be better. And we were very upset not to see the purple towels! The airport lounge had no snacks either which was a disappointment since we were looking forward to that after 2 flights. The concierge could be more helpful. The little things were lacking a bit however not enough to not come back. We will be returning to get our dose of relaxation in this beautifully designed hotel that has wonderful food. And ofcourse to see the horses run wild!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: Edward H
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife wife spent four wonderful days at the W in Vieques and had a great time. Since our trip was primarily for R&R thats pretty much what we did. First of all the weather was beautiful seeing we left Detroit at around 40 degrees (end of January) and windy and entered paradise at 80 degrees and sunny! Even though the weather forecast predicted rain everyday it only rained once and only for about 10 minutes. There were two beaches on the property, one was the public beach which was relatively quiet. The other is called Whisper beach which I hear is a nude beach and we didn't bother to check! There was a bar located pretty much right on the beach next to the swimming pools and there were also bbq grills on the beach as well. We stayed in a poolside first floor room and it was very clean and the room service was great (we were worried as we read some of the previous reviews). The only thing that wasnt so pleasant was the overall cost of the resort. It is expensive and we were able to absorb some of the cost as my mother works for a starwood hotel so we were able to stay as starhot members. There is a restaurant on the property but it was also very expensive. There is a cafe' that is less pricey and they serve breakfast and lunch sandwiches. So I would suggest renting a car and having dinner in town, or have the hotel call you a cab after you make a reservation. The cab driver we had was very helpful and took us in town to shop a little bit. All in all had an awesome time! The staff was awesome, the resort was beautiful and we barely left the beach for four days! I would highly recommend if you can afford it...

Reviews.Title: “Don't Second Guess yourself on this treasure”
Reviews.Author: kenhatton
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews about this property and was very hesitant about paying W prices for a sub-W experience, but I was more than satisfied by the level of service, amenities and the quality of the staff. This place is a gem in the caribbean and should not be missed before it becomes too crowded. The staff was very accommodating and I have to say that Yaritza, Leo and Pablo made sure that we always were pleased with the hotel and helping my group to enjoy the island. I've been going to Puerto Rico for 10 years and never wanted to waste the time to go to Vieques, but I am positive I will visit the island many more times in the future and stay at the W.

Reviews.Title: “loved it. Wonderful hotel, special island”
Reviews.Author: Jill S
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the perfect vibe for the island. Totally relaxed, easy flow and a focus on "lounge"...whether that be in your room, on your porch, at the pool, IN the pool on lounge chairs there, or in the "living room". We woke and played tennis (complimentary racquets), had a fruit smoothie for bfast, hit the gym (gorgeous, updated), relaxed at the pool and enjoyed lunch there. Then, we forced ourselves to leave and go to the gorgeous beaches for 4-5 hours. Returning for "sip" cocktail hour, then to dinner. Just lovely. Vieques is not developed....not a big nightlife or other entertainments. But, this is not why we went, and we will be back next year. We found the service to be outstanding, and we were there last week. The room was immaculate, they did everything to accomodate us, and we were impressed by their willingness to make our stay enjoyable. We prefer smaller hotels, and do not want to be "herded" around through meals and activities. This certainly feels that way. My suggestions: rent a jeep during your stay so you can easily get to the beaches (Avis is on site). Pack books...most reading material is in spainish on the island. Do the bio-luminescent bay tour. Book now! (By the way, if you did not stay at a hotel, in my opinion, you should not rate it....someone gave it a poor rating and didn't even STAY OR EAT at the hotel. They just toured it. Rate the hotel you chose, please.)

Reviews.Title: “Yes!”
Reviews.Author: ldtc2
Reviews.Content: I'm not a huge fan of W Hotels, they often try to hard to be "different" but seeing how Vieques only has one luxury hotel, we didn't have many options. Honestly the beaches of Vieques are a great attraction, but this hotel is a destination in itself and you can spend an entire trip, just relaxing and enjoying this chic ocean side retreat. We stayed in one of the pool side rooms, which were wonderful - steps to the pool and ocean, felt as if we had our own beach bungalow. Other reviews mention the service and though it wasnt amazing, it was perfectly fine - keep in mind this is a W, not a Four Seasons -- you need to temper your expectations. Two situations really speak to the inconsistent service at the hotel. The good. While we were eating lunch, workers were power washing nearby, I asked a manager how much longer the process would take and he immediately stopped the work until we were finished. I didn't even have to complain or ask, he just knew what to do. The bad. After kayaking the bio bay, I got a pretty bad splinter lodged in my foot and hobbled back into the hotel lobby. I asked the front desk for a tweezerand was told that they didn't have a medical kit but I could PURCHASE one in the "ouch kit" - 12 dollars, in my room. Thought it was awful that a hotel wasn't prepared for any level of medical situation (from a simple splinter to, God forbid, something worse) and furthermore, they attempted to profit from an injury. Luckily a kind guest overheard and let me borrow her tweezer. Tacky. All in all, I loved the hotel, loved Vieques and hope to get back to the W very soon.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Facility But Major Service Problems”
Reviews.Author: NycWinston
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the good stuff: the hotel is beautiful. The rooms are lovely and have great views, the grounds are well maintained, and facilities such as the pool, gym and spa are top-notch. The beach is nothing special by Vieques standards (all of the beaches in the wildlife reserve are superior), but still not too shabby as beaches go generally. Now for the bad part: service at this hotel is simply unacceptable for a hotel in this price range. At the restaurant, orders often had to placed multiple times. Sometimes drinks simply never arrived. We had a mechanical issue with the room, and had to call 3 times over the course of a day to get it addressed. Each time, there seemed to be no record of the prior request. Bath amenities like shampoo were not replaced when empty, so we had to call and request them specifically. Finally, I had booked a rate that included a free night. This was noted by reception when I checked in. But when I checked out, I was charged for each night. Fortunately, I took a close look at my bill and spotted the error. They did fix my bill without protest, but it would have been very easy for me to miss. In short, this resort has a lot of potential, but really needs to clean up its service issues.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Mojitos In A Perfect Setting”
Reviews.Author: MojitoMoMa
Reviews.Content: Business brought me to the W and I never could have imagined a better place. My only regret is not being able to stay longer! One of the coolest features of the W is the Living Room, complete with comfy chairs, a cool atmosphere and the coolest bartender in the world. My friend and I were greeted in the Living Room Bar by Davo with his million dollar smile and laugh, his billion dollar personality and the best mojitos ever mixed. Perfecto! Davo is the quintessential mixologist 's mixologist. He mixed up a "regular" mojito (and don't let the word "regular" throw you off - it was excellent) and then kicked it up a notch with a passion fruit mojito. It was heaven in a glass and I think I'm ruined for any other drink! As coincidence would have it, my friend and I ran into Davo later on during our trip and it was quite clear to us that he is an awesome guy whether behind the bar in the Living Room at the W or out on the town. Speaking of nice people, the W was full of nice people at every turn. The accomodations were very comfortable and the scenery was spectacular. It doesn't get much better than that. If you have the chance, you must visit the W and Davo.....you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Private 5 course dinner with wine pairings under the moonlight”
Reviews.Author: MPShank
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous private dinner on the lawn overlooking the water We had fabulous service! Joel was our waiter and did a wonderful job describing the wines and food pairings. This was a glorious experience in many ways!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for retreat, superb rooms and relaxing pools”
Reviews.Author: al3xh4
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is magnificent, under any weather. The rooms are magnificent, with a great balcony. The spa is extremely relaxing: we had a massage as a couple and it was very spacious with outdoor shower. Welcome area at the airport is perfect for relaxing while waiting for the bus transfer. Main lounge with some board games and lo-fi music is perfect as well as the terrace with the nice cushioned chairs. The pool area is great, very miami-style without the noise. I would not recommend the restaurant because it is overpriced and average. The chef was in the dinner room chatting with a table of customers he seemed to know. Meanwhile our food took forever to arrive and was very average. Desert were good though, which make me believe that the whole Ducasse training was more oriented on the sweets. Service was not up to our expectations, not at all. As the hotel is located in the northern part of the island, the beach is not as nice as the southern part (blue beach, secret beach...), so if you want the white sand and crystal clear water, you have to rent a car and drive 10-15 min to the southern part.

Reviews.Title: “Blew my mind!”
Reviews.Author: annajay85
Reviews.Content: This was an AMAZING experience! On a social worker's salary, I am not able to treat myself to places like this often, or ever. So I will say that first off this was a very expensive hotel (in my opinion). However, it was pretty magical. I stayed here with my boyfriend and we really felt like the staff treated us and every guest like VIPs. We got a smaller room and it was spectacular, so I can't even imagine what the other rooms are like. The grounds and pools were unbelievable and the food was even good which sometimes isn't the case at resorts. The beach isn't the biggest or best beach but it's tranquil and we spent most of the time at the pool anyways. The staff is also great and helpful and even when they made a small mistake, fixed it immediately and gave us a complimentary breakfast. The only thing I would say is for people who really want a local Puerto Rico experience, this isn't really it. They do have excursions to locals beaches and the biobay, but if you stay here you'd probably want to stay on the resort because it's just that wonderful. I would recommend this for anyone who wants to feel pampered with a significant other.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing short of Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SteelersFan92
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Vieques last week and stayed at the W. I can tell you that this stay was amazing from the second we pulled up to the door. The bellman helped us quickly, with a smile on their face and willing to help with "Whatever, Whenever." We find ourselves traveling at least 3 times per year and this hotel provided the best overall service we've ever had. Unfortunately my wife was experiencing back problems and was very limited walking/getting around. The staff exceeded our expectations in all areas. They were so accomodating and truly made the trip perfect. I know I'm leaving some of you out, for that I apologize, but I have to personally thank Wade (front desk manager), Christian (food and beverage manager), Angel (bartender at miX), Arelis (bartender at miX), Roberto (pool bartender), Kevin (concierge), Leo (concierge) and Joel (waiter for Paradise Edge). Without you all, and your fellow colleagues, this resort would not be the same!! We were traveling for a very close friends wedding and were fortunate enough to have the ability to stay at the W. The resort is beautiful, the food was great, staff amazing and extremely relaxing which is what we were looking for. If you are traveling to Vieques, you have to stay here! A few things to keep in mind. First, you are staying at the W; prices are as you might think they are. If they are shocking, why are you staying at the W? You get what you pay for and it's well worth it! Angel makes one of the best Mojitos anywhere. And, if you can, book Paradise Edge the day you get there, you won't regret it. My wife and I actually booked it for our friends that got married as their wedding present. We did it our last night on the island and it will be a memory we all share for the rest of our lives. Thank you to all of you who made this trip special and to Vieques for providing a true paradise to return to!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise a dream come true”
Reviews.Author: Alycia30
Reviews.Content: The most beautiful paradise where your wish is there command. Who could ask for anything more? Staff, beach, food, and service surpassed by none. They made my short vacation a dream come true!!

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent But Worth The Trip!”
Reviews.Author: km52170
Reviews.Content: I have been there twice. Both times the service was inconsistent but I would still go back. I think it is a combination of "island time" and not enough strong support staff, but I CAN say that on my second trip I saw improvements happening in all areas. The Front Desk is friendly but slow and the phones often ring and roll, but beach and pool are great, the food is good and you get the feeling that the people care and are trying - that makes a big difference when you get spotty service.The fact that Vieques is so unique makes it worth it. The entire place, including the rooms, has a funky, cool industrial feel. I personally would love to see an area rug in the rooms b/c I like my hotel rooms to have a bit warmer, brighter feel, but I kept my curtains open during the day to let the sun shine through. The lighting in the rooms took me a day to figure out since there are tons of light fixtures with various on/off switches all around the room. I suppose the solution, outside of some overhead lighting, would be to pull the room key out of the master power slot by the door before going to bed, but I need to charge my phone and laptop at night. I figured it out eventually. The resort now houses an AVIS jeep rental which enriches the experience tenfold because taxis there aren't entirely reliable and exploring the island is a blast.There are so many great beaches throughout the very undeveloped island and horses roam freely in the streets. There isn't a single stoplight anywhere. Esperanza is one of two towns. It is teeny tiny but there are actually a few good places to eat and drink. I had a great meal in town at El Quenepo Restaurant. I love the fact that the hotel has a little snack shop where you can get coffee, breakfast sandwiches, pastries, gifts, drinks, wine, liquor, etc. All of the W Hotels I've been to have very cool gift shops and here is no exception. The gym is better than average, the spa is great and there is a watersports shop where you can get free snorkels sets for the beach. They offer free kayaks and they have bikes to take out and ride around the island, but I am not sure if there is a charge for the bikes. I also recommend leaving more time than you would normally to get bags picked up from your room and for checkout at the desk.Lastly, I suspect most people coming here have heard of the Bio Bay. It sold me on Vieques and it did not disappoint. It haven't confirmed this, but it is supposed to be one of only 7 bio bays in the world and one of the best & brightest. I loved it and the hotel can arrange for you. One last tidbit is that the Cape Air flights from SJU are a quick 15-20 min but the planes are tiny. It is what it is, I guess, and the views are pretty great descending into VQS. The flight back to the states is a bit of a pain since even if you interline your bags through to your home airport, you have to pick them up after landing in SJU and bring them through the USDA agriculture scanner before checking in - with EVERY single other person leaving SJU going to the USA, ugh. It looked utterly horrifying but it didn't take as long as I thought.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: bunbop
Reviews.Content: We used our SPG points to stay here and it was well worth it. We were upgraded to a third floor pool view/ocean view room and we were impressed by the size of the room and the different style/decor. Not your typical hotel room which is what we loved about it. The tub was quite unique and it also had a shower. It would have been nice to have a little more light at the mirror though. Hard to do my makeup. I personally loved the round seat/bed. I pulled it over as close as I could do the balcony doors and relaxed while enjoying the view. The pool was amazing. We loved the lounge chairs in the water. Everything was very comfortable. All the seating around the resort, from the lobby, to the bar, to the fire pit, etc. was very comfortable and relaxing. The beach was nice although my husband was disappointed as there was no great snorkeling from the property. He swam up and down the coast, along the rocks, everywhere he could get to, and he didn't see a thing. But we rented a jeep which more than made up for it. It is definitely worth renting a jeep to explore the island. We found some amazing private, secluded, unspoiled beaches. The food at the resort was very good but I wouldn't say excellent. It wasn't bad by any means, but I guess I just expected more for the prices. Some items were "wow" and others were "just ok". We arrived early and with our upgrade our room wasn't quite ready so we had to wait. Management gave us a free lunch which we greatly appreciated and enjoyed while we sat by the pool. We had a great stay and we thoroughly enjoyed the W.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations - blown away!”
Reviews.Author: CBP1018
Reviews.Content: Amazing locale - seemed to be one of the few hotels that were beachfront. Gorgeous and relaxing lobby and rooms. Definitely a lot of brown and dim lighting but that's the W chain. Amazingly comfortable, white, down filled beds - that's also the W for you! There was a wine tasting one of the nights we were there which was a lot of fun. The waitstaff is very friendly and gracious. There are really only 2 dining options - Mix, which we didn't hear good things about so didn't try b/c the prices were HIGH - and the Living Room, where you can get pizzas, pasta, appetizers and sandwiches- good food and reasonable prices ($12 shrimp wrap, $13 mezze platter). Avoid the mini bar (I paid $7 for a bag of M&Ms, oops) and get some snacks and beer in town. They have a dive shop, car rental and tennis on the spot. they also offer complientary yoga every day and complimentary kayak trips Thurs-Sun. The pool is delightful, two separate pools, lots of umbrellas and staff. PLENTY of fresh towels and water all the time. I am a little surprised at the mixed reviews- this place was paradise for us. The W raises its own bar and makes you feel so pampered and relaxed that perhaps everyone leaves spoiled! The pool and beach never felt overcrowded. They play music all the time, that's a little annoying but it's good background music and we got used to it. Pros: amazing pool and beach and rooms and facilities - great gym! Very helpful and welcoming concierge. Everything felt hip, new, clean and fresh. Have never felt so relaxed on a vacation. Cons: A bit of a corporate, chain feel. VERY expensive drinks ($15) that weren't that strong. Terrible hair dryers in the rooms. And, they don't recycle.

Reviews.Title: “Lunch was Spot On!”
Reviews.Author: Thom D
Reviews.Content: I live on Vieques and had lunch with my partners today and we were all so impressed I was compelled to come back to my office and write. From the beginning Cindy the hosts greeted us with her friendly smile and laughter. Joel waited our table and we were tag teemed by Cindy and Joel throughout with outstanding, friendly and professional service. We started lunch with a Bloodmary, a Virgin Mary and Iced Tea all served within minutes of being seated. My partners ordered a shrimp wrap, Octopus salad and I the Vieques burger cooked medium rare the way I like it. We also had a bowl of french fries and started with creme brule and passion fruit ice cream. Everything we ate was exceptional and the service was the best I have seen on Vieques. We left planning our next meal which will be dinner this coming weekend. The experience was really above and beyond and the setting is beyond compare. Many thanks to Cindy and Joel for making a simple lunch experience into an affair! We can not wait to see you again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: philip v
Reviews.Content: Very smart rooms really nice layout, nice beach but the water is a bit rough. The pools are awesome. transport to airport and lounge are fantastic. The food and service was very good. Maybe just one small complaint was that they play music on the grounds quite a bit. I think they should let everyone hear the sound of the ocean and the wind. We would like to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great events!”
Reviews.Author: ActiveTrvler
Reviews.Content: Although I am not a guest of the W, I have attended two events during my stay, rented my Jeep from Avis on-site and purchased a membership for the W gym. I have found the staff of the hotel to be exceptionally polite and client focused. I have never been asked whether or not I was a guest (except at the gate) and have consistently been treated with respect. The Avis people and The people at the Blackbeards on-site are among the best I have encountered anywhere in the world. The gym is spotless. I have attended two large events at the hotel itself; a party to watch the airing of the Bachelor and a Wine Tasting this past weekend. The Bachelor party was great fun, the champagne flowed and a large crowd had a wonderful time. It was early during my current visit so it provided a great opportunity to catch up with old friends and meet new. Here too, the service and the food were both above average. The wine tasting attracted even more people and was equally fun!! I have been to many wine tastings and found this one to be much more free form and fun! The island atmosphere of the "Great Room" really lends itself to this type of event, making it nearly impossible to not have a GREAT time. The music was great, the food as well. Greg, the new GM and his team are working hard to earn the W a spot as a "go to" place for short and long term visitors to Vieques and I commend them! I am looking forward to my third event of the season, The Vieques Pops on March 3rd. I am sure it will be as well managed as the first two!!!

Reviews.Title: “so great”
Reviews.Author: Layla777
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights with our two kids. This hotel is beautiful, has great service, and excellent food and drink. Everyone, such as Wade at the front desk, was unfailingly kind and helpful. All wait staff were also friendly pros. We just loved it, very relaxing, not full of kids yet friendly to kids. We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Vieques - we extended our stay.”
Reviews.Author: LAoutdoorsman
Reviews.Content: Overall, I will say my partner and I had a great vacation in Vieques. We extended our stay from 5 to 7 nights total and stayed at the W the whole time. Whether you are happy with the W probably does depend on your expectations and how much time you spend at the resort. A Vieques vacation is about the beaches and you need to rent a car and explore it. We found our ocean view room which also overlooked the pool to be very well-appointed and certainly spacious enough. The grounds, pool areas, and beaches were nice. We found service to be good, certainly slow at times. Our main service issues had to do with housekeeping. They just seemed a bit oblivious to restocking things like shampoo and shower gel when its obvious you have used them up. We called one time and they handed us a huge bag of toiletries and we thus had enough for the rest of our stay. Food is expensive in the main restaurant, we had dinner there once and and breakfast once. We had many more meals utilizing the on-site more casual cafe where you could get good breakfast egg wraps and lunch sandwiches along with things like cereal, oatmeal, salads, etc. We would eat breakfast here, take lunch sandwiches to go and we were on our way to the beach. Keep in mind, to really enjoy your stay and not get frustrated with some of the W's issues, you need to rent a car. The crown jewel beaches are primarily all in the southeastern corner and include La Plata (Silver) Las Chivas (Blue) and smaller ones around and inbetween. I was surprised by the quality of the snorkeling and we saw a sea turtle or stingray on almost every snorkel and one time a spotted eagle ray did a loop around us. If the waters at the W beach look rough, realize that they may be calm and tranquil on the other side of the island, a short 20 min drive away. As for car rental, you need 4 wheel drive and that is pretty much all the car rental companies carry. We rented a jeep from one of the mom and pops in town, Maritzas, needless to say, the tires were crappy and we blew one out at the end of the day. They came to fix it fast but charged ~140 or so for a new tire. Sounds lame when they knew the tires were in less than good shape to begin with. Even the park ranger made a comment about our subpar tires. We returned it and switched to picking up a new Jeep with nice confidence inducing tires at the Avis onsite at the W. For an extra 20-25 day in comparison, we felt it was worth it. We were warned over and over about not leaving anything of value in the car and to actually leave car open and window down as theft has been a problem. At most parking areas, you cannot see your car from the beach. Its a bummer to have be so vigilant but this is something that is not unique to Vieques in comparison to other Caribbean islands. The only issue of likely theft that we did have is I left an old ipod nano in the W gym at the end of the day and my partner left his hat. They were nowhere to be found the next AM and no one turned them in. Its hard not suspect someone on staff. They took a report but it seemed like they were just going thru the motions. Its fine- it was nearing the end of its lifespan anyway. Gret dinners at Next Course and El Quenepo. We also did the bio bay with the clear bottom kayaks which was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “too bad, missed a golden opportunity”
Reviews.Author: NancyVieques
Reviews.Content: Last night promised to be a lovely evening. Left the house looking forward to sharing a night at the W on Vieques with friends, over some wine and appetizers. The event was called for 7 - wine and appetizers was what was advertised. Got there at 7:30 and found about 60 people, who were also there to share in this, what promised to be a lovely event. Paid my $15 and donned my plastic bracelet and proceeded to greet other guests and look for some food and beverages. The beverages were easy to spot. There was white wine and red wine, and out on the patio some sparkling wine. Much enjoyed. Then onto the food. Found a sushi bar with rolls of sushi being prepared. Thought that this was meant for the guests at the event, but was told that they were to be ordered from a waitress, for a separate charge. Looked around and saw one or two people who came out of the back area carrying trays - they were trays of cut up fruit and cheese, but one needed to act quickly because there was not much forth-coming. At one point, about 8:15 I went to the bar and asked about the promised appetizers and was told that they had nothing to do with that - were just serving wine. After a short while some appetizers did appear - 2 kinds - one with chicken and one with shrimp - nothing else to eat, no crackers not even napkins were made available. I mean cutting back on paper products is one thing - but cocktail napkins at an event where food is advertised. Then again, there really wasn't much food to speak of. Too bad - there were many people who I talked with that this was their first experience with the W on Vieques. And others whom I spoke with who had been there before and came with expectations that were in line with their prior experience - low. These were all local people who if treated properly could have returned many times over as well as being in a position to recommend the W to their guests and visitors to Vieques. I am very dissapointed in this experience, and if it had only been my own, then I might not have bothered to write this review, but it was the experience of many last night. Another facet to this is that alcohol was being served at a time when many had not had dinner. I heard many saying how irresponsible this event was to have so little food - not even crackers and cheese, while serviing alcohol. Again, I say too bad for your greediness. Had you been more forthcoming this event could have been a stellar one; one that could have drawn more business your way for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, relaxing, serene”
Reviews.Author: Pam7_11
Reviews.Content: When we were looking for a vacation spot, we tried desperately to avoid the all inclusive experience. As soon as we saw the website, we were intrigued. We spent six nights at the W in Vieques and we completely relaxed. The property is stunningly beautiful and the island is exceptional; rugged yet peaceful, and seeing the wild horses roaming free is a unique experience. The service and staff at the W are phenomenal. Everyone we met, from Arturro at the front desk, to Carlos who drove us to the ferry and shared stories, to Jimmy and Greg in Mix, and Megan who helped us before we even arrived. Truly, all at the W were friendly and helpful in a very genuine way. And, that level of helpfulness and service continued after our departure...we had met Angel at the Living Room bar and then saw him on the ferry to Fajardo and he asked how we enjoyed our stay and wished us well. About an hour later, he saw us walking along the street in Fajardo, looking for a place to have lunch, and stopped, gave us a ride and sorted out transportation to the SanJuan airport for us. He truly went out of his way to ensure we were well taken care of, even after we had checked out of the W. Angel was happy to help us out and wanted our experience to be top notch right to the last minute. Many thanks; your effort and desire to help was so appreciated. We rarely return to vacation spots but the W Vieques will probably be the exception.

Reviews.Title: “The W was Amazing... Except....”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the W in November of 2011. The property is really nice! The pools are amazing. Arelis, the bartender in the Living Room is awesome and makes the best cocktails imaginable! Everyone was very friendly... There were only two problems. The first was at the hotel, the cleaning staff accidentally left a bag of trash in my room. It wouldn't have been so bad if it was only MY trash, but it was actually the trash from the other rooms in the building I was in. Including the very "active" couple next door. Needless to say, it wasn't the best surprise. They did apologize profusely for it and had someone come and re-clean the whole room, and left me a plate of fresh fruit and chocolate. The only other problem was at a 3rd party vendor that was recommended to us by the concierge. Whatever you do.... do NOT go to Fun Brothers in Esperanza. They took a deposit on my credit card for $500 that was supposed to be only an authorization. However, they ran it through as an actual charge. It's been 3 months since we rented the scooters from them and still no refund. I have called over a dozen times, been promised each time they would process the refund, to no end. The nice people at the W are now trying to help me by contacting Fun Brothers on my behalf. It's nice that the hotel manager would do this. All in all, it's a great property and a really amazing place to visit. Make sure you do the tour to the Bio Luminescent bay (Bio Bay). It will blow your mind!

Reviews.Title: “A dream and a surprise”
Reviews.Author: picalexandre
Reviews.Content: The reviews were so mixed that I decided to spend the first nights in Vieques in a small hotel (Malecon, expensive and very average, very bad idea). This place is a Dream. Amazing hotel, nice chef, the staff is super friendly, sometimes a bit slow, but well we are in the South> I know they had problems with the staff but apparently they fixed this issue. The spa is ++++ the rooms are ++++. The prices are really reasonable, except the restaurant (especially because you don't want to leave the facility and eat elsewhere)> Just had to wait for my breakfast for 45 minutes but they apologized and offer me my breakfast. This place is heaven but I don;t want to say more as I want to keep this place for me ! Of course I'll be back. HEAVEN, I can't understand the mixed reviews.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Bridgetsj
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at some wonderful resorts throughout the Caribbean but the W was superlative! The property is absolutely gorgeous with beautiful plantings of grasses, etc. The staff was warm, friendly and extemely helpful - no "attitude" on this team. Food was delicious! (Note, we were told that the relationship with Alain Ducasse, the famous chef who created the menu, is about to end. However, if they keep the kitchen staff, I wouldn't worry. For example, breakfast was not "Alain" and everything was out of this world.). We were also surprised at how comfortable the rooms, restaurant and lounges were. The photos make it look a little too cool and hip for comfort but that was not at all the case. The beach was a protected cove which makes it great for swimming but not good if you like long walks on the beach. Only negative was the music that is constantly piped in all over the property - including the pool and beach. It drove us nuts! Coming from NYC all we wanted was some peace and quiet. The only sound we wanted to hear was the ocean! Why do I need to be forced to listen to the W's music? That's what the iPod is for - so everyone can listen to the music they want to hear. Or, for some of us, nothing at all - but the ocean. We would definitely go to this resort again - but would bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, amenity-rich and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Matthew H
Reviews.Content: This resort was filled with some truly wonderful people--both employees and guests. The pool area is gorgeous and it's easy to lose an entire day of a vacation just lounging around. Prices are comparable to New York City prices, so it wasn't a shock for me like it is for some. The staff are all knowledgeable about the area, and when asked, will give you hints about the most cost-effective ways to spend your time and money while vacationing on Vieques. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not the W experience I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: cha630
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of the W brand (only having experienced it in large cities) and went to Vieques mainly to have a W resort experience. First the positives - our room was spacious and nice (although a bit more eclectic than I would expect of the W). The lobby was also beautiful, and a nice place to lounge with a drink at night after dinner. Now the negatives - the food options were SO sparse. The lunch menu had very few items on it.. seriously, i'm talking like 6 items. When I go to a resort, I generally want to laze about the pool all day and have lunch there. By the second day I was already bored with the lunch menu. Another big food related problem - breakfast was only served until 11. Maybe not a problem for most, but due to my jetlag and generally being on vacation mode... I didnt want to wake up and rush to breakfast. The result: Even if you get to the restaurant at 11:15AM, breakfast no longer offered. For a hotel that talks a big game about Whatever, Whenever... the fact that I can't have an omlette when I want one is a bit ridiculous. I know all hotels have their rules, but if you make a huge deal about Whatever, Whenever, you should be able to back it up when someone requests something as simple as an egg and some toast. The little market cafe they have had breakfast sandwiches but they were greasy and the service there was very poor. I ordered a sandwich at the bar one day and asked for it without Mayonnaise and was told they couldnt do it.... awesome. So to sum it up, this experience totally put me off W Resorts. I know theyre trying to be chic and trendy by having one restaurant and limited food items... but the whole thing just didnt work. I wish I had gone to another island (with nicer beaches... I guess I didnt mention the beach wasnt great, I was too busy talking about food!). Lesson learned!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: Frederica84
Reviews.Content: We went to the W vieques last summer and I must say we had a great experience there. Our room was very spacious and clean, and we had a nice balcony with a view directly on the ocean. The bed was very comfortable ( as in every W we've been at) The beaches are on the small side, but we did not have a problem with that at all. The pool area was great as well. The only thing we did not like too much was the food at their restaurant...it was really just ok. We did rent a car for 3 of the 5 days we were there and we much preferred going to eat outside the resort. We actually found a little restaurant that had amazing food. We did the biobay tour...it was quite an experience. We actually loved it. The only thing is the person sent by the hotel to pick us up after we were done was almost 40 minutes late. And we were just all waiting outside in the dark in the middle of the island. ( didnt love that part) We had a great time at the W vieques, and it's a great place to go if you want a relaxing vacations away from the big resorts...I do recommend you rent a car while you are there to explore other beaches on the island, and eat at other restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising find”
Reviews.Author: passionatetraveler20
Reviews.Content: I had no idea that I would find a great resort on an island that the US Navy had been using for target practice. As I learned the navy only used part of the island while the locals endured the shelling and bombing until it was halted some years ago. (The clearnup of the shells and bombs is still underway, but that's far from the hotel). The flight to Vieques from San Juan's international airport takes just 20 minutes to the short landing strip. When you arrive, you take your bag and exit the tiny air terminal. If you turn to your left, the W Retreat offers a wonderul arrivals/departures lounge with cold towels, refreshing soft drinks and snacks. They'll organize your luggage for delivery directly to your room as well as your 5-minute transfer to the hotel. Not one of the giant complexes so common elsewhere in the Caribbean (about 150 rooms), the low-rise hotel lies on a bluff slightly above the beach. Two lovely infinity pools reflect the sky and the fluffy clouds. Unlike some W Hotels, where the attitude can be "We're so hip", this hotel is warm and friendly. Very accommodating, very welcoming. It's a little jewel in the otherwise very busy Caribbean. I found a few minor maintenance issues as well as a few overlooked housekeeping items. Nothing major. It's on my list to return for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: fififa
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights there in January and loved the beautiful pool, the quiet private beach on the resort. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The food at the restaurant at W were surprisingly fresh and delicious. I look forward to returning there for a longer stay in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, gorgeous island.”
Reviews.Author: dctrdes
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The new chef is wonderful. The service is varied. The concierge, kevin is worth the visit. The lovely breakfast on the front deck was complimented by the wonderful waiter Angel.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever, whenever - sometimes.”
Reviews.Author: nycreba
Reviews.Content: I make an annual trip to Puerto Rico and consider it one of the most beautiful travel destinations in the Caribbean with the added bonus of being easily accessible from the US (no passport! same currency!). Last year we went to Culebra, and this year we tried Vieques. We stayed at the W on the recommendations of friends who had travelled in years prior, and in part because my girlfriend with whom I was adventuring is a regular Starwood hotels guest. I guess we expected Paradise, with a capital P, but we were both left wanting. I won't talk about the prop planes required to get to the island (although it IS less expensive to fly from Isla Grande airport in San Juan than the main terminal) or the W lounge at the island because they weren't the resort, per se. But you can read about that in other reviews. I will tell you that a nearly full day of travel is committed to reaching Vieques from most destinations and when we arrived, somewhat exhausted, the aesthetics of the W did not disappoint. Nor can I attest to many activities "off" resort except to mention the biobays, which are certainly worth a visit. We were there to focus on R&R during our short stay. The resort itself is beautifully landscaped and built into the low coastal elevations of the island in a completely complimentary and discreet fashion. It is not one high rise or main building, but rather the resort is composed of several smaller buildings which lazily horseshoe around the beach and pools. Golf carts will take you to and from your building - and do so on arrival - but it is an easy walk between villa and beach and main house. We were there for 3 nights - on arrival we were upgraded (I think?) from fabulous to spectacular room, or vice versa. I can't tell you what that meant, but our room in villa 8 had ocean views and opened up to the pools. It was a very spacious room, nicely outfitted with two beds (per our request), a shower and separate free standing tub. For the significant square footage, however, there was a decided lack of shelving and storage space. An armoir, yes, for hanging clothes, but no drawers and a tiny, tiny shelf next to the sink for toiletries. A big deal? No. A nuisance? Almost immediately. 2 girls, 2 sets of toiletries and clothes - you do the math. Our room was quiet - we didn't hear resort noise, other guests, etc when we were inside. There is a balcony with a thoughtful drying rack of sorts for wet bathing suits and towels, and the water pressure in the shower was outstanding. Otherwise, we weren't there much. Wifi is pretty and was easy to use in the room. Verizon has hideous service on the island (and in PR in general) but my friend's AT&T worked well. There was a very well equipped fitness center which we used daily, and it was connected to the spa, which we never ended up using. Here's why: the resort is SUPER expensive. Not unlike Vegas, it seems like simply breathing can cost you $$. So let's streamline this into a quick pro/con list to make it easier. Pros: *Resort is gorgeously landscaped and well laid out. Our villa was clean (small ant problem in my girlfriend's bed but I think that's the nature of island living, not W cleaning standards and it wasn't problematic, just surprising....) and spacious. *The pools are beautiful with ample lounge chairs even on busy days and options to lie out at the beach, either pool, or in the grasses around the pool. All with sweeping views. Towels are thick and there are plenty of them. *The concierge/front desk was always available and friendly - most staff was very accommodating. Kevin set us up with dinner reservations and biobay tours in advance - I appreciated that. *While there were some small children, I never felt that this had become a "family" destination and thus remained quiet and a perfect oasis in which to read and doze Cons/drawbacks/things to think about: *The W is EXPENSIVE. Friends of ours who live near San Juan came for a weekend once and were horrified. Morning coffee from the cafe next to the gym was $5.85. For regular coffee. Sangria is $45 for a pitcher...and pitchers go quickly when you're sitting by the pool each day. Our lunch/bar tab routinely ended up in the $100+ range...for ceviche or salad plus drinks. Yes - its fresh and pretty good, but its NOT great, and certainly was overpriced each and every time for what it was. We had some serious sticker shock. The W doesn't advertise their bar menu, served in what's called the Living Room, on the casual couches and lounge area between the indoor bar and the outdoor, more formal, dining area. Its available, though, in the main dining rooms. In other words, you can have a burger, or smaller plates, but they're not going to tell you that. We ate there one night and were underwhelmed. Bartender said, "sit anywhere." Server came to the table we were sitting at (empty tables everywhere that evening) and told us that table was reserved. The particular one we were sitting at. So we moved, no problem, but the table remained empty for the length of our dinner. Odd, and he wasn't nice about it. He tried to upsell at every given moment, and when the table next to ours (different server) ordered a burger, and I asked about it (I really wanted a burger that night...) he tried to talk us out of the more casual menu. Big problem? No. But for a resort who's motto is whatever, whenever...come on, guys. Give me my whatever in the dining room instead of the living room, you know? Especially for the $20 I'm about to pay for it. Food, overall, was underwhelming. I guess you pay to eat it in paradise. *Service was lovely, but not impeccable, the server at dinner that night notwithstanding. We requested a late check out on departure day so we could return to the room to change post pool but before flight. They would not extend this courtesy to us, however, we were told - they would have to charge us for an additional day. So, no whenever there either. The golf cart that trucked our bags from main house up to our villa on arrival was conspicuously absent on check out...despite calling twice. We lugged our own bags down. Fine for a high rise in a nondescript city. Not fine for a luxury resort. So - there were kinks. Overall enjoyable, but certainly not 5 star, and definitely overpriced for all that it was, excepting the view. I'd recommend it, but only if you know what you're getting into. Honestly, I'd prefer to rent a home for a week, on island, as we did the prior year in Culebra, rent a car, and perhaps spend a day poolside at the W while taking better advantage of the island and all it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: katia o
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in November with our 5 year old daughter and my in laws. We had read all the previous reviews so we were prepared for a few "bumps". The airport lounge is a nice feature but they should keep it well stocked. They were all out of almost everything both times. It sort of defeats the purpose of having a lounge! The great room (lobby) is beautiful and incredibly relaxing. The pool, outdoor area and fire pit are also gorgeous. We did get a room upgrade and we loved the room but it was far from the lobby and the main pool so next time I might ask for something closer. We did call for golf cart service at times and it was always fast and friendly. My in-laws were near our room but had a plunge pool right outside their villa. It was fantastic for evening swims as it was very warm, very private and beautifully lit from under the water. We had one dinner at the main restaurant. We thought it was OK but not exceptional. We also ate breakfast many times at the W cafe which was basic but decent value. I was happy with my smoothie and breakfast wrap. We rented a car at the dealership across the road. It was convenient and not too expensive. Driving in the day is fine but freaky at night as the roads are narrow and twisty and there are no street lights. The town of Isabella had a restaurant that was really a hole in the wall with an Argentinian chef. The food was great so we went a few times. Esperanza has some casual but good spots too.
