It is worth renting a car as the taxi shuttles charge per person! The beach was nice and there were lots of pool chairs, towels and water although it wasn't too busy when we were there. My daughter is used to being with grown ups and enjoyed the pool and the beach but there were very few other children and no amenities for children at all (no sand or pool toys, no marshmellows to roast at the fire etc.) If your kids are used to more child friendly resorts, they might be disappointed. We liked the music playing and the staff were very friendly. We did the bio bay excursion which was fantastic although the bus ride out to the bay was horrible! No one warned us that the roads were so bad and that we would be in an old school bus without any shocks! Anyways, it was still worth it. We also drove out to the other beaches. The red beach was lovely though there are no amenities at all so bring your own towels, water, etc. One final tip, we flew to the Island from the smaller airport near Old San Juan. The price of the flight from this airport was half ($60 one way instead of $120). I would recommend this if you are staying a few days in San Juan anyways (we were). If not, it still might be worth the 25 minute cab ride depending on how many people you are with

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: milbed
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights from Jan 26, and we were a little nervous after reading some negative reviews. I think these reviewers were in a different place...everything was outstanding, great food, great service, big comfortable rooms, and the staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly....a particular shout-out to Monica at the pool bar! The island is gorgeous, lots of great beaches which were almst empty, great local food (Sol Food and Quenepo are amazing!), a perfect getaway. Can't wait to go back! Our only quibble was the $65 per day "resort charge"....just add to the rate rather than create an opportunity for complaint.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME RELAXING EXPERIENCE!!!!!! :)”
Reviews.Author: glamspa
Reviews.Content: When you say W! you say Wind out!!! Really relaxing and battery charging experience... Service is PERFECT!! Facilities are MArvelous!!! Quite a Paradise!!! Only thing I was not fully satisfied was with the food, it got boring, not too many options and excesively priced for what they offer!! but, you can always eat outside the island!!! :) Overall is a wonderful experience I would love to repeat soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Vieques and the W!”
Reviews.Author: Wendy S
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the W. We loved the restaurant. The food was excellent. Everyone was exceedingly nice to us and met our every need. We were granted a late check out on our day of departure - 4pm instead of 11am! The hotel had two beautiful beaches, an excellent spa experience, and it was super easy to rent a car right on the property. Would definitely go back! The only two complaints were it was very windy all the time and the pool wasn't heated - nobody was swimming. But we were there in January, their coldest, windiest time. Wendy S.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit”
Reviews.Author: onetheroadagain
Reviews.Content: We visited the W for dinner one evening. Although we were not guests of the property, we could not have been treated better. Jimmy the food and beverage manager took amazing care of us. We had a party of 15 all there to celebrate my husbands 50 th birthday. Jimmy had a special table in a semi-private area set up for us. Alex, our waiter was top notch. Food and service were both fantastic. The cherry on top was our dessert. Jimmy arranged for us to be served out by the ocean with tiki torches lighting the area. Beautiful. When we return to Vieques, we will visit the W again. Thank you again, Jimmy. You are an asset to the property.

Reviews.Title: “An undiscovered diamond of an island!!”
Reviews.Author: JG1001
Reviews.Content: Food, room, vistas, pool, service, drinks, people and adventures were all a 10 out of 10. The secrecy of this place won't last long. Get here. This was the perfect cap to our 8 day honeymoon. We WILL be back. Pay the extra for the ocean view an sleep with the door open. Also be sure to rent a jeep and your the island. Want a serious adventure that requires 4wd??? Try Road 200. Also you cannot miss Mosquito Bay at night via kayak. You've never experienced anything like it.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: yahimar
Reviews.Content: It had a wow factor on me since I arrived, since I got down from the plane. It was beautiful and peaceful, the room was great, with a private pool and garden...the perfect place for an amazing honeymoon! We loved it, we had a wonderful vacation. The food at the restaurant was excellent with a beautifully quiet and relaxing environment, yet we party at the bar with our bartender Arelis. She couldn't have done more to make our stay more pleasurable and fun. Thank you for making us feel so welcome. Excellent hosts, friendly and helpful. We had plans to stay for the weekend, but we loved it so much that we extended our stay for three days more. We will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Spacious”
Reviews.Author: LoveDziuba
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great except the other guests (snobbish and not friendly). Beautiful beach and pool, great service, friendly staff, great lounge at the airport. Once you're in Vieques make sure you leave the resort ($10 cab one way) and check out the local scene in Esperanza. Also, I highly recommend Cape Air. If you're lucky, like I was, you can sit next to the pilot.

Reviews.Title: “Get in touch with the locals!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda J
Reviews.Content: The W is amazing! We stayed there for 3 nights and than headed back to Old San Juan! Hotel staff were incredibly friendly. The first night we got there we arrived at around 10:30 ish (Took the ferry, horrible idea. DO NOT TAKE FERRY!) and called the hotel prior to reaching the island. They told us to call when we are about 15 minutes from land. We followed directions and did just that. We we got off the ferry and it was dark and all the other ferry guests were getting into their cars/rides except us poor Americans. (Our first time in PR and Vieques) We were scared and in the dark waiting for our ride from the hotel. This group of 10 teenagers walked pass us and made some remarks in Spanish, we understood them. Kind of nervous. The kids made a U turn and came back around for a 2nd round of additional remarks/conversation. We were really nervous and like a saint in the night on a white chariot, our hotel shuttle (which was the bell boy) drove up just in time! We laugh about it now but we weren't laughing at that time. From there on out everything was smooth sailing. We met Angie, who runs a tourist company, and she drove us everywhere on the island! She even took us to the grocery store, because the food is insanely expensive at the W, and the liquor store then recommended some amazing eats that were stealer!! At one of the local bars she recommended, we even met the teenagers from our 1st night at the pier, who were super nice but we were just naive! =D Overall - it was great and so was the staff.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it”
Reviews.Author: vibethtj
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here in December and absolutely loved it. We overheard some whiny American tourists complaining poolside, but our experience was wonderful. We live on St. John in the USVI and take long weekends to various islands throughout the Caribbean regularly, and we enjoyed this trip more than most. The spa staff was wonderful, the food creative and fresh, and we felt the service was great. There was a big wedding at the property the weekend we were there, and we were among the few guests who were not part of the wedding party. The staff went out of their way to make sure we weren't inconvenienced by the preparations for the reception (glass floor over the pool, building stairs and railing, decorations, etc.). Beautiful property, BEAUTIFUL people, and a unique and charming island. We recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Great Atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: travelfans29
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned our visit to the W Vieques on a last-minute whim â€“ literally last minute. We booked our hotel from the Vieques airport on our iPhone. Needless to say, we were impressed beyond measure. Let me be one of the first people to tell you â€“ this is not a truly family friendly resort. While we were there we saw at the most three very well behaved children. At the same time, there was a Victoriaâ€™s Secret Fashion Shoot telling me these are the types of people that visit the W Vieques. This isnâ€™t a place for spring breakers, groups of friends, families, unless you plan to spend lots of money. No wristband check for alcohol â€“ letâ€™s put it that way. This is for people with swagger. I didnâ€™t want to leave. Everyone we met couples, singles, families, was extremely considerate and mostly came from big cities like Washington, DC, Chicago, and New York. Now, letâ€™s move onto the Wâ€¦ Yes, they do charge a $30 resort fee; but that does include free Internet, free snorkel gear and flippers, boogie boards, water, towels, coffee, and use of the tennis courts and workout facility. Not too bad if you asked me. I would not want to be nickled and dimed on each of these, so I donâ€™t have a problem with it. The staff, well, they were a bit standoffish at times, but then again, it is a W. They always act a bit snobbier than other hotels, so it wasnâ€™t a problem for me. The food was great, and we met a great server named Amy. Amy is from South Carolina and told us everything to order and do on the island of Vieques. Amy, if you see this, we left you a tip at the Front Desk with Kimberly. Hope you got itâ€¦. How could this hotel be ranked #3? It should be #1!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded every expectation - a blissful retreat!”
Reviews.Author: MNTraveler2012
Reviews.Content: The W Retreat & Spa - Vieques was simply amazing and far exceeded every expectation I had. The property was breathtaking. The attention to detail perfect. The room was absolutely beautiful with an amazing view of the pool and ocean. It was beyond clean and cleaned everyday by noon. The food was delicious at the pool, Wet, the cafe and the Living Room. The fitness center had everything. And the staff was attentive, professional, personable, and willing to do whatever...whenever. Couple of must-dos: The 8:00 yoga class was wonderful. I've experienced yoga all over the United States and the instructor was one of the best I've had. The spa - amazing, blissful, beautiful outdoor showers, can't say enough! Do Abe's biobay tour!!! The most amazing thing I have ever seen. The whole experience was a wonderful amazing retreat! Just go!

Reviews.Title: “Food and beverage”
Reviews.Author: Polvorita13
Reviews.Content: For new years eve, At the living room bar were 2 weitresses very rude and offensive named Isa and Michelle almost ruin the evening with rudeless and ignoring service, but a girl named Paulina saved the night, quick service and great place, just have to find the right person.

Reviews.Title: “SO NICE...”
Reviews.Author: CalifWrldTrvlr
Reviews.Content: 2 GRANDPARENTS, 2 PARENTS AND 2 KIDS (3 YEAR OLD AND A 10 MONTH OLD...) We loved this property. The W lived up to it's reputation with a stunning set of pools, lovely large rooms and stellar grounds. it is a small hotel with friendly staff and really great food. Our only complaints would be that anything we had asked for prior to our arriving (refrigerators emptied in our room so that we could use them, a crib in our room and early check-in) was ignored or forgotten even though I had called to confirm the request the day before our flight. The only other complaint about the hotel was the cost of anything hotel associated was extravegently expensive. but the hotel is beautiful and staff very accomodating. The island is beautiful but the legacy of the US Military is still awfull. There is no local fruit available as the earth may still be contaminated. The locals retain some hostility towards the US although most seem grateful for the tourist dollars. Don't miss the bioluminescent bay kayak trip. World class adventure for all.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: wmbrett
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the W for 5 nights. We did enjoy the hotel and I don't think we would consider staying anywhere else when we return. Staff was friendly and helpful, did not have any problems with service, but we were away from the hotel most of the time. Room was large and we had an ocean front room - which was fabulous. Housekeeping was consistent, and the room was always clean when we returned. On occasion we saw horses grazing and galloping through the property - but that is consistent with the rest of the island. When you check in, you should probably ask for 3 card-keys since the electricity in the room depends on a card being plugged into the wall - and there were many times I left the room and didn't want to turn the lights off for my wife when I ran errands, but her wallet was in the large safe with her key. BTW, the safe uses a 6 digit code - not the 4 digit code I've used at every other hotel I've ever stayed- and the safe instructions do not indicate a 6 digit code required - maintenance guy fiddled around for 15 minutes like he was fixing it - and then asked me to put in a 6 digit code - and hey - it worked. The Adult beach had a lot of mosquitos at dusk that drove us off - but the greens around the property are heavily sprayed, and mosquitos were not an issue there. The room fee did seem excessive - but at least we got free wireless internet, free parking, free towels and free coffee in the a.m. (until 10). We bought a couple of bottles of wine from the local grocery store and would drink those on the balcony or scenic grounds - but a $35 corkage fee if you want to bring it for dinner - the rooms have a wine opener. The W hotel pool was very nice, but the $500 fee to rent a cabana for the day seemed excessive, as did the $20 hamburger - but the pool was a nice place to spend a day reading - we only saw one child at the pool (well behaved) - so was relaxing. The LCD TVâ€™s had HDMI and RCA connections that were accessible, and there was a DVD player connected. We took everything out of the refrigerator and stocked it with our sodas, wine and beer, and not a problem with being charged for simply moving stuff out. If you have Verizon Wireless (3G or 4G) do not expect any data service anywhere on the island - phone worked but no email or internet unless hooked up to wireless. My wife has ATT and her phone worked everywhere on the island. We had rented a jeep from Martiza's car rental - brand new jeep and no gotcha type issues with them - seemed like a professional operation and easy transportation back and forth to the W. The W lounge at the airport was a little overhyped. No beer or wine, just rum or tequila with a handful of mixers - but we were only there for 10 minutes before the shuttle took us to the hotel. We ate at all the top rated restaurants on the island, and Next Course was definitely my favorite - El Quintempo (sp?) we talked to the owner who was nice, and great view and location. I ordered a pork dish, and wasn't too impressed - I should have stuck with a seafood dish - which my wife fully enjoyed - ceviche at both restaurants were great. We did 2 different biobay tours - the first was the pontoon boat - it was nice, good history of the bay and story of the stars - would be good for grandparents and kids - but when they say the road is bumpy - that's an understatement. The brought water onto the boat you could play with, and let you stick a foot in the water. The next biobay tour we did was the clear canoe (I think Vieques Adventure or something like that) - that is the one you want to do if you're reasonably physically fit - much more interactive with the bay - looks like champagne as your kayak goes through the water. The road here was even bumpier than the pontoon boat road - times you thought the small van would topple over. The canoeing pace was quite fast. Fish jumped into a few boats - most of them harmless and the guide comes over and gets them out for you - not to scare anyone, but we had a toothed fish with a scary name jump in our boat - guide was a little shocked when he realized what he picked up (it's pitch dark until he puts on a flashlight)- and the first time one had jumped into a boat - but it was just a baby and no harm and was good for a story. We would definitely do this again. We took a snorkeling tour with Nan-Sea Charters. Rooster and Mark were our guides, and the other couple failed to show up â€“ so we basically had a private tour. They provided great narration and stories of the island and what we were seeing â€“ definitely a professional operation with well experienced guides â€“ we felt completely safe. Since it was a windy day, we stayed close to some of the beaches for the protection since my wife is a fair-weather snorkeler â€“ but we saw enough fish and corals to make it worth going on a boat, versus just swimming out from the beach with our gear.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations - great expereince”
Reviews.Author: jamie5126
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent four nights at the W in Vieques. We have traveled extensively throughout the Caribbean and we were looking forward to checking out how the W brand had gone about remodeling this property. The design by Patricia Urquiola is hip, playful and visually interesting. The main house is great for grabbing a drink, playing pool or sitting by the outdoor fire pit. The vibe strikes a nice balance between laid back "on the beach" while still chic and modern. Our room was very comfortable and spotlessly clean. The views from most rooms are great - looking straight out toward the water. My wife and I enjoyed the food - although the dinner menu is a little more limited than we would have liked. What really exceeded expectations was the staff. While I expect W staff to be professional and attentive the staff at the Vieques W seemed to genuinely care about the guests having a good time and fulfilling their various needs. I know that staffing a W on a small island is a different proposition than a major city - so hats to the management in training such a dedicated group of employees. I should also mention that the island itself has many good places to grab dinner as well as cool beaches to explore - Blue Beach and Naivo were our favorite. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful (but)”
Reviews.Author: PassportSally
Reviews.Content: Upside: Property is extremely beautiful and the grounds extremely well cared for. My room was very W. Upgrade to a room not in a building by the pool. Views are spectacular. People who work there are wonderful and each individually helpful. Always knew my drink and my room number, and each individually were just nice people. Would definitely return. Downside: Food is horrid. Bad. And expensive. Eat dinner instead at Next Course and el Quenepo where the food was absolutely delicious. Or stick to the ceviche at the pool bar. "What is your wish?" was extremely uncoordinated, although everyone was extremely apologetic. Bar closed at 11 PM most nights, which I found was oddly early for a W and for a high end vacation destination basically with a captive audience in the middle of nowhere. Tip: Views & grounds were amazing at the W, but get jeep and drive to a beach. Beautiful. Amazing. Best. Ever. Go in the morning when it is quiet. Also search around for a good rate for the W. Depending on how/through whom you book, depends on how much you spend. At least in our little clutch of friends.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for average service”
Reviews.Author: Nashvilleparkers
Reviews.Content: Read your bill carefully as there seem to be a lot of mistakes. The food quality is ourageous for the price. The resort is absolutely beautiful. You need a rental car for your entire trip because Vieques is stunning and there are some fab restaurants. We will be back to the island but will rent a house next time- it was too much to pay for bad food, rude bartenders and incredibly slow response time to any and all room requests.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service and scenery!”
Reviews.Author: TPGCMH
Reviews.Content: Our stay here has been great, I highly recommend this property. Private beaches, gorgeous pools and the rooms are amazing. Plenty of free services as well, from yoga to kayaks. All rooms face the ocean, love the sound of the waves at night.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer D
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited Puerto Rico and Vieques last week...what a way to ring in the new year! The W Retreat was one of the highlights of our trip. From your first arrival at the Vieques terminal, you are immediately whisked into the waiting arms of delightful and warm service at the W airport lounge. We knew we were in for something special and the W did not disappoint. Everything at the W has been thoughtfully planned and executed. The great house is truly great, the restaurant was well worth the price and the pool/beach are the ultimate in serenity. Other than the W, I would recommend renting a jeep and visitng Playa Prieta (the secret beach)...amazingly beautiful and untouched. Any future trips to PR will include the W hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but horrible service”
Reviews.Author: maria s
Reviews.Content: The W at Vieques is a beautiful retreat, the decor is amazing, modern but warm. We got there for lunch and the bad service began, we ordered an appetizer - they forgot about it, then we got our lunch except my daughters', we had to ask for it, they brought it after we finished our lunch and also brought the appetizer, a little late ! Ok they cover with a free round of drinks and they did not charge us the appetizer. We though ok, one time thing, NOT. The next day for breakfast we ordered coffee, a basket of breads and a fruit plate, half an hour to get bread and fruits, unacceptable for a $500.00 a night resort. The mix restaurant which advertises as a Alain Ducasse rest. the menu is non impressive and the food nothing exceptional. We stayed for two nights and all of our visits to the MIx were not pleasent, coffee no sugar, toast no butter Aghhhh it was really unpleasent to eat there. Poor service is the worst when you are in a gorgeous place paying a ridiculous amount of money for everything, from the hotel rate to the resort fee of $65 a night, plus the food, drinks etc. Management is definately to blame for the horrible service.

Reviews.Title: “An experience we will never forget!!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole D
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews prior to our stay at the w, we were a bit concerned with the level of service at this resort. We did run into an issue at checkin and were delayed a couple hours and put into a pool front rather than an ocean view room. ( it actually worked out better, we were 5 steps from the pool and bar! ) other than that nothing but smooth sailing! The room was beautiful. Very cool shower and bathroom. We didn't test out the bathtub but it was pretty awesome! The bed was extremely comfortable. On our second evening there after spending the day at the pool all day, my boyfriend surprised me with a romantic dinner on paradise edge. Paradise edge is a cliff at the edge of the resort overlooking the ocean. We were greeted by Greg at the entrance of the restaurant with 2 glasses of champagne. Greg then walked us down to the cliff where we would enjoy our special evening. We enjoyed a 5 course meal watching the sunset and by the end were under an unbelievable gorgeous star lit sky. I cannot even begin to tell you how great of a host for this dinner Greg was. He was the most friendly and accomodating person on the w staff. ( he even brought me some bug spray when the Mosquitos started coming out). After our 4 th course, Greg came out with two more glasses of champagne. In my glass was an absolutely beautiful ring. This was the evening I waited for my whole life. By the end of this special dinner we were engaged!!!! I would recommend doing the paradise edge experience for a great romantic night. And make sure Greg is your server!!!! Definitely rent a jeep for your stay. The island is still pretty remote and there are many great beaches to explore. You also do not want to miss the biobay. Really awesome experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing (but pricey) beach vacation”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkNyc85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W in Vieques last April (2011) using Starwood points, and we had a fantastic time. The pool is fantastic, the beach is private, the rooms are spacious and well-appointed, and the concierge desk is very helpful if you want to arrange activities or excursions. The only downside is that, even with our Starwood points, the trip ended up being very expensive. Aside from the resort fee (which I believe was around $60/day), the restaurants and drinks are pricey, and the "Whatever Whenever" service (while awesome) is very expensive. This didn't really bother us since it's a W hotel, and high prices are to be expected, but it's something to keep in mind. Another thing to keep in mind is that the resort itself seems to cater to young people (I'm 26, and my boyfriend is 30) and couples - I don't recommend it for a family vacation. There are semi-private seating areas throughout the hotel, which are wonderful if you're looking to snuggle with your significant other, but potentially awkward if you're by yourself or with a family that includes children or pre-teens. There is also music playing softly throughout the resort, which didn't bother us, but could be annoying to some. Also, unless you plan to spend your entire trip at the resort, I would highly recommend renting a car, and doing so in advance. We took several trips to the nearby beaches (also beautiful) and had a number of meals at local restaurants. All in all, aside from a few minor service glitches and a bit of sticker shock, we had a fantastic time and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxury beach vacation on a very special island.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Christmas/New Years week trip”
Reviews.Author: sal2009
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel during the week between Christmas and New Years. Let me first say that I was nervous after reading several poor reviews of the hotel service below....but after my trip, I'd say I was quite pleased and would even return. 1) Airport lounge: Decent place to wait while you wait for shuttle. Shuttle took about 25 minutes to arrive so sat down and had a free cocktail and sandwhich. 2) Checkin: Unable to give us an upgrade despite having status with Starwood...but it was Christmas and they were friendnly. Did have to wait for someone to take me to my room (about 10 minutes...it was dark on the hotel grounds and I wouldn't have been able to find my way) 3) Room: Clean, typical W room. There is no dresser to put your clothes which bugged my partner a bit but not me....there are some shelves where i put mine. 4) Room bathroom: If you are not sleeping with the person sharing your room, you may be a little uncomfortable as it is an open shower and provides minimal to no privacy. Not an issue with me as we were a couple. Never used the bathtub although my bf did. 5) Pool: Nice...had to get up early to get chairs...not uncommon for these caribbean resorts and again it was very busy season....Don't stay at the pool...best part about vieques is the beaches! 6) Spa: Staff was nice. My massage therapist was not great but my facial person was wonderful. Nice spa grounds. No steam room/sauna. 7) Restaurant: Didn't love the dinner menu but was acceptable. Service was good. Breakfast was minimum required to call buffet...there were usual eggs, fruits, bacon, breads, etc. Omelette guy was there every day except one. 8) Bar/Living room area: Probably needed additional staffing...had to wait a bit long for food and drinks and had to flag down the waitress a few times. But when I complained about a wait for food too long there, they took off those charges without fighting too much which made me feel better. 8) Service: Obvious that the staff had been either retooled, had additional training or had more added. Service coach guy was there, helped us...clearly working hard. Never had to wait too long for service at the pool the day we were there. 9) Kids: Please don't bring your kids to this resort....there aren't tons of things for kids to do and I'd say this place is catering more to adults (I mean...look at the layout of the bathrooms alone, bars, etc). There were a few parents with their kids (and nannies...argh!) during this week and all they did was disrupt the adults trying to enjoy their vacation (think=kids splashing being annoying at pool; again, go to the beach...it's better). 10) Resort fee: High for what you get....not much...stuff that would be free anywhere else....don't like it. 11) Blackbeard activity place: You still have to pay for umbrellas and chairs at the Blackbeard Activity place if you want to take them to any beach other than the W beaches (you want to go to other beaches)....not included in your resort fee which i thought was ridiculous. And they didn't have them when i wanted them...had to go back a few times to get them. The woman working there was not very friendly and wasn't able to suggest any beaches for me (I mean, really?? not helpful). 12) Cars: YOU MUST RENT A CAR! 13) Gym: Pretty good...treadmills, gym equipment. So, overall, I'd say that this was a nice trip...the resort is beautiful and almost all of the people were trying to improve the service....I still only give the service 4/5 tho because when you are paying over $600/night for a room, you expect more. People say, it's island time, which I expected and you should as well, but still for the cost, that should not be an excuse. Bottom line: Grounds/facilities/beaches, rooms beautiful....Resort fee ridiculous considering cost of rooms and that beach chairs/umbrellas not included for other beaches...service improving and you will have a good time if you don't mind having a bit of patience. I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Major service issues at this price point”
Reviews.Author: EWR2AUS
Reviews.Content: The diversity of the reviews on TripAdvisor for this property over what appears to be the same period of time is quite interesting. The bottom line is that this is a breathtaking resort - the views are amazing, the hotel common areas are typical W style, and the rooms are nice. The staff, for the most part, is trying very hard to provide top-notch service under what appears to be very challenging circumstances. Managers from other Starwood properties have been brought in to help and they are also working very hard to insure proper service levels - and taking very generous steps to rectify issues as they develop. That being said, the service level, overall, just isn't where it needs to be for a resort charging $600+ a night (in the high season) for a room. This goes well beyond "island time" type issues. A couple of examples, as well as some positive service points are below: 1) Housekeeping is either poorly managed, woefully understaffed, or both. This is also what ends up causing the extensive delays upon checking in (see below). The housekeeping staff is so rushed that basic elements of housekeeping don't get attended to. Towels and robes are collected for cleaning but not replaced. Trash is left in the room and on the patio. Glassware doesn't get replaced. The last night I was there, they placed a bath mat in front of the shower (first time since we checked in) but they left a large muddy footprint on it as well. Garbage from someone else's room (used Q-tipes, etc) sat on the ground outside our room most of the stay. Simple housekeeping quality assurance is clearly not happening. 2) Food and beverage service is horribly lacking. I found the service at the pool and lobby (living room) bars to be very good, if a tad slow (island time). However, the service level in Mix, the only restaurant on-property is poorly lacking. On one occasion, they were out of menus (how does that happen?) for dinner and our table had to share one menu. Service is painstakingly slow (well over an hour for salads) and some of the wait staff are rude and unapologetic. On the positive side, when these issues were identified to management, they were rectified promptly. However, at $600 a night, we should not be put in the position of identifying these sorts of issues. Similar issues were observed with room service. The late night menu has no hot options and is delivered refrigerated by a night bellman. The culture of the island is such that food is not available late night anywhere so, from a local perspective, this is probably a generous service. However, most guests with experience at these types of resorts would likely expect more. Even meals ordered during the day were served cold after an extensive delay. Again, when notified of this, the management took prompt action to compensate us, which was much appreciated. 3) Check-in process. This issue is really a function of poor housekeeping management. However, its the first issue guests encounter and it likely sets the tone for much of guest dissatisfaction with the resort. We waited until almost 6:00 pm (4 hours after arrival) on check-in day to receive a room. Others were still waiting when our room was ready and we saw other guests dealing with the same issue on other days. Management tried to resolve the issue by providing free drinks, etc., but this sort of issue really has a way of agitating guests. I believe that the percentage of people complaining about other service issues would decrease dramatically if people's stays weren't starting on such a sour note. 4) On the positive side, you can tell that management is really working to improve service. I hope they are effective because this property has incredible potential. 5) As noted, the bar staff at the pool and lobby bars are top notch - some of the best and friendliest I've seen at similar resort settings. Drink orders and food preferences were remembered from day to day, etc. All in all, this is a beautiful resort with some service issues that need to be worked out.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Destination wedding location!”
Reviews.Author: mjoma22
Reviews.Content: I am shocked to read the negative reviews about the W Vieques. My partner and I got married there on the beach and had the most amazing wedding we could have ever asked for. First I should say that the hotel and people in general were all very gay friendly, we were always made to feel that our wedding wasn't any different. The staff was always friendly and the service was amazing. The property is beautiful and is everything that you would expect from a W property. Incredible decor in both the rooms and the lobby, A beautiful pool, great pool side service and all of the style that Ws typically provide! The spa is also great. If I had to provide some critiques i would say the following 1 It would be nice if there was a hot tub 2 although the food served at our wedding was absolutely delicious some of the meals were a little below par especially the breakfast buffet. The meals are very expensive and they should be a little better when you are paying that kind of money. 3. We had a really nice suite but not such a great view. Some of the less expensive rooms had views of the ocean that were much nicer than ours. I highly recommend the W vieques we definitely plan on returning

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property, Genuine People, Exceptional Destination”
Reviews.Author: synchi
Reviews.Content: Vieques is amazing. Listen. If you want always-on, extreme-level service -- Vieques is not the destination for you. This is island time, Puerto Rican culture and a place that has not had much experience with hospitality and tourism. This is what makes the place special. The W is a breathtaking resort. Sure, things move a little slower, but that's why you're on vacation isn't it? The staff were all making a concerted effort to make sure our needs were taken care of, and everyone we met was happy to help and extremely gracious. We were there during a very busy Christmas week, yet everything we needed was provided on time and with a smile. We couldn't have asked for a better experience. We are also extensive travelers, and SPG Platinum members -- so we know firsthand the standards and nuances among brands and properties. W Vieques has a charm and carefree spirit that matches the destination, and I think that's just awesome. Kudos to the staff and management for their ongoing effort to make everyone happy -- can't wait to come back to the island. Negative: Resort fee is excessive and unnecessary.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing retreat on Vieques 'north american' style”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Battersea
Reviews.Content: Don't believe all of the negative reviews and complaints you read on here..especially about the staff. We arrived just after christmas on the 27th and were expecting the worst having read the reviews...we expected a delayed check in, rude and apathetic service, and a hotel that is all 'style' and no substance. Surprisingly - we experienced the opposite! We arrived at 5pm from San Juan - waited at the 'W' Airport lounge for 10 mins before transport arrived. Nice welcome, cold towels, drinks and food offered. Easy transfer - 5 mins. At Check in we were script welcomed - and then WHAM (sorry, your room is not ready yet..!) Ok we thought - here we go... just what the reviews had said. But, we remained calm, polite and accomodating. We were offered complimentary drinks at the Bar...so, we waited...approx 45 minutes. When the room was ready, the manager came and welcomed us...they upgraded us to a 'Fabulous' room which was FABULOUS. We also saw other guests being delayed at check in...and we can tell you why - they don't have a lot of housekeeping staff, and they are very thorough with the rooms - so, we can understand why it takes time. However, it was worth the wait! The rooms (fabulous level) are great - open, spacious, well designed and appointed Wallpaper style - nice towels, toiletries (Bliss) and comfortable beds. If anything - a little dark, but A/C worked well...free WiFi (SPG card holder) and ample closet space. The property is small and compact - it is not a mega-resort. But, it is also NOT a 'hotel' in the traditional 'W' sense - if you come expecting this, you WILL be disappointed. It is aptly called a 'retreat' and that is what it is...spacious rooms/villas in beautiful landscaped grounds...open reception area with bar, TV lounge, Mix restaurant and patio...Everywhere is a short walk away, and there are two small north facing beaches (Atlantic side -so, waves and undertow!) but a wonderful Pool area. There are lounge chairs quite close together around the two pools (one for dipping) one for swimming) which are open 24 hours a day, no lifeguard. Towels and fresh ice water available at all points/showers near beaches. A few cabanas for hire...and some water chaise loungers w/ parasols. There is a tennis court, on site car rental (Avis) and a dive shop... there is a small W Cafe (for take away coffee, sandwiches and sundries..perfect for 'on the go' breakfast or snacks). Great Gym - clean and A/C...Amazing spa massages and facilities w/ Natura Bisse products. (Go fo the cocoa scrub!) So - what about the service.. We only encountered friendly service - in all the restaurants, ground staff and pool staff. If you have travelled to Greece, Africa, or other parts of the caribbean you will understand how great this hotel is...if you haven't, and your travel experience is in north america, at resorts and hotels with a high staff/guest ratio - you may be disappointed. This is the caribbean...and, just off puerto rico. SO, it is not manhattan! It is not MIami Beach! It is not Mauritius or Hawaii..it is Vieques... kind of laid back, latino-caribbean BUT with a 'W" style script and promise...which, I think they deliver on 90% of the time. The facts - the Ducasse restaurant provides great choice, quality food and excellent restaurant ambience and service. At times it may be slow - but, if anything it is because at peak times (e.g. Xmas) they can't possibly meet the demands of so many guests all at one time, and certainly not those of the discerning NY variety. (We heard several guests complaining about some of the most ridiculous things ever...'OMG - this cappucino is soooo cold.';' The towels don't smell fresh', etc etc) The staff work hard - we never saw anyone just lounging around, or not being guest responsive. They may not all be wearing false smiles and making inane saccharine 'chit chat' with rich, demanding, NY guests - but, they take it all in and get things done. It might not be the fastest, but it is well meaning and well managed. Anytime we saw a complaint or had a problem ourselves - it was dealt with promptly and professionally. My only gripe, the laundry service is just that... your clothes are washed and returned...no folding, no pressing (irons are in your room) and no dry cleaning. So, if you want basics washed..fine. Anything else - don't do it! When my shirts came back clean (but wrinkled to such an extent even self ironing wasnt possible - they comp'd the whole laundry.. THANK YOU W!) The W cafe team were friendly and helpful, The Dive team very nice and informative. Hiram - the concierge was helpful, courteous and generous with his time to all guests. Couldnt fault a thing...front desk were efficient and helpful. FOOD - Mix is great, the pool food was good too. The Pescadora BBQ on new year's eve was excellent. Make sure you get off property too - that way you don't get bored and get a taste of PR/Viequeno cuisine - not fancy, but tasty. The island is amazing...a gem of a little secret. The W delivers what North Americans on 1 week holiday need...clean facilities, cable TV, fresh towels (which by the way, DID smell nice!) and prompt delivery of cheeseburgers and fries anywhere on the property you desire...oh yes, and coffee...Starbucks style in the lounge or at the Cafe... plus a gym, free wifi and a decent size pool. The rooms around the pool (I think they are the spectacular) looked small, and are not very private... so, if you are in these rooms you may be disappointed. After all, room and room location makes a difference to your holiday. In this case, book the ocean front rooms and you will get what you pay for. At night, the fire pit by the bar is a nice touch...and I suppose that is what W does well - the little touches of urban cool and style (very Wallpaper 2005 design)...The W brand appears everywhere (W-this and W that (WoW, Wet, Whatever/whenever, etc etc). A bit over done - but THAT is the W - branded 'warmth of cool' North American style. A great little spot, perfect for a few days of R&R at a 'retreat' without compromising on many comforts... don't believe the worst reviews...if you are friendly, polite and able to communicate with the management in an adult manner and not make childish demands as if you are in the middle of manhattan - you will get the service you deserve, and hopefully the holiday you dream of! We loved the W Vieques, and want to congratulate the team for their hard work and efforts, at least this traveller appreciates what W have created! And...a special recognition for the W for being so Gay friendly - the most gay friendly hotel we have ever stayed at in the Caribbean, and it showed by the number of same sex couples who felt at home and were welcomed for their business! (if you want to know what it is like to have the opposite - go to Jamaica for a beach break - NOT!) If you want a nice warm holiday in the sun with a touch of latino...this is the island retreat for you! And, the W brand is urban cool on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location - non existent service”
Reviews.Author: Sue2356
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely not worth it. Took over an hour to check in. The location is beautiful and the staff are friendly but they are poorly managed. The room was still not made up at 4:45 in the afternoon. Definately not up to the W standard. Service is non existent.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing retreat”
Reviews.Author: llbnyc
Reviews.Content: Vieques is a beautiful, unspoiled island. If you love beautiful, uncrowded beaches and a slow relaxed vibe, go now before it gets spoiled. The W feels like staying at someone's huge comfortable villa. Lots of places to relax and enjoy the view, beaches and pool. Service is a bit slow but done with much kindness and heart. Don't miss the Caribbean beaches! The Bioluminescent Bay is magical.

Reviews.Title: “Treatment not worth a W.”
Reviews.Author: Frenchie84
Reviews.Content: I visited my puerto rican friends from Paris and decided to take me to the W to check it out and enjoy a few drinks in good company. I waited at the bar for over 20 minutes. The bartender Completely ignored me and my friends (there were 6 of us!) and decides to take care of two American ladies who were half dressed that had just entered the empty bar (it was us and a couple). Absolutely unacceptable. It is embarrassing to this island and to the status a W should have. I have been in Ws before and this is a major disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Angel at W”
Reviews.Author: Denise851
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the amenities at the W, with breath taking views of the ocean. We were especially blessed to meet Angel at MiX on the Beach for Christmas Brunch. He was friendly, personable, and we enjoyed him filling us in on his native island and the people. Everyone was equally as helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jack W
Reviews.Content: My fiance and me stay at the W Hotel Vieques 8 nigths celebrating our engagement. I am a member of SPG and I received a fabulous amenity champagne in my room, it was surprising because we didnt expect it and we enjoy the Vallformosa! In the first nigth of our stay we order two ceasar salads and a Mezze Plate and i was surprised when the food runner (Joeanne O) says the food ticket that we keep, came fast with our food! W-W agents told me when I call by phone the food will delayed 30-45 minutes and she came 20 minutes after our call. We invite her to place our tray in the table and she kindly make it with a smile. We think she is the more youngest staff in the W Hotel! Not too much english knowledge but good service and fast! We also eat the other nigth at Mix on the Beach rest. and the servers were very nice and fast with our order.Food came out a little late but it was amazing. W-W agents are kind of rude and never answer phone calls. They always are in the computer our listening to music. The ambassador guys are excellent and always open us the door with a smile. We definitelly will stay again in Vieques, highly recommended!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Magical"”
Reviews.Author: Halsey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W in Vieques for a week in December and are completely baffled by the negative reviews especially with some of them coming from folks who were there at the same time. We did arrive early as we flew over from Ceiba after a week on Puerto Rico so perhaps that is why we had zero issues with check-in. In fact staff were so gracious I remember their names, Kelly at the front desk and Celestina who held my hand weeks prior to arrival. We found all staff to be friendly and accommodating - from the moment you arrive at the airport lounge. This included the shuttle driver, front desk, gentleman who showed us to our room and provided a brief tour of the facility, staff at the W Cafe, the woman who single handedly managed the Avis desk, Blackbeard's staff, wait staff at the Living Room and Wet (pool side) - fantastic!! Then there is the room. We waited for less than an hour (put on our bathing suits and went swimming while we waited) for the perfect room on the ocean side overlooking Sunset point. It was indeed magical at sunset and later for stargazing while listening to waves and coqui's - truly memorable. We stayed Saturday to Saturday and rented a car from the on site Avis Monday through Thursday. It was a perfect balance of resort life and island exploration. We had a blast trying to find the perfect beach for snorkeling and would have to say for this trip it would be Green beach and Navio beach. Blue beach was also a top rated beach with us. After the beach we would stop in Esperanza for dinner before heading back to the W. Really enjoyed happy hour and dinner at the Trade Winds in Esperanza. At the W, we loved going for a late drink and meal (specials every nite and great flatbread pizza's) in the Living Room, sitting outside in the very comfy couch's enjoying the warm tropical breeze and great service, i.e., no rushing - total relaxation. We would then saunter over to finish the nite off at the fire pit. It simply does not get any better than this! Have to also give a shout out to the one woman show at Roy's in Isabella - fantastic breakfast in a small tropical garden. You can bet that we are already figuring out how to do a repeat vacation in Vieques and the W. LBH

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: LiveItUp11111
Reviews.Content: Vieques is an amazing island; not many other places left in the world like it! Hotel staff was friendly and seemed to genuinely care that we had an enjoyable stay. Edison (reservations?) was a wealth of information before we checked in. Also, Tara from the spa was a real gem and I would highly recommend a treatment from her during your stay. Would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “W Vieques Needs Big Improvement: Poor Resort”
Reviews.Author: Mike R
Reviews.Content: The cons: By far the poorest W Hotel we have stayed in and the bottom 1/3 of the 90 SPG properties we have stayed in. Main problem is that the staff at the pool, front-desk, and W Cafe staff are inexperienced and rude. Some give the impression they are doing you a favor by assisting you. We told the gentleman who checked us in we were on our honeymoon and he did nothing. When I expressed concern 4 days later, he told me there was nothing in the reservation notes about our Honeymoon and blew me off. Later that day, we happened to be dining next to some of the W staff on the other side of the Island and overheard them complaining about their jobs and the guests. Very telling! We tried to book their special seaside dinner for our honeymoon prior to arriving. The W. Staff took 3 weeks to follow up with menu modifications that did nothing but complicate a fairly simple request to swap one entree in the fixed menu. We had ants in our room. I called the front desk and they told me we would have to wait one day for an exterminator. Only when I pressed did they offer to move rooms. The exterminator never came, so we cleaned up the room ourselves. Houskeeping is poor. They cleaned our room at 4-5pm almost every day. They claim cleaning is from 9-5pm, but it's really 3-5 pm. They took our towels and robes, but never replaced them. Clearly not enough staff. We paid for a "spectacular" room, yet they claimed they did me a favor by upgrading me to the same room. Garden walkways are dangerous. We almost fell twice because they were too dark. "Whatever, Whenever" is more like we answer the phone whenever we feel like it and do whatever it takes to avoid helping you. About half of my calls were answered, a couple of which were to order room service. For a 2,500 bill, they authorized 7,000 in charges to my credit card. Most times those extra authorizations expire, but I am still trying to reach finance. I don't appreciate them occupying that much of my credit. Resort fee is excessive ($65 per night on top of your bill) for what they provide. "Free Parking" as part of the resort fee is a bit of red herring since the only cars are the rental cars through the Avis pool at the W. No hot tub. Beach is not as nice as beaches off the resort grounds. The pros: The food and service at the Hotel restaurant is excellent. The menu is limited, but overall high quality food. Resort would benefit from a juice bar or something for health minded people near the pool. More local fruits and vegetables from the region could be incorporated into all meals. The best meal we had was at a restaurant called Quenepo, which is about a 10min cab ride to the harbor of Esperanza. Beautiful grounds. Well maintained. Very nice pool. Great access to outdoor activities on the Island. Blackbeards (The contracted sports shop) was outstanding for snorkling, biking and our tour guide Blaine was awesome! W Manager was sympathetic to the ants and rude front desk staff so he comp'd us dinner and sent champagne to our room. Nice gesture, but shows he knows his hotel is sub-par and something he needs to improve. Spa was excellent. It was actually staffed well and very professional. Room was very spacious. Coffee in the morning at the bar was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Worst resort I have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Todd W
Reviews.Content: It started the first night with a wedding party outside my room and no soundproofing. This was followed by a cold shower in the morning. I reported the lack of hot water and was assured a maintenance person would fix the problem. It was not fixed and I called again. They sent a maintenance person to tell me I had to let the water "run for a while" to heat up. The next morning I let it run 15 minutes and still had a cold shower. This was fixed when they moved me to a new room after I had to chase down and kill the mouse in my room. I was "upgraded" from a room with a balcony and a nice view to a ground floor room, half the size of my previous room and right next to the restaurant so everyone could walk right past my glass door which had a nice view of the constructionoutside my room. At least I finally had hot water. The sound proofing was no better and the couple next door made a lot of noise at 2 am. Also, the food was very expensive and very poor quality. I found much better food at half the price when I finally rented a car and got away from the resort. Vieques is a beautiful island and I encourage anyone to go there but do not stay at the W!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed !!!”
Reviews.Author: VLisovet
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying that Vieques is an amazing island with really awesome beaches and great atmosphere overall, I would definitely recommend this island to anyone, however, the hotel was beyond disappointing. We stayed at the W because of the brand and the type of hotel experience that the W usually offers. This hotel did not live up to the W standard at all. The room does not have dressers to unpack and have your things out of the suitcase while you are staying there. At night when walking to my room, it was so dark that I was too nervous to go by myself, people were walking around with flashlights in order to see clearly. The towels were barely changed 2 out of the 5 days that we stayed, we got turndown service one night that we were there. The staff was was less then accommodating to our needs, we called the concierge and left a message to have him call us back so we can make reservations for the bio bay tour, never got a phone call back. We ordered room service for breakfast and when it came the order was incorrect, it was less then what we ate the entire time we were down there at the hotel restaurant yet it was double the price, when we said we did not want it the person that brought it up to our room was beyond nasty and when my boyfriend tried to give her a tip she said he can keep it and walked away. There was not one day that we had towels by the pool without having to go to the concierge and go get them, the one day that we wanted to eat dinner in the restaurant we were told that because we did not make reservations it was going to be a 40 minute wait even though we saw about 3 or 4 tables that were open. My boyfriend ordered a drink to their own beach and because the waitress walked it over they had a 3 dollar charge, I would rather them tack the 3 dollar charge onto the drink then tell me because I ordered a drink to their own beach I get charged 3 dollars for a delivery fee. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Too much room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: enicideme
Reviews.Content: First of all: Vieques is the best island, PERIOD, in the Caribbean! Stunning, empty beaches. Great atmosphere. We have stayed at the W in Vieques several times, and have some strong feelings. Its definitely a cool feel to land on the island, and stay in the special W portion of the airport terminal, while awaiting a ride to the hotel. If you need a car (which is absolutely necessary, in my opinion, to explore the island) make sure to do it several months in advance. Check in is not exactly fast. Once checked in, they insist on giving an overly long tour of the entire grounds. I guess some people like that kind of thing, my wife and I don't. The rooms are beautiful. Kind of a sparse, semi-modern feel. We have only stayed in the ocean front rooms. Unfortunately, these rooms are always >$600 per night. Very expensive. Awesome views, and its great to fall asleep with the sound of the surf and the coqui frogs, but soooo expensive for a basic, non-suite room. The gym is nice. Lots of high end equipment, and my wife had a great time with the yoga classes each morning. Biggest downer? The food. I know other reviews say the same, but they're right. The main restaurant is ridiculously expensive, and not that good. The less formal bar cafe has very basic food that is still incredibly expensive. Your best bet is to find a room with a fridge, and buy food at one of the food grocery stores in one of the two towns. Having said all of that. . .we will continue to return. While the W is on the rough Northern side of the island, the south side has the best beaches we have ever seen. By far. We are not ecstatic about the hotel, but the stunning nature of the beaches overcomes our ambivalence about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed - Worst W stay we have ever had!”
Reviews.Author: ranger22miami
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? We are on our second night here out of a short 2 night stay to celebrate our anniversary... This will certainly be our last stay in this property. I am not a W fan, but I have stayed at W's in NYC, Montreal and have booked the W St. Petersburg (Russia) for this summer. I believe that cool ambiance and exclusivity cannot be produced in a chain hotel and cool can't be subjected to a cookie cutter method and I have given up on the W. To be methodical, I will list the few pro's and the many cons PROS: Airport lounge is a nice touch, although it feels like a waste of time to check-in twice Well...That's about it CONS: - Checked in at 330pm only to be told there is not a single room available and to be guided to the pool bar, without any offer of a free drink or anything else... We were called with our room number at 430, so we waited an hour. - Our room is situated in one of the back "villas" 1421 and has the great view of a parking lot, the resort's access road and the wall of the building next to it... Honestly? a $400 room with this kind of view? Avoid villas 10-15 - As reviewed before, staff can be pretty clueless. Not more so than the Mix hostess... She told us the wait would be 45 minutes and that our only other option was to eat at the bar, so we went and ordered at the bar only to be called again by the same hostess 10 minutes later with a table opening! She also neglected the fact that there was another menu available for the Living Room lounge which was much more appetizing than the burgers at the bar. - First night, a loud humming electrical noise kept waking me up from next to our room... thinking it was the AC, I turned it off... nothing. When I called in the morning a maintenance worker came and switched off an "extractor" at an engine room right next to our room without so much as a sorry... It was apparently been left on by mistake. - Breakfast was OK... although at this price ($30/person buffet) I would have expected an omelette station and better cheese choices than nasty sweaty American processed yellow cheese at the buffet! I doubt any of the guests at a hotel where prices start at $400 will actually eat this kind of cheese at home. I asked the chef if he had some real cheese and he proceeded to recite a litany of french cheeses that were available... The reason why they weren't presented was not available. I opted for a serving of good old Puerto Rican white cheese that could have easily been put at the buffet. - Room key demagnetized twice during our stay - At the pool this afternoon, after a brief rain shower, we asked the pool attendant for 2 towels... and he could only procure one... Never heard of a beach resort running out of towels! - There is an utter lack of information about activities available at the resort, we keep on finding things out by talking to other guests but there is no posted information at all, nor the staff volunteers much beyond the absolutely necessary. - We have enjoyed renting a car and honestly, spending time away from the fake luxury and pretentiousness of the W while enjoying the nice beaches in Vieques and the low key restaurants around the island. I hope you have had enough reading the bad reviews about this place to stop you from booking it... I am sure there are better places to stay in Vieques for a third of the price. Don't feel like a sucker like I feel now! Planned a romantic and special getaway for me and my wife and now we feel like we wasted our time and our valuable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, room for improvement but getting there”
Reviews.Author: Melanie_In_Chicago
Reviews.Content: It's clear they're still trying to figure things out, but they'll get there, and it seemed as though they had some additional, more seasoned help from other properties to help them get on their feet. Despite some complaints, the trip was well worth it and I'd highly recommend both the island and the W. Overall, a beautiful property - gorgeous setting, great pools, nicely designed lobby, bar, patios and restaurant. Excellent gym facility - ample, clean, well-functioning equipment. Service issues persist, however. Some staff were very good, others should be banished from the property as they tarnish W's reputation. It seems that they're inexperienced serving guests who are well-traveled and have high expectations for efficient service. For example, after a full day of traveling, we arrived at 5PM and our room wasn't yet available. We were finally able to get into a different room, and as we were getting our key at the front desk we requested to book one of the tour offerings. The front desk person with whom we had been dealing encouraged us to go to our rooms, relax, and come back later. We were tired and cranky and wanted to book the damn thing then and there so we could be done with it. And yet he persisted on telling us to come back later. Finally, we put our foot down and demanded we could arrange the tour on the spot. How crazy is it that we had to force them to take our money!? That was just one of a handful of annoyances. (And he never did book the damn tour, as we found out the following morning when we double-checked). Food prices at the hotel are exorbitant. We didn't find many places on the island for a good breakfast, but there are lots of great options for lunch and dinner, especially in Esperanza (Duffys, Bananas, Next Course, El Quenepo). Rent a Jeep and give yourself the flexibility to tour the island, whether for meals or for exploring the FABULOUS beaches on the south east side of Vieques. Be sure to do an evening kayaking excursion in the Bio Bay - extremely memorable! Other convenient amenities at the hotel: Avis car rental (saleswoman needed a major attitude adjustment but the Jeeps are in great condition), sports shop with knowledgeable, friendly staff -- and the resort fee covers snorkel rentals which are also in great condition. Last points for Starwood management reading this review: Please turn off that awful music that you've got piped in at every point on the property! It's fine for your city destinations, but when one goes to relax at a gorgeous Caribbean island, it's nice to have a little R&R without the constant beat of lounge music EVERYWHERE. Some places on the property - okay. But not everywhere. And add some subtle lights to your garden walkways, as you can't see where you're going at night.

Reviews.Title: “'Eh'”
Reviews.Author: D_ExplorerMiami_FL
Reviews.Content: If you've stayed at other 'W' hotels and enjoyed their service and hospitality, then you will be very disappointed with this location. The good- the private beach, hotel decor, signature 'W' bed (you're sleeping on a cloud) The bad- SERVICE! The service is awful. The management had to bring in other managers from other 'W' hotel locations to help this location with their service. That should tell you something. The hotel ended up comp'ing quite a few of our meals because they messed up our food orders EVERY TIME!! If this is where you are coming for your honeymoon, i would be very upset. The rooms have great detail but if you want it to be cleaned in the mornings, make sure you hunt down room service. The restaurant is okay. I think it is incredibly expensive and has few choices. You would be better served to leave the hotel instead of eating at the hotel. RENT A CAR!!!! It will end up being much cheaper than using the hotel's car service. The island is very small. Although there are beaches on the southern end of the island, they are remote. By that i mean there are no places to eat, use the bathroom, shop, or do anything. Once you are dropped at the beach, you have no way out until they pick you up. Further, they charge an obscene amount of money to go to the beach. For example, to go to 'Blue Beach', costs 37 dollars per couple or 25 dollars per person. The beach is about 10 minutes away. Rent the car. You will be independent and you won't feel like you are being ripped off by the hotel. You can rent a car on the premises but you have to make reservations. You can rent a car from the small airport, but I do not know their policies or prices.

Reviews.Title: “OUR TRIP WAS A DREAM”
Reviews.Author: Diana F
Reviews.Content: Months before we arrived I contacted Lindsay at the front desk and who held my hand through the whole process (basically I was a basket case). I had so many questions in which she happily replied to all~with a smile on her face-you could tell by her email. We arrived on Vieques around 7:30 P.M. and the van arrived right when we got our luggage. Lindsay checked us in and we waited in the living room for our luggage and tour to our room. Our room was right by the pool and we could hear the waves crashing on the shore. By the way you can't hear a thing on the bottom floor by the pool. The service from start to finish was fantastic. My husband broke a glass in our room and the house cleaning crew was there in 5 minutes to clean it up. The food was good and dinner was magical because the weather was so beautiful and it was never packed-I felt we could take all the time we wanted. The Bio Bay through I think Abe's-not sure but it was a once in a life time event! GO even if you are like my husband and never want to leave the resort-he doesn't regret going off of the site after our excursions. Scoop up the water and let it run down your arm~looks like glitter running down your arm. We also went to Red Beach which was a paradise-I recommend going to Black Beard's on the resort, their away package or something like that-$35ish and you get two chairs, umbrella and a cooler to pack beer or beverage of your choice. To make it your trip I recommend going on all sorts or web sites and get a hold of W Vieques if you have ANY questions. Remember you are on a small island and they go at a slower pace than all of us in the rat race so be patient. The only thing warmer than the weather are the people of Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review - what would you do?”
Reviews.Author: Travelers13310
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are in our 6th night of an 8 night stay at the W Vieques. I've read the other recent reviews and mentioned them to the staff who all shook their heads in obvious embarrassment. Okay so there have been a couple challenges but overall we feel the level of service is â€œtryingâ€� to improve.We've had some great meals on the island especially at Next Course (Dinner yum!) and a little dive in Esparanza called Belly Buttons (Pam brought out some enchiladas that were to die for.) but we've avoided eating at the resort mostly due to the exorbitant prices and poor reviews. Last night we bit the bullet and had a wonderful meal at Mix with Janie waiting on our every need. If they could clone Janie and Josie (the night bartender) and STOP PLAYING CHRISTMAS MUSIC around the grounds W could kiss their problems goodbye. Oh, one last minor complaint; our room is dark; there are no lights on the side of the room facing the sliding glass door and we resorted to buying a flashlight in town to find our way around the large piece of built in furniture that encompasses the desk / bookshelf / fridge. There may be better places to stay on the island but I didnâ€™t see them.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Experience @ an Exceptionally Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: ropqsr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (both in our mid 30's) just returned from a one week stay in Vieques (Nov 29th-Dec 6th). The first half of the week we stayed at the W and the remainder of the week at Malecon House (loved it here for different reasons too). Overall we loved the W and had a great experience!!! We consider ourselves seasoned travelers and have been all over the Caribbean. We have stayed in every type of accomodation from five star resorts, private villas, all inclusives to more modest inns. We travel for pleasure not business and because of the variety of places we like to stay, never care about racking up or using any hotel points. With that said, we chose Vieques to explore the incredible beaches and we chose the W in particular to sit and relax in a luxurious/romantic setting. Having stayed at other W properties, we knew what to expect as far as the decor and overall vibe. The resort itself is absolutely gorgeous and exceeded our expectations. Our room was modern (loved the shower and big chair), very spacious and had an incredible ocean view. The resort has impeccably maintained/designed grounds with a wonderful pool setting and breathtaknig views of the ocean. We also enjoyed working out in the gym. The lobby is decorated in the cool/modern typical W fashion but still somehow maintains that relaxed caribbean feel. We enjoyed all of the sitting areas by the pool and lobby, oversized chaises and the firepit at night for cocktails. We had planned to visit the spa but were so content relaxing by the pool we never scheduled any services... Service was great. Having read some conflicting reviews, we were prepared for a mixed bag. Fortunately, we received solid and consistent service from every employee we encountered. Check in was quick, smooth and friendly. Our ambassador Raul gave us a great tour of the resort and our room upon check in. The waitstaff at breakfast were always pleasant and attentive. (As a side note, I did get the sense that the W has been working on addressing some of their service issues because there seemed to be multiple management-type staff who seemed to be visiting from another location at the time we were there). In addition, we had great poolside service. The girl who waited on us daily was always coming by to check on us to see if we needed anything. Great mojitos too! The only area not up to par in my opnion, was the quality of the food. Our package included breakfast at Mix on the Beach. We ordered room service twice and also ate by the pool during the day. On each occasion, the food was average at best (One reason why we went elsewhere for dinner). For the price, it should be much, much better. ie/ not hot enough, brown meat on my turkey sandwich, breakfast meats that had been sitting out on the buffet all morning.. In contrast, we had several GREAT dining experiences elsewhere on the island. Next Course and El Quenepo had top notch service and creative menus with quality, fresh ingredients. We also enjoyed the seafood options at TradeWinds in Esperanza. Overall the W is a fabulous property that exceptionally well designed. We truly enjoyed our stay. To other travelers, I would recommend getting off the resort and renting a jeep at least for a couple of days. It's fun to drive on the island but more importantly, the beaches of Vieques are some of the best my husband and I have ever seen in the Caribbean. Seeing some of the old navy bunkers etc.. also neat. Blue beach is absolutely breathtaking (shallow crystal clear blue, calm water, long walking beach, and isolated). I think it has moved into the top position as our favorite beach of all time. Navio and Red beach are both also beautiful. There's not much to see/do in Isabel II but I'm glad we checked things out there. I always think it's an important experience to see the authentic culture of the island. Take a cab to Esperanza and walk along the Malecon. We were so pleasantly surprised by the number of great eateries, restaurants, and little local island bars and the sunsets are amazing. (Lazy Jack's, Duffy's, Bananas all fun, laid back places for drinks) Suggestions for improvement: The W should consider their own shuttle service at night (include that in the $60/day resort fee)for those who want to get off the resort property, explore Esperanza or have a nice dinner off site. Also, Keep a well stocked bar in the welcome lounge at the airport (selection was very sparse when we landed) ie/ beer, wine, margaritas, sangria... It will be a nice first impression when guests land :) (and again would again help us justify the daily resort fee $)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, frustrating service”
Reviews.Author: adair578
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days here during the week of Thanksgiving 2011. I read the reviews before going, so had expectations of how the service would be. The other reviews are right - the service is slow and not what one would expect from a W. We had numerous mixups on our meals, taxis and excursions. They were all resolved, but not without considerable effort on our part, repeatedly calling/notifying staff. We stayed here using Starwood points, but I think if I'd actually been paying for the room I might have been more upset by the lack of service. On the positive side, the hotel itself is beautiful and the views are amazing. We awoke one morning to a group of horses grazing outside our room. Pretty cool!

Reviews.Title: “Worth going to for the island”
Reviews.Author: NYC-TRAV-FAM
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where else you could stay in Vieques and wouldnt want to deter anyone from visiting such a special place, we loved driving around and exploring the other beaches and local food... seeing the wild horses! However, I wouldnt suggest coming to the W with high expectations as you will be disappointed. The property and rooms themselves are lovely, the service is poor. We expressed interest in renting a 4WD at least 3 times when we checked in and were assured it was no problem, and then the next morning when we went to hire a car [there is a car hire on the property at the W] we were told they were all booked! We were furious as no one had told us to pre-book and no one at check-in have given us an idea it would be a problem! In the end we took a "dirty" car, but it was fine, an almost brand new Jeep that was just uncleaned on the outside from the previous guests. At the hotel "Adult Beach" we waited around for hours for some service to order food and when someone finally came by the beach we were told there was a phone at the top of the steps to call for service. good to know! Also good to know was that the food was crazy expensive, it was $60+usd for a snack for one person. Dinner at the restaurant was terrible. We didnt reserve a table as the hotel was very quiet the weekend we went, but when we went for dinner the waiter made a huge fuss of the fact that we hadnt booked and wouldnt let us sit inside, this was fine as it was nice weather out. We sat outside nearer to the bar side of the restaurant, we had pizza which was cold on the inside so we had to send it back and when it came back we still didnt eat it was some cheap nasty frozen pizza. The restaurant has an affiliation with a known chef - well he should know what they are serving!!! We had deep tissue massages at the spa and I have had many massages in my time but this was the first time I have had one where I almost got up and walked out partway through as it was so bad that I was convinced my masseuse was not an actual masseuse! In the end i gave in and let myself relax but it was definitely the worst massage I have ever paid for. A real shame as the spa itself is beautiful and the massage room was very nice. The best parts of our stay were our room which was very nice, we liked the tub! it looks worse in photos than it is. We loved the jeep we finally got to hire, the island itself is such a gem, despite all the shortfallings of the hotel, I would definitely go back just to visit Vieques again. Dont bother driving to the local side/populated side of the island, but explore the beaches! The flight in and out from San Juan on Cape Air was awesome, I loved the mini plane and closeness to the cockpit, what a fun flight!

Reviews.Title: “Good, not Great”
Reviews.Author: krnesbitt
Reviews.Content: My husband is a Platinum SPG member, and we stayed here on points for 5 nights during early November 2011. I arrived first, and was directed to the W Lounge at the Airport. We were only there for a few minutes before we were escorted to the property. Upon check-in, I was informed of the $65.00/day resort charge, which I wasn't thrilled about. The girl checking me in wasn't exactly friendly or very informative, either. The couple checking in next to me had a very friendly staff member who promptly asked an "ambassador" to show them around the property. The staff member who showed me around the resort was summoned in the middle of doing something else-so he hurriedly told me where a few things were, and deposited me in my room. I had told them specifically in both the airport lounge AND upon check-in when my husband was arriving, so they could pick him up from the airport. I ended up having to call down to the front desk later that evening when he arrived and called me-because the W lounge was unstaffed and no one was there to pick him up. We had a beautiful room, in villa 17. It had an oceanview balcony, 1 full bathroom and a 1/2 bath. We had a living room with mini-bar, kitchen table, and lounge chairs. The bedroom was a good size, with a four-post bed, very comfortable, no problem sleeping! Our room was quiet and private. I definitely wouldn't have wanted a room overlooking the pool...too noisy. They did send us a complimentary bottle of champagne and a dessert plate on our first night there, along with a nice handwritten note, because we were celebrating our anniversary.
