Two issues with the room: the shower pressure from the rainfall shower head is not good. It took me FOREVER to get the shampoo and conditioner out of my hair (and I have thin, straight hair!) I also hated the bathtub. I'm someone who loves to take baths, and at an upscale property like the "W," I would expect at least a large soaking tub. This bathtub looked like a large aluminum wash tub that cattle or other farm animals drink out of. Really? The restaurant, miX on the Beach, was OK, not great, particularly for the price we paid. Very overpriced. Much better food and drinks can be had elsewhere on the island...you must try Next Course and Sol Food. The W Cafe is also very expensive...beware when going in to grab some coffee, juice, or breakfast. The oceanviews from the restaurant and the outside deck are fabulous, though. The drinks at the pool were incredibly sweet, though I've been told this is a Puerto Rican preference. My "sangria" tasted like Hawaiian Punch or Kool-Aid. I also felt like the pool area was minimally staffed, and they couldn't keep up with the drink/food orders. As for the beaches, get off the property and check out the beaches in the Vieques Wildlife Reserve, particularly Blue Beach. Actually, that would be my greatest piece of advice: rent a 4WD from the Avis on-site at the W (we did), or from Maritza's car rental, and get off the property to check out the island! So...I would stay here again, but probably because the accommodations are as nice as you'll find on Vieques. Everything else, I'd get or do off-site!

Reviews.Title: “Go, but remember your on island time!”
Reviews.Author: cew5x
Reviews.Content: I had such high expectations, but at the end of the day the W IS just another hotel, however hip it tries to be. The good: Our ocean view room (in Villa 2) was beautiful- great views, quiet, nice amenities. The concierge was helpful in recommeding a restaurant to us (Restaurant Bili in Esperanza, which was delicious) The "could be improved": --I echo the other comments about the service- our room wasn't cleaned until after 6pm (!) one night, a request for fresh towels from the whatever/whenever desk was never fulfilled. --The restaurant was outrageously priced with just OK food and terrible service. We had to ask for everything- to order, for more water, for bread, for the check.... If I could do it again, I would --ask my room to be made up immediately in the morning --go to the cafe for breakfast and lunch and skip the restaurant entirely --rent a car early (before your trip- there is an avis on site and also dealers elsewhere on the island) and skip the pool in favor of the beaches- the secret beach was my favorite. you can rent chairs and umbrellas from black beard sports on the resort --eat in town- lower prices, better food!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon In Paradise Part 1”
Reviews.Author: Shannon W
Reviews.Content: Honeymoon in Paradise: Part One Having owned several businesses, we are very sympathetic to those in the service industry. Most of the people in the industry truly have a passion, and it shows. Since I have been fortunate enough to have traveled around the globe, my fiancÃ© left the honeymoon planning up to me as she "trusted my judgment" (No Pressure Right?). The only stipulation she gave was that she did not want to go anywhere that I had previously visited, and since we had not taken a vacation in several years, would like to have the time spent on our honeymoon, "Extended" if at all possible. Since I am a HUGE "Starwood" fan and just recently slept my way back to "Platinum" status, I was hoping to keep it in the family. Now, to understand what sparked my interest in the places we ended up choosing you need to better understand my wife. She LOVES "Water", especially clean, warm water that you can swim in, and if there happens to be a beach attached to it, even better. Now here is a fun fact that doesn't really make sense, but helps with our travel decisions. We are both in the "Entertainment" industry, and would prefer to avoid large crowds if at all possible. We also are not â€œTraditionalâ€� people, for example, we made up our own vows, and there was no â€œChicken Danceâ€� to speak of at our reception. I had spent several months asking friends, "Where is your favorite place you have ever been"? Or "If you were going on your honeymoon, where would you like to go"? Our Second stop "Costa Rica", came up repeatedly, but more about that later. Note: Look for: Honeymoon in Paradise Part 2, coming soon. There is one spot that I only heard mentioned once, but just so happened to be the location of a new "W Resort and Spa". This being a small island located approximately halfway between "St. Thomas" and "San Juan" Puerto Rico called "Vieques". If St. Thomas is a "Virgin" island, then the best way to describe Vieques" would be "Extra Virgin". My friend "Patricia" and her BFF Jon have traveled to more places than anyone I know, and when I asked Patricia, "Trish", what her favorite was, without missing a breath, she not only said, "Vieques", but also said, "The W, in Vieques PR". The photos of this wonderful property that I had been viewing on the SPG website were still fresh on my mind, and since I trusted "Trish" more than most, Vieques it was. TRANSPORTATION: The first decision I had to make was regarding "Travel". Getting to San Juan is easy. In fact, I never realized just how reasonable travel between the USA, and Puerto Rico was. The challenge came when I read that the boat ride was only $2 Ea. (Yes, Two Dollars), and the flight was $200 Ea. I read as much as possible on this topic, and the way I saw it was this. Without a doubt, a 20 min plane ride, vs. a 2.5 hour (X2) boat ride made for a close decision. However, when you factor in a "Strike" and several broken down ships, causing the remaining boats to take on some extra stops (their sister island for one), the â€œPossibilityâ€� of missing a connecting flight, not to mention it being our Honeymoon, and the decision was easy. The second Transportation question came regarding a "Rental Car". It was very clear from virtually everyone I spoke with that having transportation on the Island was a "Must". However, what they don't tell you is that it is "Extremely" â€œExpensiveâ€�, choices are very "Limited", and that during the busy season, they often run out. We ended up renting a small 4 wheel drive from Vieques Rentals, and were very happy with our decision. Their representative "Joeyâ€� was extremely nice and we were very glad that we had it. The only thing I will mention here is that driving a car on the island of Vieques is not for everyone. There are only two or three "Good" (Although that word barely applies here), roads. Growing up in Michigan was the best training possible for navigating these pothole covered roadways. We ended up with a slow leak at one point, but were as good as new in a few min thanks to the well trained Fix a Flat specialists at the local tire store. THE W RESORT Being a HUGE Starwood Fan, and knowing that we were about to embark on our very first "Starwood W Resort" Experience, had me "Almost" as excited as the fact that I was about to marry the girl of my dreams. Think about it for a min... You have "Starwood" IMO "The best collection of hotels on the planet", combined with their "W" brand (Which my Best Man and I both love so much we even stayed at The W Lakeshore Chicago for my bachelor party weekend). Combined with a tropical Island that has only been inhabited by tourists for a few years, and what do you get... WOW is an Understatement... From the moment we landed we knew this was going to be something special. How many resorts have their own "Lounge" at the airport? (Although IMO it needs a little something more, such as a "Specialâ€� â€œWelcome" Island Cocktail, complimentary chair massage tied into the spa, welcome gift, etc). It may have been a slow day, but this is a missed opportunity. Also, it is not very clear where you go when you first get off the plane and when it is â€œOKâ€� to go there. They are 95% there and it wouldnâ€™t take much to go the extra 5%. Soon we were off to the resort itself (About a 5 min drive) in a beautiful new SUV. Both gals who checked us in were extremely nice. Since it was our honeymoon, they upgraded us to a slightly nicer room, and off we went. We faced what they called "The Quiet Beach", and the waves sounded like they had been scripted by a relaxation guru. Prior to booking a Starwood â€œWâ€� Property, I read loads of reviews, and one thing that popped up several times was â€œMusicâ€�, which honestly I would much rather hear deep relaxing chill/ house music, than the same 21 songs you hear on the radio all day long. This also adds a much more sophisticated feel to the â€œWâ€� properties, and is appreciated by most well traveled people. However I would agree that they need to deepen their selection, so that you donâ€™t hear the same CD/Tracks play with any noticeable frequency. The â€œWâ€� brand has been out for a while now, and Iâ€™m sure they have a good backlog of â€œLicensedâ€� material to choose from. Our first morning I was awoken by my "Bride" (who almost always sleeps in longer than I). She was gushing with excitement, and couldn't wait for the morning fog to clear from my eyes so I could focus on the photo she had taken on her phone. Apparently, my wife (Who is one of the biggest Horse fans I have ever met), went for a morning walk to see the property, came around a corner, and to her surprise, nearly ran into a pack of wild horses, who had gathered right in the middle of the path. I had heard that there were "A Few" wild horses on the Island, but little did we know that there are a few "Thousand" wild horses who roam free like deer all over the island. We ended up seeing horses "Everywhere" we went; The Beach, The Hotel, The Gas Station, The Road, I mean, "Everywhere". It's the craziest thing, and to a horse lover, a dream come true. What made this even more special was that several of them had recently given birth, and there were new born babies stumbling around everywhere. Very Cool. OK, since everyone else isnâ€™t nearly as excited about my honeymoon as they are about the details, time to get to it: First of all, the W Vieques has one of the nicest hotel Fitness Centers I have ever experienced, and they had a full time person who kept it well stocked with towels, water, and kept it as clean as a whistle. The â€œSnackâ€� spot (Canâ€™t remember the name) located next door to the Fitness Center was lacking in selection, especially if you were looking for a quick â€œHealthyâ€� snack. Again, Iâ€™m sure that obtaining good, quality produce, and more on an island faced with shipping strikes, combined with being the nicest place on the island, presents its share of challenges, but a nice â€œSmoothieâ€� bar with Protein, and vitamin boosts would be nice, as would â€œFresh Squeezed Juicesâ€�. When we asked why they didnâ€™t carry any â€œFreshâ€� items such as â€œBlueberriesâ€�, the person behind the counter said, â€œHave you seen the price of Blueberries hereâ€�, to which I wanted to respond, â€œHave you seen the price of the rooms hereâ€�? The Pool is simply incredible, and would give the smaller hotel Pools in Vegas a run for their money. There are chairs positioned in the water that allow you to stay completely dry, while resting only inches from the water. There are also some of the nicest cabanas in the Caribbean, which can be rented upon request. The layout of the Infinity portion of the pool, combined with the chairs virtually floating just above the water, makes this all very surreal. The music being played over the hotel sound system was perfect for the environment Note: If you are looking for the same music you hear every day over the radio at home, sorry, but you have just been given an upgrade. Keep in mind; you are at a "Retreat"/"Spaâ€� Very relaxing, with the best part being that there were even speakers under the water, to further enhance your experience. Nice! The Staff was very friendly, and took very good care of us. The lobby was extremely, FUN. With a pool table, games, bar, and a fire pit located just a few feet outdoors, that set it all off just perfect. However, they do need to do a better job maintaining what they have. Note for mgmt: We searched thru every pool cue stick, and did not find one with a tip. There were also missing pieces from a couple of the games we tried to play. The Food was fantastic. One thing to note here is that our vacation was during the time of year when many of the Island restaurants were closed. Since we were staying for 9 days, we had the opportunity to eat several times for lunch, dinner, snacks, and even room service. The food in the restaurant was so delicious I found myself getting cravings for it. The Chef had a "Special" dish that we tried on a number of occasions, and were blown away by how incredible it was. Even some of the appetizers like our favorite "Hummus" were done to perfection. We only found three other restaurants that were worth mentioning. Duffyâ€™s - Not really into "Bar Food", but this place does it right. The Staff was fantastic, and they played old Music Videos hosted by the legendary Wolfman Jack during Lunch. If you are looking for a Sandwich or happen to be on the other side of the Island and decide that youâ€™re hungry, Duffyâ€™s is a "Safe" bet: we ended up there twice. "Next Course" - We ate dinner here three times (And were very lucky as we heard that it had just re-opened the week prior) and enjoyed it immensely. And lastly, "El Patio", which was also very good but had zero atmosphere and a staff who albeit nice, seemed very detached. They did have one of the tastiest Lobsters we had. Be warned, itâ€™s a bit of a shock going from the â€œWâ€�, to virtually â€œAnywhereâ€� on the island, due to its rustic nature. At first glance (Other than â€œNext Courseâ€�) we had to remind ourselves that we had heard very positive things about the food. Excursions - What to do while visiting the Island. I am a little partial here, as it was my honeymoon, and everything was perfect right? Without a doubt, plan to â€œRelaxâ€�. There are some of the most beautiful â€œBeachesâ€� we had ever seen and my new bride was very happy. The drive from one beach to the next is not for the faint of heart. The roads are littered with Potholes, and often covered by water, but the reward when you finally do reach the beach is worth the price of admission. â€œYesâ€� after a tropical storm the seaweed washes up on the beach, but the beaches are so amazing, that their beauty shines through. â€œBioluminescentâ€� â€“ Bay was quite possibly the coolest thing I have ever seen, and Vieques has the largest in the world. If you have seen the movie â€œAvatarâ€�, then you will have a better idea as to what to expect, but I can say with certainty, â€œExpect the Unexpectedâ€�. The small â€œNaked to the human Eyeâ€� creatures that live it these waters light up when they are disturbed (Which means they are almost always glowing). Even the small whitecaps of the waves glowed, but this was nothing compared to the glow that shined when you paddled the kayak. We went thru a company called â€œAbesâ€�, and they were some of the nicest, most well informed people you can imagine. I would not miss this under any circumstances. One note however, if you are â€œHigh Maintenanceâ€� this excursion is probably not for you. Most of the people running the show were incredible, but very ummm, ahhhh â€œEarthyâ€�. The ride was rough to say the least, and from â€œCrabsâ€� to â€œSpidersâ€�, we saw many of Godâ€™s creatures. Also, unless you are coming prepared with the proper gear to film these creatures, leave your camera at home, as you will simply increase your chances of losing it. THE STAFF This is where many hotels and restaurants rise to the occasion, or simply fall apart. Having stayed at numerous W Hotels over the years, we had a fairly good idea regarding what to expect, but when you factor in the challenges faced by a hotel of this caliber, on an Island such as this, you had to be a little open minded. When we say that the W Vieques is by far the nicest property on the Island, we aren't kidding. Up until a few years ago, this Island was used by the military for Bombing exercises, and while we were there, the restaurant we chose to eat lunch at our first day (Not at the W), ran out of Lettuce due to a food shortage as a result of a local boat company strike. We never ran into any issues like this at the W, but it helps to illustrate some of the challenges faced by a "Commercially" new island. There were also some challenges encountered during our stay at the â€œWâ€�. "However", IMO, it's not the "Issues" that a hotel or restaurant encounters that make or break a property, but how they choose to deal with those "Issues" when they do (And they "Always" will) arise. One thing for certain, the â€œWâ€� is heading in a positive direction. The STAFF was close to perfection, with many going above and beyond the call of Duty. My favorite act of kindness came from a Tall, Curly haired native island boy named, â€œKevinâ€�. I'm not sure what exactly Kevinâ€™s classification would be, as he seemed to do a little of everything, Bellman, Valet, Etc. I had received a bad Sunburn and was in a great deal of pain. Kevin suggested that I might need some Aloe to which I agreed. Since it was afterhours and the onsite surf shop was closed, there was no immediate solution available. What I didnâ€™t know until an hour later when we were heading to dinner, is that Kevin made a quick stop at the store during a run for another customer, and brought me back a gift. I have seen things like this happen under orders from a manager before, but not from an individual (Using his own money, and "Yes", I reimbursed him, but he tried to say no). Kevin was also the employee who helped us to ultimately find our Rental car keys. Thank you is an understatement, as the cost "Per our Rental Agreement" (Make sure you read your contracts) was $500 if we had in fact "Lost" our keys. It wasnâ€™t until we actually made it to dinner that night that we met â€œChristianâ€� (General Manager of Mix on the Beach) and we realized that there was a pattern here. Our first encounter came off the heels of a brief tropical burst of rain. My new bride looked at me and said, â€œOMG I feel sorry for that managerâ€�, as he was quickly moving from table to table, finding positive solutions to every customer he encountered. Now I must say that we have owned and operated restaurants, and short of being a good owner, you usually donâ€™t see that type of â€œOver the topâ€� attention to detail from anyone these days. Since he caught our attention, we kept watching and quickly realized just how incredible he really was. Take â€œThe oppositeâ€� of your average restaurant manager, who begrudgingly strolls up to your table and offers a â€œforcedâ€�, â€œuncaringâ€�, â€œHow is everything tonightâ€�? We watched as he went from table to table, and spent a fair amount of time with each, all the while carefully watching, working with, and assisting his staff toward service perfection. When he finally made it to our table, we experienced firsthand what we had observed from afar, quite simply, â€œHe was AWESOMEâ€�! Not only did he make it to each and every table, he started over again, and visited most â€œTwiceâ€� if not more. Now there is a person that â€œTrulyâ€� cares about his customers! Over the balance of our trip, we had the pleasure of speaking with him several more times and all we can say is that they are VERY fortunate to have such an amazing person on their team. Having stayed in hotels over 150 nights this year alone, I have certainly witnessed the GOOD, THE BAD, and THE UGLY. I tend to give â€œMostâ€� the benefit of the doubt as there are â€œUsuallyâ€�, things happening behind the scenes that would explain (Not justify) what has taken place. For example, one of the biggest challenges on an island such as this is the labor pool, especially when youâ€™re already the best in your market. On our last night, we had the pleasure of meeting the â€œNewâ€� General Manager â€“ Greg White, and what a great guy. We were fortunate enough to meet both he, and his wonderful assistant â€œIrisâ€� during our visit, and would anticipate nothing but positive changes in the future. Early on in our stay we had a couple of issues that arose, and since Greg was attending a conference, â€œIrisâ€� stepped in. She has an amazing way about her, acting almost like a counselor, and truly listening to your concerns. Not only did she address these, post haste, but she personally followed up to make certain that the problem had been resolved to our satisfaction. Most of the balance of the staff seemed like really good people, but simply needed better direction, and needed to learn to communicate better. In our opinion, itâ€™s not that there was a problem in the first place that concerns us as much as how it is dealt with once it is brought to the attention of management. One of the biggest reasons we still selected this location in spite of a few bad reviews, was that there was almost no talk of conversations with mgmt. If mgmt is never made aware of a need, how are they supposed to make corrections? From looking at the history of this resort, it has not been a â€œWâ€� for very long, and the New Management team was still getting their feet wet. Based on what we saw, I would expect very positive changes in the future, as we watch yet another Starwood property go from â€œGoodâ€� to â€œGreatâ€�!!

Reviews.Title: “Like a Hot Girl Who Doesn't Even Try...”
Reviews.Author: bayleyzebub
Reviews.Content: Before I went to the W on Vieques, I read the reviews here, and was surprised just how many people commented on the poor service. I mean, this is *the W,* and you are playing $400 a night (at least) to stay here. I thought you all were a bunch of grumps, but upon my return, I cannot agree more that while the space is spectacular, the service is HORRIBLE. The staff seem to be upset that you even showed up! The woman at the cafe seemed pissed everytime I asked for a latte, but the rental car girl was the WORST! The customer in front of us had issues and she felt it appropriate to grumble to our smiling faces that she "did not come here to get yelled at by some one paying $2,000 for a room..." The restaurant, Mix, has the uncanny ability to seem overly-staffed and understaffed at the same time - you see people who lok VERY busy running around, yet no one comes to take your order, and drinks you just ordered seem to be forgotten until you are finished with dinner. (Note: try Next Course down the road, MUCH better food/service/value!) Room service trays never got picked up and we had tiny ants all over the desk... The Whenever Desk was just "whatever" as we tried to book a Bio Bay tour through them and they told us that the vendor was busy and that we should come back later.... the only bright spa was the Spa. The people working there were kind, funny and knew what they were doing. I'm not sure the politics behind the opening of the hotel, but I could guess that locals did not want it and are provoding crap servixce so it shuts down and they have their island back in peace. At least that is how it felt for me. Sorry Vieques, but the W is like a really hot girl who knows she is hot, so she doesn't even try to be friendly or charming...

Reviews.Title: “it isn't worth braving a puddle jumper to stay here”
Reviews.Author: smashleywnc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W Vieques over Thanksgiving week. My husband is a platinum SPG member so we stay at these types of resorts frequently. The property is very pretty with a nice view of the sea. The pools, restaurant, bar (living room) and fire pit all have gorgeous, serene views. Despite a loud rattle in the wall that continued off and on throughout our stay, we enjoyed our spacious and unique room. The interior design is just as beautiful as it appears on the web site. But that is where it ends! The management is horrible and the resort is incredibly understaffed. Don't ask for anything and expect to get it in a timely manner - or get it at all. I noted one night that one server was serving 50+ people at the bar / living room area. It took over 1/2 hour for her to take our order. The following day, I saw that two servers were trying to meet the needs of 50+ people at the pool. Impossible! Bring a sweater if you want to enjoy indoor Living Room space. They keep the AC pumping at a really uncomfortable level - especially at night. The drinks are expensive but tasty. We noticed if you ordered the same drink twice you rarely got the same thing. This may bother you if you like consistency. We liked having a drink by the fire pit in the late evening, but it often took over a 1/2 hour to get a drink. We found the restaurant offerings to be lackluster (especially the pool menu), which is a huge bummer because there aren't any other options within walking distance. We spent most of our evenings venturing out to find other restaurants on the island. The shuttles are not included in the $65 per day resort fee, so expect to pay another $20-40 per person per day to travel to other places on the island. We wanted to rent a car to explore on our own but all rental cars were sold out - so reserve early if you want to create your own adventure. We returned to our room one day to shower and dress for dinner only to discover that our room had not been cleaned. No biggie - but just another example of the lack of customer service. Also the welcome dessert plate they left for us the first night along with several beach towels sat on our "front porch" for our entire stay. If you go, definitely travel to the town and visit the other restaurants. Blue beach and Red Beach are gorgeous and definitely worth a day trip. As we waited for our puddle jumper back to Puerto Rico on our final day, we visited the airport lounge for some coffee. Since it was only 9 a.m., I was excited to enjoy a cup of coffee before our flight - only to discover on the first sip that it was cold. :(

Reviews.Title: “Go-to Resort for East Coasters!”
Reviews.Author: JJFigs
Reviews.Content: Short Version: the property is aaa-aaaamazing, the Suites are exceptional, beaches & pools were great, the service will frustrate you at times though. I'm sure there are nicer resorts in the world. I'm not sure we are going to spend the time or money to figure out which ones those are after finding W Vieques. This is our resort go-to! Long Version - Room: We got a great upgrade to a two room suite which made a huge difference in my experience. Nonetheless, W quality was better than most W's I've stayed at in the US. Great work on the renovation. If you want to relax, I highly encourage you to get a room away from the pool. - Pool and Beach: The beaches are small, protected (not ideal for walking, but the Adult beach is great for swimming.) The pool was relaxing during the week when there was only 42% occupancy. On the weekend, they had 100% occupancy, DJ and a quasi South Beach feel going - not our cup-of-tea on this trip so we stuck by the beach. - Service: Apparently the owner of the resort has made it her own goal that 65% of the resort is staffed by locals in order to develop a critical mass of hospitality experience on the island - great idea and commendable. The problem is that the service is hit or miss. And when the miss (which they do often) it's by a wide margin. The service is at times unacceptably frustrating given what the resort is charging. Gym was above average. Yoga class was intense. There were some people there with kids - not sure what they were thinking. Kids shouldn't be allowed. I'm sure people want to go experience resorts around the world. For my husband and I, we can't imagine it being proportionally better at one of these resorts that will cost us twice as much to stay at and 4x as much to fly to (time and money). W Vieques - 6-7 hours total travel time door-to-door, no passport = so easy. Amazing trip! We will absolutely come back! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, with some drawbacks.”
Reviews.Author: Nojesrom
Reviews.Content: The good: - The resort is BEAUTIFUL. The pool is wonderful and there is plenty of wonderful outdoors space to watch the sunset and relax. VERY picturesque. - The F&B manager (tall guy with shaved head - maybe Tom was his name?) was the nicest guy on earth. He was probably the highlight of our stay. He always came by where ever we were to chit chat, and made us feel right at home. By the end of the trip it felt like we'd made a friend! Great asset to the property. The bad: - $65 per day resort fee is ridiculous, especially when you're staying on points. - No shuttle to either of the towns on the island. The W is too far to walk to anything, and if you want to get anywhere you have to order a taxi, and the taxis are all these giant ten person vans. It would've been nice to have a shuttle that ran a few times per day to the two towns. How hard would that be to set up? - Getting coffee in the morning was an ADVENTURE. They were always running out and the staff seemed very confused by the simplest of requests. Then when they would bring coffee it would be cold. The staff really needs to get their act together around morning coffee. - NO HOT TUB. This blew us away. We were there in March and it was a bit chilly. How can an island resort not have a hot tub? This was a huge draw back, because we'd been looking forward to relaxing in the hot tub the entire flight down there! Unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at W Vieques”
Reviews.Author: MTCA_8
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 3 night stay at the W Vieques. Upon arrival at the airport on the island, you have access to the W Lounge. It provides complimentary drinks as you wait for the free shuttle to the hotel. The airport is a five minute ride to the hotel. The hotel is at par with any other W. I think it is a very nice modern hotel. The staff was very helpful upon arrival. We received an upgrade with an ocean view. We also had a flat tire at the hotel. One of the staff offerred to change the tire for us. I thought this was beyond what I could have asked or expected. Though we didn't take him up on the offer, it was very much appreciated. The hotel has two beaches, though they are more for laying around than going in the water. In addition, the hotel has a nice pool overlooking the ocean. The hotel plays the music under the water so you can hear as you swim. I thought this was a nice perk. There is a $60 resort fee which includes access to tennis courts and equipment, snorkle gear, and yoga classes. Overall, it was a nice hotel and would recommend staying there if on the island. Some overall comments on the island we researched and helpful to know prior to going: I would recommend flying to the island rather than take a ferry (due to problems with ferry from Fajardo to Vieques) and you will need a car on the island if you plan on getting around (longer distance between things).

Reviews.Title: “a slice of paradise”
Reviews.Author: yanks105
Reviews.Content: We recently had an opprtunity to visit the relatively new W on Vieques. Two years ago we had driven through the site while it was still under construction. Little did we know we were witnessing paradise being built right before our eyes. If you are looking for the ultimate luxury experience in the most lush tropical setting this is it !

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax!”
Reviews.Author: doc_barbara
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 wonderful nights in an oceanview room. The room was lovely. The bed was one of the most comfortable we have slept in. I did, however, wish the lighting was better - especially when I was applying makeup. The restaurant does a good job - but I recommend venturing out for dinner. There are some great restaurants nearby. The bartenders make great drinks. The property is gorgeous and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a retreat and far from luxurious”
Reviews.Author: bubbles2222
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? Cons: Lighting. If you expect to read at night, better bring a flashlight. The rooms are so poorly lit that you need one to find your phone, let alone enjoy a book. Every guest I spoke to had the same problem, so this wasn't an aberration limited to our room. AirConditioning: The thermostats in the rooms are just props. It was so unbearably cold, that we would turn off the AC completely but it remained cold-and between the omnipresent darkness and the frigid temps, it was pretty much like living in a cave. Again-not just my room but every other guest I spoke to as well. (The "Living Room" is also unbearably cold.) Music music music music-everywhere. In the lobby, in the restaurants, by the pool-IN THE POOL-on the beach. You simply couldn't escape it. And it was the same mind-numbing, generic Latin or Brazilian, lounge or house MUZAK, played over and over, all day, ad nauseum. It was like being stuck in an elevator! I suspect this stuff was produced expressly for the W, as none of the songs or singers were recognizable. My theory is that using this kind of crap is a cost saving measure, as it means not having to pay fees to the musical licensing agencies for the use of real songs. Whatever the reason-the music is unbearable, unceasing and oppressive. (It should be mentioned that music in the pool is a fun novelty for about 5 minutes but when you swim underwater, the treble heavy frequencies quickly become not only un-relaxing but positively painful.) Also- the music begins IN THE MORNING. If you have a poolside room, I hope you don't want to sleep late. The worst of it however, is the fact that it is pumped onto the beach. I came to the W to relax. That means ocean breezes and the sound of the surf-not 20 different version of The Girl From Ipanema. SPA you say?? How does an expensive hotel like this NOT have a sauna or a hot tub? (However, if they did, they would most certainly charge for it's use-unthinkable at any hotel I've ever stayed in). Rooms Continued: 1) There is one towel rack in the entire room and it's in the shower. 2) the Light switches are so oddly hidden-it took 2 days to find the one for the shower. 3) The hanging lamp (which produces an annoying yellow glow) has NO on/off switch. To turn it off, I had to climb over an obstacle course of furniture and unplug it manually. A guest I spoke to wasn't as lucky. His lamp was hard-wired in and the only way to turn it off was to unscrew the bulb. 4) No turn down service. 5) The tub and the floor of the shower were NEVER cleaned. 6) Virtually no drawer space-One tiny drawer and one narrow drawer in each of the end tables. We kept our clothes in our luggage on a bench for our entire stay-and mind you-this was a huge room with plenty of space for chests of drawers. 7) The TV (which wasn't getting reception for 2 days), is placed on a stand in a cabinet at a 45 degree angle to the bed. (this is in ALL the rooms) You have to pull it out of the cabinet, swivel it and even then. it's difficult to watch. 8) Internet-not only slow and useless but you have to re-sign up for it every day. 9) No room for toiletries-just a narrow shelf above the bathroom sink. 10) $17 for each new pay-for-view movie. 11) CONDOMS AND LUBRICANTS next to the candy and snacks-it didn't really bother me, I just thought it to be amusing if not somewhat bizarre. However, if i had kids, I'd be really pissed off. Beach-the beach (except for the music of course) is nice but it is not properly staffed. You have to find your own umbrella-move your own chairs and there is no food service on the sand, even though the main outdoor bar is only a staircase away. Food-Crap. Nothing more to say about it-except perhaps that it was expensive crap. If you've never had Mofongo-PLEASE do not order it here. It will forever tarnish your perception of one of PR's great foods. The last indignity-we wanted to print out our boarding pass on our last day. They charge for the use of a printer! (By contrast-I was recently staying at the Murano in Paris -which is also a very pricey hotel, and when i was having computer problems-they actually gave me a computer to use for free for an entire week-THIS is the way to run a hotel.) Pros- 1)the staff does try really hard 2) It's really the only game in town. Now here I must mention that I am not against the hipster hotel format (if that is what the W is striving for) The Standard for instance does it perfectly. Everything about the W however, is totally off and while I suspect that they are trying in part to appeal to the same crowd, they fail on every level. And as a retreat? Not even close. The sad thing is that the staff does try hard to please but there is nothing they can do to compensate for a place that was clearly so ill-conceived from the start and so badly managed by people who continue to make bad decisions and refuse to correct problems that are easily remedied. And mind you-the staff has heard all of these complaints Management simply doesn't care to address and rectify them. Finally-a very expensive hotel that calls itself a "retreat", should be just that. At resorts that charge these kinds of prices (and frankly, much less expensive ones as well) the one quality you will always find, is that there is never a compelling reason to want to leave-you love the room and the service, the amenities and the grounds so much, that you have to be torn away to go to town or outside restaurants, other beaches, etc. The W does not have this quality. Here, you instead find yourself constantly compelled to get away from all the crap that I listed, driven out by bad food, noise, cold temperature,malfunctioning internet and TV etc, etc etc..... And IT'S TOO DARK TO READ A BLOODY BOOK!!!!! If you want to go to Vieques-rent a house. the bargains are great. The W is a pig with lipstick. Truthfully-anyone who thinks it's luxurious has probably not travelled very much.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay!”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo P
Reviews.Content: Great great hotel. I staied in the island for 3 nights and this is more tha enough to know all the places, but not enough to enjoy all the pleasures that this resort may deliver to you. Great food/breakfast (Alain Ducasse chef), the view from the room to the beach is perfect (you must get a room with ocean view). The swimpool is all you need during a vacation, offsourse with a good drink service. The beach of the hotel is not the best of the island, but you can get the snorkeling equipment (included in the rate) and go to one of the most beatiful beaches that I ever saw. Also don't miss the bioluminescent lagoon tour and you must do with Abbey, the concierge will help with the arregements.

Reviews.Title: “Some Highs, Some Lows, but mostly "Whatever"”
Reviews.Author: ZeBonVivant
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I recently stayed at the W Vieques over a long weekend in October. While the property is very beautiful, hip, and modern, this hotel suffers from severe service issues that dramatically detract from your enjoyment of the property. Upon arriving and claiming our bags at the VQS Airport, we went to the W Lounge where we were greeted and offered a drink. Another couple had arrived on the same flight as us, and the attendant called for a ride from the hotel. Took about 10-15 minutes a staff member to show up with a Jeep, which was a little on the small side for 2 couples. Upon check-in I was extremely disappointed to be welcomed as SPG Gold guest as I had recently qualified for Platinum 2 weeks prior. Now, I would owe this up to a simple technical glitch if I had not called both SPG Customer Service twice AND the hotel directly once to confirm that they could "see" my status. I finally was able to get upgraded to a Partial Oceanview Fantastic Suite (meanwhile the Platinum couple ahead of us go the Wow Oceanfront Retreat), and the front desk agent made no attempt at service recovery and even made the situation awkward by whispering behind our backs to other staff members while trying to resolve the issue. We finally settled into our room, which despite having a limited view was very modern and cool. There were still a few hours of sunlight, so we decided to have a couple of drinks by the pool and then enjoy our "Sunset Sip", a free cocktail advertised by the hotel. Unfortunately this free drink amounted to a 3 oz shot glass of sangria served with so much attitude by the bar tender and lobby waitress that it made you feel as if asking for the free drink was doing them a disservice. It was an extremely upsetting display by the two of them and at this point we were so disgusted we went upstairs to have some room service and call it a night. The room service food was terrible; fries were overcooked and we were significantly overcharged for two items on the bill. A visit to the front desk the following morning to led to the the charge quickly being taken off; and I did receive an apology for the atitudes of the lobby staff the night before. While the first day was rocky, the rest of the stay was relatively uneventful, but there was a constant stream of "misses" by the staff that you could tell they just didn't care. This includes 1) Calling "Whatever, Whenever", twice, to have the pool towels at the plunge pool be refreshed, and having the attendent never show up. 2) Asking that the kitchen make a special lunch request (which was simply the pasta dish they had on special the previous night), and despite charging $30, having the dish come out wrong, twice and not offering to fix it the second time. 3) A fellow guest decided to send us a a bottle of Champagne to the room via Room Service, and they simply delivered the bottle warm and without Champagne glasses. We decided to bring it down and enjoy it at the fire and were informed that it would be a $35 corkage fee to drink it at the fire pit. Seriously!?!? 4) Never refreshing the "Free" waters in the room; inconsistent turn-down service (only happend 2 out of the five nights of the stay) 5) Charging a $65/day resort fee; which is simply obnoxious, especially for the level of service received. Now, that being said, there were some highs. We did enjoy both breakfast and dinner at Mix, and found the waitstaff there to be very nice and accommodating. The pool is a blast to hang out in, and the beach is nice to look at, but not to sit out on as it is full of ants that like to bite. Service at the pool was generally friendly and quick, but those $13 drinks add up fast. The Meeze ("Pick 3") platter was our favorite and got that on multiple occasions. We rented a car onsite from Avis to explore the other beaches on Vieques. They were very pretty; but had gotten pretty badly eroded in the recent hurricane, leaving very narrow strips of sand, that were mostly covered in dried seaweed. The water at the Blue Beach was gorgeous. Dinner at Next Course was delicious and I would definitely recommend. Back to the hotel, overall we just got the feeling that most of the staff were not "into" their jobs and took a very "Whatever" attitude about everything. There was nobody being proactive about your needs and very few people who seemed to care to make things better. The hotel could be so great but there are serious service issues here that would make me think twice about staying again or recommending to a fellow traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Urban meets retreat”
Reviews.Author: cheetah72
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights at the W. We have been to Puerto Rico several times but this was our first trip to Vieques. We have stayed a other W hotels so we had an image in mind. Overall the hotel is nice. The rooms are large and clean. The are very eclectic and open concept. The pool was great with the exception of a few unruly children (which is no fault of the hotel). Service in general was good especially the servers at Mix. Only one not so friendly server at the pool and one person at the concierge not quite as knowledgable as one would expect. The spa was nice, not a ton of amenities but treatments were good. While in Vieques we went horseback riding and to a few restaurants. We did not have any trouble with transportation, but keep in mind things do run on island time. We had one slight glitch with our bill at checkout, that will have to be dealt with, but it appears to be American Express' error and not the resort. Overall I think it is a good place for an adult vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service ever!”
Reviews.Author: cathy c
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 2 nights but the customer service was horrible. I called front desk for shuttle to go to Red Beach at 11:30 for noon and we waited in the lobby until 12: 15 and no taxi ever came. When we asked they said should be on its way. So finally we got upset and asked them if anyone even called the shuttle and then they called for one. So we waited an hr. Luckily we left early for our excursion, otherwise we would missed the Paddleboard/snorkel trip. Then on the way back, we called shuttle to pick us up at the Esperanza, the driver sounded like he was drunk. We asked where he'd like to meet us, and he kept on saying ok. So we called the W and they said they would contact the shuttle and call us back but didn't call until 2 hrs later after we had already called another taxi company. Then at checkout, they charged us erroneously, I had it taken off. But after getting home, I found more charges from the snack bar that we didn't take. When I called to have it taken off, the person at the Finance department hung up on me when I started complaining. Just horrible service. I would never stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Go now before this becomes the next hot spot!”
Reviews.Author: travelsometravelmore
Reviews.Content: My review is in two sections. First about the trip and hotel and second for those looking for a 'gay friendly' spot. Left NY with no idea what to expect. In sum, in case you dont want to read my full review; go now before it becomes the next hot spot. Amazing. Beautiful. We'll go back soon. While I don't want to start with a downside - I would say there is only two - no direct flights (the other i'll get to later). I guess you could argue that is a good thing as less people will go when it requires two legs. But really, the 20 min flight from San Juan to Vieques on Cape Air was fantastic - and a part of the experience. Upon arriving in Vieques you can make yourself comfortable and grab a drink at the W lounge in the airport before being whisked away to the Resort in a private shuttle for guests only. We arrived, checked in, and we're given a tour by a friendly member of staff. He pointed out the restaurant, pool, bar, spa, gym, and the two private beaches (including one that is what they refer to as the 'European' beach - aka the nude beach). The last stop was our room. We had a pool view room - ground floor, steps from the pool and beach. From bed we could enjoy a beautiful view and sunset with partial view of pool and ocean. I enjoyed the ground floor for ease of access to everything. You enter and exit this room via floor to ceiling sliding glass doors rather than the traditional door. This was a huge benefit in my opinion. Being on the second or third floor would afford better ocean views. The room was simple but well appointed. A series of mesh curtains acted as privacy screens. A nice tub and separate shower. Downside number two - we had some hot water issue. No one else in our large group of friends had this - so just a one off case and wouldn't impact my view of the hotel. Service overall is top notch with a friendly and helpful staff. For those looking for a 'gay friendly' place to go I'd also recommend. We were at the W for a same-sex wedding (two men). Outside of the 20-25 men that were at the W for the wedding we also met a handful of other men and women on vacation. The resort was accommodating to everyone. We felt very welcome. This is not a gay party place though. Families and people all over the world on vacation here. I do fear in time this may become a party place for any type of person. I heard already that the next season of the bachelor is being filmed at the resort. Go now before it's over run by spring break and other parties. True we were at a wedding and made lots of noise late on Saturday night and there was a wedding on Sunday night. But hopefully that's not every night. Ask in advance of your booking to see if there is a wedding - you may want to schedule around it in case you are looking for some r&r.

Reviews.Title: “loved our stay here...”
Reviews.Author: cj_minneapolis
Reviews.Content: We came to Vieques for a wedding, and had a wonderful stay. Pros: Huge, modern rooms with unique appointments Quiet and private feeling resort Great pools with ample space - didn't get the feeling of some resorts you have to rush out and save chairs at dawn Common spaces were comfortable and fun to hang out in - lots of cushy and relaxing lounge chairs everywhere you go Bio Bay tour was awesome Airport pickup and dropoff easy Solid service Cons: Inconvenient to get to Vieques itself Not walkable to main city, and taxis are not necessarily easy or reliable - whenever you left the property it felt like a production to get anywhere On-site food was expensive and just so-so We would definitely come back...overall lovely resort.

Reviews.Title: “Love Vieques!!!”
Reviews.Author: algentile
Reviews.Content: Our W experience started out kind of rough. When we arrived at the Vieques little airport we waited about an hour and a half on the hotel's shuttle, and with the hotel being only two miles away it was hard to figure out what took so long. When we got to our room we discovered the toilet didn't flush, but the hotel maintenance staff were there quickly and had it fixed in a few minutes. The entire hotel staff was wonderful.The grounds are beautifully maintained. The decor throughout the hotel was awesome. The food and drinks were really good, but expensive which wasn't a shocker. The island is amazing! So many perfect beaches! I highly recommend going to Fun Brothers and touring the island by scooter, and do not miss out on the Bio Bay! The beaches at the hotel are pretty, but I don't recommend swimming there as the water is rough and there are lots of jagged rocks. We had a great time at the W, but it kind of feels like a compound after a while. Once we got the scooter and started exploring it became the vacation we dreamed of. I highly recommend going to Esperanza, there are so many open patio bars and restaurants with that wonderful island vibe! Then after sight seeing all day, returning to the W was great! The main pool was nice, but freezing cold. There is another small pool on the property where the water was a bit easier to get used to. The entire place just left you no choice, but to sit back and enjoy yourself. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Good looking!”
Reviews.Author: treetattoo
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend 1 night here before we left the island after our annual 2 week stay renting a (great) house in Esperanza - Pura Vida. Please bear in mind that September/October is considered the 'off' season, so there were fewer people around. The entire facility is beautifully designed, decorated and, apparently, well maintained. Most staff are very friendly and helpful. We opted for a poolside room which was also very close to the ocean. We had requested an early check-in - about 1pm - since we had our 2 kids with us and it was nap time. But when we arrived they didn't have our room ready so we had lunch while we waited. The food was fine, not quite hot enough, nothing to rave about and was very expensive - but it's a resort (and that's why we rent a house). Great restaurant staff though. Beautiful, spacious room. Very 'designed'. Our son loved the extra large, round chair and the fact that our room was right in front of the pool. The shower was excellent but the bathtub didn't really drain properly. We discovered one of the lights would not turn off, called for maintenance, they sent someone quickly, and they had to just unscrew the lightbulb. Just a little glitch - it's a pretty new hotel and, on Vieques, things can be a little wonky. It's part of the charm. Finding a little coqui frog in the shower was also fun - we 'helped' him outside :) Super comfy beds, good air conditioning, big TV, very quiet, overall very nice room. The pool (2 pools, really) were very nice looking and clean. There is also a small beach right by the pools but not so great for the little kids as it's on the Atlantic Ocean and the waves get a bit big with a lot of pull. My son loved playing pool in the lobby with my husband. There was a lively group of people about but not super loud or crazy. Overall, very good. I would never, however, come to this island and remain here in this resort. There is so much to see and do - it's a very beautiful, rustic place and all the best beaches are on the Caribbean side. Staying here as you come and go is a great option, if you can find a good deal - like we did. There is a free shuttle to the airport and a new, air conditioned W lounge with snacks and drinks at the airport. We may do this again ;)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome girls getaway!”
Reviews.Author: CityTravelers999
Reviews.Content: A great 50th birthday celebration trip! We had a great time celebrating at the W. Was a little concerned about noise levels, service, etc based on previous reviewers but there were no issues. They have coffee and tea every morning in the lobby - a nice touch - and things like yoga, drinks at sunset and a very accommodating staff made this a very memorable trip. The views are amazing, fire pit at night is really fun - talking and meeting others. One thing - to experience the true Vieques, you have to get out and go to the town and beaches on other parts of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Better than your average W”
Reviews.Author: emnolan4
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this property for five nights in December 2010 and had a wonderful experience. The staff was helpful and friendly and our room was spacious and very comfortable. Unlike most W's that have pulsing "club" music and dim lighting throughout the property, this hotel was a bit more subdued and relaxed. The main pool got quite crowded during the day, but aside from that, we felt like we were the only ones on the property. We had one dinner and one breakfast at the restaurant on property, both of which were delicious, but very expensive and not "local" cuisine. We also played tennis, worked out in the gym, took a yoga class and relaxed in one of the many hammocks and double-width lounge chairs on the property. The caveat/complaint I had about the W is that it is located on the opposite side of the island from Esperanza, which is the main town in Vieques. This is NOT a dealbreaker, but you will need to rent a car if you want to eat off the property, which I would recommend. The restaurants in Esperanza are very good (especially El Quenepo) and provide a much better value for your money than the food at the W. You also will want a car to explore the many secluded beaches on the island as the beach at the W was pretty rocky and not good for lounging or walking on. Martineau Car Rental is right outside the property which we used for our trip and got a great deal on a Jeep Wrangler. Overall, this is the best hotel on Vieques and was a great home base for our stay on this hidden gem of an island.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best resorts in PR”
Reviews.Author: familyman80
Reviews.Content: I stayed an extended weekend (Friday to Monday) to celebrate our 15 year wedding anniversary. I choose this place because I was not able to leave the Island on a special occasion and has received a lot of local publicity of been above the other resorts in Puerto Rico. Also, this hotel belongs to Starwood and I had some points available for use. I started booking Vieques Air Link (recommended by W personnel), their rate is half of the other two available airlines. The flight was eventless, leaving at time, with no hassle. Upon arrival you get to wait in a W lounge at the Vieques Airport. The lounge is in very good conditions, very comfortable. They have coffee (was cold!), ice, water, sodas, and rum bottles. The trip from the airport to the hotel is less than 5 minutes. Starting from the host at the airport all the way until leaving I received a lot of courteous care, politeness, and a warm contact with the resort personnel. This is a plus to this facility and a reason to return. Good Job! Pedro Jose (PJ) was amazing in his interest and continuous follow up on how things were going for us. Once there we decided to have something for lunch because we were hungry. At the bat we ordered sandwich and a wrap. They had the room already ready for us but we wait until finishing lunch and then headed to the room. The room was first floor with pool view (actually very close), a prime location. The room decor and layout are amazing, very modern style of a boutique hotel; round sofa with LCD TV, doorless shower with overhead discharge, a tub, all very well decorated and with great ambience, the right room to celebrate our anniversary. There is a fridge well packed, as well as non-refrigerated stuff (whiskey, vodka, olives, and martini glasses). The only situation with the room was that the first day the electronic door lock failed and between the evening and the next day morning we had several maintenance interventions to get it fixed. At all times they were on top of it. We never wasted vacation time because of this. Then apparently they time room housekeeping between 6-7PM and we got the service except in the toilet room. The next day after noon I called the lobby and when my wife return to the pool from the room was left amazed with the complete wash-down done to the whole room. At any time we felt been neglected by the hotel personnel. The pool is brand new design, like a cocktail pool, but probably three times longer than a typical one. They set two pools side by side, one higher so that water cascades into the lower level one. The pool is about 4' depth wall to wall, underwater music, lighting, etc. The pool decoration is not fancy feels very comfortable. There is a close-by bar and a hostess walking back and forth all the times. I recommend going with frappes or drinks, I asked for a very, very, very cold beer and I got a warm one. I kind goofed and didn't return to the hostess (I should had) and ended up asking for a glass with ice to pour the beer and choke it down. There are two beaches spots (one for adults only). The hotels beach is north and facing the Atlantic Ocean, therefore there is a lot of sway at the beach line. There are a lot of pebbles therefore walking requires maintaining equilibrium. There is a large slate of rock at the entrance to the water (along the whole beach line). About mid beach there is a spot with sand. Probably this is one of the few downers of the resort. I never went to the adult beach, but seems to be rougher that the other. Nevertheless, I enjoyed the beach. The location of the resort is amazing, the place is very well maintained, very beautiful a lot of places for pictures and relaxing. The lobby is fabulous, akin of a boutique hotel. Outside there is a fire lit after sun down, people gathers to talk and share. There is something that you will not get in any other resort in the Island: watch the stars and sky. The lack of illumination contamination makes the dark sky shine like you never seen before. It's amazing the hotel had not exploited this opportunity! You can get a decent telescope under $500 and they can self-train in astronomy 101 and show people an unforgettable event. In general, food and drinks are expensive. The place eateries are overseen by Chef Alain Ducasse. The food is very good, but not "orgasmic" good. I'll write a separate review on the eatery places I went. The eating in the main restaurant can be definitively enhanced to be at par to price. I had as a special occasion a "Paradise Edge" experience. They set at sunset a table for two on a very nearby ridge inside the property where you get a 5-course dinner with wine pairing. I have to admit that the location is outstanding, we had a great night, PJ served us and made the night extremely enjoyable. However, it's extremely overpriced considering what you really get ($639 including tax), setting emotions aside you can match other things as enjoyable as the experience (including additional nights there!). My feeling is that it was not enough fulfilling to state that I would do it again. Lastly, although we didn't plan going out of the resort, one night we went to a local restaurant and the hotel arranged transportation and worked extremely well (ask for Jorge) both ways. I was told to consider renting a car and I found out why on my last day. After checkout I had about 1-1/2 hours to spare and decided to go to Isabel II for souvenirs and lunch. Apparently during the day the taxi service is very unreliable. I was told that between noon to 200PM when the ferry arrives, there are no taxis interested. I got stuck in Isabel II for about 1hour (after finding that the place to have lunch was closed!) and had to be bailed out by hotel personnel. To wrap up, I'm considering this resort a place to come back

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property, but needs a full time concierge.”
Reviews.Author: Amyowl
Reviews.Content: My husband I visited the W Vieques for 5 days in September. It's a beautiful, amazing, relaxing property, and we had a great trip. That said, there were several hiccups that all could have been avoided if they had a concierge. They have a concierge desk, and implied when we checked in that there was a concierge, but there was never once anyone at the desk the whole time we were there. This would have been a non-event, except that then we relied on the front desk to try to book outings (snorkeling, horseback riding, etc.). The front desk has no system for managing these types of issues. They told us they booked us to snorkel, but when we showed up at Blackbeard's (the snorkel shop that is on the W resort property), they had no record of anyone being signed up for snorkeling. The next day the front desk arranged a taxi for us, and told us they would take care of it when the time we needed the taxi changed. When we arrived to meet the taxi, a different person at the front desk somewhat curtly told me we'd missed our taxi because we were late. When I explained that the taxi time had changed (and that we were there 5 minutes before the time I'd discussed with the other person at the front desk), there was a scramble to find a new taxi. It was eventually worked out, but annoying... Otherwise, our room was clean, pool beautiful and amazing, beach great, staff friendly, etc., etc. The lack of a concierge keeps this property from being a 5 star review.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place and very accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: Jeyeiscool
Reviews.Content: We flew in to Vieques Isdand through cape air and the W guests all flew together there. When we arrived, the lounge at the airport had drinks and appetizers waiting for us. The concierge there called for the van and tagged our luggage. When we got to the hotel, they offered us a tour of the hotel and brought our luggage in. Everyone there was soo nice and helpful. They took care of everything. The whatever, whenever activities booth made sure we got our car rental and booked our outings for us. When Hurricane Irene hit, the hotel was very accommodating, gave us a late check out, and tried their best to entertain us while the rest of the island had no power. They waived the resort fee and reduced the night stay at the hotel. If you want that secluded feeling, this is the place to go. The wet pool was amazing, and we went swimming very late at night when it was less crowded. You can hear music under the water and it was quite relaxing to swim underneath the stars. They do have an adult beach where you have the option to bath topless, but we didnt go there. The other beach was in front of the wet pool and made for some good tanning and drinks. The food is expensive at the resort, but its to be expected. With that said, the lobster curry was delicious, and the filet was good too. I played this puzzle game in the lounge and was the first to actually solve it, and one of the staff members at the lounge bought me free drink for it. Overall, it was a great experience and everyone was welcoming and very accommodating, especially during the hurricane. They did the best they could under a hectic situation and I would surely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased and improving”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy B
Reviews.Content: So if you're going to go bold, go between tropical storms I say. We visited the W Vieques for 4 nights in early September just prior to the onset of Tropical Storm Maria. The inn was rather sparsely populated but the staff kept us well taken care of for the most part. The two infinity pools were well maintained as were the lounge chairs and beach area. Limited staff and a few off season low points with folks that seemed to be training, nervous about the storm, or both. Prices are a little high, the W is a little too hip for me, but overall I would love to visit this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poorly Managed and Not so Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy H
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that Vieques Island has some of the most beautiful, private and secluded beaches! The people are very friendly and gracious. And, overall, my husband and I had a wonderful trip. That said, the W Retreat and Spa was quite the disappointment. I was skeptical, after reading all of the previous reviews, about staying there. But, it appeared from the recent replies to on-line complaints, that the hotel was under new management and I was hopeful that things would have changed. And, it seemed that some things did change. And, while we encountered some issues that we overlooked early on (i.e., cleanliness of room), one particular issue was unjustifiable. We arrived Labor Day weekend, when the hotel was sold out. In fact, we flew into San Juan and stayed over night, due to the hotel being sold out on our arrival date. So, we experienced a completely sold out hotel for the first few days, followed by a desolate hotel stay. I must say, contrary to many of the other reviews, our best experience was when the hotel was sold out. The staff was friendly. Food and beverage service, pool side was fast, etc., etc. On day two at the "W", Labor Day; since the hotel was sold out, we opted to rent a Jeep Wrangler for the day and explore the beautiful island beaches. We had planned to hang poolside, when the crowds were gone the next day, to catch up on some much needed R&R. Big MISTAKE! Yes, just like the movie "Pretty Woman". When we arrived poolside, the trendy outdoor music that had been pumping all weekend, was non-existent. One guest, ultimately brought out her Iphone Doc to play music. But, the worst experience ever, was when management decided to close the poolside bar and food service down at 3:45 PM, just as I was ordering my first drink, -- due to "LOW OCCUPANCY"! Now, remember, this is a destination location, full serve retreat and spa and we were paying top dollar, to boot. My husband then walked over the the W Cafe to buy some beverages and snacks for the pool, and it too, was already closed at 4:00 PM. Needless to say, the "complimentary" 6:00 cocktail hour, never happened either. In fact, we never experienced the complimentary daily cocktail hour, ever. I, then, went inside to ask to speak with a manager about the situation and I was told that a manager was not available, but, they'd let someone know that I requested to speak with a manager. Say what!?! Not one single manager is available!?! My husband and I, reluctantly, packed up our stuff, went back to the room and ordered a rental car, for the remainder of the week. There were no refunds for early check out and/or exchanges in our charter flights that times, that brought us to this small, private island. In other words, any changes to our original reservations, were going to cost more than it was worth. In the meantime, after two hours went by and I still hadn't heard from a manager, I decided to get in touch with someone at Starwood's Corporate HQ. While on vacation! In addition to this last straw, I will say, now, that the rooms were never properly cleaned, either. On our first night, someone's old, bar of Oil of Olay soap was still laying on the shower ledge and an empty bottle of Bliss Sudsy Soap was lying under the bench, next to the bathtub. I scrubbed the black marks out of the tub, before my use. Throughout our stay, robes were never replenished, limited towels and toiletries were replaced, the balcony remained filthy and was never swept, the tub accumulated soap scum and sand, from my days at the beach -- I mean I have better service at home with a once a week housekeeper. And, with the theme of low occupancy, you would think that would have been a good time to put forth the extra effort, to do your job, value the guest and provide the finest service, in line with the rates at hand. We were not paying "low season" or "low occupancy" rates. Oh, did I mention that we stayed for FIVE days @ at a nightly rate of almost $500/night, with all of the resort fees, taxes, etc. I will say, that corporate responded to my e-mail, immediately, and directly to hotel management and put a fire under someone's butt. And, the response from management the next day, was immediate. However, we already rented a jeep and were off enjoying the beautiful day on a remote beach. When we got back to the room that afternoon, the room was thoroughly cleaned and everything was perfect. We were advised that the manager Greg, even inspected the room first hand. They even took the time to stamp "W" in the toilet paper. That was a first.... and last. But, sometimes, it's the little things that can make all the difference. Because, after that one day of what should have been every day cleaning; -- the cleaning of the room went right back to the way it had been. . . When we arrived back from the beach that afternoon, in addition to the room being impeccably cleaned, there was a lovely bottle of champagne and cheese and dried fruit spread sitting on the counter. We were very pleased and satisfied with the attention. What we didn't realize at first, but by the next morning, that the are where the tray was set down, it became infested with ants. We immediately set the tray outside our door and advised the cleaning staff as we left for the day the the room needed to be treated with some sort of bug spray. When we returned from our day at the beach, the tray, infested with ants, remained outside the door, until later that evening! It certainly was a nice gesture, but, one more headache and disappointment . . . I will say, that Iris, bent over backwards to try to make up for the horrific service and it was very much appreciated. She scheduled appointments for us at the spa the next day and comped our services, which was very gracious. She even came over to introduce ourself to us and ask if there was anything else that she could do for us. But, in reality, it was already too late. In the end, the overall experience left a very poor taste in our mouth and tarnished the Starwood Brand, for us, indefinitely. That is, until we spent the last evening of our journey at the St. Regis Bahia Beach resort in Rio Grande, PR. That place was exceptional and restored my faith in the Starwood brand. There is no excuse for the poor service and lack thereof we encountered at the W Veiques. We choose this place as our vacation destination, to celebrate out 15 year wedding anniversary. And, we could have gone any where in the world. But, as much as we loved the island, in the end, I can't say that we would ever return, unless another "high end" resort opens up. I commend management for taking action, AFTER corporate contacted them. But, I'm disappointed at the poor management decisions that were put in place to create such a horrific experience, to begin with. "LOW OCCUPANCY" is the worst excuse for poor service, ever! If you don't want to service your guests, due to low occupancy, then close the hotel, until high season, when you can get away with charging such rates. On another note, the food at the Alain Ducasse restaurant was average, to say the least. But, I won't get into that. We ordered three of the five/six signature items and they were basic, to say the least. Certainly not what one would expect from a celebrity chef's restaurant. Bottom line, experience Vieques Island, it's wonderful! The "W" hotel is the best place to stay, for now, but don't stay more than three days and demand the service that you expect and deserve. If you can't get satisfaction from hotel management, don't hesitate to call or e-mail Starwood's Corporate Office in New York. I'm sure the "W" hotel management will reply to this review, stating that they are very sorry and have taken all of these things into consideration and addressed them, moving forward. But, the decisions that were made are still unacceptable and NOBODY should ever have to experience what we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - a few low season glitches”
Reviews.Author: sfmonica
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about what the service would be like given some past reviews, but we really experienced wonderful staff. We ran into one not so great server, but that can happen anywhere. Overall, it was a very "W" experience..relaxing, modern, and a little bit "sexy" for lack of a better word. The resort grounds and rooms were beautiful and the pool and beaches were very nice. The food was reasonably good, though we preferred the bar food over the fancy dinner restaurant. The short ribs were AMAZING and you could get them at every mean (short rib scramble, short rib slider, short rib kebabs, etc.). The spa was really relaxing and both my husband & I had excellent deep tissues massages with Rafael and Carla. We did not rent a car, but the hotel was always available to arrange "publicos" for us. I believe the only real glitches were a result of it being low season. The W lounge at the airport was no open for our arrival or departure and they seemed to be out of a few food choices (i.e. nutella, anything but white bread, etc.). Not really a big deal, but when you are paying a $60/night resort fee which supposedly includes the air conditioned airport lounge, it is a bit disappointing. Perhaps the resort fee should be lower during the low season? Also, just little things like running out of towels/water by the pool or less than attentive pool servers. Again, not a big deal, but for the price these little fixes could be made. I've been at other hotels during low season (see The Tides in Zijhuatanejo) and they are amazing. Overall, lovely hotel and I would return if I planned a trip to Vieques!

Reviews.Title: “Dreaming of going back”
Reviews.Author: david011608
Reviews.Content: Such a lovely place. Marvelous atmosphere, great decor in room, wonderful view. Such a great combo that makes us feel we are seriously taking the vacation. You will feel you are in a remote quiet paradise, but you are still connected to the world by the great utility-if you want to be connected. Hated to leave, and dreaming to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Complete tranquility!”
Reviews.Author: BrookeP24
Reviews.Content: Hotel grounds are very well maintained, the rooms are great, & the pool is to die for. Our trip was very relaxing thanks to the location and tranquility of the resort. Take a rental car and explore the island and other beaches. Staff are very helpful in providing any assistance for whatever you need.

Reviews.Title: “The scenery and location is spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: wellversed67
Reviews.Content: A beautiful property. Very clean and service staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The food however in the restaurant is high price and average. Buffet breaffasts were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience.”
Reviews.Author: Mexicolombiana
Reviews.Content: We were there over labor day weekend and had a great time. I went with my husband and 1 year old daughter. First of all there weren't many kids at all (just a handful) when we were there and it is mostly an adult retreat/spa. We made sure to keep our daughter well behaved and didn't stay out late with her. People were very friendly and we had a great time with our daughter. So don't worry the place is not overrun with kids. But it IS kid friendly if you need it to be. The location is perfect. Right on the water and there are 2 good beaches. The water was pretty calm when we were there and you could actually see some fish when you snorkeled. The pool area was beautiful and the water was warm and pleasant. There is also a bar at the pool and they take your drinks poolside. I read some reviews before going and while no place is perfect we were very happy with our stay. We thought the staff was friendly and accommodating and never had a problem. As far as some of the complaints like the one lady who was livid that her kids were exposed to "nudity" and threatened to involve her lawyer? That lady is crazy. There is an adults only beach which really only means no kids allowed and you can sunbathe topless. That's it. I doubt her room overlooked the beach to the point that all you saw was nudity all the time. The rooms are not that close to the water. That is ridiculous. Plus how old were her kids that she couldn't just explain to them the cultural differences and socially accepted practice of a topless beach? People are not having sex on this beach. Worst case you might see a breast. Big deal. Her attitude was a typical stuffy and prude American attitude. Get over yourself. And then her kids found sex toys or condoms or something in a drawer and she had a heart attack! Are you kidding me? Teach your kids not to go through drawers if they are that young and if they are older teach them about sex! I'm sure your kids didn't care much about the little sealed box in the drawer until you made a big deal out of it. Tell your kids it's for adults only and move on. Then the people that complained there were bugs. Yes you're in Puerto Rico. It's tropical and hot and there are bugs. I guess roaches are gross and I did see one in our room once but I smashed it with a shoe and moved on. The food and drinks are pricey but you're at the W. What do you expect? The water in the room is expensive. So DON'T open it. Buy your own somewhere else. Problem solved. Overall we had a great time. We thought the food was good, the location perfect, the rooms beautiful and the resort grounds were well kept and very pretty. We would definitely go back and recommend the resort to others. Oh and a couple of pointers about Vieques. Rent a car if you're going to be there more than 2 days. Take a snorkeling tour (I couldn't and am sad I missed out on some of the best snorkeling in PR). Do the bioluminescence tour. Don't take the ferry from Fajardo if you can help it. It smells, it's hot and crowded and runs LATE. We almost missed our plane because of it. It's cheap ($2.00) and you get what you pay for. Next time we will definitely take a short $28 flight. Explore some of the other beaches on the island and always travel with plenty of food and water.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but still needs some improvements...”
