Reviews.Author: petunia2323
Reviews.Content: I feel like this review is a little biased as we came here on our friend's Platinum Starwood Preferred Guest membership right after the St Regis Bahia Beach. That being said, here are a few pros and cons I can share: PRO: - Beautiful beach and location: This place is less secluded and more accessible than the St Regis on the main island. And not to mention, the beach itself is absolutely gorgeous! - Amazing pool area: Two infinity pools are plenty for people to lounge around and sun themselves. It's extremely cool if you put your head underwater for the music coming out of the speakers! - Service poolside: Excellent. Very attentive and fast with drink and food orders. How can you beat drinking a pina colada poolside? - Complimentary drinks: Complementary cocktails served at 6pm. - Decor: The decor and layout here is very hip and trendy. The music is bumping and the main lobby & common areas remind me of a lounge / bar with the communal sofas and pool table. - Free shuttle: The hotel pays for your publico ride coming from the ferry station. And if you're a Platinum member, you get a free personal jeep service to the ferry station when you leave. CONS: - Service (rooms): After coming from St Regis where we had spot-on service, the W seems a bit lacking in that department. We had called to ask for additional toiletries and they never came. Called a second time, they said they tried to deliver it to the room and knocked on the door, someone came out and apparently didn't want the toiletries anymore. This all would've been fine if it had been true. None of us heard the knock and definitely no one opened the door - so either they were lying or they went to the wrong room, even though they should know the room number when they called AND I specifically told them our room number. - Room: We got a upgraded to a suite and at first was very happy with it. The decor was interesting and hip, the bed, and daybed were comfortable. We had a balcony as well, until we discovered a plethora of spiderwebs and little bugs out there. Granted, we were on a tropical island, but I was expecting those to be sweeped pretty frequently. Second and most importantly, we found 2 COCKROACHES in our room scavenging for food!! We called to complain and all we got was a "sorry about that miss" and a potential spraydown at the earliest the next morning. Well, we were only there for 1 night, so I must say, it wasn't worth having them come in. - Food: Expensive, but not as expensive as St Regis. Quality was also better, until I found it was an Alain Ducasse restaurant - I definitely expected more from such a big name. Overall, it was a pleasurable stay and definitely a fun experience!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: rosario_lw
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed 3 days over the month of July, can't stop talking to everyone about the great time we had and are planning to go back soon. Everyone we encountered was so friendly and helpful; we met Alex the Director of Rooms (forgot his last name) and he made our time at the property as well as outside so worthwhile; he recommended us where to go and what to do, right on point. He also helped me prepare a small surprise for my girlfriend, she loved it! We had so much fun we have even thought of getting married there. Love the adult beach and the pool with the underwater music. The rooms are just awesome, big and so comfortable you hardly want to go out; so relaxing. One small negative that doesn't change the overall experience is the service at the restaurant; pretty slow and not so friendly but don't let this change your mind; just eat outside, plenty of choices. We hope to go back again and bring some friends along and who knows, maybe make it official there too; what a perfect spot to do so. For now it's our official vacation place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend at the W Retreat and Spa!”
Reviews.Author: PattydeL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Retreat and Spa on Vieques Island over Labor Day Weekend 2010. There was a celebrity event going on, so the place was packed and lots of celebrities hanging out at the hotel. The W was absolutely beautiful and the pool area was fabulous! Our room was not ready when we checked in (we were upgraded to a larger, beach front room since we are SPG Platinum members), but we were pleased to find that the hotel was hosting a scavenger hunt on the island! They gave each team a Jeep to drive around the island looking for clues...it was a great start to the weekend. Other praises go to the gym, free bike rental, and the pool bar!

Reviews.Title: “Surprise 40th Birthday celebration exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Mr_IPA
Reviews.Content: I surprised my wife for her 40th Birthday by taking her to the W Retreat & Spa on Vieques Island in Puerto Rico. In addition I also arranged to have four other couples meet us there, all coming from different places. As you can imagine this was quite a feat to pull off (as a surprise no less), with many moving parts and a ton of details. I have to say our experience at the W Resort was nothing short of fantastic. In addition to the outstanding property, I also give the very highest marks to the staff (in particular Lindsay Kelsheimer) who went out of their way to make sure that this celebration was memorable. The short plane ride from San Juan airport to Vieques was really cool. When we landed there was a W lounge right at the airport which was air-conditioned and stocked with cold drinks that we enjoyed while waiting for the driver to arrive. The W van dropped us at the front door and from there the magical experience began. I had exchanged several emails with Lindsay in the months leading up to our arrival and kept my fingers crossed the entire time that everything would come together. Sure enough, Lindsay was there waiting for me when we checked in so right away I took a deep breath and knew that everything was going to be OK. As my wife and friends made their way out to the fire pit/patio for a drink Lindsay pulled me aside and quickly reviewed all the plans we had made prior to arrival. She arranged for us to have a private fish fry and BBQ right on the beach one night, with a chef and wait staff that cooked us an amazing meal. She was also able to make a custom birthday cake which they brought to our table on our last night which was my wife's birthday. Lindsay also checked in with me periodically throughout our stay to make sure that everything was OK and to update me on some of the things that she helped to arrange while we were there (including an afternoon excursion to a private beach with a stopover in a small town right on the water for shopping and a few drinks). The final piece which really amazed me was that they were able to arrange for us to use a private room upstairs where I was able to connect my laptop to an overhead projector and show a music video I had made for my wife. This is another example of their Whatever/Whenever mentality. The actions spoke even louder than the words. I also have to compliment Jonathan Heath, the GM for the property. Despite being on vacation when I emailed him initially, Jonathan got right back to me and was able to arrange for all five couples to be situated in the same building. This was a nice touch. Jonathan also stopped by after-hours to make sure that I was able to get everything connected to show the video. Talk about exceeding expectations! Kudos also goes out to Iris Ortiz (Jonathan's Executive Admin assistant) and Tara Mullane (Catering Manager). Each of them were helpful in making sure that all of the arrangements and plans came off without a hitch. The end result was that my wife had a birthday celebration she will remember for the rest of her life. Our friends also had a blast and haven't stopped talking about it since we got back. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone who is looking for a relaxing trip where the facilities are first class and the staff is top-notch. Led by Lindsay, this group of people are totally customer-focused and would not rest until they were sure every detail had been attended to during our stay. As a result I will tell everyone about this tremendous experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, but get off property as much as possible.”
Reviews.Author: erik48
Reviews.Content: There's no question that the W is a spectacular property in terms of its design and hip, chic decor. From the private airport lounge to the main lobby, very spacious and well-appointed room, two pristine beaches and pool area, everything is beautiful and exceptionally well-maintained. The main restaurant, Mix on the Beach, was great, as were the bartenders at the pool bar. The airport lounge with complimentary snacks and beverages and a private concierge provides a warm welcome to the island while waiting for the resort van. Unfortunately, not so with the front desk. The staff is personable and welcoming enough, but the check in process we experienced was excruciatingly slow. The resort insists that an "ambassador" provide a tour of the property on the way to the room. We waited about 30 minutes for the tour and finally arrived at our room about 45 minutes after arrival. While it was nice to see where the gym and spa were located along the way, what we really wanted was to get to our room immediately, unpack and enjoy a beverage on the beautiful balcony overlooking the pool. The front desk always seemed to be understaffed. Check out was similarly slow. The front desk service was really just a minor irritation. In the complaint department, we really have only one - the $60 per day resort fee. The published room rates for the W are not at all unreasonable for a resort property of this quality, but the additional fee made this a poor value. Since we don't play tennis and didn't use either the spa or the gym, all we received for $60 daily was transportation to and from the airport - less than two miles away - and "free" wireless internet. That amounts to the most expensive taxi ride and internet access in the world. Adding insult to injury was the fact that the small bottles of water in our room were labeled $6. That's just gouging the guests. Had it not been for this incredibly tacky display of greed, I may not even be complaining. This is not to say we didn't enjoy our stay. We certainly did. It's most unfortunate, however, that we found absolutely nothing about the W that reflected the wonderful, unique character of the island of Vieques. It was the island, not the resort, that was the star of this visit - the beautiful, unspoiled, deserted beaches, the horses everywhere, the lively bars and restaurants along the main street of Esperanza, the bio bay, the warm, wonderful people and their stories... So, splurge and stay at the W, but rent a car (We liked Maritza's.) and do some exploring. Otherwise, you'll miss a special treat.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Beach Front Property I've stayed at.....”
Reviews.Author: Msdacko
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and an amazing property is what you'll expect by staying at the W Vieques. I would say the worst part about this trip was getting to the actual island of Vieques (we took the $2 ferry). But once we arrived at the hotel, it was very nice and pleasant. Go here to relax and get good sun. There isn't a lot of night life and go party, but that's fine because you're going here to relax - not party.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Work.”
Reviews.Author: enkayenwhy
Reviews.Content: The W Vieques is a beautiful hotel in a stunning location overlooking turqouise blue water. Like most W's, it feels relaxing and hip at the same time. However, the customer service leaves alot to be desired, particularly at this price point. I called Starwood Preferred Guest and requested a room with 2 double beds before arriving. I was assured that as a Gold-level SPG member, my request would be fulfilled, but when I arrived, they gave us a room with a King bed. I called the front desk, and they said that there are no guarantees for room requests, but they would switch me to a different room. Given that the hotel was only about 25% full and my status as a Gold member, I think they should have fulfilled my request the first time. This incident was pretty typical of our overall experience at the W. We would routinely have to wait at the front desk for 10 or more minutes to be helped. There was never anyone at the Away (aka Concierge) desk when we went there for help. The "Whatever, Whenever" line would frequently ring 10 or more times before someone answered. More like "Whatever, Whenever We Feel Like It." Also, I don't think the floor in our room was cleaned the whole time we where there (4 nights). Given the lack of infrastructure on the island, and how much the W is charging, they also need to provide more services for their guests..such as a shuttle service to Isabelle Segund and Esperanza, car rental, and a concierge who is actually working to make arrangements for excursions, etc. The W is beautiful, but without improvements in the customer service, it's not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful vacation at the tail end of "off season"”
Reviews.Author: SarahinBigD
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely eight-day vacation at the W Vieques last November and cannot wait until our trip this coming November! Last year we arrived at both the tail-end of the off-season and the tail of a hurricane, but could not have had a more carefree and relaxing time. My husband and I always look forward to the W atmosphere--fun, flirty, and a bit more modern. I recommend thus property to everyone. I think some of the negative comments about the property are typical of a remote island resort. We did experience a hiccup one evening with service at The Mixx, but that was it. We never experienced transportation issues or lack of housekeeping. Overall, the guests and staff made our trip memorable, and we are looking forward to experiencing the same in a few months. (note to parents traveling with children--particularly in light of another review posted earlier--there is not a "topless/nude" beach. There is an "adult beach" for adults to enjoy peace and quiet when they want to step away from the other "all guest" beach that's in front of the active Wet/pool scene. I spent six of eight days on the "adult" beach, and the only time a top came off was when someone was knocked over by a powerful wave (strong waves--be careful). Also, know that every W Hotel has a box of goodies sitting out that contains some "adult" items. That's just all the W properties--keeping it fun and sexy, as they're known for being.)

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience!”
Reviews.Author: GraceinVirginia
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights (July 27,2011 and 28,2011) and three days at The W Resort and Spa in Vieques, Puerto Rico. Their motto: "Whenever, Whatever" and "What is your wish" is totally false! Don't believe it. The problems started at check in. Apparently, they have two beaches, one they call the "European Beach" which means the topless beach and the other is the normal family oriented beach that we expect in the USA. We made our reservations through their hotel website using their reservation department just to make sure that nothing was messed up and no Expedia or other agents involved. We reserved and paid for two rooms at this very expensive hotel. The room locations have names such as "Oasis", "Tropical", "Fabulous" etc. We told the reservation specialist at the W that we wanted two ocean front, upper floor rooms and that we were traveling with kids. He was nice and gave the 'What is your wish" line and the "Whatever, Whenever" talk and assured us that we would get the rooms we had just discussed. Arriving at the hotel everyone gives you the "What is your wish" line again, however, it is an absolute lie. We were shown where the pool is and the restaurant and what they call the "Living room". Then we were shown our room, on the first floor, not upper floor, and they were over looking the "European Beach". I explained to them that it was not what we had asked for and I do not want my children across from the topless/nude beach. Both rooms were across from the "European Beach". To top that, my daughter found a box of condoms, lubricants and massage oil, SUPPLIED AND PLACED THERE BY THE HOTEL, right next to the granola bar, cashews and almonds next to the refrigerator. I went to the very nasty reservation lady at the front desk and explained the situation and asked for different rooms. She was very rude and told us it was too bad! She said she was sorry that they had not explained the topless beach to us when we made the reservation. I asked for at least one of the rooms to be changed she refused. Meanwhile we had talked to other employees and they assured us that the hotel was only 60% full, we asked another employee and he said that they would only be full 45% the next day. I asked for the manager, the very nasty front desk lady said she was the manager. I asked for the owner of the chain and she said she did not have that information, I asked for the Starwood main number, she could not supply that. I asked to at least be moved the next night, she said they were 100% full and no one was checking out. She finally after much talk did offer us one room in a far away location It was very small, nothing like what they had charged us for, smelled, and had no views. She went on to explain that was where they put the "cheap rooms", and "where they put the people who pay less". I asked her for her name, and told her that she was exposing my children to nudity and sex objects. She and Starwood would be contacted by my attorney and guess what?! Just at that instant two rooms became available for the next night!!!! We were very stressed by the second day, not knowing whether she really meant it or it was another lie. We were finally moved, our bathroom smelled like urine, but the room was clean. Although these rooms were of a lower category than what we had paid for and reserved, we received no refund because their current rates were higher than when we had made our reservations. The hotel had a deserted feel to it, it was not a lively happy place. There were a few adults here and there and a couple of families with kids. Maybe it becomes more of an active and lively place on the weekends. I do not recommend this hotel for families unless you want your young daughter/son to find massage oil, condoms and lubricants right next to the M&Ms and the granola bars. The Management. Just. Does. Not. Care. Period. Exposing parents and children withour prior knowledge to nudity and sex objects MUST be illegal. But again, the management does not care about you or your kids! They do have a nice pool,the beach is very narrow. They do have a nice lounge at the airport with free drinks and apples, that is were the free sodas end. But I would rather have my daughter find only M&Ms next to the fridge and pay for my own sodas. If you do decide to stay here, make sure you have a very good attorney on call with his/her cell phone number handy, chances are you might need it! Do not believe their motto or their advertising. It should be illegal for them to put sex objects right next to the snacks. How many of us parents expected to look for such a thing and remove them before our kids look for the M&Ms? How often have any of us come across condoms, lubricants and massage oil in a hotel room? This was a first for us, we had afterall, not traveled to the red light district of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: travelforlife22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the w for our anniverary and it was just what we needed. As a gold member they upgraded us to an ocean front room, which was awesome. They alsuprised us with a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries for our anniversary. It was a really nice suprise and much appreciated. The breakfast was great, but dinner was awful. There was nothing on the menu that sounded good so we went with the local fish (we never order the same thing, but nothing else was good) and it was awful. The actual fish was good, but was covered with an awful bitter topping. It was so bad i couldnt eat it. It was unfortunate bc i have high expectations for the quality of food at w hotels. This was disappointing. Other than that, we were very happy with the resort!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property BUT customer service lacking”
Reviews.Author: elambdc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel frequently, and were excited to check out this hotel. The resort is beautiful! The location, the grounds, the design â€“ amazing! However the customer service is lacking, especially for such the W brand. Weâ€™re used to the nonexistent customer service in Puerto Rico (having lived there for 3+ years) and were hoping that it would be a different with the W Vieques. Not the case. It took the staff a long time to respond to basic requests (we waited an hour for towels), the wait staff at pool left items sitting out for hours, and overall just didnâ€™t seem to care about their guests. The only exception was the restaurant staff and the shuttle driver who took us to the airport â€“ but they were not from the island. This is not what one would expect at a place with high prices and where the staff work for tips. We were in Playa del Carmen Mexico in May 2011 at an all inclusive resort and the staff went above and beyond to take care of us â€“ and they donâ€™t work for tips! On Saturday night they had a wedding with a DJ at the pool which was in front our our room. It sounded like the DJ was in our room. At 9pm we inquired with the front desk when the music would end and we were told at 10pm. It went on until 11pm. I realize this is not that late, but for a resort that calls itself a RETREAT it's not what we had in mind. We were trying to get away from noise and craziness! Also, the lounge at the airport is nice but lacks the most important item - a bathroom. It sort of defeats the purpose when you have to go to the main airport to use the bathroom there. Plus the cockroach that ran over my foot while I was in the shower was also a low point. Go to another W resort.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place to stay- a little slice of heaven”
Reviews.Author: PaulJude
Reviews.Content: We originally planned to only spend four days in Vieques at the W hotel. We were unfamiliar with the brand and not exactly what to expect. Many chains describe themselves as four and five star and often do not deliver. The W Hotel was everything we hoped for in a hotel. The Pros-the rooms are large, stylish and everyone has a perfect view. Decidedly modern without being fussy. It you want old school design this is not your hotel. The staff were professional, accomodating and knowledgable. Once we had a better idea of the resort, we immediately changed our plans and spent the remaining week in Vieques. Not for someone looking for an action packed week...more of the feeling of being on a private island in a beutiful private home. Lots of reading, pooltime and the beach. The beach is small, private and close to the resort. You can walk from your rooom to the beach in one minute. The dining areas are close and open to a beautiful view of the ocean. The Cons-the dining options are limited. There are two choices...the main dining and a casual cafe-take out kind of place. The main dining was overly fussy without being special. Advertised as being "Alain Duccase" inspired, it really doesnt deliver. It was the one area that disappointed. All in all.........close to perfect place to get away and have a sun-inspired "get away". Serveral comanies do simple tours and scuba if you're inclined. If you want a very special tour.....ask the front desk to book Angie..........she was the highlight our our trip. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous but...... still not sold!”
Reviews.Author: Gringo-in-Paradise
Reviews.Content: So here's the deal....I have reviewed this resort before and yes, it is a wonderful place but it is NOT Vieques. It is a W cookie cutter (which is nice) but they missed the mark on a few things...Vieqeus is known for it's funky history, it's wild horses, its biolumenescent bay, its mongooses (mongeese?) and it's pristine, remote beaches. The W does not capitalize on any of these, it's just another fabulous (but overpriced) beach resort. There are several boutique hotels on the island which I would recommend if you really want the unique, one-of-a-kind Vieques experience. But again, the W is a beautiful chain. I will return to the island next week for my 14th visit and will stay at one of my favorite local B&B's.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Island, Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: desiquill
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W in Aug. 2010. The resort is beautiful and staff is very accommodating. Overall a great place for relaxation. The resort beach was very private but I preferred the public beaches on the island--the water was turquoise and the sand bleached white. I went with my boyfriend and we spent equal amounts of time on and off the resort. At the time the island was only serviced by two/three taxi's so unless that has changed you will have to plan your outings. We booked the mosquito bay excursion through the concierge as well. It was quite an adventure but definitely worth doing. As in most resorts food and drinks were pricey but we were able to balance the costs well. I really enjoyed my stay there and would like to do a girls spa weekend there!

Reviews.Title: “HAPPILY EVER AFTER â€“ W Vieques style”
Reviews.Author: Amy0402
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to experience the W Retreat & Spa - Vieques Island soon after they opened their property in April 2010. My parents and I had an amazing trip â€“ the employees were extremely friendly, genuine and accommodating (from the GM, W Insider and other staff members) and the venue was out of this world. It was not characteristic of many of the W properties I have experienced in the States â€“ but the design and dÃ©cor fit the island & environment beautifully. Later that fall, my boyfriend, Kevin, proposed and we started exploring options for a wedding venue. We live right outside of Washington, DC and since we were both approaching 40 - we wanted to explore something very unique and opted to look into destination weddings. I quickly reconnected with the W staff in Vieques and with the thorough help of my wedding planner, Rebecca Lippe, they organized the most touching and meaningful wedding experience for us, our family and guests. We were married on April 2, 2011 - every detail was meticulously thought out, planned and executed, allowing us to focus on our 65 guests and enjoy every moment of our time together with them for the 5 days we were all together. We hosted a number of celebrations during our stay and opted for different locations on property so all could truly experience the entire resort. Our guests raved about the venue, the food that was served during the events and the service that accompanied it. The Director of Beverage & Food had an incredible team supporting him throughout our stay. He and his team ensured that the celebrations exceeded expectations of what we had envisioned. Many of our guests opted to stay a few days after the wedding to soak up the sunshine, relax by the calming infinity-edged pools or the beautiful secluded beaches and enjoy the breathtaking views from the Living Room. The venue proved to be the perfect setting for us to begin this journey together with our dear friends & family â€“ we could not have chosen a better place. While it was certainly not the least expensive option we entertained, we feel the entire staff and resort offered us the greatest value and most incredible experience. We plan to return often to celebrate and remember this amazing time of life and thank the W Retreat & Spa for helping us to establish these memories of a lifetime!

Reviews.Title: “Attention to every detail...would come back in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: JennModesette
Reviews.Content: The hotel strives to meet every wish of guests and provides the most relaxing atmosphere I have ever experienced at a hotel. I now want to visit W Hotel properties more often in other locations for quick get-aways with the hubs. I was almost scared away by other negative reviews, but the reality is this place is on an island. Sometimes they are going to run out of things! In my opinion, negative reviews were probably from difficult to impress guests. My husband and I can't stop taking photos of this place. The architecture is stunningly simple and modern, design is modern industrial meets Boho chic. The pool area is gorgeous with two infinity pools, a middle deck of in-pool lounge chairs, surrounding deck chairs and cabanas. Calming music (usually house electronic) is faintly heard everywhere on property...even in the pool (i.e. go for a swim and you will hear the music being played under water!) Staff was extremely accommodating and helpful, especially when compared with other "service" we experienced in Puerto Rico. There is a resort fee, but free water around the hotel, pool towels, towels for off-site, complimentary happy hour drink, free transport to/from ferry and airport, and complimentary wireless throughout the property (not just in lobby!) make it worth it. All the food we had was amazing. Quality ingredients and fresh meals can be difficult to find when traveling. The sandwiches, salads and breakfasts we had were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Style Over Substance: Good Beach, Bad Everything Else!”
Reviews.Author: khaleesi87
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are very familiar with the W brand and were looking forward to a luxurious 4 days on Vieques but what we got was an over-designed, under-effecient resort...that smelled like warm urine. Here are the pros and cons: Pros: -Free transport from the VQS airport to the hotel, free cocktails in the airport lounge -2 great beaches at the resort, nice pool area -Awesome massage at the spa -Clean, well equipped fitness center What could be wrong, you ask? Oh I'll tell you: Cons: THE ROOMS -Lighting: Our first one had the oddest lighting scheme you can imagine. Bright-as-the-sun fluorescents over the toilet, but almost no lighting in the main area. -We were "upgraded" to a different room (hauled our own luggage, thanks) but the new room was actually identical. They INSISTED our bed was a king...um no, it was a queen. At least the lighting was better. -Layout of the rooms was terrible. It has a giant yet uncomfortable, unusable bathtub in the center of the studio-shaped room. Toilet door never really closes (what fun for couples!) and the sink area is adjacent to the bed, with no door. So washing your hands = waking people up. -Room began smelling like pee somehow. -Housekeeping failed to come, had to demand it from the front desk. -Terrible food, waitstaff and general dining options. Blechhh. Overall, the resort is slick and cool but neither comfortable nor intuitive, not at all relaxing. Unfortunately, it's probably the best resort on the island. FYI, eat at Belly Buttons for breakfast, Bili's for lunch, Tradewinds for dinner. Avoid Abe's bio bay tour (super disorganized) and don't touch the horses. They kick. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “an unforgetable Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: AGWdc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the W Vieques to celebrate our wedding anniversary and had an amazing time. The staff took great care of us, including arranging car transportation for us when our reservation fell through, sending us to the best destinations and restaurants on the island, and making sure we had everything we needed while at the property. Some of the highlights of the trip were the state beaches--truly some of the most beautiful and secluded we have ever visited--and the nighttime trip to the bio-luminescent bay. We will definitely be back and are so glad that this facility has been added to the destinations on Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “Awesone Time!”
Reviews.Author: applax
Reviews.Content: The W Retreat in Vieques was our honeymoon destination. Jennifer Toren, our travel agent, set our entire trip up, and even managed to organize a last-minute return to the W after our experience at the El San Juan was less-than-adequate. With Jen's persistence and expertise, we had the honeymoon we always wanted: relaxing, intimate, and exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: badpoodle06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for 5 nights in June and loved every minute of it. My husband is Starwood platinum so they upgraded us to an oceanfront room that was absolutely amazing. Just about all of the staff we met there were extremely nice and helpful. I heard through the grapevine that the resort has recently undergone a management change and a lot of staff changes. They are now bringing in employees from other Starwood properties in the upper 48 and putting an emphasis on service. I could certainly tell. It makes all the difference in the stay there. We ate almost all of our lunches and dinners at the resort and the food was incredible each time. Even the casual food you order by the pool - perfectly cooked and delicious. Of course it is all expensive - you're at a resort! There is a cafe where you can get mediocre sandwiches and an odd assortment of breakfast foods. The smoothies are good there. You can order a picnic basket if you do so a full 24 hours ahead of time. Sadly for us we just don't plan that well. I ordered room service one night after our bio bay tour and was sad to have a choice of about 5 things since it was after 10. The food was good, there just wasn't much to choose from that time of night. The resort is located near the airport and has a very nice lounge to wait in before upon arriving and departing. Since the airport is without air conditioning, this was much appreciated. It only takes about 5 minutes to get from the airport to the resort. Check in was a breeze and we had no problem making dinner, spa or activity reservations. However, I heard this is not always the case when there is a retreat or conference going on - so double check this when you book! The resort has a beautiful pool and 2 gorgeous beaches set up with umbrellas and chairs. There are towels and water all over the place. One beach is adults only and I thought it had the softer sand and better swimming. That is where I spent most of my time. :) I booked a package at the spa and was shocked when I arrived 45 minutes early and found they have NO locker room, no sauna, no relaxation room, nothing. You wait in the lobby until your appointment and change inside your treatment room. So odd for such an expensive and seemingly high-end spa. Big mistake if you ask me. The treatments were incredible, though and the technicians really knew what they were doing. The gym is quite large for a hotel and well equipped. Everything is brand new. We played tennis each morning and the courts are in OK condition. Some leaves and water that could easily be taken care of. They also keep a basketball goal on the court that made it hard to play on one of the courts because one player could only back up so much. My husband actually tripped on it. What am I forgetting? Some very tiny gripes: 1) The ladies that work at the W Cafe are very rude. They were the only unpleasant employees we met all week. 2) The W Cafe sells almost nothing useful. Only tiny tubes of sunscreen and no bug repellent. But if you're looking for disgusting, shelf stable cheeses (no crackers though!), you're in luck. 3) Bigger room service menu 4) I wish they would put water and towels out on the tennis courts and keep them clean Overall an incredible experience, would love to go back. A very unique and special property for sure. You won't regret going.

Reviews.Title: “Food is terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: susy009
Reviews.Content: Recently visited the W in Vieques and I have to warn people that the food is HORRIBLE! Everyone was talking about this topic. They have a named Chef but it is obvious that all he did was sell his name. The food is expensive, short of enough and terrible, just terrible. They also have a lot of tropical drinks that sound great but they will not be repeated by people. I also have to be fair to say that the property is extremely nice and the employees are very friendly. I would recommend the property but go eat somewhere else until they change the food!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, Great Food, Weak Service”
Reviews.Author: bzucknj
Reviews.Content: Our experience was consistent with other's reviews. The property is beautiful. Lush grounds overlooking the beach. The hotel is new and the rooms are stylish and well appointed. The pools are the best spot to spend your days. Two infiity style with lots of chairs and cabanas to recline in and the only good service at the resort. Shout out to Michelle! The two smalish beaches are nice, but on the Atlantic side of the island so water not as calm as the Carribean side. For real beauty, rent a car and explore the beaches in the US Nature Preserve (Blue, Red, Secret, etc.) The food at every meal was delicious. unfortunately, the service was not. Beyond the typical slower paced service that is to be expected in the Islands. Extremely slow and often forgetful. not what you'd expect from a W or a resort in this category. Not bad enough to keep you from visiting, but not up to expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Setting, Great Amenities, Service Needs Major Improvement”
Reviews.Author: roxylass
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds, buildings and decorations are absolutely amazing. A gorgeous site perched over the water with two different beaches and an incredible set of pools. There are a number of comfortable lounge chairs and hammocks throughout the grounds so you can always find a hideaway to spend time alone relaxing. The rooms are all very large and comfortable, and ours had a perfect balcony with table and chairs and a drying rack for clothes and swimsuits. I absolutely love the setting of this resort! Another great perk is that they will pick you up at the airport and the lounge is quite nice to sit in while waiting for your plane. Unfortunately, the service was overall quite poor, particularly in the restaurant (which is the only place around to eat). On our first night, about 10% of tables were full but we were quite rudely turned away saying we need a reservation (front desk should have mentioned that) and we sat outside instead. The restaurant never filled up, and we were out on the patio all evening. You can order from the full menu outside though, so I'd actually recommend sitting near the fire pit to eat. We had two other very poor service experiences in the restaurant during our three day stay. Forgotten/missed orders, cold food, incorrect orders, lack of service, etc. It is such ashame that the W hasn't been able to iron out their service problems, because it is nearly perfect otherwise. Either way, I'll probably return because I love this little island, but I expect much more from a W.

Reviews.Title: “A Tropical Paradise: Modern Flair w/ an Island Groove”
Reviews.Author: wannagetaway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for 2 nights, primarily for the Bio Bay tour. The grounds are beautifully maintained and the rooms are spacious with swanky retro decor. The staff was quite helpful, but a note to future guests: My husband requested a late checkout, but our key card was made invalid at the regular check out time. It's good that they strive to be as secure as possible, but when my husband went to front to see what the problem was, they did everything short of putting him into an interrogation room, when all they really had to do is have someone open the door for us so we could show our identification--which was in the room! It would have saved a lot of time and effort. All in all, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A "Must Go"!!”
Reviews.Author: veganista
Reviews.Content: From the moment you get in the tiny 9-passenger plane from San Juan to the Vieques Island you know you are in for something special! The airport can only handle small planes (we took Sunshine Air, but I would recommend VAL-Vieques Air Link, they by far had the nicest planes). You land at the tiny airport and the W has an amazing welcoming lounge that is as big as the entire airport! It is truly the mix of quaint meets luxury, remote meets exquisite. A short drive later you arrive at the resort and it is everything that you expect from a W. The lobby is spectacular, the rooms are even better- large and comfortable and of course extremely modern, but still welcoming. Because Vieques was a military base up till recently the beaches are virgin and untouched and the island itself is so completely charming. The W has claimed by far some of the best land on the island and laid the resort out perfectly. The staff is helpful and very friendly and the food is delish. I highly recommend taking advantage of the many activities the W offers- morning yoga was amazing and the kayak tour was also a highlight. We were unable to do it- but I also heard the Bio Tour was a must! If you are thinking about visiting this part of the word, do not pass up a stay at the W Vieques, it will be a life long memory.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel on a Beautiful Island”
Reviews.Author: quimbydog
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the W Hotel and Spa on Vieques Island. The beauty of the island is the perfect spot for a romantic getaway that is a short plane ride from San Juan. The rooms are spacious and well-laid out with a nice balcony to enjoy the breezes from the ocean. The employees were all very nice and the pool area is fantastic. We did not eat at the main restaurant while we were there, but we did eat at the pool cafe twice and the bar area for snacks one night. The pool cafe had great salads and sandwiches - all very fresh and tasty. The bar restaurant had specials each night in addition to a set limited menu - the night we were there was ceviche night and the ceviche was fresh and delicious. There is also a little coffee bar/sandwich shop that had great coffee selections and fresh pastries. (Yes, the drinks are expensive - but it's a W - what do you expect?) My only complaint is that I tried to go to the spa to get an appointment for a manicure on a Wednesday and they said they couldn't get me in until the following Monday - when I would be long gone. I found this strange considering that the resort was quite empty (it is off season) and every time I went into the spa there was never anyone there. Not quite the "Whatever Whenever" that they like to pretend they abide by - but it was a small blip in an otherwise wonderful time. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort but you need deep pockets”
Reviews.Author: Novakkevin
Reviews.Content: The W in vieques is a wonderful place to stay. The food was wonderful and the scenery and the rooms and buildings outstanding. Service, although everyone was very nice and helpful, the quality of service seemed to depend on the day. We found you need to budget about 4 to 5 hundred dollars a day for food and drink for a family of four. Drinks are expensive. 12 dollars for mojitos and similar drinks. Vieques is very rustic and the W resort offers a safe, comfortable and pleasurable retreat in contrast. A real downside is the closing of the living room, pool bar and cafe early in the evening. Water provided in the pool areas is also removed very early and no alternatives available. I would recommend the resort even with the few downsides we experienced. Views around the resort are incredible.

Reviews.Title: “MIxed at best”
Reviews.Author: marcopoloVT
Reviews.Content: Hotel is pretty good looking and stylish. Food service is fast and friendly. The W whatever/whenever service is crap. We arranged a trip off site last night and they forgot to arrange our transport. We had to wait about an hour. Tonite we asked for a taxi and were told it would be 20 min's so we waited in the lobby. After 30 min's we were told another 20 min's. After ONE HOUR AND TWENTY MINS we still did not have transport. We ere informed transport was unreliable and they could call someone else. After these two experiences we declined. I suggested the hotel shuttle take us to our destination since we had already waited so long with two children (one a baby). No dice. The standards at play to accept such behavior from a regular driver are apparently pretty low. We were all set to stay here again, but based on this -basically being trapped at the hotel unless you want to wait and wait and wait. Whilst at reception we heard someone else complaining about being double charged. *Our room service tray has not moved from outside our door for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “When it's good, it's very, very good. When it's bad, it's awful”
Reviews.Author: bladerama
Reviews.Content: There is a lot to like about this resort, but also lots to annoy. We were returning after 5 years and were interested what the 'W' make over had done. From a design point of view it has had a lot of work done. I do not personally think that the ultra modern design fits naturally with beautiful and rural surroundings, but it is not badly designed by any means. The rooms are a little quirky, with the bathtub being in the middle of the room. I am guessing they are not that well used. The rooms are quite minimalist and not that comfortable (Excluding the fab beds of course). The mini bar is expensive (no surprise) but it is also not replenished. when the local beer is $5 a can and a shop 200 yrds down the road sells it for less than a dollar you would think they would work hard not to make guests look for alternatives. We had ants in our room, they kept themselves to themselves but not very nice and opening the balcony doors let a lot of bugs in and we were quite badly bitten (Not that the hotel can do anything about the bugs, but just a warning). There was also a wedding which played loud music, it stopped at 11pm but we were on a early to bed, early to rise routine as we like the morning cool (One of the reasons we stayed at a 'retreat and spa'), so it was annoying as it was right outside our room. The $60 resort fee perplexed me, I am not sure what it is for. Towels, wifi and tennis I think, (Free in most places) why not just add it on to the room charge and not treat guests like idiots. (A new favourite trick from Starwood hotels) Finally on the gripes, the Alain Ducasse restaurant is simply not as good as many of the independent restaurants on the island and is the most expensive. It is ordinary food at a premium price. On the positives, the sun loungers in the water are very relaxing and have amazing views over the ocean. The staff are polite, some are very helpful (some need some more training though). The gym is great and provides yoga sessions (That I am happy to pay for). The two beaches are nice, with one an adults only beach. At night the resort looks spectacular and the bar scene is very relaxing as the main building literally removes its walls and people gather on the deck in a variety of outdoor furniture including an outdoor fire surrounded by cushions. I really want this resort to sort out its problems because it is OK and expensive and it could be fab and great value without changing much.

Reviews.Title: “Designed for Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: jklamerus
Reviews.Content: The W on Vieques Island is spectacular!!!! We are already planning our return. From the picturesque setting to the chirping frogs, this island get away was a 5/5!!! My partner and I spent 5 nights in the beginning of low season. Although the forecast suggested rain every day for our May vacation, sunshine abounded. I believe that this resort was designed by a relaxation architect and the staff seems to have one solitary purpose, their guests happiness. Our room was perfect. Very spacious. Excellent decor throughout the complex. Two beautiful pools, two beaches, and a great spa. We were told that a car rental was a must... my only regret. Our return trip won't include a car, I never wanted to leave the resort. Be sure to fly to the island, ferry service isn't easy and the air service is good. We used Cape Air and weren't disappointed. Book the trip. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!! I'm looking forward for doing it again.”
Reviews.Author: YYCM
Reviews.Content: It's a boutique hotel: medium size, informal but very chick and the service is great. It's a paradise: pretty beach, quiet, nature, nice rooms, all clean and neat, good food and very friendly and nice people. I always go to the spa in all of our travels and the W's in one f the best I had visited. You can go out of the hotel just getting a "taxi" called "publc cars" and go to beautiful sandy beaches with almost nobody and to eat to very very good restaurants in the beachfront or "malecon". My favorite "El Quenepo".

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: less0nlearned
Reviews.Content: This resort is a beautiful, eclectically designed paradise. It is small and extremely peaceful. The service is great but it's not the kind of place that is continually under foot. The servers do not walk around the pool etc. You are left alone for the most part but if you request something, they are at your service. If you are wanting a romantic, quiet vacation, the W is the place for you. I would not recommend this spot for a family vacation. You would be hard pressed to find activities for the kids at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “STUNNING”
Reviews.Author: Kritik0s
Reviews.Content: Kudos for W Retreat and spa for trying a new concept, RETREAT and SPA in a downturn economy. They went all out on this and it is simply stunning. The menu , spa., music , lounge area are very tropical chic. Their biggest challenge is going to be getting the resources like good produce and employees from the island. Seems like everything is having to come from U.S. I still havent made up my mind about Vieques. it is definitly different. I feel like the W customer is completly different from the typical Vieques visitor. The W brings some sophistication to the island.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: PuraV1da
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days at the W and have nothing but positive things to say about the resort. The smell (we are convinced they use pharamones,) fruit-flavored water, comfortable napping spots, tasty guacamole, immaculate grounds, and warm staff made it the honeymoon of our dreams. It's certainly not an all-inclusive, but as long as you know up front that you're paying a steep resort fee every day, you can really relax and enjoy yourself. The W could be anywhere in the world as long as you're inside the gates. We appreciated the quality of the accomodations so much more after we left and explored the island. It's such a quirky yet wonderful island. Viequense Bakery in Isabel was our favorite gem. We ate there every day after comparing the quality to the $45 resort breakfast (though the $8 French press was pretty tasty!) Hope to return to the W. Remarkable design and hard working staff. Definitely worth checking it out.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever Whenever”
Reviews.Author: Sleepybrowne
Reviews.Content: The W retreat & Spa has to be my favorite on the Island.It is very modern, chic, great Restaurant and staff.If you eat at the living Room try the Short Ribs Sandwich or the Crab Sliders.If you like Kayaking & Tennis its included.I absolutely live the fact that the Pool @ Wet was 24hrs a day.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Sleepybrowne
Reviews.Content: This as to be my new vacation getaway,I would personally recommend anyone going to Puerto Rico to visit the W Retreat & Spa in Vieques Island.My 5 days there was well spent.It was very relaxing yet still a lot of fun.The staff was very helpful and friendly.I met a lot of first timers such as myself who said they would absolutely return to the island to stay @ the W hotel.I personally recommend trying the special @ lunch time at the Wet pool area.My server's name was "Mari" she is the absolute best.If you have breakfast @ the restaurant I recommend the buffet it is a great value.Do visit El Quenepo & Trade Winds too in Esperanza for some wonderful food.If you can rent a car or even a scooter to visit all the wonderful beaches.I highly recommend fun Brothers for scooter rentals or a Jet-Ski.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property but disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: Chico2011
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property and wonderful accommodations, but overall stay was a very disappointing. Upon arrival we went to the Airport W Lounge which was depleted of many of the beverages, with just empty bottles in the pantry. We waited 45 min. for the van to transport us less than 5 min. to the hotel. Upon arrival we were told that although we paid for and booked a King Oceanfront room there was none available for our stay. The alternatives offered were far less desirable, i.e., Garden view rooms, etc. We were then told at 3:30 pm that our room was not ready, they suggested we get some food at resort restaurant. We sat down and within minutes were told to get up because the kitchen was closed. After waiting 2 hrs we were told the room would take another 30 min. After 30 min. we were told it would take another 30 min., at this point it was 6:00pm. At dinner we were told by the waiter â€œWe are out of many of the items on the menuâ€� which was an already limited menu. That second night we were again greeted with the fact that many of the items on the menu were not available. The food was cold, overcooked and tasteless, not something you expect from an Alain Ducasse restaurant. In the afternoon we had ordered a bottle of Rose wine to the room, they delivered it without a wine bucket, or had plans to open it, we were told â€œthere is a corkscrew in the roomâ€�, which there was not. On our last morning we never received our requested wake-up call. When dropped off at the airport the driver mentioned we could use the Lounge before our flight â€“ but the Lounge was in fact closed that morning. Not W standards at all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort - but not able to live up to it's own standards”
Reviews.Author: AnniversaryCouple030
Reviews.Content: "Whatever, Whenever" is their motto. Booked four nights here for a special 20th wedding anniversary trip and was willing to pay top dollar for a special resort. The resort was beautiful and the employees were all really nice. It would be easy to blame the staff for the problems in service at this resort, but that would be just wrong. Staff was continually put in positions to say that "we are out of that" and "that is not available today". The management is selling this place as if it pampers guests and meets their every need - BUT cannot deliver on basics such as having the dinner menu items in stock. Their on hold advertisement says: "Want a chocolate fudge bath?" , so we called two days ahead of check in and asked that a board game (backgammon) be available for us. 2nd day there, when we followed up - they said that they had no such game, but could order it and it would be there in 2 days. Drinks were $14 each and weak. Lobster dinner special was the size of an appetizer for $38. Wait staff was great, but understaffed and unable to provide good service. Bottom line: great place, nice staff .... better to stay away until they get a manager who knows how to provide service to guests. It is annoying to see the Whateever, whenever slogan when basic day-today operations are still so rough. We checked out on the day after we arrived and had a lovely anniversay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Whenever/Whatever is the motto for all.”
Reviews.Author: Surf_GypsyNY
Reviews.Content: My nickname is now "Mosquito Slayer." Heading to Puerto Rico during the wet season isn't the best idea in the world but when your timetable is determined by some dear friends' wedding and when you know both the bride and groom, sacrifices have to be made. Who knew that they'd have to be made in blood? My mother always told me to be sweet and that it wasn't inherent in my nature but the 37 mosquito bites on my body tell a different tale. My friends and I joked that they used me as a shield during our nearly week-long stay on the island. The W was my savior and sanctuary. After battling floor-to-ceiling windows, flying cockamouses, giant centipedes and outdoor showers in our gorgeous Bravos Boys housing - Bungalow 180 - located in the middle of Vieques, I started to feel light-headed from the blood lost and the adrenaline rushes from encountering man-size insects (I think I saw one fly off with a horse). I made the executive decision to vacant our truly gorgeous but very open rental house for the safety, I mean comfort, of the W Vieques. As a loyal cult member of Starwood and especially of the W brand, I know that Whenever, Whatever is bible to the employees. I just didn't expect it to apply to the employees themselves. Many people have complained about the slow service but in the vein of your annoying friends who go to an island and get into the spirit of things, I say, relax mon. Yes the service is slow but where do you have to go? You're stuck on a gorgeous island and the last thing on your mind should be deadlines. And this is coming from a New Yorker who will mow you down in the streets if you stop to look up at buildings. Perhaps I have Stockholm Syndrome as I checked in at 11pm, desperate for a long shower from my extremely dirty and mosquito-ridden bioluminescent bay tour (worth it!) but still needing to arrange for a roll-away bed. Just when I gave up on them bringing me one, 45 minutes later a rap on the door resulted in gratuitous thanks from myself. I felt like the service at the W is like a mediocre boyfriend, you're more grateful when they actually do what they are supposed to. The friendly employees will get you that toothbrush and bring you those toiletries; they wait is just so you're super happy to get it when it finally does come. Or pissed as in some cases. The rooms are separate from the stunning lobby. The decor of the property itself from the rooms to the pool is just exquisite - a true upscale resort feel. And most importantly, the mosquitoes are few and far between (inside). I had an ocean-front room with a deep, retro tub in the middle of my room. The circular couch was fun and comfortable and I fell asleep to the sound of waves. I do agree that the beds do not feel like the W beds I've slept on so many times. It was not as plush and definitely harder. The cleaning service also leaves a little to be desired. The room was clean but slightly sandy. The showers are fitted with rainhead showers and a sliding wooden door offers a rustic privacy. My ocean-front room with a balcony was gigantic. A roll-away bed fit in there with room to spare. Tip: the W also offers double roll-away beds if you get a King Room and need extra beds. I tried the W Cafe and here is where service fell beyond even the island relaxed standards of time. Getting three pre-made sandwiches became an excruciating process. I left my sunglasses upstairs and was able to go back to my room, get my things and still wait another 15 min (30 min total) for the transaction of already made food! And we were in a hurry this time to adhere to a wedding schedule. I think I ripped my bag of chips out of the cashier's hands before he could even get it over the counter to me. If you're thinking about getting married at the W Vieques, I say go for it girlfriend. This was the sixth wedding I've attended this year (and it's only May!) and it was by far the most romantic. None of the 60 guests thought about mosquitoes though we dined in long tables next to the pool outdoors. Instead, we concentrated on the lobster curry and other amazing dishes from Chef Alain Ducasse. The service during the dinner and reception was stellar. Not an empty wineglass or dirty plate sat for more than a minute before the surprisingly efficient wait staff took care of it. The ambiance was incredible - thousands of candles, fresh flowers and water everywhere. We topped things off with an ice cream bar and later, a late-night nacho bar! A wooden deck off to the side offered ample space for dancing. Halfway through the couple's first dance, brilliant fireworks lit up the sky! Incredible work from the W to celebrate the union of my friends. Wet (the W Pool) is always open 24/7 so what could be more fitting than a jump in the pool after dancing? As many weddings happen at the W and I'm sure many guests have the same idea of a late-night dip, I highly suggest requesting a room on the ocean side. Noise travels and we weren't loud, but we weren't quiet by the pool either. The next morning, the W offered complimentary transfers to the airport. Here, island time became an issue as our driver waited a long time for other guests who were sharing our ride making us anxious for our flights but we made it there with plenty of time to space. My impatience was punished when I left my anti-itch medicine behind in the van. Ultimately, if I had to do it all over again, I would have stayed at the W the entire time. It was a pleasant experience but I would definitely want to have gone with a significant other.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: tigergrad00
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night (our anniversary) because we stayed at a friends vacation house the rest of the time and overall our experience was great! The pool was a nice change from the beach. However, as quickly as we arrived, the hotel started asking us about our checkout time! They called, sent TWO checkout notices, and we felt like they really wanted us gone! We had drinks by the pool ($13 drink!) and lunch at the W cafe (reasonably priced!). Breakfast was good, but we think they lost our order for awhile because it took us 20 minutes to get our food. They did give us some free pastries about 3 minutes before our food arrived, but it still took awhile. Overall a wonderful place, but there are many fun little places to stay on the island!

Reviews.Title: “Trying way too hard ...”
Reviews.Author: Dukezilla
Reviews.Content: This place just doesn't hold up to the W standard. They are horribly under staffed and the food service is a joke! Don't even get me started about the DJ in the lobby ... Maybe they should get him to wait tables and put the CD player on random. Also, there are lots of kids here ... So if you're looking for an adult get away .... This is not it.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the splurge.”
Reviews.Author: SATXKen
Reviews.Content: We did five days in PR â€“ two in San Juan and three in Vieques â€“ with the third day, our anniversary, spent at the plush W Resort in Vieques. We are glad we splurged for the day. The resort is a wonderful experience. I have never encountered staff more universally determined to help make your stay the best one possible. I cannot imagine those who have experienced something different. The resort is gorgeous, from the rooms to the grounds. We particularly enjoyed soaking in the well-known tub located in the center of our room -- after a difficult day of dealing with flying in bad weather. Dinner and breakfast at the Mix were both excellent. We sprung for the buffet at breakfast at $28 apiece. How one reviewer spent over $100 for two is beyond me. The pools are among the best we have ever experienced at a resort. This is a romantic place â€“ we even witnessed a proposal â€“ but we saw groups of singles of both genders in addition to plenty of couples. We spoke to other couples who explored the island while staying there, so not everyone sticks to the resort. â€œWhatever, wheneverâ€� is their motto, and they live up to it. Given that this W is isolated here on Vieques, it may not be quite as tightly-run as others, but it is a great experience nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel need more employees and service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lauzump
Reviews.Content: First we got in on Thursdays (3 night stay) there was nobody there to take our luggage, we got in the hotel the lady on the from desk told us our room was ready but did not give us the keys and referred us to the pool bar and told us somebody was going to pick us there to give us a tour of the facilities (that we never got) and take us and our luggage to the room. We were in the bar for about 45 minutes waiting for the employee when he came he guided us to the room (tour of the room) and thatâ€™s it (beautifull room). The first morning at the breakfast restaurant we waited for our omelets about 30 minutes and so did a couple of tables around us, on the second morning we waited for our omelets (not done correctly) for 45 minutes and they forgot the toast, wish came after we finished our breakfast we ask for the manager he never came and the poor waitress (was not her fault) gave us and a few tables around complementary breakfast because of the long waiting and shortage of employees in the kitchen. That same day the hotel was real busy and you notice only two waitress serving the pool they were working like crazy with the amount of order going their way, we waited 35 minutes for two sangrias and ask the waitress what was happening and she roll her eyes and told me to many people and not enough employees. That night the same waitress were in the lobby with another one trying to serve 20-30 customers who were there including us an she never got around to serve us (we took off again). We also notice that the room maid only broom the room, donâ€™t mop them at all, did not check the shower to see if shampoo or soap is needed, did the bed, change a few towel and if you run out of one size of towel good luck seeing that size again, make a few call for more towels and soap. The third day we sat in the hotel restaurant to have dinner, it took 15 minutes to serve us water and we never saw the waitress we just got up without being attended and left, nobody even notice and we went outside the property to eat (we went eating outside every night because of the bad service in the hotel restaurant). The last day we went to breakfast early to beat out the rush, we got our breakfast real fast but the eggs were under cook again we did no complain that time because we were tired of it, but this is a very expensive hotel for things like that to happen. And to complete our stay when it was time to leave they have two passenger vans to give rides for the ferry and airport one of them was without A/C and not working at all, so another 30 minutes waiting. This is a big beautiful hotel with great modern dÃ©cor and architecture, great rooms, great gym, but they are throwing it all to waste with real bad service even if the few employees they have working are real good people. This is supposed to be a top of the chart Hotel with a great service, cleanliness and food, the reality is that is a real expensive hotel with no employees to serve the customers bad service, bad breakfast, dirty and not organize. We overpaid for a bad long weekend. I wonâ€™t recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience but - unfortunately - it did not WOW me”
Reviews.Author: talula001
Reviews.Content: I am a bit puzzled about writing this review. First of all, let me tell you that I travel a lot (and like high end places) and I am a huge fan of the W brand. I had looked forward to my stay in the W Vieques, and I did have a very nice holiday. However, would I go again after having visited the resort ? Probably not, because I was not WOW-ed at all. First, the pros : - very clean resort grounds with a very nice pool area - nice, spacious and trendy rooms (as one would expect from a W hotel) - excellent and friendly staff - the outdoor campfire in front of the lobby is a nice touch All in all a very nice 4+ star hotel in my opinion. But, there were some contras : - no matter how nice the resort was, I did not have the feeling at all of being in the Caribbean. The vegetation on the resort is not lush at all (maybe it is still immature) and the 2 beaches - although taken well care of - are not your typical exotic dream beaches. In fact, you have to go to other side of the island to convince yourself that your are in a tropical hideaway. - the restaurant does encounter too many problems (we were there in November ; maybe things worked out since then). Service was too slow (and we are Europeans, so used to slow service), one evening they forgot the meal of my partner, the menu is too limited, and portions rather small. Food is very good (but not memorable). Of course, nothing stops you from eating in a restaurant outside the resort, but still, a hotel that claims to be 5 stars should have an excellent trouble-free restaurant. However, I am confident that the restaurant will be solved in the future. - what would really have added some extra value for me, would be the presence of some outdoor hottubes, so that one could take a dip after sunset (like most high end beach resorts have these days). Don't take me wrong. I loved my holiday. And I liked the resort. But I was simply not wow-ed as the W brand claims to do.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful vacation at the W!”
Reviews.Author: DC327
Reviews.Content: Our vacation at the W in Vieques was so amazing and relaxing. We have been to several islands and many luxury hotels and this place had such a wonderfully luxurious, but laid-back vibe that we loved. We would return in a second if we could. We stayed at the resort the first week of May, which apparently is a shoulder/off season, and therefore, thankfully missed many of the crowds that were there just a week or two prior. Maybe that helped to ensure we were better taken care of, because we had amazing service the entire trip. Some people who were particularly great were Imelda, Bree and Rodrigo at the front desk, Mari in the restaurant, a cute petite woman at the bar/living room in the evenings whose name has escaped me (apologies), Ricky, and the crew at Blackbeard Sports who helped us with our gear and diving needs. Others were very good, too, but we didnâ€™t always remember to get names. The grounds are beautiful and we loved the main pool. We had no wait at check-in and received a great tour of the property. Our room was spectacular (pretty sure thatâ€™s also what it was called) :) and overlooked the ocean and pool. It was very large, had a great balcony and that horse trough tub which was wonderful for a long soak. I loved all the little decorative hooks on the wall to hang your clothes, beach bags, etc.- very nice touch. I think my only small complaint was that we never seemed to have enough shower gel for all the showers we take on beach vacations-ha. Another nice touch is the free water (with citrus fruits) all over the property. We thought that most of the food was wonderful. Breakfasts were always great. We ordered the buffet once, but since we donâ€™t tend to eat so much in the morning, we started ordering off the menu and that was much better. Some of the best dishes are only available from the menu. Dinner there was also great both times we went- the specials, in particular, were always perfect. We also recommend going to dinner off-site- there are some really great restaurants on the island (which we found, of course, by reading the tripadvisor forums). We only did lunch a couple of times and they were pretty good- salads and sandwiches. Not too heavy which is great when by the pool. Oh- and the smoothies/shakes are great! The folks at reception were helpful in setting up our biobay tours and anything else for which we needed assistance (restaurant reservations, etc.) And everyone was so friendly. We really felt we had received great service the entire trip. Also, we always dig the music played at W Hotels and one expects that as part of their brand. Itâ€™s a hip, loungey feel and the Vieques resort seemed to also have an added island vibe to the music. It was perfect for us when laying by the pool or in the living room. But if that is not your scene, you may not enjoy it as much. But you should know that itâ€™s part of the W experience. We did yoga two mornings and really enjoyed it. The rest of the days we used the fitness center which met all of our workout needs (weights and cardio). We also had some spa time (massages and mani/pedi for me) and enjoyed all of it. Really great people in the spa- so friendly. As for the rest of Vieques, definitely try to rent a jeep/car! We read all the forum posts and got one for a few days. It made a great difference to be able to drive to the beautiful Caribbean beaches (particularly those little ones where barely anyone else is- so lovely), to tour the rest of the island, and be able to dine off the resort. Yes, you need to book the jeep very early- as soon as you book your stay. But itâ€™s definitely worth it for a few days. All in all, our Vieques trip was amazing. We are hooked on this little island and the W there and canâ€™t wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and bad food with a view”
Reviews.Author: seattlejs
Reviews.Content: We came for a wedding and while the pool area was nice, the food was mediocre and the drinks were way overprice! $13 for a rum punch, $20 for a mezze plate, etc. We ordered ceviche and it was rancid, so we sent it back. We paid $55 a person for a "fish fry" as the front desk explained it, but there was not fire or whole fish frying; just one piece of cuttle fish, three prawns and a 1x2 inch piece of overcook tuna. The sides were dry -- a guest choked on a piece of yucca! The food for the wedding was average, typical buffet quality. We had a room off the pool, our room was clean, but not consistently. The cleaning staff didn't take empty glasses on some days and on another took a half full corked bottle of wine (we had recorked it and set it aside by our nighstand). The staff was super nice though! Love love love the bartender at the pool! I'd like to see how this resort adapts once there is more competition.

Reviews.Title: “Total relaxation”
Reviews.Author: khd8286
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W from Tuesday - Friday of Holy Week. We arrived at the airport, were met by a van rather quickly, and arrived around 2:00. It had been a long day, and the wait to get to our room after check-in was quite long and I wished they had just let us walk there ourselves and not made us wait for the guided tour. However, the grounds are beautiful and the staff is accommodating and lovely. Our room was fine - we didn't have a view, but then again, it was quiet and close to everything. I do wish they had explained that we needed to put our room key into the charge outlet to get the electricity to come on because it was pretty dark! We headed to the pool as soon possible. It was busy that day, and it took awhile to get our food order at the bar, but it was so gorgeous outside that it was easy to be forgiving. We didn't rent a car, so we needed to take a taxi (not individual, but a publico) in the lobby to get to our dinner reservation. All went fine until we tried to get back and the driver never responded. It seems they have specific drivers that they call upon, though some people we spoke to had arranged their own transportation. If I were visiting more than a few days, I'd definitely rent a car so I could have visited many of the Caribbean beaches - apparently that needs to be done months in advance. After an hour wait, and 3 phone calls to the hotel, we made it back. but again, it's the island and it was warm and beautiful outside, and the wait wasn't so bad. The next morning we went to the cafe for coffee and pastries, (not realizing there was complimentary coffee in the main "living room" ). We spent much of the day on the beach, which we found to be great. Most people gravitated to the pools, and it seemed that they also plopped their beach towels on the most coveted floating lounge chairs quite early even if they were nowhere in sight, pretty tacky. There weren't many children there; I don't think I would want to have had young kids there - not a lot to do for them, and when they take over the pool, it is kind of annoying if you're there to relax. It was mid-week, so it wasn't as busy as it appears to have been on the week-end. Only once did we need to move our chairs to the end of the beach where there wasn't a speaker in our ears with the resounding bass so often complained about in reviews. We took a kayak out and also took advantage of the inner tubes. It was glorious to bob in the soft waves. The bar staff was great - as was the red sangria. We also enjoyed the solitude of the plunge pool. My favorite time was 7 a.m. once I knew I could grab some coffee and just sit and enjoy the quiet and the view of the ocean. We had a glitch with our biobay reservation, but the concierge was accommodating and made it right. I truly think they want to do the best for their guests, but sometimes island time and lack of resources may prevent that from happening 100%. When we were there, there was a gas shortage, and one of our publico drivers told us he had been up at 4 a.m. to get gas. I did find that different staff gave different advice, and that was confusing at times. But all in all, our stay was glorious. We ate at the breakfast buffet one day, no complaints there, and mostly just enjoyed the beauty of the island. We also took a public to Playa Caracas one day - the place was hopping as it was Holy Week and the locals were partying. It was great to witness the culture, maybe like coming to the states on the 4th of July. I do think they are reading these reviews, because there was a sunset "happy hour" with free cocktails from 6 - 6:30, and the music was only intrusive one time. Great weather, great locals, great views, great sleeping (comfy bed), great cocktails, extremely relaxing. All in all, a wonderful place. I'd return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, the best experience ever! the best RETREAT”
Reviews.Author: Barbararodz
Reviews.Content: Getting to Vieques will need some planning ahead, however once there you leave everything behind... the experience begings at the airport lounge with complimentary drinks and a concierge that will assist you with the transportation. While waiting for our transportation we met Bree (Guest Manager) we shared that it was my birthday weekend and we were looking forward to a relaxing and enjoyable time. Emilda was our front desk agent, great check-in experience asked questions to learn what was important to us. Bree came to the front desk and share with Emilda that it was my birthday, that evening a Happy Birthday chocolate cake came to our room, It was a very nice surprise and it showed their attention to detailed. We also got a personalized tour of the property and the same person took us to our room and explained all the room and resort amenities. This property is located on top of a hill with amazing views and beach access. It is not like any other resort, it is a place that will make you want to visit again and again, for sure if you are looking at a relaxing, romantic and very secluded place.

Reviews.Title: “not quite sure if the W stands for Wash”
Reviews.Author: poppaswife
Reviews.Content: ok so first let me say that we are cutting them a lil slack & grading them on a curve because it was a holiday weekend & the place was PACKED. Having said that we ran into some problems. we were able to check in early (great) we asked to be upgraded to a beach view(we would pay of course) we were told no, only to find out that another couple we flew in with was upgraded without asking.
