Duvet in room was dirty, toilet-dirty, faucets dirty with toothpaste, & lotion. DvD player broken, problem logging into w-fi. Went to bar was ignored by bartenter, waitress was nice enough to make our drinks (left her a big tip, & preceeed to deal with her for the most part for the rest of the stay). Waiter spilled a tray of Mimosas on my husband at breakfast (he was very sorry, but kept saying"what can I do to make it right" well if he doesn't know than who the heck does) he later compted us on two mimosas after careful consideration. 3 days in a row I ordered a tray of Happy Birthday cookies to be sent to the room in honor of my husbands birthday..finally rcvd them on the 3 day. Laundry was not picked up, had to call twice for that. Specifically told room service and front desk that I wanted my breakfast at 6:45 am SHARP as we were checking out early , breakfast arrived too late so I went to the airport hungry. Also due to a mix up at check out, our driver that was supposed to take us to the airport removed our luggage from the shuttle without telling us & just left us..so there was a last minute scramble for the hotel to provide us with trasportation to the airport. There were several other mishaps, but I'm exhausted. I will say that the W lounge @ the airport is STELLAR, most of the staff at the hotel were very kind, & polite. Just not equipt to handle any kind of problems at all, & rooms (once cleaned) & grounds (make it very relaxing) were nice, spa was FAB, & the view Outstanding. I think we will give them one more chance on a slower weekend, & see how it goes

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Relaxing Time”
Reviews.Author: OGgolfer
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Vieques for our kids spring break and some much needed r&r. Turned out to be one of the most amazing times we have had. The people were friendly the hotel was awesome and very relaxing. Food at the hotel was excellent, the service was a bit slow, but they made up in quality and pleasantness. Already planning our next trip out there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but limited dining options”
Reviews.Author: DRECG
Reviews.Content: This really was not a relaxing visit..sure its a lovely hotel and the beaches are beautiful. However, dining options in Vieques are limited,few restaurants seemto have heard of a childrens menu. The hotel restaurant was fine for breakfast and lunch...but slow. Dinner offered limited choices and was even slower. We waited an hour plus for our main courses(which were small). Our appetizer order was never put in. The dinner menu doesn't offer any kids choices but if you go back to your room you can order your child macaroni or a hot dog off the room service menu. The rooms were average, lacked storage space but were quiet and large.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: nonnagallagher
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews and did extensive research before going - and glad I did. Our trip was absolutely perfect in every way thanks to all the info I found on this site! About the W, we really enjoyed the property! The grounds are beautiful, the room was fantastic, and the staff simply outstanding! Because of some of the reviews I'd read about the music being too loud, I specifically requested a room away from the pool area. We ended up in one of the villas that overlooked the adult beach. It was perfect. I was a bit worried about the funky chair in the room being unusable based on some reviews I'd read, but I found it to be a great place to lounge and read a book after a sunny day on the beach! The only thing I would change was the chairs on the balcony - they were very uncomfortable. I finally pulled a big pillow off the funky chair and it made the balcony chair a little more comfortable. We only ate at Mix for breakfast. We avoided it for other meals due to the reviews here, however we did have a salad and a burger at the pool which comes from Mix, and it was quite good. The staff were fantastic...really wonderful people who worked very hard to please their guests. The Black Beard store had a great deal on a get-away kit - 2 beach chairs, 2 straw mats, an umbrella, and a cooler for $30. It was everything we needed to go to the beach. We did it for 4 days, and got a discount of $25 a day. One of the days we picked up some food at the W Cafe for our trip to the beach. It was good food - fine for going to the beach. It was convenient, but we found better food in Esperanza to take with us. The pool area was beautiful. We must have been on the island during a lull between spring break and easter because the pool and the beaches were never crowded. I do agree, however, with many of the reviewers here about the music at the pool. It's just unneccesary. I don't know why they pipe it in...I suppose it's to create a certain vibe, but really I think most people would prefer to listen to the ocean or their own preference of music on their iPods. My only negative really was something that was my fault. My husband and I thought it would be cool to do a couples massage. We made the reservation and I didn't even ask how much it would be. I figured it couldn't be much more than $80-90 per person. I usually pay $60-70 on cruises so figured it wouldn't be much more. BIG MISTAKE! The massage area was nice, it was relaxing although I've had much better massages elsewhere. But the real shock was when we checked out afterward...it was $300!!! That's about $150 per person...before tip. What an outrageous price for a sub-par massage. I should have known better...I know that resorts like this charge exorbitant prices for different things...I should have asked. Speaking of exorbitant...the bottles of water in the room are $6 a bottle - for a Fiji bottle - maybe 12 ounces! How ridiculous is that. But, like I said...that's pretty standard at resorts like this. I just don't know who would ever pay $6 for a bottle of crappy Fiji water. We went to the local grocery store and bought a 12-pack of Aquafina for $5.80. It lasted us nearly the week and then we just filled them up with the hotel water. All their water is filtered and tasted as good as Aquafina. So, overall - fantastic time. We are already discussing our next trip back. If we go just the two of us, we'll definitely stay at the W. We'd like to bring our near-adult kids - they'd love Vieques - but if we do that, we'll find more reasonable accomodations... Lastly, I'll add some non-W-specific info to this review. Don't miss the biobay...amazing. Get a jeep - it's the only way to explore and experience the island...truly I asked many locals where they like to eat several told us about a place on 997 maybe 1/2 mile past the hospital and firestation called El Resuelve. It was awesome...authentic PR food. It's not listed here on Tripadvisor, so thought I'd mention it here. Go to as many beaches as you can. They each have a different personality. You'll find the perfect one for you. If you're looking for nightlife - there is some to be had but only on the weekends. I'd say don't come to this island if that's what you're looking for, you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Dante_Pestano
Reviews.Content: The experience we've had with the W Vieques is simply amazing! When they say have a WOW experience, that's exactly what we had. Starting from the W Lounge at the Vieques airport where we were greeted with a W staff and after a long flight from JFK and transferring on to Cape Air in San Juan, the complimentary fruits, pastries, and beverages (non/alcoholic) along with the soothing lounge was just what we wanted to be greeted with. We were then picked up by a W SUV that took us to the gated W Villas! The palm trees and lush grounds were simply beautiful. We checked-in at around 9am and to our surprise our room was ready and we had already been upgraded to an oceanfront, swimming pool side villa. The W welcome ambassador gave us a tour of the place, and the first thing I saw was the private beaches and the gorgeous infinity pools overlooking one of the beaches. WOW! - I really felt like I was in paradise. Our room was huge with a king sized bed and a balcony - the view from the balcony was like a postcard. We stayed there for 5 days and each day was an amazing experience. The pool bar staff Monica, Billie or rather were fun and made amazing pina coladas! Bree the manager at the front desk was very accommodating and friendly. The staff at Mix on the beach gave the best service where our dining experience was one to remember. We didn't have a reservation and the place was fully booked because Alain Ducasse was there that night but the hostess made sure that we had a table. We had the 5 course taster and it was so delicious (the shrimp cocktail was so good, we had it each time we had dinner there). And yeah, the chef Alain Ducasse was standing right next to our table- very cool! Oh, and the Chakra spa was heaven! I got an hour massage by Karla (I think that's her name) and she was so good, I fell asleep after 10 minutes. After the massage, I was able to shower outside but it was totally private! I loved it!!!! There is also a gym on the property that offers yoga at 8am and 5pm. There's also the W Cafe next to the gym where you can buy pastries, coffee, cigarettes, etc. This was a good find because breakfast at Mix was $38 a person but coffee in the Living Room is free and the pastries at W Cafe is like $4. There are also two beaches: one is called Whisper Beach (Adults Only) and the other the beach for adults and kids. You can kayak on the beach but you have to go to Blackbeards (next to the gym) to get the ores - one hour is free! We rented a Jeep at Maritzas rental that the concierge arranged for us so we were able to explore the island on our own. But if you're not the adventurous type, the W has a van that takes guests daily to Caracas beach (Red beach) from 10:00 am - 4pm. You can also book the Biobay tour (Abe's Snorkling) at the concierge. This tour is amazing!!! If you don't do anything else outside of the W Retreat, please do the Biobay tour as it will totally blow your mind. The trip to Mosquito Bay (Biobay) is a little bumpy as the roads are not paved and very rocky but I think it's part of the adventure. We were sad to leave the W and Vieques. I'm going to miss the the beaches we visited especially the one beach where my partner and I were the only ones there when we visited -- an entire cove for ourselves! Oh, and there's also the Secret Beach or Pata Prieta - love this beach and the 5 fish that played with us all day! LOL. I already miss you W and Vieques but don't worry we're already planning on going back and experience you again in a couple of months!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.....worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: PDRICC
Reviews.Content: If you go to the W Retreat and Spa in Vieques and do not have a spectacular time, my guess is you would be impossible to please. Every detail is tended to, beginning with your arrival on the Island. You are greeted by a Welcome Ambassador in the W Lounge where a bar, beverages, and snacks are provided while you wait for your complimentary transportation to the Hotel. It is an impressive touch. We loved everything about Vieques. The island is serene and friendly. The locals are lovely. The beaches are secluded, tranquil and unlittered. The hotel exceeded every expectation. Definite assets--Bree at the front desk, Monica at Wet Bar, Cindy, Greg, Amy, and Gabriel at Mix on the Beach. The food is delicious and prices appropriately for a hotel of this caliber. Outstanding service. I wish I knew all the names of the people who accommodated us. The pools and grounds are gorgeous..meticulously maintained. We are already planning our trip back. We've only been home a few days and can't wait to get back. A few tips..... Do not miss the BioBay..you will regret it. It is amazing. We chose Abe's as our tour group. We went on the 930 pm outing. Fantastic. Also, we found a jeep to be essential. We wanted to explore the island and there are a lot of roads that are unpaved and have deep holes that resemble moon craters. I wouldnt begin to imagine how you would navigate the island by taxi or moped. Jeeps run about $80 a day. My advice is read up on the history of the island.. it is fascinating.....then get to your computer and book this trip. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Island relaxation, character & great beaches -minor glitches”
Reviews.Author: POPOJIJO
Reviews.Content: I also wanted to give you the short list of things that may be considered minor issues in our minds that came to our attention during our 4-5 days there that will hopefully be addressed before we return to your property in the future. Most would be not an issue at properties that were of a lesser class or cost, but since you hold that W experience to be at the top of the Starwood food chain, then they would be worth mentioning. (A) The pool "confusion" over where one can sit and one can not. We were asked (politely) to move our location at the pool on one day and saw that others were asked to if somebody had reserved (paid more for) a cabana and were promised the lounge chairs in front of it .. Awkward for staff and confusion for guests (Maybe RESERVED signs on chairs would help?) The Lap Pool was sometimes overtaken by folks swimming laps for a period of 30, 45 or 60 minutes yet other wanted to cool off and were not sure if they were allowed in this large pool ...those swimming laps continued forth and even bumped into people in their routines. (Maybe time allotments in the AM/PM for those who do this for more than 15 minutes,30 minutes?) (B) Complexity of room key and lighting . The person who took us to our room was not too clear about how the key worked and the locks on the doors. We ended up asking for help the first day to not only use the lights but also to lock / unlock the sliding door and the safe box. (Maybe a simple , detailed info card left in the room to go over these areas for guests would help?) (C) The DAYS events in the lobby... We wre not sure on occasion what ,when , where on the W Hotel events of the day. (Maybe a more visible board of those items?) (D) Dining room service by food staff. I do not have to tell you about this. I am sure it will only get better but waiting for coffee one morning for almost 30 minutes is not acceptable at ay hotel or resort, especially the W . (E) The rental car scenario is one that I know you are working on. I managed to procure one but had to call over 60 days in advance of our visit..and even then at Martineau outside the property I ended up with a larger Jeep than I certainly wanted and paid more money ($90 per day) than I pay in any major cvity in the US. I guess I am to be happy that I at least got a car? If I had been able to get a smaller Jeep, I would have been happier and actually saved over $100 in fees! (F) Lack of a Happy Hour? One of the things that appealed to Mary & I on Islands like ARUBA was the daily presence of a "happy hour" at the beach bar or at least one location on the property. Paying $13/$14 for a mixed drink all the time can be a little steep and often drives people to other locations and lounges "off property"..especially those that put the bulk of their cost into the travel/ the room/ the car/et Even with the above items, we both found the staff, the quality of the food and the architecture of both our room and the property to be First Class all the way. It is a beautiful place and a wonderful island. We will strongly consider a return visit to Viequez and to the W when the opportunity presents itself. We wish you and the staff , especially Robert at the pool bar, a wonderful season and hope that we see you again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding hotel! Would come back every time!”
Reviews.Author: Switzerland007
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review in the hotel room while staying from April 2nd to April 7 for 5 nights. The hotel is outstanding and really worth to go. I traveled from New York City to San Juan and from there another 20 min. by Airplane (Cape Air) to this little beauty island. Outstanding Food (Alain Ducasse) and outstanding Hotel, pool, etc. Just amazing. I can definitely say that this hotel is worth every penny you spend here. In the highly priced resort fee is Internet included. Try to buy your Red Bulls at the W Cafe for 3.-- instead of 5.-- in your minibar and the water is overpriced. But you get it for free in almost every hotel public room as you drink over there. The pictures on the W Hotels Internet homepage are looking exactly as it does in real!

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever”
Reviews.Author: hpchicago
Reviews.Content: After numerous blunders by the hotel upon booking, being threatened by the front desk manager is not the best way to start a vacation but that is the way ours started at the W in Vieques. I will sum it up by saying the W is like Ikea. It looks good on the surface, but when you get down to the heart and soul of the place it is just a cheap imitation. Food was okay. Very American menu without much creativity and few vegetarian options. Service was slow and inconsistent. Usually one server for everyone at two pools. The two times we ordered from room service they got the order wrong. We waited over an hour for dinner on the patio with many apologies from the server. When it finally arrived our children wanted to go to sleep so most of the dinner was wasted. The amenities were mediocre for a hotel of that class. No washcloths in the hotel. The hair dryers were tiny and cheap. Pay-per-view was down the entire visit. The good things - The location was outstanding. Beautiful view, gorgeous pool and beach. The water - The hotel provides chilled water throughout the grounds flavored with lemons or melon etc. It is so nice to have a tasty option to bottled water. The truth is there is no other 4 star hotel that isn't adult-only on the island so you are left with few choices. In the end we had a nice vacation because the other guests were friendly and laid back. And the staff was friendly after you got past the front desk, but I wouldn't go back for more abuse from the disorganized management of the hotel. If they don't learn their lesson, I would predict the place will be closed in under two years.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Option for a More Secluded PR Resort”
Reviews.Author: LindsayBee1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for five nights after our destination wedding in the British Virgin Islands. Overall the resort is very nice but not one I'd return to time and time again when traveling to the Caribbean. For fellow SPG members- we got a great deal on the room and it's a nice option if you're looking for a more secluded Starwood property than those in San Juan and on the main island. We had an ocean view room in one of the buildings surrounding the pool; view was great and the room itself was very clean. The service was excellent and the staff was friendly and attentive. The major negative was out of their control, the weather. Hurricane Tomas came through a few days before our stay so our days were very cloudy and rainy. Our bio bay tour was canceled and we were unable to do a lot of the outdoor activities we were hoping to. The prices were also high, but not out of the realm of what you'd expect traveling to a Caribbean resort. Some suggestions: Grab dinner outside the resort. I am a picky eater to begin with but I found the food options to be boring and monotonous. The local restaurants are fabulous and no more than a 15-20 cab ride away. While there we ate at Trade Winds (Esperanza) and Conuco (Isabel Segunda), both of which were excellent. If you're looking for authentic Puerto Rican cuisine Conuco is a great option. We didn't make it to Coconuts or Next Course but several people also staying at the resort said they were very good. Rent a car for the day (or two) and visit the beaches. They are known to be some of the most beautiful in the Caribbean. We did this on our last day (after the bad weather ended) and visited Red Beach- it was stunning! Just watch out for all the wild horses; you will encounter plenty in your travels around the island. Get to the pool early for a coveted lounge chair in the water. These face the ocean, partially covered by umbrellas and are perfect for spending the day reading and drinking cocktails!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: Ajsaraf
Reviews.Content: The W is a place you go get away. My wife and I enjoyed everything about Vieques and the hotel from the dining, relaxing,and the little town of Esparnza. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: hms1vt
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, hope to go back next year. Enjoyed the quiet vacation with leisurely atmosphere. Great food on the Island and easy to take taxi to those locations. Concierge recommendations were right on, most have been mentioned on this site. Nice exercise facility and spa. We thought the room was functional and met our needs. The staff were pleasant. Easy to nitpick about this and that but overall, if you are looking for some peace and quiet to de-stress, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but a lot of noise pollution and some kinks to iron out”
Reviews.Author: alison2379
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Vieques for six nights in early February. We booked it using points, and had read the reviews on the site warning us of the inconsistencies to be expected, so we went in with eyes wide open. I think it's easier to list what was good, and what was not so good: What we liked: The property is beautiful. There are two beaches - one is adults only. Both were empty during our stay. Breakfast was excellent. They had a breakfast special daily that changed and was always made with the freshest ingredients and a lot of times had some local flair. I'm not a huge breakfast eater and it was definitely my favorite meal of the day. We liked our room - we booked an oceanfront Fabulous room - so we were on the second floor overlooking the adult beach. It was comfortable and well appointed. Rather than having to pay for every single drop of water you want to consume, there are water coolers around the property with fruits or citrus in them, and glasses. As someone who drinks a lot of water, this was a nice touch. The lounge in the airport is lovely, and can be used both upon arrival and departure. The W cafe provides a nice alternative when you just want a quick snack or meal on the go. The gym was very well appointed and clean. There was a great little shop where you could get beach chairs and towels to go on a day trip to some of the better beaches on the island. They set us up beautifully for a reasonable price with cold drinks, and a cooler. The spa was great - but probably could have used more seating for waiting in between treatments and relaxing. The island of Vieques itself is an untouched gem. It's a pity the W is the only big resort in town - I'd love to go back and stay somewhere else - there aren't a lot of other options though. I say this below, but RENT A CAR. You must book early to secure one - the day you book your trip is advisable. The concierge was great. We worked with two ladies who walked us through a map of the island with advice on where to go, what to see, where to eat. They were terrific. What we didn't like: The music. Or, as one could say, all the noise, noise, noise, noise, noise. I don't know if it is a W thing, but they have speakers around the property spaced at about every 5 feet playing trance music. You can't really find a quiet spot in the entire resort. It absolutely blew our minds that you're in a gorgeous setting with the waves crashing, and music is being piped in basically 18 hours a day. It's not super loud, but I just really prefer peace and quiet, and I know many of the guests felt similarly, as I was not the only guest that repeatedly asked for the music to be turned down or off. You can't sit by the pool without music. At these prices, turn down service should be a non-negotiable. It was available but you had to ask for it *every* single night. We had a room on the quiet side of the resort. I specifically requested this in advance. If you book a room that is close to the pool, I can't imagine how you could get a moment of peace without hearing the previously mentioned music that is always playing. With that said, there is one side of the resort that is quieter, and that is where we stayed. However, it was close enough to the lobby area that when the bar was open late, we could hear the base coming from the main building - and there happened to be an event that same night that was apparently offsite but at a volume level where they eventually had to call the police in. That's certainly not the resort's fault - but the noise level within the resort was definitely within their span of control, and it was just one more issue with the noise pollution issue. We did complain about our displeasure and the hotel did give us a "Whoops" credit which we did appreciate, so I did feel that we were listened to, but the overall issue remains and I can only imagine who is directing the music playing. The restaurant (only one for dinner) was fine. But just that. It's expensive and you'd think you'd be getting more at those prices and with big names attached to the meal. It was not memorable. The pool staff needs some serious coaching. They all have attitudes that should be found at a hotel that costs $99 a night on Miami Beach where you're just trying to save some cash. This is not a cheap hotel, and the pool staff was sloppy, kind of rude and neglected basic things like clearing of dishes, tidying of the pool area, etc. It just seemed like it was not being watched at all. The whole team needs to be retrained, if not replaced entirely. We had fun, and enjoyed our time there mostly because we were fully prepared for some issues based on these reviews and since we were paying with points, it wasn't money out of our pocket. I would have been much more unhappy had we been paying $700 a night. The foundation of a fabulous resort is there but I recommend management go stay in a better managed property for a few nights (try Parrot Cay, Turks & Caicos) and see what it really is all about when you have staff that works together and when you're creating an ambiance that caters to your guest and not some vision that an apparently singular individual is trying to create. The guest population was all old enough to not be that interested in a "scene" and I felt like that's what this hotel was trying to pretend it was.

Reviews.Title: “So Lovely and So Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: AndreaJ100
Reviews.Content: Loved the location. The grounds and shared amenities are beautiful. Service is spotty and varies from fabulous to offensive. There are rock stars like Katti and George; but more staff need training on the basics of customer care than don't. The rooms are fine. They look cool, but functionality is a bit off, like the flat bath tub and the washbasin which is designed so that when you wash your face, you get your feet too. Our shower curtain had a mouldy smell and hot water came and went. Meal orders take forever, and if you ask why, expect to get lectured on why you had no right to ask. Meal offerings at the W are limited so you really need to go off-site. Vieques though has great alternatives. The W beach is ok, but take transportation to Red Beach of one of the others. There are fab. beaches. Rent a car months in advance so you have freedom. If you wait to just before your trip, you will not get a rental. Don't recommend bike riding unless you have great death benefits.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the negativity! Vieques is great!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda111111
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this site 3 weeks before my trip and wanted to cancel and stay in San Juan. There was so much negativity about how bad the horse poop, bugs and beaches were that I was so bummed. However, I loved this vacation! The W is absolutely gorgeous. They spent $157 mil on a 2 year renovation and nothing was spared! Our room was the most the most aesthetically pleasing I have ever stayed in. It is ultra modern and so chic. I took pics of everything on the property for my own design needs to replicate. I am a fitness person and the gym they had was the best I have ever seen in a hotel! They have yoga at 8am and 5pm everyday as well. They have free snorkel gear and kayaks for guests. The W is very expensive (like $38 for weekday breakfast brunch buffet and $13 drinks) so I suggest you go to one of the little stores and buy snacks and liquor/beer and drinks. The fruit/veggie market is every Tuesday and Wednesday right down the road so you can get healthy items there but get there early! My favorite restaurants on the island are: El Quenepo, Coconuts in Isabel, Next Course, a truck on the side of the road on the way to the beaches called Sol Food has the best gourmet like, healthy food I have eaten out of a truck stand, Salads at Trade Winds (just beware of Dotty, the surly server, as she actually was the reason we never went back), Cafe Violeta for rustic out door breakfast dinning. The scuba diving is ok and the outfit we went with was Nan Sea Charters and they did a great job! Love those guys! The bio bay tour is a must! Such a unique experience. All the outfits are about the same so no preference here. No night life that we found on the island (but we weren't looking) except what is at the W. You must rent a car (and pay their outrageous prices) to thoroughly enjoy the island but they do have the publico that will come get you and take you wherever you want to go. I had to call 8 places about a month before my trip and there were only 2 with 1 car left. Soooo, make sure you can get a car before you even book your flight if that is something important to you (martiniques is right across the road from the W so logistically the easiest place to pick your car up). We used Coqui and they were great. They took us back to the W after we dropped the car off at the end. There is no need to get 4x4 as the island is flat and any off the beaten path beaches are reached by boat. Speaking of flights, Cape Air was a nightmare to fly. They just are too busy and have not got the kinks out. I will do another airline the next time I go back. The ferry is even worse from what we heard from the locals. The people on the island are so lovely! They come from everywhere and seem to just fall in love with the place and move there. The locals are nice and not unfriendly or surly as I have experienced in other Carribean Islands. There are no chain stores or restaurants-love it!!! I had a great vacation and will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil setting at a real trendy hotel...”
Reviews.Author: lesseidman
Reviews.Content: We spent sometime at The W Retreat and Spa on Vieques Island in Puerto Rico. I have to say that this was a luxurious, avant-garde hotel. We loved the 2 level infinity pool overlooking two beaches. We rented the cabana for a day (overlooking the pool) and it had a TV, refrigerator, as well as a sofa. Our room overlooked the ocean and had every possible amenity. The staff was available for every whim. We enjoyed the tranquil setting, two really nice beaches and the food preparation/quality was superb.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Fantastic Vacation Of Our Lives!”
Reviews.Author: MyBrokenJeep
Reviews.Content: The "Whatever, Whenever" montra for this resort was far exceeded in our opinion! Prior to travelling to Vieques, we read everything we could find from history of the island and the people to resort reviews both positive and negative. We arrived at the International Airport and opted to take the ferry to the island. We had the most wonderful driver, her name is Ilca (--), take us to the ferry launch. We had read that it was a very long and expensive ride... Our experience was that it was a delightful ride of about 45 minutes and was priced less than the cab fares we have paid in NYC. During the drive, Ilca gave us a lot of great history of the island and told us about some things that were "absolute must do's!" like the rain forest and old town San Juan. The ferry ride was great! For $2 each, we enjoyed what was a 45 minute ferry ride to Vieques. Enrique, from the W, met us in Isabella II as soon as we arrived. He was fantastic! A smiling face and great conversationalist that told us about the W and things to do on the island. The short 15 minute ride to resort was nice. We were surprised to see all the wild horses roaming around on the island. When we arrived at The W, our "Ambassador" Luis, was fantastic! Our check-in took only a minute... Luis gave us a great tour of the resort and then took us to our "Spectacular" room that was overlooking the pool with a great view of the ocean! The pictures on the W website very accurately if not under estimate the beauty and comfort of the rooms and facilities. The taxi or shuttle service to Isabella and Esperanza was great! Inexpensive at only $10 each way... One day the taxi driver took us all the way to Blue Beach! An absolutely wonderful place for snorkeling and swimming! The sea life was absolutely beautiful! We rented a Jeep from Maritza's Car Rental. I highly recommend that you rent a Jeep and venture out to see the island. The island is small enough that you can really see it all! We went to the old Navy artillery bunkers, Green Beach, Blue Beach, Secret Beach, drove through the mangroves... and went to what became our favorite spot, Navia Beach! You will find that the ocean water on the Caribbean side of the island is much clearer and less choppy than the Atlantic side. We ate at a different restaurant each night. We loved the fun atmosphere at Duffy's, the fun at Lazy Jack's, the food at Trade Winds, lunch at Banana's, Pescadora at the W, etc. The only place we were not really impressed with was El Quenepo. We thought the food was way overpriced and was not really tasty. The Bio Bay is a must do! We did the bio bay experience with Abe's on the kayaks... Cruz and the guys did a fantastic tour! This is something that you MUST experience! Pictures do not turn out... we had an underwater camera and took lots of pictures but the pictures did not do the experience justice at all. If we would have had more time, we would have done this excursion twice. The Ambassador's at the W went far beyond our expectations! I wish I could remember all of their names... In most situations, we didn't even have to ask the questions... it's like they knew what we were thinking and always made the perfect recommendation! Jorge became a good friend to us while we were there... He treated us like family! He even made arrangements for us to go on a last minute gift and trinket buying excursion... Jorge is indeed a great Ambassador for not only the W but the for island of Vieques too. We made it a point to hang out for a little while each night at the fire pit. We met some wonderful people and had great conversation! The pools at the W were unbelieveable! The water was always the perfect temperature and we found the wait staff to be great! The private beaches were beautiful! The property was perfectly manicured and maintained! We will make the W at Vieques our annual vacation! We give this place a score of 20 out of 10!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite natural beauty, high European style, fabulous food, attentive service.”
Reviews.Author: mhb10023
Reviews.Content: The staff is still working out a few kinks, but get an A+ for effort. Everyone has gone out of their way to make our stay as absolutely perfect as it could be. The resorts is, simply, stunning. Thanks Omar, Christian, and all!

Reviews.Title: “paradise found!”
Reviews.Author: whYteH2O
Reviews.Content: There are so many reviews for this property so I'll keep mine short. We stayed for 10 days between February - March 2011 and everything was perfect. Room (Spectacular Villa) overlooked pool and ocean. There were always plenty of chairs on the beach and poolside - never had to wait or reserve them & there were plenty of towels. Bar service at the pool was fast and friendly (food was very good). Mix restaurant: breakfast - excellent; did not eat there for lunch; dinner - underwhelming. Living Room bar - great service and fun to hang out at night (we ate off the bar menu for many dinners - much better than Mix for dinner). Resort grounds were beautiful and well kept - amazing views. Hotel beach is OK but be sure to rent a car and see the other, much better, beaches. All the Talent (staff) were extremely helpful and polite - they helped make our stay very enjoyable. The spa was very good - got pedicures and haircut. Fire pit was fun at night. Ate "pescadora" on the beach twice - a must. Many other users commented about food/drinks being expensive - yes they are - mixed drinks were in the $12-15 range; breakfast at Mix was about $100/day for 2 people; lunch by the pool was usually $60/day for 2; and dinner at Mix was usually $150+ for 2. There are several much better options for eating out on Vieques that are less expensive if that is a concern. Overall, we had a great vacation at the W and will definitely return and recommend to friends and family. The pictures shown on the W website accurately portray the property - in fact we commented on how the pool area was reset with towels etc. each morning so it looked just like the pics. Things to do while on Vieques: Sail & snorkel on Marauder - great trip! Go to the beaches - Media Luna was a favorite. Bio Bay - clear bottom canoes were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a quiet and beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: LWM_2010
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel was great---great service, rooms, staff and pool area. It was a piece of tropical paradise. Staff lived up to their statement of "whatever, whenever"---extremely service oriented. We had a great time. It is a small and quiet resort--a perfect escape from our crazy lives. The beach is the only downfall (fairly rocky with a steep drop off and high/rough surf). Overall, a wonderful place to go and we will certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Miamitravels42
Reviews.Content: Been reading reviews from Trip Advisor for years...this is my first review. The W Vieques wa definitely a great place to stay...and would stay there again. Understand that some reviews knock the place for the charges, but you are staying in a luxurious resort with an awesome staff! Recommend you don't try to rationalize the $65 resort fee (because of course you are not getting anything special for that fee), just think of it as a part of the overall fee of the room. And if you don't want to drink the $9 bottle of water in the room...go to the market and buy a few to bring back. The resort can be private and exclusive if that's what you want or very lively and entertaining. Also, highly recommend renting a vehicle to explore the island...lots of great sights and beaches to see! Bottom line it's a beautiful resort and we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Be in the 25-39 demographic, or suffer”
Reviews.Author: Getitright212
Reviews.Content: If you don't love endless unavoidable LOUD Latino/Brazilian/techno/clubs atmosphere music, best avoid this hotel. There is only one escape, "whisper beach", otherwise The music is non stop from morning to 10 PM, EVERYWHERE. Staff tries hard, but falls short. A broken sprinkler at the entry path to our room meant navigating mud flats to get in. We asked it to be fixed every day or shut off, but it never was. I could never return to this hotel. 25-39's seemed happy.

Reviews.Title: “Made to Feel Like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: WanderLust42001
Reviews.Content: There are so many things I could mention that I loved about this resort, but on the top of my list is the level of service. The staff is extraordinary in their "can do" and "anything for you" attitude. I never felt for a second that the service and friendliness we experienced was forced or anything but genuine. This exceptional level of service is very rare these days. At one point my wife asked if they had an elastic band for pulling her hair back in a ponytail and while they did not, they offered to leave the resort to purchase one and return. Also, we had to rely upon public cars (taxi) to get around the island and were given the resort number and told to call if we ever needed anything - we felt comfortable exploring because knew that the W staff was behind us and we would never get stuck or left somewhere on the island unable to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautify hotel overall great experience”
Reviews.Author: travelchic083
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was beautiful- the open areas and common rooms are wonderfully designed and I loved the aesthetic and vibe. The food at mix, the restaurant, was good but not as good as I would have expected considering 1) the celebrity chef factor and 2) the extremely high prices. The rooms were very nice (we had a spectacular room, the more base level rooms are on the ground floor by the pool so don't offer much privacy). Our view of the ocean was great and the soaking tub and shower were very nice as well. We did visit the spa, and got a very nice couples massage, including private outdoor shower with ocean views. Definitely need to book spa reservations way in advance because they were extremely busy. One thing to keep in mind when coming here to vacation is that the beach at the W is not on the caribbean side, so the beah sin't as picture perfect white sand turquoise water that you would expect. That said, the caribbean side beaches are only about a ten minute drive away. Overall I would definitely go back to this hotel- totally fit the bill for modern and luxurious hotel in stunning natural setting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Patrick121
Reviews.Content: I just completed a stay (for pleasure) at the W Vieques and this place is wonderful. I typically stay at high end resorts for vacation so have plenty of experience, especially with Starwood properties. The W is a beautiful property and expertly staffed. The resort is on the north shore, so it tends to be windier than the south shore, but there is something to be said for chair side service. Both beaches are beautiful and one of them is children free (and incidentally clothing optional though all were appropriately clothed while we were there). Keep in mind it's a new property and since there is a maturity curve to any hotel, I'd ignore any negative reviews before fall 2010. Some of the reviews about staff surliness point more towards the reviewer as I found everybody (W staff and islanders) to be incredibly friendly and this is true for all of Puerto Rico. We had a minor glitch with dinner as two of the entrees were not available, but that is common on a small island and the food we got was great. We didn't plan early enough to get a car (think July for a February stay), but didn't miss it at all. In talking to other guests with cars, I don't think it is imperative. The hotel runs inexpensive shuttles to some of the better beaches (Red Beach for one) and a cab into Esperanza is $10/person roundtrip. There are also decent bikes available for rental ($35 daily or $10/hour) and since the island is so small it's easy enough to ride around. Absolutely do the bio bay tour. We used Vieques Adventure Company (booked through the hotel the day before). They are the only operator with clear kayaks and that alone makes it worth while. It is an amazing sight and VAC is the best operator to take you there. Overall, I would give the W an eight or nine out of 10. In looking back though some of the reviews, I think that some people would not be happy anywhere. My wife and I loved this place and would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location.”
Reviews.Author: Tamarindo00738
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with a couple of friends. We had a good time the location is beautiful just in front of the beach and we even had a small pool right in front of our room! The staff was very friendly ... But service at the pool should better and faster... We ate at the lobby bar and the food was not something out this world but it was the only rest. Open at the hotel. Anyways I want come with my boyfriend. The place is very relaxing and romantic. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Perfectly fits my Personal Aesthetic”
Reviews.Author: SavvySeattleTraveler
Reviews.Content: I like to sit and ruminate on places I have stayed before taking the time to review them. The W Vieques is one of the most stunningly designed hotels I have ever stayed. Designer Patricia Urquiola has a sense of humor as well as respect for the locals. All the art in the hotel "living room" was done by local artists and it's a great place to spend some time reading books, playing games and having a cocktail. The rooms themselves seem to vary greatly. We were lucky to have a king room in the area by the pool (and on the corner even) and the room fantastic. Comfortable, functional and also with a great sense of humor. Hide the TV behind sliding doors and take a bath in a tub designed to look like an old horse drinking trough (again, a nod to the local culture) and sleep behind the netting around the bed. Very comfortable room. The pools are also spectacular and well designed. Prepare to get up early and stake out a spot as they fill up quickly. The food poolside is also really great and maybe the most affordable place to eat on the property. The food at the Alaine Ducasse restaurant was fantastic. We arrived on Thanksgiving and had a fairly traditional turkey dinner but above and beyond anything we expected. The food was memorable to say the least. Now, a few of the bad. Sometimes poolside they don't remember that this is supposed to be a "retreat". The music is loud and often runs into the night (even when there is no one at the pool). We called each time and got different responses but most of the time they came and turned it off. Also, and nothing against kids, but the "retreat" part can be spoiled a bit by kids running around yelling and splashing while their parents drink and pay no attention. Teens throwing the football in the pool isn't really what we signed up for (again, "retreat" means quite to me. Lastly, the "resort fee" of $60 a day seems a little outrageous. Now, we took full advantage of it (snorkel gear, umbrella, kayaking in the morning with Mark, who was awesome) but if you arent active, it's seems steep and was something I heard lots of guests complaining about. All being said, would I go back? In a heartbeat. There is way too much good to outweigh any of the small issues. Dont just stay on the property, get out and see Vieques. Great beaches, hole in the wall food stops and wild horses. Get there before the charm of the island is lost when it becomes a full time tourist destination.

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing, sooo relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: Coho115
Reviews.Content: We booked our Vieques trip several months ago and to be honest, I was a little nervous after reading the reviews. I'm so glad I decided to see for myself--the W Vieques is spectacular. We are seasoned vacationers with high expectations and we were not disappointed. We were met at the airport by a W representative, who collected our luggage while we relaxed in the W lounge. As Starwood Preferred Guests, we were upgraded to a beautiful suite upon check-in. (The decor is definitely modern-bohemian; if you are looking for something more traditional Caribbean, this might not be your thing.) The grounds are gorgeous, with breathtaking views of the Atlantic, Puerto Rico and Culebra. The beaches are nice but the surf is a little rough. The double pools are spacious and the temperature is perfect. The one annoyance was that lunch service by the pool was very slow, but everyone was so kind it was hard to be angry. The gym was spotless, with top-of-the-line equipment, and yoga is offered every morning and evening. The concierge staff was great with planning our snorkel/sail, bio bay tour and dinners each night. The Alain Ducasse restaurant was very good, but there are great (dare I say better) restaurants in the quaint Caribbean-side town of Esperanza. The island itself is beautiful, untouched and as yet unspoiled by tourism. From our conversations with residents, they are doing all they can to keep it this way. Wild horses roam like squirrels and the multiple Caribbean beaches are perfect powder-soft crescents with warm turquoise water. Not to be missed: -Bioluminescent bay tour -Caribbean beaches (W runs a shuttle daily to Red Beach) -snorkel trip w/ Sail Vieques -Dinner in Esperanza (El Quenepo and Next Course were amazing. Tradewinds was great on Paella Night). -Happy hour sunset at Duffy's or Bananas in Esperanza Don't overpack--everything is casual. Relax & enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Escape”
Reviews.Author: jkamens
Reviews.Content: Utterly fabulous. Go! The ambiance of the entire grounds echoes relaxation everywhere, from the light jazz music, front porch swings, low lighting, hammocks & welcoming "beds" in the lobby, the deck - everywhere, to the fire pit and the attitude of the staff, the W Retreat & Spa is casual luxury at its finest. My husband & I vacationed with our 20 year old twin daughters & our son who is 21 and we all adored the place. Dine wherever you feel like it! We ordered as we sat around the fire pit & moseyed over to a few sofa's & dined living room-style, kicked back with our feet tucked beneath us or stretched out on the sofas. Casual was the theme with comfort the number one goal. The rooms are huge and utterly fabulous. We had 2 rooms with 2 queens. Love the decor & style which is as laid back as the rest of the place. Largest rooms I've experienced in my travels - we've stayed at several hotels from Starhot's luxury collection and the W is my favorite - completely non-pretentious. The gym is the best offering I've ever seen at a hotel - which is not what the W Vieques is. This is not a hotel, it's a huge, lovely complex. The beaches are not large, so if you're expecting long strolls looking for seashells you will be disappointed. The pool area is fabulous and not at all crowded when we went. Make sure you find the black stone whirlpool - it's on the grounds away from the pool area. We saw several iguanas in the trees as we walked the grounds. Wild horses are everywhere and lovely to hear in the fields. Be sure to try the cappuccino in the cafe - it's as good as the one's I've had in Italy and the Panini's are pretty good too. Libations? The drink menu is a little pricey, but you get what you pay for! While not a fan of Puerto Rico in general, I would come back to the W for a perfect escape.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely spot”
Reviews.Author: mrintdsgn
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful hotel. Amenities areexcellent. Nice beaches, pools, spa, restaurant. Service is super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Relaxing Property...Service Issues Continue”
Reviews.Author: DC79
Reviews.Content: The W property is amazing: immaculate grounds seemingly built to induce relaxation from even the most high strung east coasters. The room was spacious, modern, and comfortable. The drinks were fabulous and Mix was decent. The main issue was the staff. Training needs to occur if this hotel is going to be the retreat it claims to be. Staff are indifferent, uninformed, and in some cases, unhelpful. Do your research before you go and you will have a great time; even if you do have to call for your bags to be picked up three times and ask about the airport shuttle four times...but for Vieques this is still the best bet.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT believe the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: renick
Reviews.Content: My wife described it best upon arrival at the resort. "This is my Fantasy Island". From beginning to end we were not only attended to by the staff, we were pampered. The staff are so accommodating and genuinely "Whatever, Whenever". A negative reviewer commented on the disbelief that positive reviews contained so many names of the staff. That is the very soul of this resort. The staff interact with you genuinely. At first, I thought this was just training, however, it rapidly became evident that training only enhanced the individual beauty of each staff member we encountered. Jorge met us at the airport with "You're on vacaaaation", Angel and Efrain tended to our every need at breakfast and Robert the pool bartender deserves a special shout for his killer Sangria recipe. We learned that Angel graduated from the University of Iowa after attending on a baseball scholarship, Efrain is a boxer and Jorge is absolutely an ambassador for the island! As far as the quality of the food--never did we have anything less than a very tasty meal. The expense--no more than you would spend at a very nice restaurant at home. One glaring difference from the restaurant at home--the view of the ocean is breathtaking while having your breakfast. The resort grounds are beautiful, I think one of the reviewers commented on the unkempt nature. That is the nature of the resort, unkempt nature. The picture "illustrating" this was grass by the pool. This is not indicative of lack of maintenance, it is purposeful. The grounds are immaculate and are constantly being attended to by the staff. They even have automated lawn care by the wild horses that visit regularly. Both beaches are wonderful and have seating, towels and fresh water that are included in the resort fee. Speaking of the resort fee, it is an irritant, however, when considering the value of the things that normally would be a la carte at other resorts, even with a resort fee, it is a very minor irritant. The pools are great, it is generally 85 degrees outside, they really don't need heating and the music underwater is a nice touch. The lighting at night is appropriate, allow your eyes time to adjust and no problems will be encountered. If the lights were brighter away from the Greathouse, it would be distracting from the "Retreat" aspect of the resort. Oh, the loud music? Turn it up! The music was NOT loud, it was very volume and area appropriate. I really do not get the negative reviews of this place. I have followed this W from pre-construction (rebranding really) and anxiously anticipated my stay there. My expectations were exceeded in every way. I cannot wait to get back to "Fantasy Island"! Be sure to meet Jorge. He will tell you all about the island and point you in the right direction. He is an absolute wealth of information about Vieques. My advice to all. Hurry to the W Vieques and go on vacaaaaation!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent retreat”
Reviews.Author: sdeadulus
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with attentive friendly staff. Even though it was full, it was not crowded. The food was very good. We did have high surf and it was chillier than usual. The pools should have been heated a little more. Once the kids realized that this was not an MTV spring break type of hotel, they got into the mood. Difficult to get there, but by the end, we were all relaxed and needed one more day. The spa staff were friendly and I had an excellent haircut and facial. I think this would make an excellent romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I never had to leave- Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: capeandislandsgirl
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to visiting Vieques, I have always wanted to. I was a little nervous with some of the reviews of the W I read online, fortunately, I disagreed with most of the negativity regarding this property. This hotel is amazing! First, you land at the airport at the cushy W lounge, we were whisked off to the property immediately. The first view of the lobby is breathtaking. It is absolutely gorgeous, clean, and whimsical. Check in was quick and efficient. Our room was beautiful with a full view of the ocean and the pools. Food at Mix is pricey, but very good (EXCELLENT service). There is a cafe where you can grab a sandwich or a snack. Wet at the pool has a great lunch menu with awesome salads and sandwiches (I would highly recommend the shrimp wrap and the chicken cobb salad). When lounging at the pool or at the beach, there is always waitstaff checking in on you and delivering delicious tropical cocktails-the Sangrias were top notch. There are plenty of awesome restaurants on the Island-Il Quenepo, Coconuts, and Next Course are great spots for a really great dinner-you can easily get to and from these spots by taxi. Pina and Letty were delightful and more than happy to pick you up and drop you off whenever, wherever. When you return to the hotel after dinner, guests congregate around the fire pit overlooking the ocean for cocktails. Great conversation all around! The hotel staff was extremely accomodating. The set up our bio bay tours, car rental, airport transfers, and all of our taxi service in a very timely matter. The beach here was very calm for our first two days, I picked up one of the innertubes on the beach and floated for hours in the afternoon. The pools are immaculately clean and beautiful. It's so relaxing in the afternoons to lounge on one of the chairs built into the pool. Other beaches you must see on the island- blue beach, red beach, and Sun Bay. You should arrange a rental car in advance! The downtown area of Esperanza is a blast-great bars right on the water (I suggest Duffy's)-close to beaches, and great people watching for sure. I would highly recommend the W Vieques-overall, it was one of the most beautiful properties I have ever stayed at, and except for some slight staff miscommunication (minor), the hotel was a great experience. Shop around for rates and GO!

Reviews.Title: “I expected more from a W”
Reviews.Author: Joeyavidtraveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms and the hotel itself are nice looking, although the interior looks pretty IKEA-ish. That is contemporary, but not expensive. The pool looks cool, but is not very big and not very practical. The beach is very nice and secluded, but very small. The water and sand are very similar to Puerto Vallarta, blue and fairly clear water with heavy grainy brown sand with lots of rocks. The food was pretty disappointing. The prices are outrageous and the menu itself was nothing special. One especially disappointing thing about all of the menus are the desserts. Or, the lack thereof. They only have ice cream and sorbet. I hope they're not trying to cut corners by not hiring a pastry chef. One standout was the front desk/guest relations manager, Henry. He made sure the staff went the extra mile to ensure the service was excellent. And without him there the customer service was good, but not memorable. Other than Mosquito Bay and the bar there is not much to do at night. You're much better off staying in San Juan and staying in a Four Seasons or Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “W-Vieques - Love the Resort, Not So Much Vieque”
Reviews.Author: BOLDMissionHills_KS
Reviews.Content: We just completed a five night stay at the W Hotel Resort in Vieques, Puerto Rico. As platinum Starwood members, we were very excited to try this new resort. Overall, we were very pleased and recommend this Starwood property for the following reasons: W Plus Reasons- From the moment the W staff greets you at the Vieques airport, you know you're going to adore this hotel. You'll love the free shuttle service to and from the hotel and airport lounge. The W lounge offers free alcoholic drinks, free snacks, and a trendy atmosphere to set the mood for your stay. When you arrive at the hotel you are greeted by staff in a lobby that exudes the W style. You are provided a tour of the resort which includes a viewing of their spectacular pools. Afterwards we were taken to our wonderful upgraded room (Building # 3) which had an ocean view and quiet setting. If you're looking to listen to the ocean rather than hip pool music, request Buildings 1-4. Our room was well appointed and decorated trendy. We loved the open design bathroom which had a great walk-in shower and unique tub (friends or families sharing space may not). We loved spending time in the W Living Room (lobby area). From the free morning coffee to the free sunset happy hour drink, the setting and view were picture perfect. We actually preferred having dinner in Living Room rather than the very expensive Mix on the Beach. Our $17 hamburger and fries was a good alternative to the $200 plus dinner at the Mix. The two private beaches are great for relaxation (adult or family choices). If you're looking to more safely snorkel or swim in the ocean, you should leave the property for better options. The outdoor music volume around the resort is not really a problem as others have mentioned. It's a great feature. We loved the pool table and special TV room in the Living Room. The $65.40 resort fee seems a bit high at first, but once you realized all that it covered, we were "OK" with the charge. I am pleased to say the W crowd is diverse and a great mix of guest. It was very nice to see guests from all walks of life (age, culture, race, and sexual orientation) enjoying the resort. The following are comments for W Vieques management: Service- We found ourselves waiting long periods of time for service which is an indication of either understaffing or poorly managed employees. In addition, many employees lacked the basics of good customer service. Many employees were not knowledgable about the island "things to do" and could not talk from first hand experience. Mix on the Beach- This restaurant has great potential but is lacking something special. A creation of a "unique" atmosphere and a better menu with reasonable pricing might help get people in the door. The restaurant was sparsely populated during the majority of our stay. Consider adding things that would help separate the high-end dining from the regular outdoor living room area. A decorative screen between the lounge area and the dining area, using white table cloths, installing more outdoor landscape scenery and ocean lighting, and other decorative accents that would make you feel like you are getting more value for your dollars spent. Inside and Outside Lighting- The property is gorgeous, however, when the sun goes down the outdoor lighting is so dim you could actually hurt yourself. The guest room lighting also makes reading a difficult feat day or night. Spend a few bucks to replace the solar outdoor lighting (we assume this maybe a "Green" status requirement) and add a few reading lights to each room. On Site Car Rental Service- Consider having your own car rental agency on site. The options in town were seedy and difficult to work with. Guest Hints- Take a small plane rather than the public ferry to and from Vieques. Rent a car during your stay to explore the island for a few days. Skip eating dinner at the Mix and eat at El Quenepo (outstanding food-the best on the island), Next Course, and Sol Food (only open for lunch). Plan a few excursions like the Bio-bay (we preferred the pontoon boat rather than the kayaks) and horseback riding (choose the Esperanza Riding Company with Elizabeth over Seagate). Buy your own alcohol at the local grocery store and save a few bucks. Enjoy the morning yoga class and great gym. Spend lots of your non-sun time in the Living Room relaxing and socializing. Visit the ocean point by Building #1 to enjoy a few sunsets. If you're going to spend a day at the beach away from the hotel, choose Red Beach. Not Loving Vieques - The island of Vieques is not the prettiest island. Compared to St. John or Kauai Hawaii, it's a bit of a disappointment. The island has a local government and resident population that is resisting improvements needed to take this island to the next step. Most buildings are in a state of disrepair, roads are inadequate for two way traffic, there is problem with locals dumping trash just about anywhere, and crime is a big problem. These issues and more will have to be addressed if the type of guest that patronizes the W will pay this resort a return visit. Bottom line ...... we loved the W Vieques. It is one of the most relaxing and well appointed Starwood resorts we have visited. With a few minor modifications the resort could be one of the best in the Carribean. If you're looking for a first class oceanfront resort and don't want to leave it during your vacation, this is the place for you. However, the island of Vieques isn't a good pairing for the typical W hotel guest and will make you think twice about returning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: ansb10
Reviews.Content: We were apprehensive about this trip because of all the mixed reviews, but ended up loving the W and Vieques. We did get a great deal (70% off!) and felt it was worth it, maybe some of the bad reviews are from those who paid the rack rate and felt that it wasn't. When you land in the airport, the lounge is a great start. There was hardly a wait for a shuttle, and the hotel grounds are beautiful. At first it seemed huge and we were concerned about the walk, but the distance wasn't bad at all. At night it does get very dark and difficult to navigate, but I think that's partially to reduce light pollution in the area for the Biobay. I would recommend getting your bearings in daylight first. Our room was huge and very clean. Housekeeping came every day while we were out and reloaded our Bliss products, folded and put away clothes, etc. We ate in the restaurant, pool and the bar, and thought the food was good, if not amazing. Things were pricey but we had expected and planned for that beforehand â€“ most of the time we went out to eat in Esperanza or Isabel 2. You absolutely should reserve a car in advance. The hotel beach is pretty, but a little rough, and the pool is great but after one day I could see it getting boring. The music in the pool area didn't bother us at all, we liked it a lot actually. But our room was quiet and set further back, there were rooms that were right on the pool so not sure if they had to listen to the music all night long. The beaches on the south side of the island are amazing. We didn't rent the chair/umbrella/snorkel package, but you can take as many free beach towels as you like every day if you are going exploring. We found the front desk and all the staff wonderful. I can see why Vieques as a destination gets such mixed reviews â€“ it has some beautiful areas but not very many amenities (besides the beautiful beaches). There are very few places to buy anything, only two or three grocery stores, two gas stations, etc. The roads are winding and narrow, and there are no traffic lights. The grocery stores all sell alcohol, so we bought cheaper drinks and snacks and loaded our minifridge with them. We loved it, the locals we met were so friendly and helpful, and it was nice to have all the amenities of W when you wanted it, or the rustic island when you didn't. Plan ahead, rent a car, find affordable places to eat and water activities to do, and you'll have an excellent time.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre!”
Reviews.Author: nonstop99
Reviews.Content: I am sorry I spend my time and money going here. If it wasn't for the good weather, , and lots of tequila, I would have shot myself. The food is just OK, nothing to write home about. Alan D. should be ashame to have his name associated with the W there.The beach at the hotel is very small, and is on the Atlantic side of the island. So, the water isn't very clean and its a little rough swimming. You have to go to the other side of island for a beautiful beach, and the caribbean ocean( no bathrooms on these beaches). The spa was terrible. I have been to many destination spas, and the therapist were inexperienced, and definately not worth the money. I had to call an outside therapist in the hotel to get a decent massage (Ingrid Berman). There is no jacuzz or steam room in the spa. The is no entertainment at night at the hotel, and you have to go into town for any life. If you like to shop, forget about it. There is hardly none there. IOn a positive note, the room were roomy, clean, and the lobby decor is nice. The staff are all very young , and were nice. I wound not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: grazilla
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely beautiful. We had a wonderful time, the pool, beaches and rooms were gorgeous. This is a very relaxing retreat. There is not much else on the island so if you are going to party, you would need to go into town to Esperanza. We took a sailing trip with snorkeling, see the concierge to set this up. Do not do this on your own, it just creates confusion with transportation and other amenities, and stay away from Captain Bill. He is crazy and not the safest. When he asks if you are a good swimmer, he is really asking if you are an olympian. When we were visiting there was a concert and art show, these were fun little extras. If you want to leave the resort you need to rent a Jeep. You need to do this weeks in advance. Also, pay the extra $ to have the jeep rental fill up with gas. If you do not, you will wait in a 2 hour line to get gas at one of two gas stations on the island. Do not be alarmed at the puddle jumper you need to take from the airport at San Juan. The planes are very small, but the scenery is gorgeous and takes all nerves out of the experience. It takes quite a bit of travel to get to Vieques, this is the only reason I gave it 4 stars, not 5. You are pretty exhausted when you arrive. It is important to remember that they are on island time. Nothing happens on time. Especially the airline to and from Vieques. We waited about 45 mins for our captain to come and take us back to San Juan. This can be especially frustrating when you need to catch a flight in San Juan back to the states. It was the same situation leaving San Juan to Vieques, we waited about an hour in the plane before take off. Very hot and stuffy! Again, this resort is a gem. The natural beauty of the island has not been commercialized and ruined. It is very raw and absolutely gorgeous. The people that live on the island are very friendly!!

Reviews.Title: “W is for WOW, WONDERFUL and WORTH the trip.”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_Frankish
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the Vieques Island and for the W Hotel. First off...yes it is pricey...but it is very true that "you get what you pay for". The pools, the beaches, the food...no complaints at all. When my wife and I stayed here, there were no kids. Although they do offer a small kids menu, it is obvious this is a place for mom and dad to get away alone. A little noisy at night though...the sound of the waves and the coqui frogs fill the air. The main pool area has a view of the Atlantic Ocean. For some reason, no one ever goes to an second "secret" pool only a three minute walk away. It can be yours for the day is seems. No matter where you are on the grounds, on the two ocean beaches or the pools, you are always by a phone to call for food and drink. The service, the pools...all 24 hour operations. , Rent a jeep and explore the island. (rental place right across the road from the W) and ask for towels to bring with you. It didn't seem that we had any request that they could not accomidate. There was a 60 dollar daily charge that went towards internet, kayak use etc;

Reviews.Title: “management is a kind of a disaster - but I kind of love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: adventurersnyc
Reviews.Content: Well - very mixed on this one - It begins with a well sorted arrival into their exclusive airport lounge - followed by a great tour of property - impressive and inspiring. Looks like such a great place you cant wait to get out of the shuttle van and go exploring - but following following these events is a kind of an amatuer hour service disaster - despite the beautiful setting, the service was kind of appalling. Let me begin with contrast of being charged $950/night for an ocean view room with some of the comical but mind-boggling quotes from the staff: $950 a night !! "Uhm ..You shouldn't be sitting here if you want food - it was New Yearâ€™s Eve last - no one is coming in today and itâ€™s just me. Try room service or wait til dinner?" (we were sitting in the lobby bar restaurant at 2pm) "Why does everyone drink such big cups, I donâ€™t have time to make another." -This at breakfast when the coffee urns and creamer/milk were empty for the tenth time - and I finally reported the problem. "But, I'm sure that this is what you ordered" this regarding dessert at the restaurant - we ordered two different desserts - there were two of us, but then they delivered three of the same dessert - 3 black forest cakes - 3 of them - and there were just two of us at the table. Trying to get it taken of the check was like explaining how to solve a Rubikâ€™s cube. â€œI know, Papi, but we can only handle a certain number of tables at a time â€“ we are short-staffedâ€� This when we tried twice to make reservations at the restaurant only to be told they were fully booked until 10:00 pm - but when arriving at 8:30 for drinks - the restaurant was full of open tables - but we were still not seated b/c the staff, not the restaurant, was at full capacity. If the W can only handle 8 tables during the highest occupancy time of the year, then - why open ? Why design at huge restaurant with seating for 70? - at least charge prices appropriate for a soft opening. I wonâ€™t even begin to discuss the ordering service scenario at the pool â€“ â€“ or mentioned that I paid $150 for a half-assed massage - but the worst of all was the concierge desk. Bottom line is that they were just ill-prepared. Itâ€™s peak holiday season â€“ itâ€™s like their super-bowl weekend - did any of these managers think ahead about increased guests requests?? As pleasant as the staff was - I have never heard the words â€œNoâ€� or â€œI am Sorryâ€� more than I heard it come from the mouths of these concierges,. No car rentals. No taxis. No availability on any outings. No I donâ€™t know that restaurant. No, I don't know how you would get to that restaurant. etc...I know it's an island and it has limitations - but Starwood Group is powerful - get a few company cars sent over guys for the holiday season - cmon!! Everything at this W seems to be designed to squeeze as much money from guests to make back opening hotel costs in the most rapid way possible. This is done in such overt ways (9 dollars for bottled water that at most luxury properties would be free, the absurd $60 'beach' fee, the noticeably small portions in the only restaurant guests can eat at - simply b/c with no car rentals â€“ there isnâ€™t a choice) This combined with almost surreal ineptitude in service, leaves one feeling not only angry but exploited. Not the best word of mouth for a new property. All of this could have been fine if we were at the Inn on the Blue Horizon for $350 a night. But if you charge St. Barts prices- you need to get a handle on service. Period. $950 a night - at any time of the year - means that guests are met in the lobby with drinks, that bottled water is complimentary - that the hotel has several cars at the disposal of guests to be driven to restaurants or excursions - and that there are simply a few well-trained extra servers on hand to handle that kind of occupancy. Itâ€™s Hospitality 101 - and Iâ€™m afraid the W has bombed in this area On the positive - the staff were all a very pleasant bunch â€“ really lovely. Inept but super nice. It just appears that they have no managers to train or supervise them. This is all so disconcerting considering the expectation one has of the W brand in combination with such an elegant well-designed property. Rooms are great. Beds ARE comfortable. Pools are great- food is better than expected. A nice diverse crowd of guests. Itâ€™s got the bones to be a fantastic place...so in the end I do have to recommend it as the best place to stay on the island - as I've stayed at three of the others...and this is the best. The location is fine actually and the beach is great - I went swimming every day - they must only close the beach on very windy days - the gym is great . The last thing to say- and I feel the most important thing to say - is to the reviewer who says that it needs to decide if it's a gay resort or a family place... Really? Why would it need to decide that? Surely it can be both. As a family man myself, there with my wife & kids - I will have to disagree that the clients were mostly gay. I was there on Jan 1 too, and there were maybe 5 or 6 gay couples - and in a hotel this size I think they were undoubtedly in the minority. But why does that even matter? Moreover, I can promise you that the gay couple we met were much nicer to my kids and more fun to hang out with than most of the other 'families' that we met. If you don't wish to encounter gays on your W holiday - probably best to plan your holiday at an Econo-lodge in northern Florida. Maybe the W should decide if it's an idiot-free property too?

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler99336
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W on Vieques from January 2 through January 9 for our honeymoon. It was truly everything I ever wanted in a honeymoon. The number one thing that stood out to us was the fantastic service. Everyone we encountered that worked for the W was friendly, professional, helpful, and most of them went beyond to make sure our stay was wonderful. We had fun visiting with different staff members, and they were very helpful when we had questions about Vieques. I honestly can't understand any of the complaints in other posts on here. Sure, not every little thing was perfect, it never can be. We had to call on our first day about a couple minor things with our room, and they were taken care of right away. We found the resort to be lovely, the food to be good, the drinks were delicious, and the whole atmosphere was very restful. There are several complaints on here about prices, but we knew about the resort fee when we booked our room, so you can't complain about that, and as for the price of food and drinks, I think that is pretty expected, especially at a pricey resort like the W. We definitely recommend going on the Bio Bay tour. It is amazing. We also enjoyed horseback riding, snorkeling (at the hotel beach), and shopping in Esperanza.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Grounds, Unbelievable Pool and Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: jlibor
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect and more from a W Resort from the moment you arrive at the airport lounge with a full complimentary bar with snacks while you wait for the staff to come and get you in the free shuttle to the resort. If you want to vacation on an island that doesn't feel like its been trampled on by a million tourists but still stay at a luxury resort then the W Vieques is the place to go. The staff is there when you need them but not constantly bugging you when you don't. The pool area is by far the best its so relaxing you won't believe it. They always have a great mix of house music playing poolside as well as in the pool itself. I've already booked the same week for next December and can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing Retreat”
Reviews.Author: TOBYTOBY311
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Retreat from December 29, 2010 thru January 8, 2011; it was very relaxing and fun. The W has a lounge at the airport to provide you with drinks and refreshments before transportating you to their property.
