The beauifully designed and expansive property fronts the Atlantic Ocean with two large lap pools along with smaller jetted pools on the property. Our full ocean view room was large and artsy decorated with a great patio. We loved the comfortable king bed, the large separate tub and shower. The entire staff at the facility (lobby, restaurant, cafe, living room (expansive lobby area), bar and pools were excellent. Access to the beach was steps away from the pool and our room. The dining room had great food, but the menu was limited. However, the property also had a cafe to purchase sandwiches and other snacks from morning to 5:00pm. We loved the expansive seating on the inside and patios (beach and pool views) with full service provided for food and drinks. We loved the pit fireplace that felt wonderful with the night tradewinds. We used the exercise facility that had great equipment and we also loved the yoga classes that were provided twice daily.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location but hotel management and restaurant need a BIG change”
Reviews.Author: vahoya
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W during the week of Jan 2nd. Our oceanview ground floor room was very comfortable, we did not encounter any problems with hot water or A/C. We did however, have issues with hotel staff. We were unable to rent a car in advance and upon our arrival inquired again about renting a car or scooter and we were told by hotel staff it would be impossible to do so because the island ran out of gas. On our last full day we gave up and decided to rent bicycles from the hotel (for an additional $70) in order to get ourselves to one of the off-site beaches by any means necessary. We went to the front desk to check on our route we noticed a small sign advertising a hotel shuttle to the beach ($12 per person) that had left an hour before, this was after we were informed the day before that hotel "only provides shuttles to the airport." The next day we recieved a message from a staff member proudly announcing they had found a scooter we could rent for the entire day, on the morning of our check out. Insult to injury. Another issue we had was being interrupted on more than one occasion by staff members coming to our room mistakenly. Once a staff member banged loudly on our glass door announcing he was there to check on a complaint about the hot water (we had no such issue) and the next morning another banged on our door frightening us VERY early in the morning to collect our luggage, except we weren't leaving for another day. We called the front desk to complain and received a most unsatisfactory response and barely apology. As for Mix the restaurant, do yourself and favor and don't go. Or alternatively, have your spouse/companion punch you in the stomach and then hand them $200. Totally agree that Alain Ducasse should remove his association or think about intervening immediately. Bottom line: Staff are mostly pleasant and nice just not very helpful. Small issues are far more tolerable when you aren't charged a small fortune for every last thing whether or not you use it($65 per day for tennis/parking??) For the outrageous prices here people expect and deserve to be treated better. We might return to Vieques someday but it probably won't be to the W, unless they make some major changes.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous grounds, top-rate staff, mediocre food.”
Reviews.Author: SunFlight
Reviews.Content: We had planned to rent a house on Vieques but our friends had to pull out so we traded in Points to stay at the W. If we had been paying the rack rate of $1,700 per night (!), my review may have been different. Our room was huge, with a lovely large deck. We were further back on the property, but had a great view of the beautifully landscaped grounds. The room was a little funny though; the living room had a lot of unusable space, seemed to have redesigned an earlier kitchenette. There was a large unusable entry way with no lights. They also were short on roll-aways, though they had tons of advance warning, it seems that they could have brought in some more, because they told us months in advance that there may be a problem with one for our 9yo. But we had a large lounger and they were very nice about bringing in bedding for it. We borrowed movies from the front desk twice and it was a nice bonus. Hooks - hello? There was one hook (inconveniently behind the bed-sized tub), and not a single hook or soap dish in our guest bathroom. We had to drape towels on the bathtub, or clump them on the back of the toilet. Maybe rich people have towel-boys to hold their towels for them? The pool area and Living Room were gorgeous, with huge sliding walls that opened onto the grounds, more seating, and the firepit; it was just wonderful. Although there was a shortage of pool chairs (the staff nicely raided even their own to try to supplement), and CRAZY people were getting into fights over them, and saving them starting early in the morning to use for one hour in the afternoon. There probably could have been more shade umbrellas. There was a beautiful smaller pool near our villa that was stunning at night. For all the fuss about the food and the chef, it wasn't that good. I had some scrambled eggs one morning that I really think used shelf-stabilized eggs, they had that taste of college cafeteria. We did love the Cubano sandwiches in the Living Room though. We went to two local restaurants that were great, and a fraction of the price, and there were a few other highly-rated ones we didn't make it to. You should ABSOLUTELY call as soon as you book in order to rent a car. There are some gorgeous beaches on the island, but the cabs won't go there because they're down dirt roads. So the beaches they will take you to are nice, but no where near the caliber of Blue beach, or Red beach. (we didn't have a car, and were very sad to miss some of the others). The hotel beaches are fine, but nothing special, and on the Atlantic (rather than Caribbean) side, so rougher and without the white sand). You MUST do the bio bay tour, and swim in it. There was a torrential downpour on our second day, and this was the real opening of the peak season for the hotel. The staff reacted fantastically, they devised games, found additional seating for the Living Room, and worked very long hours amusing everyone who were trapped inside. One annoying thing though was that when we arrived, they were advertising two video game rooms for the kids, and a movie room. This never materialized, and they didn't really have any explanation. Overall the rooms were lovely, the grounds beautiful, the staff incredible, the value marginal, the island very nice. As noted, there are lots of add-on fees - this isn't a cheap hotel. There were also a lot of privileged teenagers (this was xmas break) with a lot of attitude tormenting the staff. Off-topic slightly, make sure to give yourself extra layover time if you have to catch a flight home. Cape Air was laid back and running over an hour late, and we missed our weekly charter. It took us 3 days to get a different flight out of San Juan, and cost us $1,500. We're still waiting to hear from Cape Air if they'll do anything for us.

Reviews.Title: “Not a typical cheesy W”
Reviews.Author: 212explorer
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome. Its a smaller hotel that fits well into its surroundings on the beach. While modern/stylish its not obnoxiously cheesy like some Ws can tend to be. The pools and beach were great, but i'd definitely recommend renting a car to explore the beaches and restaurants on the south side of the island. The bio bay was one of the coolest things i've ever seen (do the kayak tour). Looks much nicer than the photos on the website too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property...Excellent Service...Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: gtrotter22
Reviews.Content: We fell in love with the W Vieques...great property, excellent service. We had a great trip. Service was at it's best, they take really good care of their guests. I disagree with many of the negative reviews posted on here. It's a great place just to relax, forget about what's back home, and spend quality time with your partner. Food lacks a bit, but again, because how much we were enjoying, we didn't really care about it. We went out for dinner one night at El Quenopo in Esperanza...and that was a great restaurant. Other than that, we relaxed by the pool on the beds everyday, had drinks and lunch there, and then had dinner at Mix or in the living room. Definitely recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beware. Overpriced, Wrong side of island, guests mostly gay couples”
Reviews.Author: dynaman
Reviews.Content: 1) Whether you have an issue or not staying at a mostly gay male resort, you should at least know when you book what the resort is. I believe they need to decide to be either an adult/gay friendly resort or a family resort. 2) Hotel is on windward side of island. We were there 5 days Dec 29-Jan 3. Beaches were closed each and every day. No water activities which we were charged for in hotel fee were available at any time. This is a $65.00 per day charge after they add tax on top of your room 3) Hotel has major problem with pool areas. Every day all chairs around both pools were taken by guests that were not even using them by 8am. Some were never used during the day, but you could not if you had not marked them early each morning. The hotel solution was for me to rent a cabana at an additinal 250.00 per day. This was in addition to the $65.00 we were already paying for something not available 4) New Years Eve party was a joke. Advertised as a dinner, music with a guest dj, dancing, it was actually burgers, fries, and someone playing music (techno) off their laptop. This was at an addittonal charge of $307.00 per couple. Advertised at $125.00 per person, but of course they added on 57.00 in tax, tip;, etc 5) Bedding in rooms is advertised as W Signature Bed, but I have stayed at enough W and Weston properties to know that is not what they have here. Since this was a Wyndom Property last year, it is my belief they put the W feather top and pillows on the old Wyndom beds. These are the worst beds I have ever experienced at ANY Sheraton property. I stayed at the Sheraton in Puerto Rico coming and going on this trip to the W in Vieques and it is very easy to tell the difference. 6) Part of the $65.00 per day charge is high speed internet. Do not expect high speed. It is slower than dial up and will drop your connection several times each time you use it. 7) I do want to compliment the employees at this resort. They have a great attitude and do not complain. They all realized the problems the management is having but are doing a great job taking care of the guests. 8) At the published rate of 609.31 per night for just a garden room before taxes and the 65.00 added room charge, this resort is highly overpriced for what they offer. Only one restuarant, two bars, and being on the windward side of the island, I would never chose to stay here again. They hotel is very nice, but too many major problems.

Reviews.Title: “Don't write a check your "rear" can't cash!”
Reviews.Author: AlohaShan
Reviews.Content: Let me start first by saying, my husband and I am world traveled and stay in everything from 6* to budget lodgings. I have worked in the industry and give allowances for things that can go wrong and am always very patient. We love everything from luxury to funky to rustic and don't travel with a lot of expectations. I also adore the Starwood brand and 99% of the time stay in Starwood hotels, but this W was "interesting" to say the least....the phrase we used to best describe our experience is "don't write a check your "rear" can't cash". Yes it's beautiful kind of Camp W, meets Bohemian Chic, the rooms are spacious (unusual for a W) and has a laid back atmosphere. The guests were an eclectic (though mainly pretentious) mix from 80 year olds to 5 year olds, families and alternative couples. The problem was the expectations that the W set with the Whatever Whenever slogan and the "Wish" telephone button. You throw that kind of bravado out there and you damn well expect it to be met. Our stay was the week of New Year's, the hotel was fully booked and woefully understaffed. It felt like a hotel that had only opened a week ago and just didn't seem to fit on an island where the horses roam wild in the streets. These are just "some" of the things we had to deal with during our stay. We would not stay here again nor would we recommend it to friends. There are other boutique lodgings in Esperanza or even a home rental we would consider next time. 1. Our room was not ready when we checked in at 5pm (check in is at 4pm), we were 2 drink tickets as a consolation but our room was not ready until 6:30pm. 2. The concierge was severely severely severely understaffed. Though we booked most of our own excursions, whenever we visited the concierge desk it was 3 people deep and everyone in front of us was complaining about some thing or another (dinner reservations screwed up, late car pick up, etcetera). 3. A reservation we made for an excursion with the concierge one evening was not made the following morning by the morning staff. It was only because we thought to check that we learned the reservation was not made and then concierge made the reservation while we waited. LUCKILY there was still space available considering it was a holiday week. 4. We had a room near the pool and could not sleep in with the door open to hear the ocean because the infernal awful "vibe" music started every single morning at 9:00am. That music should NOT start until at least 11:00am. Huge annoyance. 5. Some days the room was made up mid day. One day we came back at 5pm and the room had not been made yet. One day it was never made up at all. Some days there was evening turn down, other days there were not. On the days there was turn down sometimes chocolate was left, sometimes it was not, and one time they even removed chocolate from the room. Sometimes when the room was cleaned dirty glasses were not removed from the room. 6. We don't mind paying resort prices for cocktails but if you're going to charge $14 for a cocktail then fill the damn thing to the brim. Every single cocktail was short poured by 1/2" and was extremely weak. 7. Big lack of communication from hotel staff to guests - Front desk or "wish desk" didn't know what the menu was for the New Year's Eve Pool Party. There was never any communications about daily events, like the live evening music. Had we known about the entertainment, we may have stayed and spent our dollars at the resort rather than leaving the hotel and then coming back to walk into the middle of a full music show. There was no communication about the lunch BBQ at the pool, tiki grill at the cafe, nothing. 8. The W does not have a shuttle to take guests to various places on the island. Because of the lack of car rental availability on the island, the W should really employ their own shuttle vans to transport guests around the island (not just back and forth to the airport or to Red Beach). One that goes back and forth to the beaches until they close (2pm is too early for the last pick up from the beach). And one that goes back and forth to Esperanza, Isabele, etcetera similar to what the Starwood Vacation Ownership properties provide. 9. If you're a "coffee-er" you'll hate that there's no coffee maker in the room. There is complimentary coffee in the bar in the morning but when you wake up in the morning, you want coffee now, to enjoy on the balcony, not after you dress and stand in line with the masses. 10. Room service presentation was hit or miss. One night it was 3 stacked dishes on a tray with no extras (no rolls/butter with the salad) with no explanation/presentation by the waiter and 2 pepper shakers were brought instead of 1 salt. While the other in-room dining experience was full blown wonderful presentation with it all explained and beautiful presentation. 11. AC/electricity went out and all we got was a note, nothing for our troubles and the fact that our beverages in the mini frig got warm. 12. I recall seeing a note that said the resort fee of $60 would be waived yet we were charged for the resort fee. The whole concept of Whatever Whenever "your wish is our command" fails because the expectation they set was horribly not met. The only other item to note is this hotel is on the Atlantic side of the island, very windy and rough ocean.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay there for free.”
Reviews.Author: budgaboo
Reviews.Content: I realize sites like this suffer from negative bias. However, if I can save one person from going to the W Vieques it's worth violating my aversion to complaining. If you want to get away and go somewhere that isn't spoiled: Vieques has gorgeous beaches, and fresh spiny lobsters, cool people and no crime. However, hanging at the W you'll feel more like you're in their Lexington Avenue, NY flagship - WITHOUT the quality of service. You'll be on the rough Northern facing part of the island amongst the very people you went on vacation to leave behind amid a system that CANNOT DELIVER the level of service that 7 or 8 grand a week can buy. I would never waste a week there and I hope you don't! Best, J

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Jswan1963
Reviews.Content: The W is a beautiful, friendly guest-centered hotel. Even with tennis, pools, & a decent workout room there's not a lot to do. We were there for 3 days and the two beaches were closed all 3 days. The beaches on the Atlantic side of the island were too rough. I you can't go and do "ocean things" - kayaking, snorkeling, etc. - hanging at the pool is about the best you can do there. For what it costs to stay there - and eat and drink there - it's not a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - bad food, bad service, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zkempner
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a disaster. The food is not edible and the service is nice but completely incompetent. One day when it was raining, they were unable to find us an umbrella and all of the carts were out of charge. The rooms were beautiful, but lacked any sort of lighting. The television did not work the entire trip and the Internet, while advertised as high speed, was painfully slow. Restaurants are not accommodating to food wants and the concierge and front desk answer questions incorrectly that they do not know the answers to. Overall, I would never ever come back here and would not recommend that you do either.

Reviews.Title: “Casually elegant, modern, chic, and caribbean convenience....perfect W”
Reviews.Author: ChillaFromManilla
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying im a well traveled New Yorker...I'm tough on service and amenities, and can be quite hard to please at times. That said, I give this place Must Go Status if you are looking to chill in the caribbean in a chic but not pretentious atmosphere. Regarding some of the negative posts...I think they are likely just negative people in general.... From the moment you arrive at the W Airport Lounge you know that you're in good hands...warm greeting, cold adult beverages, chill music, snacks and plenty of comy furniture to sink into. Moving on...Once I arrived at the property the atmosphere was inviting, yet hip. The Front desk/Ambassadors quickly arranged for a brief tour and then off to the room, which was designed in W Fashion; all the bells and whistles...most comfortable bed ever. To our delight they hooked us up with a Great view of the pools and Ocean (Gracias Edison!). Food was quite good, probably best on the Island and inline with the prices of the other top tier restaurants in Vieques. Service was always great, even when busy they did things right. I must to give a shout out to our breakfast server Angie B, she was awesome..service with a HUGE SMILE. The property was stunning, two infinity pools (3rd secret one), two beaches, two tennis courts, fire pit, and many great places chill and watch sunsets. There was a slight hicup as can be expected anywhere in the caribben, and MGMT took care of it with class and professionalism. Jonathan Heath (GM) runs a smooth operation, is an asset to the Hotel and Island as a whole.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven”
Reviews.Author: hanleytina
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the W in Vieques. The management was so kind and personable. We stayed there 10 nights and wanted to stay forever. The manager Joe knew we were on our honeymoon and gave us a dinner at the restaurant and champagne in our room with chocolate covered strawberries on the house! Saying that the W is gorgeous in Vieques is an understatement. My husband and I can't wait to go back! Also, we were at the W during the Taste of the Carribean and it was a $100 a ticket to try top-chef's cuisines from all over the islands. It was amazing. If you can go to Vieques during this time, you will have a blast!

Reviews.Title: “The W was amazing! Be prepared for a unique experience.”
Reviews.Author: LaurenB_119
Reviews.Content: We loved the W Retreat & Spa on Vieques! Our stay was truly memorable made so by the staff and facilities at the resort. The negative reviews posted seemed to come from guest that are not aware of what W Hotels and Vieques are like. The W has taken a fresh modern approach to a hotel that is funky, fun and caters to a younger generation. It is NOT the Ritz Carlton but you will get every pennyâ€™s worth of your stay. Tips to maximize your stay. -Take advantage of free drinks from the full bar and snacks at the airport W lounge. It is truly a great way to start your vacation. -If you do not like loud music that plays almost all day, specifically request a room that is away from the main pool prior to arrival. If you are looking for a quite pool and beach make sure to go to the whisper beach or the circle pool. -There is excellent free coffee and tea in the living room every morning. Unless you want an espresso drink donâ€™t pay for it at the cafÃ©. -The cafÃ© offers pastries, yogurt, and sandwiches for a more affordable breakfast. There are a few grocery stores in town where we bought yogurt and cereal. You wont find much fresh fruit on the island. We walked to the farmers market that is on Tuesdayâ€™s and Wednesdayâ€™s from 8-3 and it is about a mile and a half from the W. Most of the produce is shipped in from the mainland. -Bring your own alcohol or buy it in town. The grocery stores have wonderful tropical juices that make great mixers. -Vieques Events magazine was a wealth of information and was in the hotel room. It listed daily events on the island, restaurant menus and general information. -The floating chairs at the pool were fabulous but go very quickly. Make sure to get to the pool early if you want one. -Snorkel gear and kayaks are free for use on the hotel beaches. -Alain Ducasse has done a wonderful job with the restaurant MIX on the beach. His French creations are delicious. We loved every bite of our two dinners at MIX. Greg was especially attentive and had an excellent knowledge of the food being served. -The Platinum amenity was either points, in room movie, or a W signature gift. Take the points. -Use the Whatever, Whenever option on the room phone if you need anything. They are very accommodating and respond quickly. -The hotel shuttle is really the only taxi on the island but was very convenient and we never waited long. - The spa was wonderful. I have visited spas all over the world and the W spa is one of my top five favorites. Each treatment room has a locker and an open air shower allowing you to fully enjoy the serenity of the spa without sharing a locker room with other guest. The relax package with 30 min body scrub, 30 minutes massage, and 30 minute facial was the perfect blissful ending to a great vacation. Minor flaws: -We had scheduled a bio bay tour for our last night with the concierge and were told to be in the lobby at 5:30 for the shuttle departure. We arrived at the lobby at 5:10 and checked in with the front desk that we would be waiting in the living room when the shuttle was ready. We did not hear from the front desk for a while so we checked back only to find out the shuttle had left and there was no way to make it to the bio bay in time. We were extremely disappointed to say the least and the front desk could only half way apologize. We then spoke to the concierge to see if there were any other tours we could try to make that night with no luck. Melissa was very sympathetic to our situation and compensated us very well for the inconvenience. -The largest down fall was the annoying and sometimes obnoxious other guests that demand things beyond reason and stake claim to all of the floating pool chairs and then never use them all at once. Vieques: Vieques is an extremely unique Caribbean island. Up until only a few years ago almost half of the island was owned by the United States Navy and was used as a proving ground for marines and sailors. Tourism was almost nonexistent because the Navy was frequently firing at the uninhabited half of the island. It is still getting used to visitors and is a little rougher around the edges. There are lots of horses that roam free on the island and they do leave droppings along the roads. The people of Vieques are vibrant and very passionate about their island. For us this made the vacation even more authentic and made us feel like we were in a foreign country with an oasis at the W.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “The Only Wow is the Price”
Reviews.Author: HegemierDiaz
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of the W hotels and tend to stay there when on business. I thought what better than to stay at a W while taking in the rustic appeal of Vieques. Unfortunately I get the sense that someone had to go home early in the middle of setting up the hotel and the staff have been left behind to figure out how to finish the job. The experience began to go downhill from the beginning when we arrived to find only four of our five day stay was on their system. Luckily I had proof via Amex of the full booking and they were able to accomodate. But had I not had the documentation with me it would have been a big problem. If you do plan on coming to the W - I highly recommend some type of night vision eyewear. Please plan on wearing it around both outdoors at night and also pretty much any time you are in your hotel room. The sexy dim lighting the hotel employs is a great visual but very impractical and even dangerous when walking back to your room. One downstream effect is that our refrigerator was plugged into a low voltage outlet intended for the dim lights and so was warm. This was a big problem as we had baby milk to keep from spoiling. After two days and multiple requests an "engineer" came and plugged the fridge from one outlet into another. If they had indicated a voltage difference in the outlets I could have done that in the first ten seconds. Similar experience with the wi-fi for which we were paying basically $60 a day (more on this). It took three full days and multiple requests to the front desk to have the service restored which I am certain was no more than turning on and off the router. We were in Villa 13 which is at the very beginning of the property. I don't know if it was added as an afterthought because the sidewalk ends before the Villas. Meaning my family and I all had to step out on to the road to finish the walk to our hotel room. The road is inside the property so this didn't seem bad at first until experience showed us that this little road was continuously trafficked with guest jeeps, staff golf carts, or construction vehicles. And since at night the light of the moon was the only light available, it was a bit intimidating to step out into oncoming headlights and just hope they are not drunk. The restaurant is at best so-so. I think Alain Ducasse would be wise to pull his name from it because at this point, I would rate Alain's food about on par with the fine chef's of Stouffers. Coming from New York City, I understand the high premium of world class food. But the $30 entree's would be overpriced for what they were at a fifth of the cost. Only the prosciutto appetizer really delivered. Finally and importantly the price - of everything! All of the above and these other reviews would be nit picky if the hotel wasn't charging thousands of dollars for the experience. If you wish to charge diamond star status pricing - you have to deliver. I have stayed at Holiday Inn's with more consistent amenities and services. In addition to the healthy room fees is a mandatory $60 per day charge which includes things like access to wi-fi, tennis courts, the gym (how many hotels have you stayed at with a separate gym charge?), pool towels, etc. Basically nothing very impressive. Anything that would normally be extra (like taking towels to the external beaches) was an extra charge - so the $60 didn't cover much. You do need to a rent a car in Vieques if for nothing more than to escape $60 granola and yogurt breakfasts, $100 lunches, and $200 dinners. Mixed drinks were $15 minimum (made more criminal by the absence of any noticeable alcohol), we ordered a pitcher of Sangria by the pool and found out it was $50. So the little enjoyable things tend to be ruined when you realize just how overpriced it all was. In a nutshell, I will say that the location is beautiful, and I love the W style. However the W would be well served to get a seasoned manager from another well functioning property down to this Vieques one and whip the place into shape before they get a reputation they cannot shake.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my high expectations”
Reviews.Author: Ann-70
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a romantic getaway to Vieques. Since we had heard great reviews about the newset hot spot in the island, we decided to gie the W Resort a try. WOW!!!!! We were not dissapointed, even though we had high expectations. Heer are a few observations: * W Lounge at the airport meant we had arrived to the perfect place * Convenient location just 5 minutes from the airport * Upon arriving to the hotel, a breathtaking view of the ocean * Great Ambassador Prpogram who escorts you to the room while describing thr Resorts facilities * Amazing room with high quality furnishings and very modern decor * Beautiful pool and beach facilities. (Note thah there are adult only pools and becahes on this resort) * Expansive grounds to find your private nook for reading or just relaxing I really enjoyed my time at the hotel. The only downside was the price of food, which was on the steep side. Other than that, we had a memorable experience. Should be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here!!! someone tried to break in our room at 1:30 am”
Reviews.Author: darlingm
Reviews.Content: let me start with the worst. someone tried to break into our room at 1:30 am on our 2nd night at the hotel. banging and slamming into the door so hard that the deadbolt latch became undone. we yelled, turned on all the lights. then we called for security.. no one showed up. 8 minutes later we called again. no one picked up at the front desk. we called again finally got the original person who told us that someone was checking on towels in our room because it showed us as checked out. TOWELS AT 1:30 AM ?? SHADY, SHADY, SHADY. after zero sleep that night we went to speak to a manager to expplain what happened. she was very alarmed and todl us she would investigate. later in the day we went back to speak to her again and a different manager spoke to us. this time she told us that it was showing in the system that we were checked out and someone was coming to check on the room. i guess they are sticking with this lame excuse... she also told us the room next to us had a little boy who was throwing up and the room had called for an employee to come to their room. and they came to our room instead. REALLY? that's how an employee comes to the room of a little boy who is throwing up?? by breaking into the room?? it was all very shady.. and we could not get a straight answer. first of all the hotel is beautiful... but to go to this island for this hotel was just not worth it. there are many better islands and hotels in the caribbean. the food was not that great. for an Alain Ducasse restaurant i expected more. the lunch food by the beach was awful. chicken and shrimp skewers were not cooked properly and a very generic, uninventive sauce was thrown on top. the chairs by the beach and pool were so uncomfortable, my husband had to take the cushions from our room lounge chairs for comfort. the room service was not that good. they did not do any room service the first day we were there. we had to call for it. the spa also has no steam room. what kind of spa has no steam room?? there are many other places to spend your money and feel safe on vacation. this place is not one of those places. DO NOT STAY HERE. NOT WORTH IT.

Reviews.Title: “unwind easily here (but don't forget your wallet)”
Reviews.Author: 212NYCMom22
Reviews.Content: All in all we had a great stay and I mainly enjoyed every bit of it. Pros: Beautiful location, rooms were well appointed, staff was very friendly, pool lounge chairs in the water were amazing, as were the little pods and hammocks throughout the property. Liked the amenities. Bliss products always enjoyed at W Stays. Areas for improvement: Pool temperature was COLD. they had a full house on Saturday and not many people in the pool. And there was never any option for night swimming (which is a favorite of mine as I don't have to worry about burning or sunscreen) as the water was fridgid. Warm the pool up by 5-10 degrees and the pool would have received a "10" from me. Concierge staff was AWFUL! Barely ever there and for this type of resort property you should have someone on at all times and someone to cover them on break. Then when they were there they were essentially useless. Told us to go to one venue for dinner and food/service was bad. Another person told us we could walk from the Bio-Bay tour into town easily AT NIGHT! ARE YOU SERIOUS?! Thankfully we took note of the length of the drive as we were being taken from the place to the bay and realized that not only was it a long walk it was entirely unsafe as well! All around the staff needs better training, but they were extremely nice (which you can't train for). Bell staff was the most knowledgable/friendly/accessible as well as the front desk staff. Room service needs some work too. Called Whatever, Whenever, Whereever and asked to have the pasta from the restaurant delivered to our room (vs. the one on the RS menu). They said the pasta was the same (which it wasn't) so we went to the restaurant, they told us we couldn't order from them for "take out" but could do so from the bar. Bar told us they couldn't order the restaurant menu from the bar. Finally got it all worked out, but it was certainly not "WWW" service that I've experienced at other W's. Also was extremely disappointed with "mix on the beach" dining. As were other guests we spoke with. Bar & pool menu was good, but actual menu in dining room was diappointing. CONS: There was this god-awful banging all EVERY NIGHT we were there coming from the pipes or something. We never could figure it out. Should have told someone on site, but we were having too much fun to complain while on vacation. Another con at times for us was the open bathroom...and the fact that the WC door doesn't close fully or have a vent in the WC. People have business to do there and unless you are staying in a resort on your own (yeah right) I don't think anyone wants to share their business. Also the tub wasn't that inviting. I love taking a tub and had no desire to do so in a big metel bin. someone took "funky" a little too far there. Also, there's not really any place to eat but on site w/out taking "publico" or renting a car, so bring your wallet. W Lounge at the airport was really nice (especially when you see the airport hee hee). Small plane ride over was interesting. My friend had to (or got to if you ask her) sit in the co-pilot seat both ways. I was sweating from the heat and the nerves...but 20 mins to get there on that little dinky plane was better than a 3 hour unpredictible ferry ride! We had bad dinner at Trade Winds in Esperanza...but a really really good lunch at Duffy's (get the bloody mary!) as well as a pretty decent inexpensive dinner at Island Adventures (after the bio bay tour which you MUST MUST DO) Also had great snorkling at Blue Beach (ask the guy at the sport shop on site to tell you how to go into the right point of the beach there for best viewing...we saw sea turtles and tons of fish!) All in all I would recommend this place. I will say as a girls get away we were the "few" as it was mainly couples there. But we didn't care. We weren't there to pick up boys or make new friends...just to relax, unwind, and enjoy each other's company...which we did easily.

Reviews.Title: “If you could rate them only on effort these guys are an A+. Unfortunately you can't.”
Reviews.Author: Ginlis
Reviews.Content: This is a great concept that needs some work on execution. The pros: 1. Beautiful pool with an attentive staff. Drinks and food were easy to order, staff delivered ice water numerous times during the day, the music was terrific (I was worried as some of the other reviews were fairly negative on this) and the pool area is relaxing and clean. 2. Mix restaurant on the Beach was terrific. The food was terrific, the service was attentive and competent and deserts were delicious. Try the ice cream sandwiches! 3. The bar area was fun and the menu was terrific. We relaxed on a chair built for two with a cheese plate and a glass of champagne to watch the sunset. A fun way to end the day. 4. The staff in the workout room and adventure travel area were helpful. We rented chairs to go to a beach off property and when we returned and shared that we had not used them because it rained we were not charged for them. 5. The rooms are clean, nice and the beds are comfortable. Cons 1. Check in was atrocious. We arrived at 2pm and were told that check in time was three and that our room would not be ready until then. The front desk clerk clearly did not have a great grasp of English. When we returned at 3 she sort of told us that the room would not be ready "for awhile". Finally without speaking she handed me two free drink tickets and I walked away. We went to the pool (after changing in a community bathroom) and relaxed for the afternoon. When I asked a server at the pool to check on our room she came back after about 15 minutes and told me that she did not know how to do this. 2. Part two of the check in concept is something called the "Ambassador". The ambassador walks you to your room, shows you the property amenities during the walk and then familiarizes you with the room. If you want to go to your room and there is no ambassador available you can sit in the lobby for 30 minutes or more. At one point there were at least 3 couples waiting to be walked to their room. We chose to walk ourselves to the room and got there and the key did not work. Upon returning to the front desk we were told by the woman who did not speak great English that it should have worked and no apology. 3. I asked if an ambassador could come and meet us at the pool to familiarize us with the property and was told no. If I wanted a tour I could come back later. 4. The W Cafe was ridiculous. It was if a senior management group got together and each one raised the price on everything by another dollar until it was time to go home. A small coffee is $4 (plus tax) a small muffin is $3, an individual serving bag of chips is $3. The staff is apologetic but unable to do anything but key in the amounts and tell you that your breakfast of a bagel and cup of coffee is $11. 5. We were scheduled for 8 days and were never contacted by a concierge to see if we wanted to plan any activities or needed any help. We had used trip advisor for our preplanning so did not need them but were surprised that the service was not offered. 6. There is no where to walk or hike on the property or near the property. We walked down the road one morning and turned around after less than a mile after having too many mack trucks come flying by. 7. There was a tremendous amount of construction happening at the hotel while we were there. One morning a maintenance person tried to enter our room (even though we had the do not disturb sign out) because he was supposed to work in the next room but accidentally opened our door. There were a couple of major renovations happening at the pool and there were anywhere from 6 to 10 construction guys hanging around mostly watching girls while one or two did some work. And Finally, The biggest issue with the W is not their fault. There is nothing to do on Vieques. No golf, no hiking, no galleries (please don't believe any of the advertisements), two average restaurants off property to eat at, two filthy little towns to visit, a number of beaches that are advertised as wonderful but most are loaded with horse manure (as is the entire island) and tons and tons of mosquitos and something called No See Ums that get under your skin and bite you for days. Upon visiting the local farmacia the response from the Pharmacist was "Oh My God!". My most memorable moment was stopping at the Glass Beach and taking a photo of my wife with her t-shirt over her mouth because it stunk like garbage and horse manure. The issue with the manure is that the horses run free on the island. They are on the roads all the time and crap literally everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and wonderful staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: gapeachfl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 days in November and were treated like royalty! We had the best suite in the house! It was directly on the water on the point of the cliff. The service was awesome and the staff was so wonderful to us. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Jonathan Heath hits a home run with the W Vieques”
Reviews.Author: exp_traveler27
Reviews.Content: I would personally like to thank Jonathan Heath, the incredibly helpful General Manager, who made my vacation at the W Vieques a truly memorable and relaxing experience. When I first arrived at the W Retreat & Spa, I was impressed at how beautiful and stylishly chic this resort is - from the Bliss bath products to the sumptuous duvet covers. The W Retreat gets all the details right.. The Concierge, especially Lauren, made sure that every morning my plans were mapped out in detail from what beach to visit, to what the top restaurants in town were, and to what the best sightseeing venues were. My favorite part of the hotel was the pool. The staff that supported the pool were exceptional, from Carlos, Robert and Monica serving the most creative frozen drinks to Lala making sure that I had fresh towels and that I did not burn. They treated me like I was part of their family. Mark, from the Sports Club, made sure that my hike in the rainforest was vigorous but memorable. My only negative experience was with ISLAND ADVENTURES. The Concierge had arranged for a bio sightseeing tour. The taxi dropped me off at Island Adventures a few minutes late and I missed the boat. The manager at Island Adventures decided to scream and talk down to me, and finally asked me to wait outside of his store like I was a dog until my hotel picked me up. Their lack of professionalism and customer service shocked me because everyone on the Island of Vieques went our of their way to make me one of the best trips of my life. All in all, the W Retreat & Spa hit a home run on this trip. Well done, Jonathan.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: 1AAFlyer
Reviews.Content: Clearly a marginal resort. No beach/pool service for the $60 per day PER room charge, 90% of the time there were no towels at the pool, concierge comes on duty at 1PM. Taxi was quoted at $10 and turned out to be $10 PER PERSON for a 5 minute ride (another guest had 4 adults and 6 children and was charge $100). The menus are extremely limiting and the food OK at best. We had bugs in one of our rooms which I reported 3 times. There are 2 pools on the property, one of which we never heard about except for a guest the day we left. The beach is TERRIBLE and was posted with swimming warnings. If you want a beach DO NOT GO HERE. The pool is also very undersized considering you risk your life swimming in the water off the resort. Also do not believe the BS about great snorkleing...it is poor at best. The printer at the business center was out of toner and 5 days after reporting it, it was still not replaced. Also, no locks on the bathroom stalls in the ladies' room by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property - service needs work”
Reviews.Author: jms831
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay at the W Vieques that we booked using Starwood points. We arrived at the Vieques airport and had a quick 10 minute wait in the W lounge. The lounge was very impressive - it takes up half the space of the tiny rustic airport and has a very helpful staff, snacks and drinks in a very comfortable setting - if only they could run the entire resort the way they run the lounge! Upon arrival we checked in and were told to wait in the lobby for an "ambassador" to show us to our room. I'm not the most patient person and waiting almost half an hour to be shown to our room was unacceptable in my book, but our ambassador did turn out to be helpful and gave us a tour of the entire resort on the way to our room. The grounds of the resort are beautiful and there are seating areas all around the property where you can relax and enjoy the view. The pool area is quite large but always very crowded with loud music playing. I actually liked the music, but can see how some guests would complain that it was too loud. I personally preferred to sit on the beach rather than the pool, which was virtually empty and much more relaxing. They seemed to have a problem keeping the pool towels stocked and there were quite a few times that I had to go to the hotel lobby to get a towel. They also need more people to work at the pool area and clean up towels, etc. once guests have left. If you arrive at the pool in the afternoon, every single chair has a used towel on it and half are unoccupied, so you have no idea whether or not you can lay down or if you'll be stealing someone's seat. As far as food at the hotel, we had breakfast at the restaurant the first morning, but then opted for the W Cafe for the rest of the week. They have breakfast sandwiches, cereal, smoothies, etc. This seemed slightly more cost effective (although a smoothie is $8) and just all around easier. We only ate lunch by the pool one day - it took around 40 minutes to get two drinks and two sandwiches (which are also quite pricey). The rest of the trip we tried all of the other restaurants throughout the island. We rented the beach package from the hotel for a day which included 2 beach chairs, an umbrella, a cooler, snorkel gear and straw mats. This costs $45 but we felt worth it to do once since the beach is much more enjoyable with chairs and an umbrella. It would be nice if this was included in the daily resort fee. As everyone else has mentioned, the $65 a day resort fee is absurd. Yes, you get free wifi and parking, but the snorkel and kayak gear is not even usable at the resort and the beach chairs that are included are for their beach only - not to take off property. The concierge helped us book Abe's mangrove, snorkeling, biobay tour (amazing, you should definitely do this). The cost is $100 per person, which the concierge failed to mention is cash only. Luckily when we went to pay Abe at the end of the tour, we had just over the $200 that we owed him in cash. This is a very important point that I can't believe the hotel fails to mention. Another issue was restaurant recommendations. It was Thanksgiving and I had called the front desk for a recommendation. The girl at the desk called Next Course to get us a reservation and called me back to say that they didn't have an opening until 9:30, which was too late for us. She then recommended Coconuts and said she would call them for a reservation. She called me back 10 minutes later saying that they weren't answering their phone but they were open so we should just go without a reservation. We drove over there to find that they were not open. We then decided to drive towards Esperanza and drove past Next Course. I ran in just to see if they could squeeze us in - half of the restaurant was empty and they seated us right away! A resort of this caliber should be able to tell their guests which restaurants are open and get them a reservation without a problem. All in all, the W is a beautiful resort, but has to train their staff better and step up their service to be in line with the five star resort they claim to be. They are getting away with this lack of service because there are no other luxury resorts on the island but I don't think that will last long. I would recommend this hotel because I would recommend traveling to Vieques and thought it was a nice place to stay, but it definitely needs some work.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Vieques”
Reviews.Author: anujin
Reviews.Content: Four days before our wedding, Hurricane Tomas hit our resort in St Lucia where we were supposed to honeymoon. Based on recommendations from friends we decided to change our honeymoon to stay at the W in Vieques. I was a little confused about the transportation from the airport to the hotel - the website mentions it but at no point did I get any communication that it was part of the package - I assumed we would have to pay extra for it and take a cab to the resort. Just to be sure, I called the W from San Juan and found out that it was in fact included. It would be nice if the W could make this more clear. I had booked a spectacular room online - it was really important to us to have an ocean front view. However, when we went to check in, we were told we were in a mega room. Luckily I had the internet confirmation print out with me and showed that we were supposed to have a spectacular room and she moved us to the correct room. The W website implies that it has a rental car desk at the hotel - but in fact there is not a rental car desk. As we had to re-plan our honeymoon on such short notice we were worried about getting a jeep - but the W was able to help us get a rental jeep for two days. We didn't spend much time at the W beach or pool - we explored the island and we went to blue beach for our beach time. The music that's commented on in other reviews was definitely noticeable - but we could only hear it from our room on Friday night - that night it was loud enough to be heard over the waves - but the rest of the trip the music did not bother us. However, we did request a room that was further away from the pool so it might be nosier if you stay closer to the pool. The room was beautiful and clean and we didn't notice any issues with service. The food and drink are extremely pricey. We expected that to some point - we are from Chicago and the drinks were comparable to the W here. It does seem a little extreme though to pay $60 for breakfast consisting of toast, granola with fruit, juice and coffee. Just eat at other restaurants as much as you can - there are plenty on the island. We also stocked up on lunch food from the local supermarket to take the beach. And the resort tax is very unfair. Overall, we really enjoyed our room at the W the most out of the experience. The W living room and fire pit are also a nice touch to hang out in. We were disappointed that there's not a hot tub at the resort - but the bathtub in the room is a nice second place. I would recommend this hotel- just be ready to pay top dollar for food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not great”
Reviews.Author: NC_Hiker
Reviews.Content: We flew to Vieques on Cape Air which uses 10 passenger planes (including the pilot). One passenger was assigned to the co-pilot seat. It's a short ride at 140mph & 2000 feet max altitude. Upon arrival at the Vieques airport we were directed to the W Resort lounge where we waited for about 20 minutes for the short ride to the resort. It took about 30 minutes for someone to deliver us and our luggage to our room and by that time it was getting dark. Upon arrival at the room there were dirty drink glasses outside our door - and they stayed there for 2 more days. When we entered the stairway to go down we discovered it was completely dark - the overhead light had burned out and my wife almost fell down the stairs. I reported it but they made no attempt to fix it that night. The next thing we noticed is the pathways are also dark because they are illuminated by very weak solar lights. We had to use our feet to feel for steps in some places. If you go, take a small flashlight because you'll need it. Dinner was OK but nothing great and the quality did not match the $107 price. The next morning the light in our stairway was replaced - about the time we lost hot water. It seems the resort has a problem with hot water pipes and after that first morning we had no hot water for the rest of the stay. The even worse part was when they cut off the hot water the shower stopped working. We had to use a hand sprayer in the tub to take a cold "shower". I complained several times about the lack of hot water and all I got was "I'm so sorry" but we were never offered anything to make up for the inconvenience, not even so much as a free drink. I had called several days before arriving and asked guest services to line up a jeep rental for us and I was told it would be taken care of. After our arrival I called guest services and told them I was ready for the jeep I discovered they hadn't made any arrangements at all. It turned out to be difficult to get a jeep because the gas stations on the island were out of gas. I finally got a jeep but we lost a half a day in the process. We went to buy a sandwich in the cafe before it closed at 5pm and discovered they had a single sandwich in the cooler. They did have ice cream but the next afternoon there was no ice cream. Seems the machine broke. If the days we spent at the W Resort had a common theme, I think it would be just that - something was broken every day we were there. The resort is beautiful and in a great setting. Food and drinks are over priced but that is probably typical for a remote resort. However, in my opinion there is a huge gap in promised customer service vs what is actually delivered. We probably will never return again because there are too many great tropical resorts that will take steps to make up for shortcomings such as no hot water. Had they tried to make up for the lack of showers / hot water by providing a free dinner, we might have considered returning. An irritant to many guests is the whopping $60 resort fee per day. The rational they supply is the fee covers the wi-fi, beach chairs, parking, towels, water sport items, etc. Therefore you are required to pay for those items whether you use them or not. Upon check-out we were taken back to the little airport where we were able to check our luggage back to our home airport - but not really. Vieques has no TSA or agriculture inspection so you and your luggage MUST be delivered outside the secure area of the San Juan airport. You must then present the luggage for an agriculture scan and get the luggage to the airline. Then, after a very long wait in the security line, you'll be at your departure gate. If we had arrived in San Juan to change planes with less than 45 minutes before boarding our USAIRWAYS flight home we would not have made it. The only reason we could have made it in 45 minutes is we discovered that there are 2 security lines at the San Juan airport. There must have been over 200 people in the line leading to the USAIRWAYS gate but we accidently found the second line when we were on our way to Vieques. We avoided the really long line and found the second line which had no wait at all. Then we used the connector hall to get back to our terminal. I was amazed that no airport personel were directing any of the passengers to the second security line.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Everything about Vieques -- W Hotel, SeaGate Horseback Riding, BioBay and Duffy's”
Reviews.Author: WendyGFrisco_TX
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful time in Vieques. If you love the Caribbean, but not the commercialism, then Vieques is for you. The W was awesome -- great rooms and they really display the W brand. The people at the hotel were awesome to work with. We also loved the horseback riding at Seagate Horseback. Penny the owner will take care of you. We loved it so much we went back the second day. For a 2 hour ride, we went through the town, the country-side and rode on the beaches. There are wild horses in Vieque roaming the streets like stray dogs. We did the bio-bay luminsicent kayak trip. It was a full moon but we still glowed and sparkled in the water. Overall it was awesome! There is a resort fee but covered everything from the arrivals/departure lounge, lift to hotel, coffee service in the morning, snorkel gear, free Internet and pool side service. We bulked at it in the beginning but figured out very quickly it was of value.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the pictures”
Reviews.Author: CSIguy
Reviews.Content: If I could describe the W Vieques in one phrase, it is better in real life than in pictures. That being said, its not all in the looks. There are a few minor nuisances that you need to be prepared for and before arriving. The good... The design and layout of the resort are a work of art. Just sitting by the pool and looking out over the ocean and beyond to Puerto Rico was enough to keep me relaxed. The terraced infinity pools make you want to skip the beach. Staff was friendly and very knowledgeable. The nights are even better with the constant croaking from the "coque" frogs, and the clear sky. Everything is extremely dark to protect sea turtles, so you get around with a glowing orb. Fun, a little dangerous. The bad... The service and prices are not great. Be prepared for an additional $100/day in resort fees and taxes. I averaged about $300/day, which was pretty conservative There is a grocery story less than a mile from the hotel and the W Cafe which sells a few items at a discount. Most of the locals seem to be on "island time", so service is generally slow. This goes for the hotel, and especially for local establishments. Our room had a damp, unpleasant smell that the hotel offered to fix with a spray. Did not take the offer, and we left the doors open most of the time anyway. Summary, I think its worth dealing with the few service issues and high pricing if you seek a uniquely relaxing vacation experience. I hope to return next year, as I feel they will be able to resolve the staff issues, and never got to visit bio bay due to excess rain. Tips: Rent a jeep one day and visit all the beaches, especially red beach. Eat ceviche at Next Course, and visit Esperanza for a sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Modern island gem that let's you relax and soak in the sun.”
Reviews.Author: mxjoshua
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my long weekend at the W Retreat and Spa at Vieques. I found the rooms to be clean and modern, yet very relaxing with the ocean breeze and surf sound pouring thru our ocean view balcony. The property is gorgeous. Loved the two elevated, parallel infinity edge pools that allow you to look down at the beautiful beach and carribean while sipping your favorite cocktail. Hiding speakers seem to dot the property in all areas and always play the perfect ambient and chillout tracks. I highly recommend waking up a little early in the morning and walking over to the 8 a.m. beachside Yoga class. Mari, the instructor was excellent and really focused on deep breathing and good stretches to leave you feeling invigorated for the day. At night, the firepit and bar are wonderful as you mingle with other pleased and relaxed guest. Everyone seemed very happy and were raving about the property. While in Vieques make sure to do the biolumenescent bay and national beaches... truly wonderful. Or go horseback riding with on one of the local island horses. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “First Time at a W resort won't be our last.”
Reviews.Author: AdsPony
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Retreat the last week in Oct. for our 20th Anniversary and couldn't have been happier. We took a very small prop plane from San Juan to Vieques and were in desperate need of a drink which we got for free (sort of) at the W welcome lounge at the airport. A very nice man works there and took care of our luggage and made sure we were comfortable. A van took us to the resort a few minutes away and it was stunning. Lots of natural materials combined with a high concept design. A staff member gave us a quick tour and we arrived at our room on the top (3rd) floor overlooking the pool and ocean. It was spectacular. The balcony has funky but comfortable furniture but I think the room's highlight was the bathtub which sits by itself and has a wooden slab to sit against. Since it was our anniversary flowers, champagne, strawberries and chocolate covered marshmallows were waiting for us. The staff was excellent especially Angie our breakfast server, Lauren the concierge and Caesar who seemed to do everything. He and Lauren helped my husband plan a wonderful private dinner for us on the property on top of a cliff overlooking the ocean with tiki torches. It was very special. I don't remember their names but the bartenders were terrific too. Drinks were expensive so we bought liquor on the island but some nights we had to splurge. We both thought the food was great especially the fish dishes and almost everything at breakfast. The music that plays all day was a bit much but we couldn't hear it from our room or on the beaches. We loved listening to the frogs at night which would be plenty of music for us. The tennis courts could use some better maintenance but one day a staff member came out with Fuji water for us which was really nice. We had some trouble using our cell phones on the property but could find a signal in certain spots like the tennis courts. Overall this was one of the best vacations we have ever had and we would welcome another trip the the W on Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of paradise”
Reviews.Author: mjps81
Reviews.Content: We expected a nice, but loud W experience but the W Retreat and Spa exceeded every one of our expectations. The staff - everyone from the drivers who pick you up at the airport to the concierge, food and beverage manager and pool staff are friendly, helpful and go above and beyond to make your stay amazing. I wanted to do something special for my boyfriend's birthday, and they came up with the most creative, fun ideas for us. Its definitely made for couples, as even the lounge chairs in the pool are in 2s. The spa treatments for couples are also incredible, and after each body treatment the technicians give you time together, in an outdoor shower overlooking the ocean. It was one of the most romantic places either of us have ever gone, and we can't wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Finally a W Resort, well-done”
Reviews.Author: Dog_Cove_on_the_Road
Reviews.Content: Italian modern meet Thailand funky, fortunately the new owners of the W took the 8-year old former "Martineau Bay" property (which was so deftly designed and built it into the landscape to soften the view of each individual building as to make you feel the structures were at one with the landscaping) and â€œsimplyâ€� polished a major gem by pouring some obviously huge money into a fabulous redesign of the existing spaces and outfitting each room, spa, restaurant and lobby and/or lounge area with extremely fine appointments. Kudos to the designer and to the managers (and their bank!). Every sofa, day bed, chair, pillow, light et al is a piece of art and all are well-integrated to create and maintain a hip vibe. A funky and cutting edge feel abounds in the lobby with huge windows looking out onto the blue ocean, terrific background music, and the somewhat racy coffee-table books (you'll have to see for yourself) tip one to an almost adult-swim-only theme. Multi-tier pool areas with cabanas ($150/d) and two private beaches, one adult only... I didn't see any kids on the property. Very helpful and attentive staff. An alluring ocean-side seating area situated around a large fire pit was a terrific place to repose with sunsets or late-night moon romping. Rooms are very large full wall sliders out to the ocean views, they have large showers and a free-standing soaking tub, separate w/c, beds are very comfy beds and they have day beds instead of sofas which is a really nice touch. For those new to Vieques, the W will seem incongruous with this somewhat sleepy island where well-worn sneakers/shoes and wrinkled shirts are more the norm. But the W begs for couples to visit and get lost. The Alain Ducasse restaurant was somewhat disappointing but I suspect that they will work the bugs out of that place (off property dine al fesco at the newly built Next Course or try Chef Michael's Coconuts), The spa is a peaceful and lovely place, individual treatment rooms were serene my (each?) with large outdoor showers, and compliments to builder who made the rooms almost silent, there is nothing worse than hearing others while you are trying to drift away into an massage.. that said my massage was terrible, I am not one to complain, but I almost got up and excused myself. My massage and the food at the restaurant were the only hiccups on what was a fabulous three night stay. When you arrive at the airport, don't miss W's private greeting area while you cool your jets before pick-up. Oh, if you are on Vieques, inquire about Ingrid Bergman, she is absolutely terrific masseuse though not affiliated with W.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly wonderful but a few issues with W.”
Reviews.Author: melissa703
Reviews.Content: W at Vieques is a beautiful resort. I would have given it an excellent rating except for a few issues I had with them. For the most part, it is exactly what a resort should be. Exceptionally clean, modern rooms. The grounds are well kept and the beaches were nice sized and kept clean. The service staff for the most part were attentive and helpful. My husband and I ate both breakfast and dinner twice and got food at the pool bar for lunch once. The food was well prepared and well presented. Our breakfast special of Churrasco steak on ciabatta bread was awesome. Overall, we had a wonderful time. Now for the negatives...the music that is pumped thoughout the property is way to loud - on the beach you can hear it through the ocean waves. It it an odd mixture of new age and dance music. They do not turn it down until 10pm. It definitely gets to be a bit much. The 65$ "resort tax" is an unfair addition to the bill and W is the only hotel on the island that charges it. The drinks are $14 a piece on average - much better to purchase your alcohol at a local store. The floors in the rooms can be dangerous if you are still wet from swimming since they are very smooth. The ATM was empty while we were there and there are only three ATMs on entire island. All in all, if I were to return to Vieques - I would go back to W but I hope they do improve on the above issues.

Reviews.Title: “W Vieques lived up to my expectations”
Reviews.Author: universltraveler
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from a 5-day vacation at the W Vieques. The grounds were simply stunning. Each day I had to stop and admire the beauty of the resort and the breathtaking views. Our room was very comfortable and we had a nice view of the pool and the ocean. The food and drinks were nothing spectacular and prices were high, but nothing more than what we expected. Do: Bio bay tour with Abe's; Picnic lunch at Red Beach; Dinner at Next Course (get the ribs) The staff at the W were attentive and very friendly. We got used to the new age house music by the pool, but at times we would have preferred listening to the waves on the beach or even some light island music. Its a 5 star resort and you will feel relaxed and rejuvinated after your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: ELAMFERN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first three nights of our honeymoon. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. We felt relaxed as soon as we entered the property. Though there is a nice private beach within the resort, the car rental agency across the street is very convenient with fair prices. Do not miss the beaches on the southern coast of the island which would only be accessible by car. The whole atmosphere at the resort is fantastic. It is a relatively small property, which makes you feel very welcome with personalized attention. The restaurant's food is good but pricey. Try a few places outside of the resort for some variety, (we recommend Next Course.) Overall a wonderful stay, we would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Bohemian Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Nolanative
Reviews.Content: My husband I just returned from a six night stay at the W Vieques. We thoroughly enjoyed the "do-nothing" atmosphere of the island and would love to return to the comfort and retreat of the W. First, the property is stunning. It is impeccably maintained and pristine, with hotel staff constantly tending to the landscaping, pools, and porches. The styling and decor is flawless, but please note that it is modern and certainly not "traditional beachy." There are no watercolors of sailboats or shell art in sight! The two pools were beautiful and, again, impeccably clean. We loved the loungers that were placed on a large step in the pool, with about three inches of water surrounding them. As for the techno music in the background, I can understand some reviewers' frustration. It was, at times, noticeably loud. We grew used to it, but also noted when it wasn't playing because we were then able to enjoy the sound of the surf in the background and the general quietude of the wildlife. If you would be offended by loud techno/new age music while lounging by a pool or lunching/ drinking outside, I strongly recommend that you really think about staying here and using the pool area because it is a noticeable distraction. At the very least, request a room away from the pool if you want to avoid the tunes and enjoy the sound of the surf. The two beaches, although small, were lovely, with the water being crystalline and the sand clean and soft. We enjoyed swimming in the water on the beach at the W almost as much as on the other famed beaches of Vieques. There was an ample amount of beach furniture, umbrellas, inner tubes, towels, and loungers available for the guests. Our room in Villa 4 was on the third story and had a beautiful view of Whisper beach. We were pleased that the hotel honored our wishes to be away from the pool area, per the recommendations of the wonderful Trip Advisor reviewers! Our room was large, incredibly clean, and well-appointed with two telephones, a flat screen mounted television, and all of the other W amenities. We both commented that it may be awkward to travel with a friend or family member that is not your spouse/boyfriend/girlfriend as the tub is out in the "open," almost studio style. Housekeeping was meticulous throughout our stay. Our only small "complaint" would be the service during our entire stay, and it is not as much of a complaint, but, moreso, an observation that should be considered if you are deciding whether you want to book the W Vieques. Everyone at the W was friendly, but there was a notable lack of consistency among the staff and its training. Some staff would go above and beyond, truly embracing the mantra of "Whatever, Whenever." However, a majority of the staff, although well-intentioned, did not seem trained in luxury hotel customer service. We had to do a lot of "asking," which is unusual for a hotel of this retreat's caliber. For example, we had to be very proactive in booking our excursion to the Bio Bay, almost interrogating the staff member on things like, what to bring, where to go, what time to be picked up, price, etc. Without our prodding, the only information we would have learned was "We booked a tour for you at 6:30." Throughout our stay, we had to make an extreme effort to find out about small things such as our jeep rentals and our airport transfers, laboriously having to check in with the front desk, inquiring about everything from cost, time, location, etc. We were fine with being proactive, but it was not exactly a helpful environment. I could easily see a guest getting sort of lost in the shuffle, with no one guiding him or her and explaining the ways of the resort and the island. Essentially, the staff were all green and did not provide us with the confidence that a more polished, professional staff would have. (I tend to think that this may be a common theme within the W brand as I have reviewed the W in New Orleans and one of the W's in NYC, stating similar issues....) We did not find timing issues to exist the way others have mentioned. The in room dining was always efficient. We had to wait around for about 30-40 minutes at check in, which did not bother us at all, but I could understand someone being very frustrated upon arrival if he/she had to sit around without bags, hoping that the welcome "ambassador" would show up soon. Last, I feel like the prices of the resort should be addressed. There is a $60.00 per day resort fee. The food and drinks were pricey, but nothing out of the ordinary from another W in a mid-large sized city. We enjoyed the food and drinks at the pool, once we just accepted that we were going to be paying top dollar. However, I continue to note that the food and beverage prices really did not differ greatly from those of the New Orleans W Hotel. The food at Mix was decent, but nothing monumental and the meal was about $125.00, which is an expensive meal for what I found to be "hotel food." I would recommend skipping Mix for the price, but taking advantage of the pool food, the Living Room bar menu and the in room dining as it was tasty and easy. That being said, the drinks range between $6.00 for a beer to $12.00 for certain mixed drinks. After a day at the pool, with an average of about 3-6 mojitos/beers, 2-4 clubs sodas (I am pregnant so only half of our couple was drinking!) and snacks/lunch, we would spend sometimes up to $85.00. I hope this calculation helps you when deciding on the W. This review was very focused on the actual W Retreat, but I am happy to answer any questions about our experiences on the island, too. We ate at Duffy's, Belly Buttons, Roy's and the Inn at the Blue Horizon. We were disappointed to discover that El Quenepo was closed for hurricane season. We rented a Jeep for two days from Martineau Rentals and enjoyed Media Luna and Red Beach. We, of course, did the Bio Bay tour with Abe's. I welcome any questions about any of the aforementioned eateries and vendors...this was just getting too long!

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL WILL IMPRESS AND WILL CHANGE YOUR LIFE, ITS A MUST!”
Reviews.Author: claudiopr
Reviews.Content: me and my wife stayed 2 nights in the w retreat & spa. we had the best vacation ever!!! the location of the hotel is paradise, the food incredible!!! the best food around chef Johnny Besch cooks the best food we have ever had!!you will be impressed with his food!!! 5 stars!!!! trust us!!! the service in the restaurantexcellent!!! Cesar the head waiter is a great person and his staff and him will make your breakfast,lunch, dinner to be so comfortable and nice you will only eat at the hotels restaurant!!!! the service since we arrived at the airport, they have a w lounge in the airport to welcome you.drinks on the house!when we got to the hotel Jorge Luis gave us the welcome tour he is one great guy that will make your first impression be really exciting. Roberto the bartender at the pool and his staff are great aswell and really friendly great service!!!! the rooms are AWESOME!!! the bed matresses are incredible i want to buy one for my house. the beach area is great!!!, ricky the towel/waiter of the pool and beach area is also really friendly and great service and funny!!!the munchie box employees were great too dayanara and frankie where great and friendly too. we were recomended to this hotel by Cristina Carreras from finance and she did well because we had the time of are life!! great experience!!!me and my wife really enjoyed this, if you have a chance this is a must!!! you wont regret it!!! if i could remember all the staff names i would put everybodys name because overall we felt at home in this hotel seriously like home!!! but better!so thanks to all the staff of this amazing hotel!!! when you stay have the a la carte breakfast so you can experience Johnny Besch food it will blow your mind!! thanks for the memories guys!!! we surely will be visiting again as soon as possible!!! brenda y claudio

Reviews.Title: “a bohemian oasis, chic and sophisticated and tasteful”
Reviews.Author: epekes87
Reviews.Content: what a fabulous place to stay. friendly and low key and very sophisticated. a beautiful environment and friendly service. the island is very bohemian with wild horses and more beaches than one can imagine. the bio luminescent bay is a must and so are the amazing restaurants all over the island. I think this is a great island for foodies.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Adventure”
Reviews.Author: remnyc
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a low key island with a 5 Star resort this is the place ... Everything on the resort was perfect -- the hotel beaches were quiet and the pool was always lively. Room was amazing and we saw some of the best sunsets we ever experienced. We found the food at the hotel over the top and worth the price. The service was immpecable -- every staff member we interacted with loved where they worked and lived and it showed through in the level of sevice that was provided -- in particular Bree made our stay truly memorable and seemed to appear whenever we needed anything. When we broke away from the hotel to explore we found the island easy to get around and incredibly low key. You need to rent a jeep to get to the endless suppy of beaches that you have all to yourself. The Bio Bay is a must do adventure on the island -- go on a nighttime Kayak tour and swim with Abe and Cruz. Best local food is at El Resuelve (every locale we asked directed us there when they realized you didnt want tourist spots) right outside of Isabel and only about ten minutes from the hotel -- its a road side stand filled with locals and the food is so good we became addicted. If your hanging in Esperanza then Duffy's is a great relaxed bar/restaurant. If you are a history buff stop by Conde Mirasol Forttress and find the curator -- he is former Boston native that has made the island home for the past 20 years and can definetly provide some local color to the islands history. We were there for a wedding anniversary and it was a great place to celebrate and reconnect.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish W outpost”
Reviews.Author: SusanDallasTexas
Reviews.Content: The W Vieques is a stylish W outpost.
