Positives: interesting decor, sexy pool area, excellent sap/fitness facilities, complimentary airport transport and airport lounge, beautiful grounds, clean beach. Negatives: isolated from the towns on Vieques, and thus from dining options, beach is small and surrounded by rocks on both sides, thus not walkable, pool music disturbed sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: PJF09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Retreat and Spa in Vieques with friends in June 2010. We couldn't have had a nicer time. The staff was wonderful, from Jorge who checked us in to Oscar who was a source of information and great conversation. This island is a true gem in the Carribean and once people discover it's charm it will be a place that you go back to time and time again. Especially if you are lucky enough to stay at the W. The food was great by the pool, at the bar and especially at the hotel's restaurant. I felt truly pampered as I was given cool towels by the pool and frozen grapes. The rooms are beautifully decorated and everwhere you went in the resort offered a comfortable place to sit and relax. We spent many nights by the firepit and in the hotel lobby which they call the "living room" because it truly makes you feel at home. If you can request a room on the ground level near the pool you will not be disappointed. We even moved for one night just to have a room there when it became available. Be sure to rent a car and visit other parts of this island especially Esperanza. Nice little town with a few shops and restaurants. Very easy to navigate around the island and see it's true beauty. We are looking forward to returning next year at the same time. We hope to find the same welcoming staff.

Reviews.Title: “For the money could do a lot better! Go to Hawaii!”
Reviews.Author: LASteve1977
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very clean, modern and nice. Great rooms, bed, ext. However... the staff seemed more like a bunch of island kids playing around than what you would expect from a four star resort. They were all slow, and seemed stoned most of the time. There is only one restaurant on property, so not much options for food. The beaches there were horrible, you have to take a taxi across the island to see the real nice beaches with calm, clear waters. And if you're not staying in an ocean front view on the quiet side of the resort (whisper beach side) don't even bother. The side near the pool was loud. And the garden view rooms, seem like they just face the parking lot. Overall I had a good time because I was in an Ocean Front on the quiet side, but for the money could and should have been better. Oh... and check your bill carefully, because they overcharge (nickel and dime you) every chance they get. What this hotel needs is a new staff and better beaches. Next time I'll head to Hawaii, or another island in the Caribbean.

Reviews.Title: “ct for reward travel, but there are far better hotel values if you are paying your way.”
Reviews.Author: Clooney_99
Reviews.Content: Most guests at the recently opened W Retreat Vieques probably donâ€™t know that it was once the Starwood Martineau Resort. I have seen both incarnations, in 2007 and 2010, respectively. W Hotels has completely renovated the old Martineau, and has created a unique W experience that ranks with their best properties (which I consider to include Mexico City and Montreal). They redesigned most structures inside and out, built new units and amenities, and established a consistent reclaimed wood aesthetic throughout that reminds you that you are on a luxurious W property. Or perhaps I should say, â€œa W Retreat,â€� because thatâ€™s what it is. This is the Wâ€™s second retreat-style resort following its extremely expensive and exclusive Maldives retreat in the Indian Ocean. What makes it a retreat? In addition to all the familiar W qualities (a pool bar, the â€œLiving Roomâ€� lounge, â€œSweatâ€� gym, coffee shop, conference space, and â€œWhatever Wheneverâ€� service), the W Retreats have a large spa and a private beach. There are actually two private beaches at the W Retreat, kept exactly as they were when the resort was the Starwood Martineau. They are little coves, bordered on both sides by boulders and coral, so that neither beach is visible from the other. The smaller cove allows topless (â€œEuropean styleâ€�) sunbathing. The larger cove is family friendly. Both coves are perfectly fine for sunbathing. But being on the islandâ€™s northern coast, they do not have ideal water color and temperature. They are totally swimmable. But you will want to drive to the warmer, brilliant turquoise waters of the south coast beaches (Navio, Red, Blue, Garcia, etc.) to enjoy the ideal, â€œpostcardâ€� Caribbean beach experience. I was a given a full tour of the resort, plus I had lunch at the pool bar, and I have to say, the prices simply do not justify the few advantages that the W offers. The cocktails at the bar are simply not special. They arenâ€™t memorable nor strong. The gazpacho is wonderful, but the sandwiches are uninspired. Lunch for two (soup, sandwich, and two cocktails) was over $60. So it was memorable for the wrong reason. The W offers one thing that most hotels on the island do not â€“ room darkening curtains. Most rooms in Vieques are white, bright, tiled spaces that offer no escape from the morning sun. At least guests at the W can sleep late without being disturbed by sunlight. Another tidbit â€“ the front security gate is completely unnecessary. Yes, this is an exclusive resort for mostly mainland US residents. But Vieques is not some banana republic. It is a lazy island owned by the USA. Considering that the W charges roughly double what most other Vieques hotels charge, and it charges a $60 per night â€˜resort feeâ€™ on top of that, the W is not a practical place to rest your head at night. Rather, the W is a fine place to stay if you ever earn enough Starwood Preferred Guest points. There are several other fine hotels â€“ even colorful new houses with swimming pools you can rent â€“ for less cash. And when you are on an island where you will be spending just as many hours on the beach as you will be sleeping, finding a better hotel value is a wise move.

Reviews.Title: “Nice short stay”
Reviews.Author: JmaxBod
Reviews.Content: Spent two days at this property over the weekend after I discovered it on an SPG site. After spending the day in San Juan, my friend and I took a 20 minute flight to the island. The W airport lounge was a really nice touch when we arrived, however it was closed on our return. While we went to the airport expecting to sit in an air conditioned lounge with food and drink, we waited 45 minutes in a sweltering hot makeshift terminal. I wish the W had informed us the lounge would we be closed prior to us leaving the hotel. The hotel staff is very friendly and attentive. Everyone tried really hard to make sure all our needs were met and I feel they did a phenomenal job. The hotel is quite nice but I was not to thrilled with the layout. My room was right next to the lobby and the partial view of the lobby and a section that doubled as service area for the living bar. It was very unappealing especially considering they had private events going on. The beach is very nice and was not crowded at all. The beach staff (Orlando) was awesome as well. All the food on property is handled by Ducasse and is decent but pricey (the breakfast was excellent). Do not go to his hotel if you are on a budget of any kind. The hotel charges a $60 resort fee which includes services that should be standard. At most properties I find a comp bottle of water from SPG, here it was a $9 bottle of Fiji and no other SPG gifts. "Who's thirsty?" Not me for 9 bucks a bottle. Lauren at the concierge was very helpful in planning our activities, however, there is not much to do. Outside the hotel there is really nothing much to do at all. The town is almost not even worth checking out. While it may be a nice spot for couples to spend a romantic weekend. If you are looking to party with a buddy or two I suggest you go elsewhere. The hotel is exactly what you would expect from a W. I would give the hotel another shot in the future. Again, the staff is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great to rest and relax, poor on service.”
Reviews.Author: FcoRodz
Reviews.Content: This is one beautiful hotel with a very impressive presentation on the lobby. The rooms are very beautifully decorated and grounds are perfect including the pool and beach. But for the price you pay it don't delivers on service. Three calls from the room for the ice bucket and one hour later it came. Very poor bartender at the main pool who couldn't mash and mix a decent mojito nor a madras. Don't go for the mix drinks stick to beer and wine. And the wait for them at pool for them went beyond reasonable. Everybody from the staff kept apologizing because they were not ready for too many guest. Not good enough for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Not the true Vieques experience but you will be in your bit of heaven.”
Reviews.Author: Turkey19
Reviews.Content: The W is all about comfort and service. You walk in the W lounge after you land and it's nothing but relaxation. Pros: Great friendly service with a smile, beautiful infinity pool that never closes, beautiful rooms, nice beach area and plenty of parking. Treated ourselves to dinner at the Mix, delicious but expensive and not the taste of the islands type of meal if that's what your looking for. Cons: It is costly, but you get what you pay for. Advice: Rent a car, you must leave the hotel and see the beaches (Blue Beach was my favorite). Bio bay tour is a must. You can stock up on groceries and pretty much anything else at nearby Supermercado Morales. Check on the restaurants before heading there, while I was there, most of them were closed due to the low season. Thank God we found a little spot called El Resevuelo where we got good cheap spanish food. The only other options was the tourist spots like Bananas in Esperanza. Bring a small flashlight as the grounds and pathways around the Hotel can get very dark at night.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: ehorsman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ventured to Vieques Island, PR for the first time and opted to stay at the W Retreat and Spa. This hotel is wonderful in all matters of personal service, quality of rooms, spa services, pool and beaches and their manicured grounds. The W gave us an opportunity to have the best of both worlds on our vacation; raw nature on the island of Vieques and come home to the luxurious grounds at the W. We would definitely stay here again! Yes as others have stated, the drinks are somewhat pricey, but unbelievably superb. I live in Dallas where we have $8 - $12 margarita's so I am somewhat used to his price. And remember you are on a somewhat isolated island, cost of transporting goods is high. So all in all the prices were not bad. Especially considering the quality of drinks I had. Vieques Island is a marvaleously raw beauty with its gorgeous beaches, crystal clear waters, free roaming horses and growth of lush green fauna. The island was safe to travel on your own accord, easy to navigate and very peaceful. Bio bay is a must if traveling to the island. We chose to kayak with Abe's to the bay and had a grand time. I

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy444
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd visit to Vieques, but first to the W. I was fortunate enough to stay on a HOT RATE. My review: Room: Room was large, comfortable, nicely decorated. Products and towels were fully stocked anytime. Only complaint was that my room was close to the pool and i was able to hear the music most of the day (bass) with the doors closed. If you want it quieter, request a room not close to the pool. Music ran late. Highlight: The bed was PERFECT! Pool bar/restaurant: Staff were friendly and helpful. I recommend getting the bucket of beer to save some $. The bloody mary's were to die for at $10 a pop. I did not try everything on the menu, but my favorites were the hummus, olive, pita plate. Perfect snack by the pool. Also, i recommend renting the cabana. It is guaranteed FUN!. The cabana included a TV, water, Energy drinks, and apples. Hotel Beach: There were two beaches and the hotel provided tubes which i happily floated on. I recommend experiencing the other island beaches too. Hotel restaurant: Breakfast was delicious. Best on the menu was the Madam Croque. So delicious i had it 3 times. French press coffee and more. Dinner menu was perfect also. I was able to have the Halibut and the Mofongo was delicious. Also, the lobster special. Appetizers i recommend the tuna tartare and the cheese plate. AT 6pm they have free drinks in the lobby bar. Service was exceptional. Mix Cafe: This was one of the best things i have seen at any resort. Staff was so friendly and helpful. They packed out picnic basket filled with ice and sandwiches. I recommend getting the Roastbeef and Brie sandwich. Also, the smoothies are so delicious. I had one pretty much every day. Other hotel comments: Peaceful resort (no rowdy-ness), the hotel's drivers (jeep) were so helpful and friendly. Please note it is very dark to walk around the resort so bring a small flashlight or something. Views were amazing during the day and the starry sky at night is beautiful. There is always staff around to answer any questions. Vieques Comments: Since it was my 3rd time i did not need to explore to much. I recommend going to NAVIO BEACH (def), eating at Next Course, and ending the night at Lazy Jacks in Esperanza. Car was rented across the street at Martineau car rental. Do not rent anything new or nice especially if you plan on exploring the island. Roads are bad and getting to the beach it is bumpy dirt roads. No need for a nice car. Watch out please for the horses and dogs. Especially the horses. Highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “No hurricane can stop this resort”
Reviews.Author: cgclos
Reviews.Content: We were there for our wedding, and due to Hurricane Earl, we were concerned our wedding at the resort wouldn't happened as planned. Due to the staff there, the wedding went as planned, and they helped ensure everyone made it to the island and everyone was able to attend. The staff there from the top to the bottom ensured everything went without a hitch. The resort itself was superb, couldn't even tell there had been a hurricane the day before. Staff friendliness was what you would expect from a W hotel, anything you needed or wanted, they made it happen. When they say, "Whatever, Whenever", they back it up! If you're thinking about having your wedding here or simply just finding a place to getaway, don't think twice, they will make it happen, hurricanes or not...

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable 30th Anniversary thanks to Robert Hunt and The "W" Staff”
Reviews.Author: rfamily9
Reviews.Content: I went to Vieques Island as a surprise to my wife of 30 years. After we stopped in San Juan for two days it was a welcomed surprise. First of all I highly recommend flying into the Island, (we used MN Aviation,$75pp each way, and they flew (a 10 seater prop) in and out of SJU-Luis MuÃ±oz MarÃ­n International Airport plus they dropped us off at the terminal upon our return). Everything I heard about the ferry was awful, from long waits to rough rides. However from the moment your plane lands The W Resort whisk you away into a Fantasy Island type atmosphere. The W has a special air conditioned room (as part of the airport) just for resort guest where you can get something to drink or eat. Moments later the hotel Jeep picks you up and takes you to the resort. Robert Hunt greeted us at check in and since I had called ahead he was aware of my special occasion. Of all the people I have ever met that were associated with hotels, Robert is far and away the best at making sure your stay goes exceptionally well. Our room was spectacular, the amenities were fantastic. This was a perfect location to relax and take our minds off of business and family obligations. Check out the pictures I have included that range from the room to the awesome pool/cabana and even our special 30th anniversary dinner which was way beyond my expectation. Let me also say the spa/massage was fantastic as well. If I had to change anything with the hotel I would say that the beaches were a bit too rocky for a former Florida boy (but not too bad). And the ice machine didnâ€™t work in our building during our stay however it simply meant a 30 step walk to another buildingâ€¦..hardly a complaint. I have read several comments about how pricey the resort is, and those who know the Caribbean are aware that Islands pay extra to bring in supplies and someone has to pay for itâ€¦â€¦My experience was that I got more than I expected for what I paid!!! There is a car rental company across the street from the hotel (walking distance) and Robert Hunt was very helpful in assisting us with that reservation so we could explore the island. Our highlights of our day long exploration was clearly the Bioluminescent tour in mosquito lagoon (A DON'T MISS EXPERIECE) and the ability to try out restaurants in the two citiesâ€¦..Coconuts and El Quenepo are the best, in that order. Robert also arraigned for our 30th anniversary dinner for two on the cliffs of paradise point overlooking the ocean, followed by the most romantic setting in our room possible upon our return, complete with rose petals, heart shaped towels and candles. Needless to say my wife was surprised and VERY pleased with the evening; I guess she signed up for another 30 years:)!!!!! Thank you Robert and thanks to The â€œWâ€� staff for making my 30th anniversary a week to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta get here...”
Reviews.Author: pmeadct
Reviews.Content: It was my yearly birthday trip and I chose the W in Vieques. Couple reasons: 1. from NYC area there are tons of nonstop flights with low prices. 2. The flight time is short 3. PR is a US territory - so no long distance roaming charges or text charges or internet usage problems. 4. The W just opened in March, so it was out of the awkward stage and ready for guests. And my verdict - I loved it! The hotel is beautiful, very modern, clean and sparse but not boring. Interesting Art work and unique furnishings are everywhere, making it truly one of a kind. What makes the W special and not just another hotel are a couple of things. First, Vieques is a small quiet island, not a lot of night life, shopping malls, etc. We saw horses roaming free along the roads. So, the island is not heavily commercialized yet. Secondly, with the lack of commercialization, the prices are low - outside of the W that is - for excursions, tours, etc. And Finally, the best part of the W is their staff. I met a few wonderful people there that I would like to thank for making my trip so wonderful. The first is Arelis, the Living Room Bar Manager, she is amazing...the best sangrias that I have ever had. My husband and I followed her from bar to bar to eat lunch with her. The second is Lina, the amazing waitress with Chef's training. My husband loves food and Lina exquisitely described every dish on the menu, down to the sauces and different cooking methods, it was such an education. The last two individuals are Angie and Casey, both waitresses who knew their stuff and were so welcoming and hospitable. I also want to thank Nick from the Phoenician who was incredibly helpful. Thank you again for saving those Taste of the Islands tickets for us we had a great time! Also, thank you goes out to the GM, Jonathan, for personally getting our togo lunches on departure. I would highly recommend the W Vieques. I would call it warm and welcoming....and blissfully peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “really nice, new hotel if you're looking for a do-nothing vacation”
Reviews.Author: travelerkevin
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights as a relaxing get away at the W Vieques. We weren't looking to do much of anything, so this fit the bill perfectly. As for the positives/negatives : Positives - Top notch service, especially by Caribbean standards. It's obvious that Starwood is paying a lot of attention to this place judging by the number of staff around (even appears to be people shuttled in from other places). This seemed to be everywhere in the hotel. - Quality of food - our package included in the breakfast buffet - thought they did a really nice job by making it a little better than the typical hotel buffet (no premade eggs, some local things thrown on to the buffet, etc.). We had dinner 2 of the nights and thought the food was really good even if the pricing is all over the place (in some cases, certain entrees seemed really reasonable for the quality while others like the $18 shrimp cocktail with 4 shrimp, made no sense). - The beaches were really nice. Not huge, but they are pretty much private on account of the geographic layout, snorkel and kayak equipment is free (and good quality!). The pool areas are nice and well maintained, plenty of towels (and no silly sign out system), no issue with lack of chairs, etc. - The concierges were helpful with car rental, restaurant suggestions, etc. - The setup with airport picks was awesome (lounge with snacks/drinks while you wait for pickup, get picked up by bellman in private car, etc.) - Rooms were nicely decorated and comfortable. We had a poolside room and had no issue with the music that other people mentioned (though when you're outside, it does get annoying after a while that the music never shuts off :) ) Negatives - Be prepared to spend $$ on everything here. There is nothing within walking distance of the hotel and they know it -so everything is pricey. $13-$15 cocktails by the pool, $5-$7 beers, $9 bottle of Pelligrino, $17 burger, etc. As long you know this going in and accept it as part of the cost of vacation, you'll be fine :). There is a grocery store is that a 3 minute drive away that has cheaper goods to stock up on. The W cafe is also more reasonably priced than the rest of the hotel. - We rented a car for 2 days to explore the rest of the island. We saw some beautiful deserted beaches and we had great dinners at Tradewinds and Cantina La Reina. However, a couple of notes - take the advice everywhere about not leaving valuables in your car/leaving your car unlocked to avoid damage - our car was searched by thieves 2 different times. Also, given the narrow roads, wild horses/dogs, etc., it wasn't exactly a soothing drive in the dark back to the hotels from dinner. I thought it was a bit easier to drive around St. Martin than here. Also, it's not cheap to get off site - a jeep is about $80-$90/day and the W charges $45 to rent a package that includes beach chairs/snorkel/coolers - which is kinda needed if you want to enjoy the beaches. All in all, we enjoyed ourselves. Given the lack of activity, I think it's probably a good "long weekend" type of place than anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful resort !! Everyone very...”
Reviews.Author: Rubiabella
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful resort !! Everyone very nice ! But the most wonderful 2 people were the bartenders at the main pool side ! Roberto navarro and Monica they were great and attentive to thier clients ! The best drunks the island could offer ! Especially the Coso-Coso Raro That was created by Roberto u must try it when ever u visit the W resort in vieques !

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Getaway Retreat...”
Reviews.Author: Btw120
Reviews.Content: This is a place where you leave your worries behind and become enchanted by the beautiful splendor this hotel represents on a secluded island off Puerto Rico. The W Hotel is a retreat where beauty and nature meet luxury. We had the absolute time of our lives laying out on the prestine beaches of Vieques and enjoying the amazing pools while sipping on a drink. This place will forever hold a place in our hearts of great friends and unforgettable memories. Thanks Vieques for the best time- we look forward to our return!! Besos.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable stay at The W-Vieques”
Reviews.Author: 2tchrs
Reviews.Content: To start off....The experience at The W Resort and Spa in Vieques was one in which my partner and I will never forget! Upon arrival to the airport in Vieques, you are ushered into the W lounge where you can indulge in a variety of drinks, food, snacks, and ample relaxation while waiting to be brought to The W Resort and Spa! When you arrive to the front door, not only will you be greeted by the W insiders, but the carpet itself changes from morning to night welcoming you appropriately. We were upgraded to a ground floor overlooking the pool and ocean, the room decor is modern and fitting for the W brand! More beautiful than the resort is the amazing staff, which made us feel so welcome and as if we were at our home away from home!! The bartenders at the Wet Bar Robert, Monica and Orlando were amazing, and knew so much about the resort and Vieques as well as what was good to order for lunch. Dinner at MIX was great and the wait staff was exceptional. You must try the daily specials and the MIX candy bar! Above all, our stay at The W would have not been the same had we not met Robert-the w insider who helped us plan daily trips and gave advice about what to do around Vieques. Rob always went above and beyond to make sure we were satisfied and things were going as planned! On the last day of my trip I decided to run to the Pier from The W! Probably not a great idea, but to experience the island is to rent bikes or run the island and get a great feeling of the nature Vieques has to offer. On my way back, I stopped in at the W Lounge at the airport and asked for a ride back after my three hour run! Without a blink, they were there to escort me back to paradise! Thank you for an amazing vacation experience! We both highly recommend this resort and cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL SIMPLY IMPRESSIVE”
Reviews.Author: rplaya
Reviews.Content: W Vieques is one of the most impressive Starwood resorts period. Amazing property and a real whatever whenever staff always available to offer you beyond supreme service. All you need to do is exit the plane into the W lounge VQS airport & the rest is taking care off. To the owner: Your staff is your most amazing assets. Thank you all from the 20 of us that stayed at the end of August 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional stimulation and relaxation all in one very special place”
Reviews.Author: bcm0830
Reviews.Content: 21 of us found ourselves scrambling to figure out when we can return to this Caribbean gem after a weekend of SO many fond memories. My friends love to drink, eat, and be just downright crazy! The staff made everything twice as much fun. It was obvious that everyone at this "retreat" loves their job and interacting with guests. The rooms were so much fun, and no expense was spared on any detail. The rooms on the ground level that walk out to the pool were very convenient and wonderful. Everything we had to eat was out of this world, and the service was spot on (and let's be clear, it's not easy to serve a group of 21 demanding animals so gracefully). W Vieques, YOU ROCK!!

Reviews.Title: “I'm in Wuv”
Reviews.Author: WhatWhen
Reviews.Content: The service here is great, and the staff is beyond the friendliest! From the start, my party took Vieques Airlink from Isla Grande Airport in San Juan. Upon arrival at VQS we stepped into the W airport lounge and checked our bags with the W agent. Sip a couple drinks and wait for the shuttle to take you to the W. Your bags are placed in your room before you even arrive. W arrival is like coming to Jarassic Park. After check-in we were given a tour from the concierge Robert, who by the way kept tabs on us all week and made our stay the most pleasent by providing answers and recommendations to everyone of our wild requests We also arrived just in time for "Sunset Sip" which is at 6:15p to 6:30p everyday, a free preset drink and hor d'oeuvres Alcohol prices vary around $15 a drink/ shot on property (we brought some of our own from San Juan and from in town in Vieques. The food at Wet as well as the Living Room was good, nothing exceptional. Though our dinner at Mix was phenominal! In an effort to see some things outside of the hotel and get some cheaper food we took cabs to Esperanza (There are only 4 on Vieques, and avg. $5 to 10 ea. way person). After so many cab rides, I'd recommend renting a car ($70-$90 a day), or a scooter ($50 a day). You will also need some sort of private transportation because these cabs won't go off road to the private beaches (Red and Blue were my favorite). We took the snorkal gear off property and went to the pier and saw some cool fish. My friend was daring enough to kayak from the W beach to the island 2mi. out. In Esperanza is were we rented jet skis and the scooters (Fun Brothers Co.) The staff is really knowledgable of what's in town, and where is the best place is to find anything. Cash is king in town. Don't bother taking your SPG Amex out, because the W is the only place that will take it. Merchants will take Visa or MC, but the cabbies won't. Beware, as many of the horror stories I've heard before, we did get stranded one evening in town. No cabs were answering their phones and the W had to personally get us. It was all fun though The demographic at the W was "older", 30-40ish and very "couple'y" There's not a whole lot of mingling going on and it's super quite. Beware, the Living Room lounge (bar & kitchen) shuts down around 10p. The late night menu is bleak (Turkey Club, Tom., Basil, Motz plate, 2oz Ham, and Cheese Plate). Same goes for in town, you can not find anything to eat after 11p tops. 1 to 10, this W was a 10!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: BigEdAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We went for a 5 night stay at the W on Vieques. The excellent service started at the airport, where the W has a arrival lounge. Our luggage had not found its way to Vieques. The gentleman at the lounge took our baggage tags and dealt with it for us, talking to the airlines and all. Our luggage arrived at our room about 3 hours later. We got to the resort on the complimentary transportation and checked in. When our ambassador took us to our room, there was a leak in the AC unit. We went back to the lobby where we were upgraded to a higher room class for our trouble. (we were booked into a Fabulous room and were upgraded to a Spectacular room. I think I have the W-speak right) The view from the room was great, looking out over Whisper Beach, the smaller adults-only beach at the resort. It was just a short walk to the Living Room, restaurant and pool from our room, and we were right across from the gym and cafe. Speaking of the cafe, the gelato/sorbetto there was excellent. We thought the food and service at Mix, the hotel restaurant was great. We had the breakfast buffet each day, which included cooked-to-order eggs, smoothies, pretty much whatever you wanted. Dinner was ok the first night, great the last night. I think it was being tired from traveling somewhat the first night, plus the effects flying has on your taste. We also had lunch at the pool one day, the salads we had were great. Jason had a pedicure at the spa, he was very pleased with the pedicure and the woman who performed it. Couple words of warning. There is only one (maybe 2) ATM's on the island, so bring some cash. You will need some if you decide to go out to dinner or something. We had emailed about a rental car. Being off season, I figured this would be easy to get. They replied and said they would arrange one for us when we got there. Well, turns out a large number of people from Puerto Rico mainland came over the weekend we were there as school was about to start, so there were no cars to be had. Overall, a great vacation at a nice, newly-renovated resort. Easy to get to from the East Coast, and the price, although not cheap, is reasonable for the quality. We will most likely go back in the next couple of years.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful destination location :-)”
Reviews.Author: Biz19890
Reviews.Content: This is the best place I've stayed by far! I work in the industry and love to explore to places. The beauty and accommodations are beyond belief on this island off the mainland.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with terrific service”
Reviews.Author: adesousa
Reviews.Content: I set out to give my girlfriend a relaxing and memorable experience on a beautiful island and the W delivered it spectacularly. I'm a big fan of the W brand because we've always been treated very well throughout our stays and folks at this W seemed to go out of their way to make a gay couple feel welcome. The host made sure my spg status got us a suite upgrade even though we arrived on a busy Saturday ("trust me, this room is gonna impress your lady", I was told); the concierge gave us an unprompted tip on the most romantic beaches; and even the masseuse playfully chided my girlfriend for not giving me enough massages! I was very impressed with the service, the amenities, and the postcard-worthy views. This is the place I'm going to bring my girlfriend to when I'm ready to pack a diamond ring in the bag =).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wonderful Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TheBourneAdvisory
Reviews.Content: We LOVED LOVED LOVED every moment our our stay at the W in Vieques! From the exclusive W lounge at the Vieques airport, to our beautiful ocean view room! (Do not take the ferry! Take an airplane. It's more expensive, but saves time and frustration) The staff of the hotel was very hard working and very kind. Eric and Georgie were both terrific and should be proud of the hard work they do. Who pleased us most was Katti, our server both evenings we dined in the restaurant. She was smart, extremely genuine, and by far the nicest person we met on Vieques. Thank you Katti! The living room was very beautiful with extremely challenging puzzles guest could attempt to solve. (If you solve the puzzles you get free drink tickets!) Our room was very nice with an IPod docking station and DVD player and direct view of the pool and ocean! The swimming pool was the best pool I have seen in a long time and although it was incredibly busy from sunup until sundown, the pool staff managed the guests and the grounds very well. The hotel also has several private beaches with chairs, umbrellas and kayaks. I look forward to our next visit to Vieques and The W. Thank you W staff for a "W"onderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “$60 per Day Resort Fee Didn't Save The Day”
Reviews.Author: ottacee
Reviews.Content: Nothing worse than spending $300+ a night only to get slapped with a $60/day resort fee that was never disclosed or discussed while checking in. When you check in, they will not give you the keys to the room till the "ambassador" takes you to your room. Then when you get your keys, you find out that your spending $60/day for free towels and internet access. Oh, that's so kind of you. We were placed in front of the pool area, which was a huge mistake. The pool is open 24hrs so you can hear people partying late into the night. Starting at 10am each morning the music "bass" is turned up so even if your sleeping (with the door shut) you can hear it through the glass door. This music wont stop till 10-11pm. I would suggest getting a room on the other side of the complex. Our room had very chic decor but unfortunately had a huge spider web above the mirror. The restaurant was very expensive and suggest traveling around the island for some local flavor. Our "rice and beans" was made of B&M and Rice A Roni. Otherwise, this hotel is truly beautiful. I "get it" with the feel and decor since I fit into that 25-40 yr old mold. But people this age cannot afford to come here. I kept thinking, would my parents come here (50's age)? While they have the money to spend the extra $60/day to use towels, they don't like the loud music, the dark colors, slow service, and overpriced food.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmm, is this Vieques?”
Reviews.Author: Gringo-in-Paradise
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visitor to the island of Vieques, I stayed at what is now the W when it was the Martineau Bay Resort. As the Martineau, this property was gorgeous and fit in fairly well with the local vernacular. Prices were reasonable, staff was friendly. Now as a W, this resort was somewhat disappointing. I was only on property for cocktails at the bar this visit but was disappointed with the decor - aside from a lone vejigante in the lobby restroom area, there was nothing "native" or related to this special island, or even Puerto Rico. It could have been a resort on any island in the Caribbean, or could have been in Manhattan frankly! Lines were harsh, lots of concrete, uncomfortable and modern chairs, strange large "beds" scattered around (not that anyone would feel comfortable sleeping in public) and the great room was completely filled with a cluster of strange and unrelated furnishings. Frankly, if you are just looking for a nice tropical retreat it's fine, but if you really want to see Vieques, it might be best to stay at one of the smaller bed and breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “The most excellent and remarkable resort on an unusual and quirky and equally excellent island.”
Reviews.Author: geneRayburn
Reviews.Content: Fannie Flagg and I will elaborate later, but for now, we are reporting that this resort is incredible for great service, beauty, food, other distractions, etc. We stayed for a 25th anniversary visit July 17-22, 2010. We'll go on-and-on later, but suffice to say, this resort and this island are simply terrific. Gene.

Reviews.Title: “Great for honeymooning, beautiful resort, relaxing, but...”
Reviews.Author: JustinHubb
Reviews.Content: Let me just start off by saying that we had a great time here for our honeymoon. We stayed at the W in early July for five nights and would definitely consider coming back with family and/or friends. It is a beautiful resort and I think it is a perfect W for the area. I love the W's in the more urban area (Chicago, Atlanta, etc) for their funky decor modern twist on accomodations. However, I liked the more tame and rustic feel of this resort better...I don't need to go "clubbing" on my honeymoon...it was the perfect place for relaxation. The two private beaches are absolutely beautiful, the pool is amazing and relaxing, and the grounds are impeccable! If you want to get away to an island no one has heard of (no one at our wedding at heard of Vieques) and vacation in luxury then this is the place! Vieques is a beautiful island with beautiful beaches, a great charm, and excellent food and restaurants. Now...there are some service issues with this hotel. I don't know if it is growing pains or an island mentality (my wife grew up in the Bahamas..so she's all too familiar with Island time). Getting anything to your room will take some time...we had a bottle of champagne but no champagne glasses so I called "Whenever/Whatever" to see if they could send some champagne glasses up...after waiting two hours and two phonecalls later..we simply had to drink the champagne out of cups before heading out to dinner...not the most romantic since it was our first night of the honeymoon. In addition, we would always have to call to get our room cleaned. We would be at the beach or down at the pool all day and come ack to the room at 5pm or 6 and the room has not been cleaned...this after we "missed" our first cleaning at 8am. Who cleans a room at 8am... The food: The restaurant is very good...and the food is outstanding. Everything we had was delicious. It is very pricey, so be prepared to spend some money. I would also suggest that people leave the resort and head to some of the local restaurants in the area..Conocu and El Quenepo are outstanding! Transportation: Do NOT take the ferry...its such a mess. The W should put something on the website about transportation to the island...we flew for a mere 26 dollars per person and were greeted by a beautiful W lounge in the Vieques airport. Save yourself some time and headache and just book a flight...its ten minutes and easy. All in all, the W Vieques is a great resort and a perfect honeymoon destination.

Reviews.Title: “Not Ready for Prime Time”
Reviews.Author: Cydneejo
Reviews.Content: At 20,000 points per night, W Vieques should be one of the premier properties in the Starwood family. While the setting is gorgeous with two private beaches and a totally renovated physical plant, the service could not even rate four-stars. The mostly young staff is exceptionally friendly and excited to be there but, like most puppies, they are not yet trained. Room service came late, phones weren't answered, electrical outlets didn't work, fans could only be set to low or would make a piercing whine, spa is woefully amateurish, flower delivery for birthday was not executed as promised. Thumping hip-hop and overly formal Alain Ducasse menu also need to be edited. The icing on the sour cake was the GM Jonathan Heathâ€™s decision to ignore FIVE (!) emails from me and my Starwood ambassador. Bottom line: wait till W puts a grown up in charge of this property unless you enjoy paying platinum prices for three star service.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Rustic Cool-Best Hotel on the Island”
Reviews.Author: aeonflux10
Reviews.Content: True to form, this W has it's own unique character among the collection. It's quiet, understated, rustic, and relaxing with hints of the local culture and art and is situated right on the coast. The property is intimate, 150 or so rooms, each with ocean view and features two private beaches, two pools, and cool little fire pit. And Mix, an Alain Ducasse restaurant. Very good food, excellent service; best on the island. The hotel never felt crowded. Most travelers seemed to be couples, though there were a few young families.

Reviews.Title: “Is this really a W Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Dolce1127
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W hotel in Vieques for the second week of our honeymoon. We stay at W hotels across the US for work and we love the chain. However, this hotel was no representative of a typical W. If you are expecting a trendy, plush hotel.....don't go here. This W has more of a rustic type of a feel. And the "whatever, whenever" phrase ONLY applies to the employees. You'll get your food, drinks, room on the W's schedule, not yours. I know every new hotel has some kinks to iron out but this is by far the worst opening I've ever seen. Case in point, our first day we had lunch by the pool and a waitress brought over hummus & pita. We thought it was complimentary so we started eating it. The waitress rushes back and says it was delivered by mistake, takes it from us, and serves a half eaten appetizer to another table! That's just gross. There is NO excuse for that. And that's just one of the many horror stories we have. Some of the other highlights of our trip: extremely uncomfortable beds, broken ice maker, no elevators (pack light), 1 hr+ for room service, limited menu at their restaurant, and poor service. The W couldn't pay me to return to this hotel. Please save your money and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Imma coming back!”
Reviews.Author: BENtraveln
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and stay at a variety of hotel properties/chains. But when it comes to the W group, this one surpasses all that I've stayed at thus far. Being an SPG Platinum member I was in touch with the property (thanks Jonathan & Joe!) prior to my stay and was quickly up-graded to a Marvelous Suite while still utilizing points for the 2 two nights. All I can say is that the gorgeousness, sprawling space and comfortability of the room matched the entire resort as a whole. My experience started upon landing with a private W lounge at the Vieques airport where the staff there immediately set the tone for what was in store. Believe me when I say that this property excels with the "Whatever, Whenever" mentality. And they do it with an air of ease and honesty that doesn't come across as forced or robotic as I've felt in other W locations. This place is exactly the place to go (be it with family, friends or lovers) when you want to get away from it all and not have to do anything. I suggest you indulge in the amazing pools, the two beaches, the couches off the living room or one of the many hammocks across the property. There ain't much in ways of entertainment in the evenings, but again, at a place like this, who really cares? Save that for San Juan. My only 'warning' for any potential visitor is to take note of the costs that you'll incur that starts w/ a hefty nightly deposit up to $250, the daily resort fees of $65ish dollars and the heavily priced items on all menus and in-room bar (i.e. $9 water & $125 small bottle of Patron). But if you are expecting to get away from it all while still having access to the smaller 'fun' things in life, then stop complaining or go somewhere else. This place ain't cheap, but in my opinion its worth it. Oh, and if you are staying longer than 2 days, definitely look into renting a car so you can really explore the island and see all the beaches. There really is a lot to see outside of the resort and with limited island transportation, a car will get it done quick. But as mentioned, I was kinda bummed to leave and have already made a pact to myself to return and enjoy even more.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing - Shangri La in the US”
Reviews.Author: woofdoc31
Reviews.Content: Simply stated - an amazing property. Great private beaches - very few kids (this is NOT a kids place at all - really none of the island is) - amazing pool and service that is unparalleled. Rooms: Got the WOW Villa - way pricey but worth it - two patios steps away from the ocean. Nothing about the W is cost effective - if you want to blow it out - it is worth every penny. Food: We only ate at Mix one night - it was great - pricey and nice - we found stellar restaurants throughout the island - see reviews for SOL Food, Next Course and Belly Buttons. Personnel: Get ready to adjust to "island time" but ALL of the staff at the W was amazing. Standouts include: Jonathan (GM) - A Kiwi with a warm greeting and is always visible and helpful on the property. Robert- Manager of Mix/Living Room - what a personality and so helpful with all things island. Best of All: Lindsay (Whatever/Whenever) - she went above and beyond and was key to making our trip a complete success - we want to adopt her. She gave us an insider view to the island and none of our time was wasted or ill-spent - seek out Lindsay - she is awesome. To Do on the Property: The spa is nice - limited staff and offerings but beautiful. Great massage from Marco. The W Cafe has the best sorbet on the planet - try the CocoLime. The gym is state of the art - killer workouts. SNORKEL RIGHT AT THE HOTEL - some of the best snorkeling I have done in my life - right off the hotel beaches - small reefs house thousands of colorful - and friendly - fish. Will be going back to the W Vieques again and again - the island is NOT touristy by any means. Biggest Tip - Rent a Jeep in advance from Martineau - across the street from the W - DO NOT use/rely on taxis - $90/day for the jeep - but it gets you to remote and incredible beaches.

Reviews.Title: “W must stand for WOW”
Reviews.Author: kfecher
Reviews.Content: We have traveled all over the Caribbean and this by far has been our best vacation ever. Let's start with the island. We flew from San Juan in a 9 passenger plane, first for my wife and she was very nervous. The plane was fine and only 15 minutes. The only other option is a ferry which we almost did, only $2 each way but 1.5 hour trip. We heard horror stories from other travelers who chose this route, spend the extra money and fly. The W hotel has a very comfortable lounge at the airport where you can have a drink and a few snacks while you are waiting for a van to take you to the hotel. The hotel is a 5 minute drive from the airport. Rent a for a day or two and explore the island. The island is 5 mile wide and 20 miles long and very easy to navigate. The first day we drove to Red beach, the hotel will rent you beach chairs, towels, snorkeling gear, umbrella, cooler and beach mats for 2 or 4 people, we had 4 and the $45 charge was worth it. There is a jeep rental agency very close to the W, they will pick you up and drop you off or you could walk. We rented a 4 passenger jeep for $90 a day. Spend the morning at the red beach and then go to a beautiful little town called Esperanza. Great views, food and night life. The is very little in the way or transportation options so I would recommend renting a jeep. In the afternoon we went to blue beach and back to Esperanza for a few drinks. Now for the hotel. What a great experience. The hotel lobby, or you living room as they call it, is exceptional. Seating is abundant with great views of the ocean from everywhere. You could only hope you living room was like this. The food is expensive, as you would expect at a island resort, but was exceptional. From fish to steak every dish was great, we ate there 3 times and by far the best food on the island. Try The Next Course restaurant, 5 minute drive, it was very good. Bar food at Duffy's in Esperanza was also very good. The room was beautiful and well equipped, ask for a first floor unit, you can walk out you door to the pool or beach. The pool was very nice, and the bar was great. Service was exceptional, ice water, frozen grapes were served all day and your towel was replaced when you left your chair with a new one. The beach is steps away from the pool and was beautiful. Very calm water and nice sand. We never saw more than 2 or 3 couples on the beach at a time. Not much to do for kids, we did not bring ours and did not see any all week. The concierge, Jorge was awesome. Helped us throughout the trip. All of the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, whatever/whenever is their motto and they live up to it. This is one of the best managed properties I have ever been to. A quick shout out to Oscar, hotel employee that seemed to be everywhere, knew us by name and was a wealth of knowledge. You will not be disappointed with Vieques as a vacation destination, especially the W Hotel. We arrived on Sunday 6/27 and were supposed to depart Thursday 7/1. Well we bit the bullet, changed out flights, not cheap, and extended our stay till Saturday. It was worth every extra penny. We can't wait to return in November for our 25th anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “You have to visit, even if it is for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: nana019
Reviews.Content: The location is breathtaking. The service is incredible. The room was brand new. Multiple beaches - European and non-European. Great pools. They have all kinds of water toys available - for snorkeling, kayaking, etc. The hotel has a great restaurant and bar. You have to try one of their specialty drinks. Of course being a W, the hotel is pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “luxury on a higher level...”
Reviews.Author: raine4398
Reviews.Content: i was only able to stay at the w for one night, but i was more than impressed... first the service was incredible... i believe i put the staff to the test by asking for a late night ride back to the resort from esperanza... i was told a taxi ride across the island is not easy to come by after dark, but the staff found a taxi nearby to give us a ride back to the w... and the staff always seemed to have an answer or the ability to find us an answer promptly... i am only giving 4 stars for service though because someone came into the room early, and he just didn't seem like he had entered the correct room... and i don't think he was there to clean either... the amenities were spectacular... my favorite was the swimming pool... i was surprised to hear music underneath the water... the beaches are beautiful [i stayed away from the european-style beach so no one would mistake me for a peeping tom]... the amerian side was more than enough for me... the room was gorgeous and modern... the view of the ocean from our balcony was amazing... i am sorry if it seems as if i am running out of adjectives to describe the w, but it was an experience that was new to me... maybe i am new to this level of service and amenities, but it is definitely something i would not mind experiencing again...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property but I suggest to eat out!”
Reviews.Author: jacrain
Reviews.Content: First off, we had a great time at the W Hotel Vieques. We were treated very well as soon as we entered the hotel - except for one situation. We decided to do a Bio Bay tour (Abe's Tours $30/pp) and they were scheduled to pick us up at 6pm. We were told to bring cash, but when we got to the lobby at 5:30, the ATM was out of money. They did not know when it would be refilled. The concierge and front desk manager (?) let us know that they talked to the person with Abe's Tours and we could pay them tomorrow. Sounds great except they had terrible delivery - it sounded as if WE had made a mistake and they were going to do us a favor. It definitely rubbed me the wrong way. Maybe they were speaking down to us because we are young (23-24), but regardless, this was not our fault. Moving on - food was expensive. Everything we did order was very good, but I definitely suggest stocking up on some food (and maybe some beverages!) and eating in Isabel Segunda (try Conoco's) or Esperanza. It was difficult for us to do this because we did not rent a car. I suggest doing this at least 1 day. Cabs were pretty reliable for us.. but nonetheless, it is a hassle and can be costly when used every day. Now for the good things! This is such a beautiful property! We received an amenity upon arrival (maybe because we're Platinum?) - this really made us feel special! We had a beautiful ocean view. They said we were upgraded? I guess they meant with the ocean view. The room was spacious with a very cool tub. Pool was awesome! Renting snorkeling equipment and keeping it on the premises is free! It was only $15/day to take them off the property. The beach had steep shelves, waves and large rocks - I stuck to the pool. We had a great stay. Pricey but we knew that going into it. Just beware of the resort fee $60/day because that can be a large expense if it's unexpected.

Reviews.Title: “WOW. We will be going back.”
Reviews.Author: VBSC
Reviews.Content: Terrific property that is still working out the kinks just prior to its grand opening. Soft opening apparently started March 31st. Most of the guests during the first part of our stay appeared to be either SPG members or residents of the main island of PR. Yes, it is a W. Yes, there is music playing everywhere. Yes, the food is wildly expensive and not too varied (restaurant, bar, pool bar, & room service all pretty much operate off the same menu). You're either going to love this place or just not be thrilled with it. I would find it difficult to believe anyone could hate a resort as beautiful as this. We arrived into the airport and took a little walk outside to the W's Arrivals Lounge, where Veronica had snacks and refreshments, and a very friendly, personable attitude, and great recommendations for things to see and do around the island. Our driver, resort guide, doorman, bellman, and apparently the hardest working man on Vieques (we saw him literally every day) was Ricardo, and epitomized the "Whatever, Whenever" premised of the W chain. I fully expect to run into him at some point in the not-too-distant future when he is the GM of a Starwood property somewhere in the world. The most unusual aspect of the trip (keeping in mind Vieques is pretty lightly populated) was sitting at Duffy's in Esperanza and being unable to get a publico (cab/van) to pick us up. The bartender started chatting with 3 ladies behind us when all of the sudden one asked me my last name. When I replied, she immediately responded by blurting out our room number at the W. Turns out, it was Lola, possibly the friendliest and one of the most helpful people at the W/W Guest Relations Desk at the Resort. Note: No gift shop yet, so newspapers, sodas, etc are all off-site. do the Bio-Bay tour eat at Chez Shack go to the supermarket (Morales) and buy some less-expensive eats & drinks fo ryour room have a late lunch at Duffy's Say hi to Roberto at the pool bar eat at Next Course Snorkel off the "whisper beach" and then snorkel somewhere else. Drink a lot of water Bring your camera Bring a flashlight (this is key) Bring an umbrella Relax

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property, but not a relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: bbsdad2010
Reviews.Content: The property is simply gorgeous on the beautiful island of Vieques. Very modern design and furnishings as you would expect from a W. Beach, pool and room were very nice. The staff was very friendly and did their best to accomodate the needs of guests. The problem is the W hipster lounge atmosphere doesn't mix well with the desire to have a nice relaxing beach vacation. The incessant boom boom bassed up music drowns out the sound of the surf and other nature sounds like the tree frogs that chirp at night. There was also a private party at the pool one night that lasted until the wee hours. Our room was just a few feet away and management would not do anything to keep the noise down. If we were under 30, I'm sure we'd have enjoyed it more, but being a little past that age I guess that we'll have to find a more relaxing spot on Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven has found a place on Vieques at the W”
Reviews.Author: Babs35
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a long holiday weekend at the W and were in heaven. The staff was amazing - particularly Edison in reservations who helped arrange our accomodations, Jorge, who has got to be one of the best bellmen/concierges we've encountered (find him when you get there and have him give you a tour) Steven, the pastry chef who brought me a special birthday dessert and the rest of the staff that made our stay so wonderful. Thank you! Thank you! Opinions will naturally range based upon one's own expectations and experiences so for those that didn't write a glowing review, I think that their expectations were just incorrect before arriving. This is a boutique hotel and although part of the larger Starwood group, the resort feels intimate and relaxed. You don't feel as though you are at a large overcrowded resort. It is a W. If you know the W chain, then you will expect a certain "feeling" upon arriving. The lights are dim, yes, music fills the air most days, the seating is low and comfortable with plenty of places to curl up with a book, play one of the many games provided in the living room or just chill. It is all part of the ambiance. If you care for that, then you will love it, if you don't...well .... your choice. There is a resort fee and the food is on the expensive side. It is a luxury resort. Expect it upon arriving and you won't be surprised. The W staff will pick you up from the airport (if that's how you arrive) and take you to the hotel for no charge. If you want to get out and explore the island, I'd highly recommend a car. You can walk to one of the car rental locations or the W will drive you to others nearby. There are plenty of casual restaurants to visit around the island that have less expensive and more casual food if that's what you are in the mood for. There are 2 private beaches that are on the resort property, both very private and beautiful. The water is amazingly warm and there is some decent snorkeling off of both. The W provides plenty of huge towels, chairs, water, etc. at both locations. Depending upon your preference, you can choose a villa on the ocean side facing the water in villas 1-4 or choose a villa that surrounds the pool with the ocean beyond that in villas 5-17. We loved our oceanside view and rarely went to the pool as the beach was just one of the best little spots to hang out and soak up the sun. The rooms are spacious providing for just about anything you'd want and decorated in fun colorful colors that remind you that you're not at home anymore. The linens and bed are top quality and incredibly comfortable. At the entrance to your room is a small spot to throw down wet towels and kick off your shoes before entering the room. The fitness center is quite large for a hotel and has plenty of new equipment and is next to a small W cafe where you can grab coffee in the morning or have them pack a picnic lunch for you if you go out for a beach day on the island. (beware of the roaming free wild horses while driving around) We will be back and in the meantime....we're going to try and find a way to bring a little slice of this heaven to my home if it's just the aromatherapy candles that get me there. Thank you W Vieques for a wonderful birthday trip!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful surroundings/room, poor service, & annoying non-stop music”
Reviews.Author: TravelSnob1
Reviews.Content: HOTEL REVIEW # 177 W Retreat MY TRAVEL STYLE: If possible, I try to stay away from business hotels and strongly prefer resorts that resemble the Four Seasons, Aman, and Oberoi but try to find similar properties at lower cost. I seek out the â€œwowâ€� experiences and I encourage you to view hotels I have stayed at and their respective reviews (by clicking on my name). LOCATION: Great. A car ride away from other restaurants but in a nice spot with 2 beaches and ocean views throughout property. BEST WAY TO GET THERE: W lounge at airport will provide complimentary shuttle to hotel. TYPE OF ROOM: â€¨â€¨Spectacular pool/ocean & later Ocean View BED/SHEETS/PILLOW: Excellent. Same as other W Hotels which to me set the standard for the best beds, sheets, and pillows at any hotel. LIGHTING: Good in bedroom and great in bathroom. Would prefer a little more light in bedroom. BATHROOM/SHOWER: Bathroom is part of bedroom so there would be very little privacy for people not in a relationship. Shower is rain shower only. Bathtub is very cool looking but not very comfortable. TOILETRIES: Bliss productsâ€¦ very good. CLEANLINESS: Hotel is 2 months old and everything is spotless. A/C: Worked very well. CLOSET SPACE: Decent amoun but a bit small for 2 people to unpack all items. STYLE OF ROOM: Very nice. Great styleâ€¦ just like the website photos. Oceanview/pool room was more of a partial ocean view and was disappointing. COMMON AREA: Outstanding atmosphere. One of the more beautiful resorts I have stayed at. Restaurant, pool, and beaches are all excellent. Downside is music is played non-stopâ€¦ perhaps ok at a city hotel but not a resort when you are there 24/7. Music becomes very annoying. QUIET/MORNING LIGHT: Pool/Ocean view room was too loud. The music by the pool would turn into constant bass when the doors were closed. It starts at 930a (6:30am CA time) and woke us up. It ends at 10pm at night. Sunlight could be blocked with curtains. FOOD: Mixed. Breakfast was good and dinner went from mediocre to excellent. The really only very good entrÃ©e we had was the halibutâ€¦ and we ate here 3 nights in a row. Dinner entrees range from $25-$40 which would be ok if the restaurant quality matches the pricingâ€¦ they donâ€™t. We had shrimp one night that smelled so bad. Breakfast ending at 11:00a (8:00 am CA time) is just too early. What happened to â€˜whatever wheneverâ€™ as this request is basic. TV/INTERNET: Internet is wifi with ok-good speed and no charge (part of $60/day resort fee). TV is flat screen and should be larger given the distance from the bed. SERVICE: Very friendly, but inexperienced and terrible service. Too many issues to mention them, but mistakes seemed to happen non-stop. Phone calls to reception would go 20 rings without an answer, staff doesnâ€™t follow through on requests even when told it was a second request. Complain nicely to the right people and they will deliver. Staff is just too new and incompetent. SUMMARY: Know what you are getting into and this resort could be awesome. Be sure to stay on the quiet side at whatever the cost or perhaps just go to a different resort. Expect bad service, average food, and then enjoy the beautiful resort, pool, and beaches. We rented a car at the place directly across from the W hotel (Marquinez??) and were very happy with the service although the car was not in great shape. Definitely do bio-bay and be sure to go on the tour with the clear bottom canoes as itâ€™s a huge improvement over the regular kayaks.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dalex0529
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoney at W Retreat and Spa in Vieques and it was absolutely wonderful! The staff was extremely friendly and went out of their way to satisfy all of our needs. They truly live up to their motto of "whatever, whenever". As soon as we told them that it was our honeymoon, our room was upgraded and a bottle of champagne was sent. The room was fabulous, the grounds beautifully maintained, and the beaches private. The only downside to this propety was the prices - extremely high, but worth every cent. We are already planning another trip to Vieques and another fabulous stay at the W.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on Vieques Island”
Reviews.Author: Maureen15
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the most magical and wonderful 8 days on Vieques Island and enjoyed our trip even more with all the help we received from Trip Advisor. The island is quiet, the beaches amazing (saw sea turtle, sting ray, too many fish to comment on), the weather hot and wonderful. What we most enjoyed was our stay at the new W Hotel. The property is beautiful, two fabulous beaches with great swimming, outdoor pools that were cool and lovely, and classic W service. The staff was always trying to anticipate our wants and needs. The food was delicious, pricey, but delicious. My daughter has several food allergies and the staff went out of their way to accomodate her. The pool staff was delightful, always ready with clean towels, bringing iced water with lemon, moving umbrella's, always with a smile. The property is situated with a perfect view of the ocean and the breeze so we never once felt hot unless were traveling around the island. The property is quiet, no roosters, and you can hear the comforting sound of the waves and the island birds. The rooms are amazing, big and wide with open type baths and so much storage space we didn't even use it all. We had such a fun, relaxing, and it truly was a perfect vacation. We have been to Kaui, Bora Bora, Sarasota, Puerta Vallarta and I can honestly say this was the most relaxing vacation with imecable service in an ideal setting - truly beautiful. Green beach was our favorite and other than the W food we loved Next Course!

Reviews.Title: “W for WOW !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hectorkeren
Reviews.Content: This is our first review on trip advisor, however, we have travelled to Italy, Hawaii and Spain. We know quality when we see it... The W Vieques by far has provided us with the best experience of all places we have travelled to. The hotel has an inviting feel with their luxurious and urban setting in their living room ( lobby ). The service here is also unbelievable, everyone is friendly and welcoming. The rooms are hip and sexy with an urban decor. We got the Mega room which steps out directly into the wet area ( pool )...loved it!!!! The Mix on the Beach restaurant absolutely rocks!!! Please do your selves a favor and order the three way pork...amazing. This pork is home grown in Puerto Rico and it taste fresh ... Also, I think you have to request for house keeping every day by calling the front desk ( whatever whenever service ). They didn't automatically clean your room unless you called for housekeeping called "Style" at the W. .... Just a heads up. This hotel isn't for kids AT ALL!!!! This is a couples place( all types of couples ) if you know what I mean....there are no childrens activities on site and the feel of the resort gears more for an adult environment. Finally, Vieques isn't main stream just yet and most of the island is well undeveloped. If you are looking for your typical touristy island vacation, then Vieques isn't for you...this place is for those looking for a simple and " off the beaten path" type of luxury vacation. W truly rocks!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST VACATION WE EVER HAD.”
Reviews.Author: karinpadden
Reviews.Content: what makes a place? the beautiful surroundings? the great food? the weather? the accommodations? to a small extent, yes. but what really makes a place is the people. i have never seen so many people working at one place who are on the same page. the hotel is new; there are probably little kinks here and there. for instance, when we arrived there was insufficient hot water in our shower. after one phone call and 20 minutes, we had more than enough.boy, they really do make your wishes come true quickly. when was the last time you were at a hotel and saw the general manager outside stooping down to pick up a piece of paper off the ground? these people are young, smart, and are there to make your stay memorable. they even accommodated our special diet needs. ps, in the $2 million kitchen, there are 4 chefs, headed up by executive chef degan lynn. this was the first time we went to a "w," hotel and it will now be our destination of choice. the island of vieques is also unique. untouched, not like all the other caribbean islands we've been to, and we've been to them all, vieques is the largest nature preserve i the caribbean. you'll never see a building taller than 3 stories tall here. plus or minus 50 beaches, all different. a bioluminiscent bay touted to be the best example in the world. world-class restaurants...just a hip place to be. we would recommend this place to anyone who wants to go to paradise and be treated like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “This W Retreat provided everything we wanted on this island”
Reviews.Author: hapyendngs
Reviews.Content: We had been to Vieques before but had not found a luxury property or anything even close in the past. There are wonderful small guest houses, Casa de Armistad in particular, but we often work while traveling and we needed some services that only a more complete hotel could offer. We found it at the W Retreat. The property is beautiful, taking into consideration the beachfront location set a short ride from both the main towns on the island. The rooms were designed to feel cool and contemporary as well as comfortable. The staff was more than friendly. As we visited within a couple of weeks of its opening, the staff was still learning but we felt they were all happy to be part of this new upscale property. The food was terrific. Alain Ducasse has been involved and while we were there, the one representative of his staff left after a few days and another was brought in to oversee. We enjoyed breakfast, lunch and dinner and brought some local friends over for the experience. Vieques is not Ibiza - if you are looking for extremely lively nightlife, you will not find it here. You will find a relaxing atmosphere, great drinks, beautiful swimming and snorkeling, and this property is very romantic yet lighthearted. Is it perfect? No, but it is human. And those who love Vieques feel that this addition to its development will be enough to be comfortable wtihout changing the things that bring people year after year. People we met from Cape Cod just bought property the week we were there because they felt it was Cape Cod 20 years ago. We will recommend the W and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: missycard
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 4 night trip and enjoyed every minute of this hotel. A few things you should know if you get a room by the pool there is music on from about 9am-11pm, so if you want quiet ask for rooms on the other side. They have 8am yoga and 6pm sunset appetizer/ cocktails daily. Food & bevs are very expensive - I recommend hitting the supermarket to stock up for the room. Really close to the airport - W provides free transportation service. Staff was super helpful. Awesome gym. I would suggest renting a car (free parking at hotel) b/c taxi service is expensive to/ from restaurants and beaches. To go roundtrip to dinner was $25 and we rented a car for $35 per day for 2 of the days. And at least you can zoom around and explore unless all you want to do is chill out at the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel and be sure to check different sites b/c there were varying prices - I got the best deal on hotels.com and W price matched with their Best Price Guarantee program. One complaint I do have is they had this $60 a day resort fee on top of the hotel price and they claim it's for all the things you can use - tennis, gym, snorkel equipment etc, but really what hotel ever charges for any of that?

Reviews.Title: “Nice with "newly-opened kinks"”
Reviews.Author: travelswithdogs0
Reviews.Content: When we visited in April 2010 they were in phase 1 of their grand opening which meant there were sections of rooms still not open so there were a nice & limited number of guests even though they told us they were booked full for the rooms that were open. They were pet friendly as described, we didn't bring our dog but saw people who did and they had dog water bowls available at hotel entrances with clean water every time I looked. There were no waits for dining tables or pool/beach chairs. The rooms are very "W" and every little touch was what we expected from the nice robes to the well-stocked minibar. The lounge at the airport was nice and we were greeted with snacks and cold drinks before being shuttled in new jeeps with a/c to the resort just a short drive away for no charge and bags delivered to our room. The website photos are accurate. The food was great, although we never, in 5 meals, got a correct order. Our room wasn't ready til 8pm, so they comped our first meal and drinks as would be expected. The sliders are great with slaw. The lobster curry was great as well. Other guests mentioned they thought the on-site menus were expensive, I thought they were reasonable and I was happy to pay for the nice meals as I would in any American restaurant. Overall the property itself was perfect! The staff were gracious and bent over backwards to help, but given the remote location the anything/anytime philosophy was hard to live up to even with a simple request for a cigar, it took 24 hours but Bree came through and got some for us. We took a taxi to Fun Brothers (booked through the concierge) for a night kayak tour of the bio bay and even with a lot of little mishaps with the tour company I would highly recommend doing the kayak tour so you can explore and swim on your own. I can only imagine the longer this resort is open the more smoothly it will run with everything.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel and Spa”
Reviews.Author: kansascem
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the new W hotel and spa. Relaxing and beautiful place. Employees were great and made our stay special. Two pools and the ocean to swim. Great for any age.

Reviews.Title: “Still Working Things Out”
Reviews.Author: DCTravels850
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel is still working things out. Upon arrival at the airport, we were invited into the W Hotel room and offered cocktails and water -- a welcome relief given the heat. Check-in was a bit of a challenge. I had expected it to go more smoothly and easy; however, it seemed staff are still not fully proficient with accepting guests. And it took us several attempts to get the benefit of our packaged rate (not offered the cocktails and beach bag). The hotel's motto of "Whatever, Whenever" seemed to fit the staff. Good things: The atmosphere, pool, beach, rooms, and staff (very friendly and helpful) were all great. The lobby was also very well done. Things to Improve: Food prices are too high, and getting a check seemed to take some effort and patience. I would recommend that management provide more instruction to staff on service expectations. The breakfast buffet is $30/person and dinner will run you over $60/person; about a mile away, you can find great local fare for less than half the price. On the other side of the island in Esperanza, you'll find great seafood at reasonable prices and half the price of W Hotel. This is a $300/night hotel. We felt it was overpriced given the cost of other locations on the island. The hotel does not yet have a gift shop. The W cafe is supposed to be open 9 - 5 but we found it closed one day during lunch. Wireless internet is free and available but, those staying in the villas #100swere unable to connect. Vieques is still working on getting its tourism industry up to standards as compared to other Caribbean islands. Given the plethora of islands and resorts in the Caribbean with lower prices and more mature tourism industry, we doubt we'd return here.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from a 3 night stay less...”
Reviews.Author: markliving
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay less than one month after this new "W" property opened for business. My wife and I agreed that their greatest achievement is ambience. If new bohemian is what we're calling it, then we applaud the end result. A blazing open firepit with relaxed seating all around the sprawling 'living room'; free cocktails each sunset; a huge steel soaking tub in our room. About 90 of the 157 rooms are open- many I'm assuming like ours still with a few kinks to iron out- but the resort has a spacious, private, uncrowded feel that I suspect is more challenging to pull off than first appearances, and from experience vacationing in the Caribbean, rarely executed this well. We travelled with a 1 year old and his two and a half year old sister. Many of the staff are locals with young children and we found them to be so patient and caring toward our little ones it made our stay so much more relaxing. Twin beaches absolutely pristine and safe for kids. The resort fee includes unlimited on-property snorkeling and kayaking gear. Top quality mountain bikes with kid seats $10/hr. 2 minutes from the tiny, recently polished and shined vieques airport complete with a cozy lounge for W guests and free transport to/from. Check Seaborne Airlines for impending non-stop service from St. Thomas to Vieques- about half the cost of other options. Highest recommendation we could offer- already making plans to return and do all the things we just never got around to doing... This trip we never wanted to leave the dubyah!

Reviews.Title: “Not 100% there yet, but should be great”
Reviews.Author: eb500
Reviews.Content: There are definitely still a few problems to iron out so close to opening, but in general this is a great property and location. The staff was very friendly and helpful and are definitely trying their best! My biggest concern going forward is the pool area, as it can get quite crowded already despite the fact they are still running well under capacity.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort off to a great start”
Reviews.Author: blueeyedgolfer
Reviews.Content: My family and I had the pleasure to spend four nights at the W on its first week of operation. One has to appreciate the confidence of a hotel that opens Easter weekend to a full house. A full house was quite a challenge for the staff, but they managed to pull it off with just a few hiccups. We were upgraded to an oceanfront room that was spacious and sleek.
