The bed was comfy...as a gadget fan, it was nice to have a flat screen television (that allowed easy hook up for a video camera so you could review any footage that you shot earlier in the day), dvd player and an iPod docking system that provided excellent sound quality. I had no trouble with my iPhone, surprisingly the area was even AT&T 3G. The pool area was beautiful, but small, with only six cabanas. During our stay, the cabanas were free, but staff were confused about how they could be claimed...one told us that they were first come, first served, but another said you needed to reserve them at the pool bar. The other contentious issue was that guests who were not in the cabana would use the lounge chairs immediately in front of the cabana. This caused more than one dispute, all of which could have been alleviated if both the reserved cabana and accompanying lounge chairs were marked with signage from the hotel showing that they were reserved. We were disappointed that the gift shop was not opened yet. There was a small ice cream/deli that was open that carried several products, some of them very peculiar. It was a mystery to us why they would stock their shelves with bags of pasta or a tin of olive oil, but yet not carry aspirin, deodorant or toothpaste. Granted, I am sure that these necessities will eventually be sold, it is a mystery as to why they weren't there from the start in lieu of the pasta and olive oil. As many have reported, the island is just starting to become popular with tourists. While some may welcome the undiscovered nature of this, for us, it was a bit frustrating. The W is a bit isolated (and with restaurant choices on site being limited), it is necessary to go to the nearby towns. Cab fare was $5 per person, no matter if there is one person traveling (or in on of our excursions packed with 13 people) ...but the drivers are highly unreliable and apparently in short supply. One night we were stranded at 9 pm at Belly Buttons, fortunately, the bar's owner was kind enough to make the 15 minute drive to take us to the hotel. While we found limited activities on the island (the concierge needs to do a better job having information regarding what activities are available,) but made the trip to Bio Bay with Island Adventures and enjoyed that. (To be fair, because of the crowds that flocked to a festival on the Island over Easter weekend, we opted to avoid the masses and enjoy the tranquility of the hotel.) Overall, the W is a heavenly place, perfect for a relaxing escape or a honeymoon. As it works through the growing pains, it is sure to become a first-class destination.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENCE AT IT'S BEST, EVEN BEYOND STARWOOD STANDARDS”
Reviews.Author: Partyoffivelexington
Reviews.Content: I have been waiting for this property to open for 2 years and I am proud to have been the 1st OEM Platinum guest. We arrived at the property via ferry on the morning after it opened after spending 3 nights at the Waldorf on the main island. I must say that I was a little worried about having kids at the W and also knowing that it had just opened, would they be able to function with minimal hiccups? After arriving on the ferry with my family, we were immediately greeted by the director of operations (Oscar) in one of the new W jeeps and he would not let me lift a finger to help him with my baggage. He had bottles of H2O waiting for us and insisted that he would take us on a tour of the island and its hidden gems including quaint towns, hard to find beaches with wild horses running free and must do restaurants. We were certainly receiving the Platinum treatment but I do feel he would go out of his way for anyone. Some people are just molded that way and he is all about bringing happiness. Next, we pull into this dramatic entrance with the traditional W greeting you at the gate. We then drove about a 1/2 mile lined with 2 story beautiful villas to the great house. WOW!!! when you walk in, it takes your breath away. Once inside, you can see right through the back to a fire pit and the cliff and ocean beyond that. To your right, you have a massive living room and to your left and great bar and lounge. beyond the living room on your right, is the famous Alan Ducasse Restaurant that has such a romantic feel to it. We were greeted by the lobby staff including Bree and Sandra who immediately felt like family and when you meet Jorge you will know what I am talking about. He not only exceed my expectations, he was on another planet. Bree, informed me that I have been upgraded and we were very thankful. We were upgraded to a WOW suite and let me tell you, You say Wow when you walk in to this beautiful 2 room suite. We also had the best location with a dramatic view of a small cliff and ocean. you can walk out of the suite through 2 sets of sliders from either room on to a patio and the grass to the edge of the cliff. The last night, while our children slept, Mr. Al Lopez, Alan Ducasse's GM set an intimate table for 2 on the edge of the cliff with a 3 course tasting menu and wine pairing over candle and moonlight so we can have a romantic evening. Again, going beyond expectations. The Pool area called WET again very well done and the staff equally incredible. Pablo and Blane were tremendous. My worries about the kids being with us quickly disappeared when we saw how many other children were there and the staff seemed to love having the kids around. It is such a peaceful place and well worth the wait. The spa will certainly be a treat for those spa lovers and the fitness center is state of the art for the great workout. There are Yoga classes outside and just like everything else here the sense of Zen is with you. We travel plenty and I must say this resort was breath taking. We were so sad to leave. In the traditional Oscar way. He insisted on taking us to the airport and not letting me lift a finger. The airport was close by and the W even has its own waiting area where you can continue to feel on vacation till your Cessna arrives. This Place Rocks and the staff is what makes this place rock. Will I be back? (ABSOLUTELY!!!!) THANK YOU W FROM THE DUNNING'S. PS-HONEYMOONERS THIS IS THE PLACE YOU WILL NEVER FORGET BUT FAMILIES, DO NOT SHY AWAY. Lastly, it is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Exceeded our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: diva4Chicago
Reviews.Content: We excitedly awaited the opening of the new W and were not disappointed. We traveled to Vieques with our two kids, ages 10 and 14, and the entire family enjoyed the property. Our younger daughter deemed the food wonderful (as well as the poolside drinks). Rooms were spacious, comfortable and well designed. The property had a beautiful, tropical setting that made it very peaceful. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. From the restaurant director to the concierge and the general manager - all were great. Even though it was the opening week, we barely felt the anxiety of the staff. We didn't even mind that they forgot to clean our room one day during our stay. We look forward to visiting again next year.

Reviews.Title: “A little pre-open peak”
Reviews.Author: dergondarkhelm
Reviews.Content: I recently had the opportunity to take a guided tour of the W Vieques. It isn't scheduled to open for a few months yet, but I am very impressed with the layout. The resort will be relatively small with 157 rooms. There is no tower or multi-stoyer complex. Instead, a number of clusters of 4-8 room buildings flow along the northern coast of Vieques island, looking out with beautiful ocean views. Separate buildings for a main reception area, spa, and small "Dean & Deluca style" grocery are being built. There will lots of flowing water around and, I presume, lots of thumping music (I can't imagine a W without it). We're hoping to stay here next winter. The value will depend on price point for the rooms and level of service....but from an early look it is pretty impressive. :)
